response: In large bowl, combine flour, sugar and butter with electric mixer until crumbly. Press into 9 inch square baking dish. Beat egg with forkstir in coffee granules until blended. Pour over crumb mixturesprinkle with almonds. Bake at 350 for 20 minutes. Coolcut into 6 bars. Sprinkle with powdered sugar. Makes 6 servings.

Cook the bread cubes in boiling water until done. Remove cubes from the water. Saut the sausage meat in butter until brown. Add the celery and onion and cook until tender. Add the cubed bread and saut for 2 minutes. Add the mushrooms and cook for 1 minute. Add the boiling chicken broth and stir. Add the salt and pepper and the sage. Cook 2 to 3 minutes. Remove from the heat. Cool to room temperature. Stir in the eggs. Pour the mixture into an unbaked 9x13x2 baking dish. Bake at 350 degrees for 30 minutes. Makes 12 servings.

Mix all ingredients except bread cubes. Set aside. In a skillet, cook the turkey. Drain and chop. Add to bread mixture. Combine well. Pour into a greased baking dish. Bake at 350 for 1 hour. Unmold and serve.

Cook spaghetti according to package directions. Drain. Add broccoli and cook according to package directions. In a small bowl, combine peanut butter, stock, soy sauce and vinegar. Stir until smooth. Heat oil in a large skillet over medium-high heat. Add garlic and red pepper. Cook and stir 2 minutes. Add spaghetti mixture and sauce. Heat through. Stir in scallions. Serve immediately.
Boil pasta. Drain and rinse with cold water. Combine pasta and remaining ingredients. Add breadcrumbs to taste. Bake at 400 degrees for 30 minutes. Serve hot.
Brown sausages, crumble bacon. Add the rest of the ingredients. Bake in casserole dish for 35 minutes at 350 F. Serve with crusty bread.

Cut 6 pieces of bread into 4 triangles to create a checkerboard effect. Spread crunchy peanut butter on half of the triangles, jelly on the other half. Place a goldfish cracker on each slice of bread.

Preheat oven to 375 degrees. Put a large pot of water on to boil for the white rice. Cut the chicken into small cubes. Place the chicken in a large Ziploc bag. Combine the flour, soy sauce and sugar. Add the chicken to the bag and toss to coat. Add the pineapple. Bake for 45 to 60 minutes. Serve over white rice. Garnish with parsley sprig.
Cream together butter and sugars. Blend in eggs. Stir in flour, soda and salt. Blend in chocolate chips. Drop by teaspoon on ungreased baking sheet. Bake at 350 for 10 minutes or until done.

Rinse lime and grapefruit wedges in warm water and pat dry. Muddle the lime and grapefruit wedges in a cocktail shaker until the fruit is broken down into small pieces and pulp. Add ice and all remaining ingredients except the maraschino cherry. Shake for 10 seconds until cold and frosty. Strain into a chilled martini glass and top with maraschino cherry.

Combine water and sugar in a large saucepan. Stir in lemon juice, almond flavoring, and vanillaheat to boiling over medium heat. Remove from heatstir in frozen orange juice and spiceslet stand 15 minutes or until thickened. Serve hot or cold.

In a small bowl combine the eggs and milk and stir. Heat oil over medium high heat and pour half of the egg mixture into the pan, sprinkle with half of the green onions and half of the cheddar cheese. As the eggs begin to cook scramble and stir for about 30 seconds. Add the remaining egg mixture and continue to scramble the eggs and stir for another 30 seconds or so. Then fold in the remaining green onions and the rest of the cheddar cheese and continue to scramble and stir for 1 to 2 minutes more until the cheese is melted and the eggs are cooked to your liking. Serve hot.

Place strawberries and ginger ale in the blender. Blend well. Strain through a colander, reserving the strawberry liquid. Add the milk to the strained strawberry mixture and stir. Pour into individual glasses. Add 2 tablespoons of sour cream to each glass. Sprinkle with sugar and garnish with the vanilla and fresh strawberry slices. Serve immediately.

Combine all the sauce ingredients in a bowl and stir. Place the fish in a baking dish and pour the marinade over it and turn to coat both sides. Marinate for 10 minutes. Preheat the oven to 400F. Bake the fish for about 15 to 20 minutes or until it is cooked through.

In food processor add red peppers, cilantro, vinegar, garlic and mustard. Pulse until blended. Add coriander and cinnamon. Process to combine. Add oil. Season with salt and pepper. Add nuts and pulse to combine. Cut chicken breasts into 1 inch strips. Thread chicken onto skewers. Grill 4 inches from heat 4 minutes on each side. Serve with pesto.

In a bowl combine the blue cheese and the butter. Add the lemon juice and mix until smooth. Add the basil and garlic. Remove from fridge. In a cast iron skillet melt some olive oil and heat until almost smoking. Add the vegetables. Sprinkle with the butter mixture and stir gently. Cover and grill for 5 to 10 minutes. Serve warm.

Preheat oven to 375 degrees. Season the pork with the salt and pepper. In a large pan over medium heat, melt the butter. Add the onion and cook until the onion is translucent. Add the olive oil and garlic and cook for a few minutes. Remove the pan from the heat and place the seasoned pork in the pan and roll to coat the pork with the olive oil and garlic. Place the pork in a roasting pan. Bake the pork for 30 minutes. Remove from the oven and place the pan back on the heat. Add the butter and the chicken stock and stir the mixture. Pour the mixture over the pork and bake for another 30 minutes. Remove the pan from the oven and let stand for 5 minutes. Slice the pork and serve.

Heat oven to 375 degrees F. Place dough in a 9 inch pie plate. Pour in the pumpkin puree. Top with the pears and figs. In a medium bowl, whisk together the brown sugar, cinnamon and cornstarch. Stir in the water and the lemon juice. Pour over fruit. Bake until the filling is thick and bubbly, about 45 minutes. Cool.

Preheat oven to 350F. Mix flour and butter together with a fork. Add vanilla and walnuts. Press mixture into a greased 8x8 pan. Bake for 15 minutes. Spread marshmallows over top. Sprinkle with chocolate chips. Bake 2 minutes. Cool completely. Cut into bars.

Combine oats and almonds in a large bowl. In a small bowl, combine wheat germ, honey, spices and vanilla. Pour over dry mixture and stir to combine. Spread mixture evenly on baking sheet. Bake at 350 degrees for 15-20 minutes stirring once. Let cool completely on baking sheet before breaking into pieces. Store in airtight container.

Slice the oranges into quarters& place them in a saucepan with the caster sugar. Pour in enough water to cover them by 1/2 inch& bring to a boil over medium-high heat. Lower the heat& simmer until the fruit is very soft& the syrup is thick enough to coat the back of a wooden spoon, about 1 hour& 10 minutes. Meanwhile, cut the vanilla bean in half& scrape the seeds into the syrup using the back of a spoon. Remove from heat& let cool& strain into an airtight jar. Discard vanilla bean& cover the syrup with plastic wrap directly on the surface of the syrup. Refrigerate until cold& discard any excess syrup that has risen to the top.To serve& stir together& pour over ice cream or float over desserts. The syrup will keep refrigerated in an airtight jar for up to 2 weeks.

Heat oven to 350. Grease and flour a 9x13 pan. In a large bowl cream margarine and sugar. Beat in eggs one at a time. Stir in vanilla and cocoa. Combine the flour and baking soda. Add to mixture and stir until blended. Fold in nuts and mini chips. Spread in pan. Bake 25-30 minutes. Cool. Cut into bars.

Mix together butter and sugar. Add egg substitute and pineapple, mix well. Add in flours, soda, and salt, blend together. Add vanilla. Pour into greased & floured loaf pan. Bake at 350 degrees for 1 hour.

Preheat oven to 350°F. Beat the butter and the cocoa powder in a large bowl with a mixer at medium speed until blended. Add the sugar and the salt and beat until well blended. Add the eggs and the vanilla and beat until smooth. Combine the flour and the baking powder and stir with a whisk. Beat the flour mixture into the sugar mixture alternately with the milk in 2 additions at low speed. Stir in the chocolate chips. Spread in a greased and floured 9x13 inch baking pan. Bake for 20 to 25 minutes or until a toothpick inserted near the center comes out clean. Cool in the pan on a wire rack. Drizzle with additional chocolate as desired.
In a bowl mix the sugar, vinegar, miracle whip and cheese. Add in the bacon and mix again. Add in the broccoli and mix again. Then add in the onion. Chill for 2 hours or overnight.
Combine ice and limon in a blender. Add lemon concentrate and blend until smooth. Serve in glasses over ice and garnish with lime slices.

Rub the orange rind over the insides of four champagne flutes or wine glasses. Add a few of the fruit in the bottom of each glass. Top with a layer of jelly and a splash of port wine. Continue alternating layers of fruit and jelly until the glass is filled to the top. Cover and chill for at least one hour before serving. Mint sprigs make an attractive garnish.
Puree mangoes and add lime juice and club soda to taste. Serve over ice cubes. You could also add a shot of vodka.

In a large bowl combine the oat cereal, sunflower seeds, almonds and coconut. Add the remaining ingredients and mix well. Spread onto a baking sheet and bake in a 350 degrees F oven for 20 minutes. Let cool. Store in an airtight container.

Preheat oven to 425 degrees. In a large bowl combine corn meal, flour, baking powder, sugar and salt. Stir in beer and eggs just until blended. Add onion and jalapeno pepper to batter. Heat vegetable oil over medium heat in a heavy 12-inch skillet until hot and bubbly. Scoop batter into hot oil with a large spoon. Fry for about 3 minutes or until golden brown, turning once with a slotted spoon. Remove to paper towels to drain. Sprinkle with additional salt if desired. Serve warm with a side of barbecue or other favorite condiments.
Slice tomato thin and spread on each slice of challah. Sprinkle with basil. Top with brie cheese. Close and press until cheese is melted. Cut in half.

Place the rosemary and lamb chops in a bowl, and pour over the vinegar and a tablespoon of olive oil. Leave to marinate for 1 hour in a cool place. Meanwhile, make the sauce by placing all the ingredients in a food processor and blending to a smooth puree. Add a little more water if necessary to get a smooth consistency. Set aside in a jug to cool. Meanwhile, preheat the grill to high heat. Drain the marinade from the chops and grill until done to your liking. Serve with a little of the sauce poured over each chop and a few mint leaves sprinkled over it.

Combine first 4 ingredients in large saucepan. Add chicken broth. Bring to boil. Reduce heat. Cover. Simmer until veggies are tender-crisp about 15 minutes. Season with salt. Stir in lime juice and oregano. Sprinkle with parsley. Serve hot. Makes about 4 servings.

In medium bowl, combine sugar, olive oil and mayonnaisemix well. Stir in mustards and seasonings. Spread onto baking sheet or large plate. Sprinkle with paprika. Bake at 200 degrees for 20 minutes. Stir and spread back out evenly. Bake another 15 minutes or until desired crispness is obtained. Remove from oven and cool completely. Store in an air tight container at room temperature.

Preheat oven to 375 degrees. Line a cookie sheet with aluminum foil. Tightly wrap each pear in a strip of bacon, overlapping ends by about 1/2 inch. Bake for 15 to 20 minutes until bacon is crisp. Remove from oven and set aside. Combine all remaining ingredients in a medium bowl. Add roasted pears to mixture and toss gently. Serve immediately. Serves 4.

Place white bread in a greased 9x13-inch baking dish. Layer with jalapeno jack cheese, cheddar cheese and bacon. Combine eggs and milk in a bowl. Pour over bread mixture. Refrigerate over night. Bake uncovered at 350 for 30 minutes. Let stand for 10 minutes before cutting into squares. Serves 8 to 10

In a large skillet over medium heat melt the butter. Saute the fish and scallops in the butter until browned. Add the green peppercorns and cook for another 2 minutes. Remove from the heat and add the lemon rind. Stir in the lemon juice and salt and pepper to taste. Serve the scallops and fish with the sauce spooned over it.

Preheat oven to 375 degrees F (190 degrees C).Combine the flour, baking soda, and saltset aside.In a large bowl, cream together the butter and granulated and brown sugars until smooth. Beat in the egg yolks and vanilla until well blended. Gradually stir in the flour mixture until a soft dough formsdo not overmix or the cookies will be tough.On an ungreased cookie sheet, shape the dough into 1-inch balls.Bake for 10 minutes in the preheated oven.Remove from ovencool slightly before serving.

Beat the cream cheese and sugar together until smooth. Stir in the frozen dessert topping. Spread into the prepared graham cracker crust. Refrigerate for 1 hour. Spread the cherry pie filling on top of the cream cheese mixture. Refrigerate for 2 more hours before serving.

Heat butter in large saucepan over medium heat. Add orzo and cook until lightly browned. Add chicken bouillon and seasonings. Stir in rice. Add lemon juice and enough warm water to cover. Bring to a boil. Reduce heatcover and simmer 25 minutes. Remove from heat. Add parsley and peas. Stir gently. Cover and let stand for 5 minutes before serving.
Shred the cabbage, carrots, and yellow onion. In a large bowl combine the cabbage mixture with the remaining ingredients. Cover and refrigerate for 2 to 3 hours before serving. Serve chilled.

Preheat oven to 350 degrees Fahrenheit. Cut the sweet potatoes lengthwise into 1/4 to 1/2 inch thick slices. Toss with brown sugar, low sodium soy sauce, mirin, dark sesame oil and garlic. Roast until tender, about 30 minutes. Top with toasted sesame seeds and nori.

In a large skillet heat the olive oil over medium-high heat. Add the cherry tomatoes and garlic and saute until the tomatoes are slightly golden. Add the clams and wine and bring to a boil over high heat. Cook until the clams have opened, about 5 minutes. Add the lemon juice and fresh parsley and toss. Serve with crusty french bread for dipping in the broth.

In a large plastic bag combine all the dry seasonings. Add chicken pieces and coat well. Let sit for 10 minutes while you heat up the oil for deep-frying. Heat oil to 375 degrees. Using a slotted spoon or spoon with holes in it, lower chicken pieces into oil. Fry for 10 to 12 minutes or until golden brown on all sides. Drain on paper towel-lined plate.

Core and quarter the pears and put in a buttered baking dish. Combine the syrup, butter, vanilla and cinnamon and pour over the pears. Bake at 375 for 30 minutes until the pears are soft. Serve with plain yogurt for an elegant dessert.

Peel and chop carrots and garlic cloves. Bring stock to a boil and add chopped carrots and garlic. Reduce heat and cover and simmer until carrots are tender. Drain and return to pot. Mash. Add butter. Add thyme and season with salt and pepper to taste. Serve immediately.

Preheat oven to 375 degrees F (190 degrees C). Cut each biscuit into quarters. Beat the cream cheese with the sugar until fluffy. Beat in egg. In a small bowl, combine the flour and cinnamonstir into the cream cheese mixture. Spread some of the mixture evenly over the bottom of a 9x13 inch pan. Place a layer of biscuits on top of the mixture. Repeat with remaining biscuits and filling. Bake in the preheated oven until the filling is set. Cool in the pan on a wire rack. Cut into wedges.

Preheat oven to 350 degrees F. Spray large cookie sheet with olive oil or nonstick spray. In large bowl combine taco seasoning, olive oil, potatoes and onion. Toss to coat. Spoon mixture onto cookie sheet. Bake 40 to 45 minutes or until potatoes are tender and lightly browned. Sprinkle with cheese. Bake 5 minutes longer or until cheese is melted.
Place all of the above in a saucepan over medium heat. Cook for 3-5 minutes or until all the liquid is absorbed. Makes 1 serving.

In a skillet over medium-high heat, add oil, onions and ground turkey. Cook until no longer pink. Drain fat. Add in the spices. Cook for an additional minute or two. Pour into crockpot. Add in the diced tomatoes and kidney beans. Stir to combine. Add in the red chili powder and the black pepper. Add in the Sazon Goya and the salt. Stir to combine. Cook on low for about 8 hours. Serve with your favorite toppings. Enjoy.

Boil and drain the potatoes. Stir in sour cream, milk and chives. Sprinkle with the salt, pepper and the cheese. Bake in a 350 degree oven until the top is golden brown. Crush the corn flakes and sprinkle them on top of the casserole. Bake until the crunchy topping is golden brown.

Boil water. Add lentils and bay leaves, cook until lentils are tender. Drain lentils and place in bowl. Add olive oil and mix well. Add oranges and orange juice and mix well. Add onions and mix well. Salt and pepper to taste.

Cream together butter and sugar until light and fluffy. Add eggs one at a time. Add vanilla. Combine flour, baking powder and salt. Blend into creamed mixture. Add walnuts. Spread into greased 9x13 pan. Bake at 350 degrees for 20 minutes. Cool. Spread with peanut butter. Melt chips with shortening. Spread over top. Chill. Cut into squares.

Warm oil in pan over medium heat. Add onion. Cook until onion is tender. Add vegetables. Cook until vegetables are tender. Remove from heat. Add enchilada sauce. Add 1/3 cup of cheese to each tortilla and roll up. Arrange rolled tortillas in pan. Sprinkle with remaining cheese. Bake at 350 degrees for 15 minutes or until cheese is bubbly.

Brown ground beef with onion soup mix. Season with salt and pepper. Place red potatoes in center of foil, put hamburger over potatoes. Then add baby carrots and season with salt and pepper. Fold up sides of foil, making a seal around the food. Bake at 350 degrees for 2 hours or until potatoes are done.

Preheat oven to 350 degrees F (175 degrees C).In a large skillet over medium heat, cook bacon until crisp. In a large bowl, beat the eggs, milk, light cream, seasoning salt, onion powder, and onions until well combined. Divide egg mixture among four 10-inch round pizza pans coated with cooking spray. Sprinkle evenly with bacon. Bake for 12 to 15 minutes in the preheated oven, or until the egg mixture is firm when cut with a knife. Garnish with additional bacon and onion. Makes 4 servings.

Preheat oven to 350 degrees F (175 degrees C). Grease a 13x9-inch pan. In a large bowl, combine the cake mix, margarine, sugar, eggs and cocoa powder until well blended. Stir in the white chocolate chips. Pour into the prepared pan. Bake for 20 to 25 minutes, or until the top springs back when pressed lightly with a fingertip. Cool completely before cutting into squares.

In large skillet over medium heat, saute 2 minced garlic cloves in olive oil until golden. Add potatoes and saute until potatoes are tender. Add 3 cups cooked green beans and cook 1 min. Add 1/2 pesto sauce and stir until heated through. Serve over cooked linguine. Garnish with parmesan cheese.

In a large bowl combine the macaroni, egg, salt, and peppermix well. Combine the flour and baking powderstir into the egg mixture just until blended. Add the milkstir until smooth. Pour into a greased 1-1/2-qt. shallow baking dish. Sprinkle with cheesebake uncovered at 375° for 30-35 minutes or until bubbly. Let stand for 10 minutes before serving. Makes 6 servings.
Brown the ground beef. Drain the fat. Add the remaining ingredients. Simmer for 1 hour. Serve with crackers.

Cover dried beans with boiling water by 3 inches in a large pot. Cover and cook over low heat for 1 hour or until tender. Drain. Heat oil in a large skillet over medium heat. Add onion and garlic. Cook 5 minutes or until tender. Add beans. Cook over low heat for 5 minutes or until heated through. Stir in rice, textured vegetable protein, cayenne pepper, cumin, salt, pepper, and enough boiling water by 1/4 inch to moisten. Cook 10 minutes or until heated through. Serves 6.

Cook pasta according to package directions. Meanwhile, saute bacon. Add onion and garlic and saute until tender. Add bacon and drain peas. Stir. Add cream and reduce until thick. Add ricotta and parmesan cheese and stir until smooth and thick. Stir in parsley. Drain pasta. Add pasta to bacon mixture and toss until well coated. Serve immediately.

Preheat oven to 375 degrees F. In a 12-inch deep ovenproof skillet heat olive oil over medium heat. Add chicken skin side down. Cook 8 minutes or until browned. Remove chicken and set aside. In skillet add onions and saute until tender crisp. Add parsnips saute until tender. Add stock broth, mustard, honey and thyme. Bring to boil. Reduce heat cover and simmer until tender about 10-15 minutes. Return chicken to skillet turn once or twice to coat in sauce. Sprinkle with parsley. Bake in oven uncovered until chicken is cooked through about 45 minutes. Serve with cooked rice or noodles.

In a medium saucepan over medium heat, combine granulated sugar, butter, milk, and cocoa. Bring to a boil. Remove from heat. Stir in peanut butter and vanilla. Stir in rolled oats. Drop by teaspoonfuls onto waxed paper. Allow to cool completely before eating.
Combine all the liquid ingredients in a blender with a handful or two of crushed ice and blend until smooth. Pour in a tall glass and garnish with an orange slice and a cherry.
In a large saucepan cook carrot until tender. Drain. In same saucepan combine all other ingredients. Cook over low heat until glazed. Serve warm.

Heat olive oil in a large skillet over medium heat. Add onions and mushrooms. Cook until softened. Add roasted red bell peppers. Stir for 5 minutes. Add pasta and cook for 2 minutes. Mix in parmesan cheese, salt, pepper, onion powder, and garlic. Serve hot.

Mix meat and seasonings together. Shape into 12 patties. Spray skillet with non-stick spray. Brown patties on each side. Add a few tablespoons water to pan, cover to reserve moisture, and cook till done. Spread about 1/4 cup of the meat mixture on the party rye. Top with a spoonful of cheese, a spoonful of the remaining meat mixture, another spoonful of cheese, another spoonful of meat mixture, a spoonful of cheese and a spoonful of the meat mixture. Bake at 350 for 10 minutes to melt the cheese. Serve immediately.

Boil the eggplants until tender. Slice into 1/2-inch thick rounds. Saute the onions in the oil until they are tender. Add the garlic, peppers, diced tomatoes, oregano and basil. Simmer for 5 minutes. Spread the peppers on the bottom half of the rolls. Top with the eggplant slices. Spread the onion mixture evenly over the eggplant. Top with the top half of the rolls. Cut each sandwich in half. Serve warm.
Combine chicken with cream cheese, mustard, lemon juice, and cayenne pepper to taste. Form into balls. Roll in chopped walnuts or pecans before serving.

Spray large skillet with cooking spray. Saute ground beef and onion over medium heat until browned. Drain excess fat. Add water and taco seasoning mix and bring to a boil. Stir in sour cream and cheese until melted. Serve in flour tortillas with additional taco sauce on side if desired. Serve with refried beans on side if desired.

Boil carrot and onions in water for 15 minutes. Drain well. In a bowl, mix mayonnaise, horseradish and pepper. Spread half the mixture over bottom of 1 1/2 qt. casserole dish. Place drained veggies on top. Sprinkle with bread crumbs. Pour remaining mayonnaise mixture over the veggies and top with cheese. Bake at 350° for about 30 minutes or until hot and bubbly. Serve warm.

Cream butter and cheese. Add flour and seasonings. Stir in rice krispies until well mixed. Roll into balls and place on ungreased baking sheet. Bake at 400 for 8-10 minutes or until lightly browned around the edges. Cool on wire racks.

Bring water to boiling in a medium saucepan. Cook pasta in boiling water until tender. Meanwhile in a small bowl combine avocado and tomatoes. Mash to desired consistency. Set aside. In a skillet heat oil over medium heat. Add garlic and cook for one minute. Add avocado and tomato mixture and heat through. Stir in the cooked pasta. Toss to coat. Add salt and pepper to taste. Serve.

Place fillets in a greased 13x9 inch baking dish. Sprinkle with salt and pepper. In a large bowl, combine the first 5 ingredients. Spread on fillets. Top with crumbs. Bake at 450 f for 10 minutes or until flakes easily with a fork. Garnish with parsley. Serve with lemon wedges. 4 servings.

Combine lemon zest and juice in a small bowl. Mix corn syrup, cornstarch, hot water and cinnamon in a small saucepanstir over medium heat until smooth and thick. Add lemon mixturecook and stir for 1 minute or until thickened. Add carrotscook and stir 1-2 minutes or until thoroughly heated.
In medium saucepan, boil potatoes until tenderdrain. Melt butter in skillet, add bay leaves and seasonings. Add potatoesmix wellserve over frozen peassprinkle with paprika.
In a small bowl mix together the Jimmy Dean sausage, butter and flour. Add the milk and stir until well blended. Add the sour cream and mix well. Season to taste with salt and pepper.

Preheat oven to 375. Cream the butter, sugar, egg, and vanilla. Stir in the flour, salt, and baking powder. Blend well. Chill the dough for 1 hour in the refrigerator. Shape into 1 inch balls and place on ungreased cookie sheet. Bake for 12-15 minutes. Cool for 10 minutes on the baking sheets. Place the confectioners coating in a small bowl. Dip each cookie in the coating and shake off excess. Place on a cookie sheet with wax paper underneath. Return the cookies to the refrigerator until the coating is hardened. Store in an airtight container.

Place family-size tea bags in a large tea ball or tea infuser. Add 5 cloves and 1/2 teaspoon of ground cinnamon and 1/2 teaspoon of ground ginger. Add enough water to cover. Bring to a boil. Reduce heat and simmer for 5 minutes. Strain out spices. Add 1/4 cup of Splenda. Stir in 4 cups of water and 1/2 cup of Splenda sweetened cranberry juice. Add a small piece of lemon rind and a small piece of orange rind. Bring to a boil. Remove from heat and allow to steep for 5 minutes. Strain and add 2 cups of cold orange juice. Serve.

Preheat oven to 450 degrees. Peel and wash potatoes. Slice the potatoes with a mandoline or food slicer into 1/4 inch thick slices. Bring a large pot of water to a rolling boil and add the potatoes. Boil for about two minutes, until the potatoes are just cooked but still firm. Drain and rinse with cold water. Pat dry with paper towels. Melt the butter in a large cast iron skillet or casserole dish. Add the seasoning and stir to combine. Add the potatoes and toss well to combine. Spread the potatoes evenly over the dish. Bake for about 15 minutes, tossing once halfway through baking, until the edges of the potatoes are crispy and the center is tender. Remove from the oven and serve immediately. Serves 4

Cut bacon into small pieces and fry in a large skillet until crisp. Drain bacon and set aside. Add garlic to remaining fat in the pan and saute until softened. Add asparagus and cook until tender-crisp. Remove from pan and set aside. In a small bowl combine butter, brown sugar, worcestershire sauce and lemon juice. Cook until butter is melted. Add to the skillet with the asparagus and bacon and mix well. Serve warm.
Heat to rolling boil. Remove from heat. Add unsweetened chocolate. Mix until smooth. Add vanilla. Cool. Fold in butter and refrigerate.

Plump raisins by soaking in boiling water, about 10 minutes. Drain raisins and place in a bowl. Pour boiling water over pine nutslet stand 5 minutes. Heat oil in a large skillet over medium-high heat. Add the garliccook until it starts to brown, 2 minutes. Add the raisins and pine nutscook until they begin to brown, 2 minutes more. Add the spinachcook until wilted, 2 minutes more. Add the salt and the black peppercook until the liquid has evaporated, about 2 minutes more. Stir in the raisins and pine nuts. Serve warm or at room temperature.
Add coffee and sugar to blender container. Cover and process for 30 seconds or until well mixed. Pour into tall glass. Add ice cream and process for 10 seconds or until mixed well. Serve immediately.

Peel potatoes and cut in half crosswise. Place in large pot with water to cover by 2 inches. Bring to a boilreduce heat and simmer 15 minutes or until tender. Drain and place potatoes in baking dish. Scoop out centers of potatoes to create a wellset aside. In skillet over medium heat, cook ham, stirring occasionally, for 5 minutes or until heated through. Stir in soupcook until heated through. Spoon into potato wellssprinkle with cheddar cheese. Bake at 350 for 30 minutes or until heated through. Serve immediately.

Preheat oven to 400 degrees f. Mix together flour, blue corn meal, baking powder and salt in a large bowl. Make a well in center of the dry ingredientsadd buttermilk, egg and butter. Beat until well blended. Stir in bacon bits and jalapenos. Fill greased muffin cups two-thirds fullbake 15 to 20 minutes or until a toothpick inserted in center comes out clean. Makes 12 muffins.

Preheat oven to 400f. Peel and slice the eggplant into 1/4 inch thick strips. Put the slices into a bowl and toss with 1 tbsp of the olive oil. Add the parmesan cheese and toss again to coat. Spread the slices onto 2 lightly greased cookie sheets. Bake for 12-15 minutes or until the slices are lightly browned and crisp. In the meantime, combine the remaining 1/2 cup olive oil with the bread crumbs and toss well. In another bowl, beat the eggs and milk together. Dip the slices in the egg mixture and then in the bread crumb mixture. Place back on the cookie sheet. Bake for another 10 minutes or so until golden brown. Serve hot.

In a large bowl combine sun dried tomatoes and kalamata olives, crushed tomatoes, and garlic. Puree in blender or food processor. In a large non stick skillet over medium-low heat, saute the pureed mixture, stirring frequently, for 20 minutes or until thickened and reduced by half. Stir in the basil and sugar, and season with salt and pepper. Stir in the feta cheese and parmesan cheese. Serve over pasta.

In a small bowl, combine the soy sauce, garlic and orange marmalade. Put the fish on a broiler pan or oven rack and brush with marmalade mixture. Broil 4 inches from the heat for 4 minutes. Turn the fish and broil 3 minutes more. Serves 4.

In a large saucepan of boiling water, blanch sweetbreads until just tender. Drain and cool slightly. In a large skillet over moderate heat, melt butter or oil with bacon until fat is rendered. Remove bacon with a slotted spoon and keep hot. In remaining fat, saute sweetbreads until lightly browned and slightly crisp. Season with salt, vinegar, and garlic powder to taste. Place in a bowlsprinkle with bacon and serve hot with toast or English muffins.

Peel acorn squash and cut into thin slices. Cut apple into quarters and remove the seeds. Heat a large frying pan over medium high heat and add the apple quarters. Cook until the apples are softened. Add the squash slices and cook until softened. Remove from heat and add the maple syrup and cinnamon and nutmeg to taste. Pour the apple and squash mixture into a greased baking dish. Cover and bake at 375 for about 20 minutes. Meanwhile prepare the pork chops by adding the apple juice and cooking at medium high heat until the chops are cooked through. Serve the pork chops over the baked apples and squash mixture.

Heat pan to medium heat. Add the butter and ham. Cook until the ham is brown. Beat the eggs together with the heavy cream, spices and ham. Cook the egg mixture in the pan with the ham until it is just set. Fold the cheese into the mixture. Serve with toast or tortillas.

Melt together the sugar, syrup and honey. Add the butter and mix well. Add the porridge oats and stir well. Transfer to a large baking tray lined with greaseproof paper. Bake for 10-12 mins until golden.

Prepare cookie mix as directed on box, adding egg, oil and water. Bake as directed on box. When completely cooled, spread cream cheese frosting on bottom of cookie sheet (about 1/2 cup). Spread jam evenly over frosting. Place baked cookies on top of jam. Spread melted white chocolate evenly over top of cookies. Cool before cutting into bars.
Cream together butter, sugar. Add eggs. Beat in flour, baking powder, soda, salt & orange peel. Stir in fruit. Spoon into greased loaf pan. Bake at 350 degrees 55 minutes. Cool.

Preheat oven to 350 degrees F. Grease a 9-inch springform pan or 13x9-inch pan with cooking spray. In a medium bowl, combine chocolate chips, pecans and 1/2 cup coconutset aside. In a large bowl, combine dry cake mix and kahluaadd half-and-half and egg or egg substitutebeat at medium speed of a mixer until well blended (batter will be thin). Pour batter into pansprinkle chocolate chips mixture evenly over top. Bake for 45 minutes or until a toothpick inserted into center of cake comes out clean. Cool completely on a wire rack (about 1 hour). In a small bowl combine powdered sugar, remaining 1/4 cup coconut and enough milk to make a glaze that drizzles easily from a spoon. Drizzle glaze over cooled caketop with additional coconut if desired. Refrigerate for 1 hour or until glaze sets. Run a sharp knife around edge of panremove sides of

Remove tough bottom portion of spears and snap off woody ends of spears. Add oil and garlic to skillet and cook over low heat for 2-3 minutes, stirring frequently until garlic is lightly browned and fragrant. Add spears and cook over low heat for 5-6 minutes, turning once or twice and shaking pan frequently to stir spears and prevent burning until they are just tender but still firm when pierced with a fork. Sprinkle with salt and pepper to taste and serve immediately, garnished with almonds and/or parsley if desired. Serve immediately while hot, garnished with almonds and/or parsley if desired.

Cook the rice as directed on package. In large bowl, combine milk, eggs, sugar, and flour. Stir into the rice. In 9-inch square baking dish, combine the milk mixture with margarine. Bake in 350 degree oven for 30 minutes or until knife inserted near center comes out clean. Serve warm. Sprinkle with nutmeg or cinnamon.

In a medium size bowl mix together fine breadcrumbs, margarine, paprika, flour, pepper, poultry seasoning, and salt. Store in a tightly covered container in the refrigerator for up to 2 weeks. Use to coat poultry prior to broiling.

In a 6 qt. slow cooker, melt butter in a skillet over medium heat. Add onion and cook until tender. Add tenderloin to skillet. Cook until browned. Add remaining ingredients. Cover. Cook 4 hours. Serve with wild rice.
Mix chicken with butter and seasonings. Heat to a boil, cover and simmer for 20 minutes. Add vegetables. Heat until vegetables are tender. Serve over long grain and wild rice.
Toss greens with half of dressing. Place apples in center of greens. Top with pecans. Sprinkle cheese over top. Drizzle with remaining dressing. Can add a bit of red onion if desired.

Chop the herbs. Stir in lemon juice and zest. Beat in the butter until smooth. Season with salt and pepper. Store in an airtight container in the refrigerator. Or, dish it out on parchment paper and roll into a log. Wrap in plastic wrap and foil and it can be frozen for months. Best part is you can just unwrap and slice off what you need and rewrap it and stick it back in the freezer.

In a large pot of boiling water, add the cavatappi pasta and let boil for 10 minutes until tender but firm to the bite. Drain the water and return the pot to the burner on medium heat. Add the butter and heavy cream to the pot. Stir together until the butter melts, then turn off the heat. Add the garlic salt, pecorino romano cheese, parmesan cheese, and 2 cups of the shredded cheddar cheese. Stir until all the cheeses have melted together. Once the cheddar has melted in, add the remaining 1 cup of shredded cheddar cheese on top.

Place potatoes, carrots and onion soup mix in slow cooker. Pour water over the top. Place a layer of beef on top of the vegetables. Add the rest of the meat on top of the first layer. Pour the rest of the tomatoes over the top. Sprinkle with salt, pepper and basil. Cover with lid. Cook on low for 6-8 hours.

Cut chicken breast into thin slices. Mix together goat cheese, spaghetti sauce and white pepper. Place each slice of chicken on top of spaghetti mixture. Add cheese. Roll up chicken breast. Heat in 350 oven until cheese is bubbling and chicken is heated through. Serve with spaghetti.

Drain and flake the tuna into a large bowl. Add the remaining salad ingredients. Combine well. Chill. Arrange the lettuce leaves on a plate. Spoon the salad onto the leaves. Garnish with the egg slices.

In a large skillet over medium heat, saute the meat until brown. Remove from heatdrain any fat. In a large saucepan over medium-high heat, saute the vegetables until tender. Add the meat and barley. In a small bowl, combine the tomato paste and beef brothstir into the skillet. Coverheat to a boilreduce heat to a simmer, cover and simmer for 30 minutes or until barley is tender. Salt and pepper to taste. Serve hot.
Place all the ingredients in the blender and blend until smooth. Refrigerate for at least two hours before serving. Serve with warm pita bread and chopped tomatoes and green onions.

Preheat grill to high heat. Cut the chicken into 1 inch thick slices. Combine the olive oil, garlic, basil, oregano, paprika, peppers and salt in a small bowl. Place the slices in the bowl and toss until each slice is coated with the mixture. Place the slices on a platter and marinate for at least 2 hours. When ready to cook place the slices on the grill. Cook for 8 minutes per side.

In a blender or food processor combine the watermelon and strawberries. Puree until smooth. In a large glass bowl combine the watermelon puree and sugar and mix well. Add the undiluted lemonade concentrate and stir well. Add the fresh lemon juice and mix well. Serve over ice garnish with a lemon slice and enjoy.

Preheat oven to 450 degrees F (230 degrees C). Combine the first 5 ingredients in a large bowl, and then stir in the butter until the mixture is crumbly. Dip each chicken breast into the mixture, coating evenly. Place in a greased 13x9 inch pan.Bake for 20 minutes in the preheated oven.

Heat oil in heavy large saucepan over medium heat. Add onions and bell pepper and cook until tender, stirring occasionally. Add eggs and picante sauce and cook, stirring constantly until scrambled and thickened, about 5 minutes. Stir in sour cream. Spoon into tortillas. Sprinkle with cheese.

Cream butter and sugar. Add the eggs, one at a time beating well after each. Fold in the flour and baking powder. Add the ground almonds and mix well. Pour into two greased and floured 8 inch round cake pans. Bake in a preheated oven at 350 degrees for 25 to 30 minutes or until done. Cool in pan 10 minutes. Remove from pan and cool on wire rack. Drizzle with glaze. Combine confectioners' sugar with enough water to make a glaze. Stir in food coloring. Drizzle over the top of the cake. Decorate with red glazed cherries.

In a 13x9-inch pan, spread 10 ounces of tater tots on bottom. Brown turkey in a skillet. Drain and add green beans. Stir in condensed soup and milkheat through. Spoon over tater totssprinkle with cheddar cheese. Bake at 375f for 45 minutes or until cheese is melted and golden brown.

In large nonstick skillet, cook beef over med-low heat, stirring occasionally, until no longer pinkdrain. Add barbecue sauce, teriyaki sauce, chile and saltcook 1 minute longer or until heated through. Serve on rolls.

Sift together the flour, baking powder and salt. Set aside. Cream butter and sugar in a large bowl. Add the egg white and water and beat well. Add the dry ingredients and the almond extract and beat just until blended. Chill dough for a couple hours or overnight. Heat the oven to 375 degrees F. Roll dough into small balls about the size of a small pea and place on an ungreased cookie sheet. Using the back of a spoon make an indent in the center of each cookie and place a whole almond into each one. Bake for about 14 minutes or until the bottoms are lightly browned. Remove and let cool on the cookie sheet for a few minutes then remove and let cool completely. Dust with powdered sugar if desired and store in an airtight container for up to a week or freeze for longer storage.

Soak bread in milk for 10 minutes to soften. Line bottom of buttered 9 by 13 inch pan with bread cubes. Top with green onion. Add tomatoes and sprinkle with mozzarella cheese. In a large bowl, beat eggs and add milk, butter, garlic salt and pepper. Pour over bread mixture. Sprinkle with basil. Refrigerate overnight or at least 8 hours. Bake at 350 degrees F for 1 hour. Makes 6 to 8 servings.

Cook rice pilaf according to directions. Meanwhile, combine artichokes with tomatoes, red bell pepper, parsley and capers in a medium bowl. Add the lemon juice and sugartoss well. Add the lemon rind and lemon juice to the cooked pilaf. Toss the rice with the artichoke mixture and serve at room temperature.

Mix ingredients together in a small bowl and store in a jar with a tight fitting lid. When ready to use, rub chicken with mixture and place in a baking dish. Bake at 350 for 1 1/2 hours, basting once or twice during baking.

Combine first 4 ingredients in a saucepan over low heat and stir until mixture thickens and coats the back of a spoon. Remove from heat. Add pecans and mix well. Drop by teaspoons onto wax paper to cool completely before storing in an airtight container.

Combine pineapple with juice, orange juice and zest in a blenderblend until smooth. Remove from blender into a sauce pan and cook over medium heat, stirring constantly until thickened and hot to the touch, 5 to 6 minutes. Remove from heat. Sprinkle gelatin evenly over top of pineapple mixturelet stand 5 minutes to soften. Beat egg yolks in a large bowl with an electric mixeradd pineapple mixture to egg yolks and beat with an electric mixer on medium speed 2 minutes or until well blended. Stir in neufchatel, orange zest and vanilla. Pour mixture into crustbake 30 minutes or until center is set. Cool completely on a wire rack. Refrigerate overnight. Spread with whipped topping before serving.

Combine all filling ingredients in a bowl until well blended. On a clean work surface, lay a wonton wrapper out on a cutting board or countertop. Place a teaspoon of filling on one corner of the wrapper (see photo), fold the wrapper over the filling and press edges together firmly. Repeat for all the wontons. Heat butter and oil over medium heat in a large skillet or wok. Add wontonsstir fry until crisp and golden brown, about 3-4 minutes per side. Drain on paper towelssprinkle with a little more pepper if desired. Serve warm with dipping sauce of your choice.

In a food processor, combine the graham crackers and butter. Blend until fine crumbs form. Transfer to a bowl. Beat the cream cheese and fat free cream cheese until smooth. Beat in the lime juice and salt until well blended. Beat in the eggs one at a time. Add the splenda. Mix well. Pour into the prepared pie pan and bake for 1 hour. Cool for 10 minutes on a wire rack. Refrigerate overnight.

In a large bowl, beat together eggs and milk. Add butter and season with salt and pepper. Add rice and corn and stir until combined. Pour into a 9x13-inch baking dish coated with cooking spray. Bake for 30 minutes at 350 degrees F.

Cut off the tops of the peppers and slice off the stem. Cut off the seeds and white core. Cut into 1/4 inch thick slices. Heat oil in a nonstick skillet over medium heat. Add peppers, 4 or 5 at a time. Cook about 2 minutes. Turn over. Add garlic and cook until the peppers are just tender crisp. Sprinkle with salt and pepper.

Grate the cabbage into a large bowl. Add the mayonnaise, sugar, cumin and chili powder and mix well. Add the dressing and mix well. Add the peanuts and mix again. Chill for at least an hour before serving.
Combine all ingredients in a jar with a tight-fitting lid. Shake well to combine. Cover and refrigerate overnight before using. Shake well before pouring onto fruit salads.

In a large bowl combine the sugar and cornstarch, then sprinkle in the apple pie spice and stir well. Add the sliced peaches and gently toss together. Pour into a deep dish pie pan and bake at 350 degrees F for 35 minutes. Serve warm or cool. Serves 12.

Cook chicken in skillet with onion until tender. Cut into bite size pieces. Combine chicken, soup, green chilies, cream cheese, cumin, garlic pepper, colby-monterey jack cheese in a bowl and mix well. Heat in microwave on high for 2 minutes stirring every 30 seconds until cheese is melted. Serve with tortilla chips or crackers.

Cook baby spinach in a small amount of cooking spray until wilted, about 2 to 3 minutes. Drain on paper towel to remove excess water. In a medium mixing bowl combine ricotta cheese and 1/2 tsp of the black pepper. Add the cooked spinach and mix well. Cover with plastic wrap and set aside to cool to room temperature. Preheat oven to 375 degrees F. Remove one wonton wrapper from package and brush lightly with cooking spray. Place 1 tsp of filling in center of wrapper. Brush edge of wrapper with water. Fold wrapper in half to form a triangle shape. Press edges together to seal. Repeat to make 12 pillows. Place pillows on a greased baking sheet. Brush with egg white mixture and sprinkle with remaining 1/2 tsp black pepper. Bake for 15 minutes or until golden brown. Serve warm. Makes 12 pillows.

Rub fish with oil, sprinkle with lemon juice and set aside for 10 minutes. Whisk together oil, lemon juice, parsley and garlic until well combined. Place fish in a single layer in a shallow dish and sprinkle with lemon-garlic mixture and season with salt and pepper to taste. Sprinkle with paprika and bake 15-20 minutes or until fish flakes easily when tested with a fork.

Preheat oven to 400. Line a baking pan with aluminum foil. Spray with cooking spray. Place all the remaining ingredients in a bowl. Toss to combine. Place the chicken in the pan. Pour the marinade over it. Cover. Roast for 1 hour. Uncover the chicken. Continue baking for 30 minutes.

Preheat the grill. Cook bacon until crisp. Drain, reserving 1 tablespoon of bacon drippings in skillet. Add onion and saute until tender. Add the black beans, salt and pepper and hot sauce to taste. Add the bacon at the end. Serve with sour cream.

In a large skillet, brown the beef and drain off the fat. Add the rest of the ingredients. Cook over low heat until all the liquid is gone. Pour into a baking dish. Bake uncovered at 350 degrees fahrenheit for 45 minutes. Serve with chili sauce or taco sauce.
Boil and drain the potatoesmash with the butter and half-and-halfadd the remaining ingredients and stir to mix well. Salt and pepper to taste. Serve warm as a side dish or with chicken.

Mix the teriyaki sauce and oil and brush over both sides of each steak. Place in a heavy skillet and cook over medium-high heat for 3 minutes per side for medium rare. Remove from pan and let rest for 5 minutes. Meanwhile, combine the oysters and oyster liquor in a skillet and heat until hot. Serve with steak and oysters over rice.

Combine maple syrup, brown sugar, butter, and water in heavy bottom saucepan. Heat to boiling. Boil one minute. Remove from heat. Stir in half-and-half cream. Stir in vanilla. Serve warm over ice cream. Garnish with walnuts.
In a screw top jar combine lemonade concentrate, honey, poppy seed, and dry mustard. Cover. Shake well to mix. Combine fruit in a large glass bowl. Add dressing. Toss to coat. Serve immediately.

Mix all the dry ingredients together in a bowl and set aside. Cream the butter and sugars together until light and fluffy. Add the eggs and milk one at a time and mix well after each addition. Add the dry ingredients and mix well. Stir in the chocolate chips. Use a small ice cream scoop and place on a baking sheet lined with baking paper. Bake for 12 - 15 minutes until lightly golden. Allow to cool on the tray for 5 minutes before removing. Store in an airtight container.

Preheat oven to 450F. Rub oil over potato wedges. Sprinkle Cajun seasoning over and toss to coat evenly. Spread wedges out over a rimmed baking sheet or cast-iron pan in a single layer. Roast until lightly brown and crisp, about 30-35 minutes stirring once during baking.

Preheat oven to 350. Place a piece of foil on a baking sheet and place each chicken breast on top of it. In a bowl combine artichoke hearts, thyme leaves and parmesan cheese. Spoon about 1/4 cup mixture on top of each chicken breast. Wrap chicken breasts in foil and bake for 45 minutes or until chicken breasts are cooked through. Unwrap chicken breasts and place in a warm serving dish. Serve with extra virgin olive oil and lemon wedges.
Combine mushrooms and dressing in a large salad bowl. Add asparagus and toss to coat well. Divide among 4 plates. Top with nuts and serve.

Preheat oven to 350 degrees F (175 degrees C). Melt butter in a saucepan over low heat. Add honey and stir until smooth. Remove from heat and let cool slightly. Mix butter mixture with oats, pecans and walnutsset aside. In a large bowl, combine the oat mixture and honey mixture until evenly coated. Spread onto a jelly-roll pan and bake for 1 hour in the preheated oven, stirring occasionally until golden brown. Let cool and crumble into individual servings.
Steam the Edamame. In a large bowl, combine the cooked Edamame, lemon juice and rind. Add the seasonings and toss to coat. Serve immediately.

Boil sausage in a pan of water till no longer pink in center. Drain meat from water and cool slightly. Grind in food processor. Add all remaining ingredients except chives. Stir well. Spread on toast or bagel slices with chopped chives.

Preheat oven to 400 degrees F. Spray baking pan with non-stick cooking spray. Season tilapia with thyme and black pepper. Drizzle with lemon juice and bake for 20 minutes or until fish flakes. In a medium saucepan, cook chicken broth and mustard over medium heat. Bring to a boil. Add mushrooms and simmer for 5 minutes or until tender. Stir in cream and heat through. Spoon over fish.

Heat oven to 375 degrees f. Grease cookie sheets. Cream butter and sugar until light and fluffy. Add barbecue sauce and beat until well combined. Beat in eggs and baking soda. In a separate bowl combine flour and remaining spices. Gradually stir into creamed mixture until well blended. Drop dough by teaspoons onto cookie sheets 2 inches apart. Bake for 10 minutes or until edges are slightly browned. Cool on wire racks. Makes about 3 dozen.

Grate the swiss cheese into a mixing bowl. Add the gruyere cheese, cornstarch, brie cheese, champagne, almond extract, ground nutmeg, apple juice. Beat well until smooth. Pour into a fondue pot or a chafing dish. Place the fondue pot over a flame. Stir gently until cheese melts. Do not boil. Serve with french bread cubes and breadsticks. Garnish with apple slices.

Heat oven to 200C/fan 180C/gas 6. Lightly beat the eggs with a fork. Add the beans, cheese, oregano and spinach. Heat the olive oil in a large frying pan until hot. Pour the mixture into the pan. Cook for 3-4 minutes. Turn over with a spatula. Transfer the pan to the oven. Cook for 10-12 minutes, or until the frittata is set. Cut into wedges to serve.

Brush one side of the slices of bread with oil. Sprinkle the oiled sides with salt and pepper. Grill the bread for 2 to 3 minutes on each side or until golden brown. Brush the top side of the bread with oil. Remove the bread from the grill. Cut the eggplants in half lengthwise. Brush the cut sides with oil. Season the cut sides of the eggplants with salt and pepper. Place the eggplants on the oiled side of the bread. Top with the tomatoes, the cheese, the basil leaves and coarse sea salt. Slice in half and serve.

Preheat oven to 350 degrees F (175 degrees C). In a large bowl, combine cream cheese, 1/4 cup of the sugar and the frozen orange juice concentrate. Beat until smooth. Add eggs one at a time, mixing well after each addition. Pour into prepared crust. Bake for 30 to 35 minutes in the preheated oven. Cool on a wire rack.In a medium bowl, combine the remaining 1 cup of the sugar and the light brown sugar. Add the mandarin oranges and the juice. Mix well. Pour onto cooled cheesecake. Chill before serving.

Peel, core, and grind the carrots in a food processor or blender. In a large enameled pot, combine the carrots, pears, pineapple juice, lemon juice, cinnamon, nutmeg, clove, and sugar. Bring to a boil over medium heat, stirring constantly. Boil for 1 minute while stirring continuously. Remove from heat and stir in the liquid pectin. Skim off the foam from the surface of the jam, and seal in hot sterilized canning jars. May be water bath processed for 10 minutes, if preferred.

Lightly coat an 8-quart Dutch oven or large deep skillet with nonstick cooking spray. Cook chicken in hot skillet over medium-high heat until thoroughly cooked. Add tomato sauce, water, and next 6 ingredients (through cayenne pepper). Bring to boil. Reduce heat and simmer uncovered for about 20 minutes or until thickened. Stir in beans. Sprinkle with cheese.

In a bowl, cream together butter and sugar until smooth. Beat in eggs and vanilla. Sift together dry ingredients, beat into mixture alternately with milk. Divide into 24 balls and roll in raspberry jam. Place in miniature muffin tins, leaving room to spread. Bake at 350 degrees until done.

Preheat the oven to 400 degrees. Place the potatoes in a large bowl and drizzle with olive oil to lightly coat each piece. Sprinkle with sea salt and pepper and the chopped fresh rosemary and the minced garlic and toss to combine. Spread out the potatoes in a single layer in a shallow 8-inch square baking pan. Roast in the preheated oven until the potatoes are just beginning to turn golden brown around the edges, or until the edges crisp up, about 30 minutes. Serve hot.

In a small saucepan over medium heat combine honey, lime juice, sriracha sauce and 1/4 teaspoon of salt. Bring to a boil. Remove from heat. In a large skillet heat 1 tablespoon of olive oil over medium heat. Add garlic and cook for 30 seconds. Add brussels sprouts and stir to coat. Cook until tender. Remove from heat. Add Sriracha honey mixture to the pan. Toss to combine. Serve immediately.

Preheat oven to 180. Line baking tray with parchment paper. Beat eggs and kirsch together until well combined and frothy. Sift together the flour and anise seed. Stir the egg mixture into the flour mixture. Turn out onto a lightly floured surface and knead until smooth and elastic. Divide into 2 equal portions. Roll each portion into a 20cm x 10cm rectangle. Using a pastry cutter or a 5cm round cutter cut into 10cm rounds. Place 2cm apart on the prepared tray. Brush with beaten egg and sprinkle with the icing sugar. Bake for 15 minutes or until golden. Transfer to wire racks to cool completely. Store in airtight container. Makes about 25 cookies

Mix water, sugar and cream of tartar together. Bring to a boil and cook until mixture is clear and the temperature is about 240 degrees F. (This is called the soft ball stage.) Remove from heat and add salt. Cool and use as desired.

Preheat oven to 350 degrees f. Line a 9x13 inch pan with foil or parchment paper. Grease or line pan with non stick spray. Mash bananas in a medium bowl with a fork until mostly smooth. Set aside. In a large mixing bowl combine the sugar, flour, baking soda, and salt. Mix well and set aside. In a separate bowl mix the eggs and vegetable oil. Add the oil/egg mixture to the dry ingredient mixture and beat well. Stir in the mashed bananas. Gently fold in the chocolate chips. Pour batter into prepared pan. Bake for 45 minutes or until a toothpick inserted into the center comes out clean. Cool in pan for 10 minutes and then remove from pan to cool completely on a wire rack. Frost with vanilla frosting or let cool until the next day. Store in an air tight container for up to a week.

Place all ingredients in a crockpot and cook for 8 to 10 hours at high or 10 to 12 hours at low. Remove meat and place in a warm oven to keep warm while making gravy. Skim fat from pot and bring to a boil in saucepan. Stir in cornstarch and water and cook for 1 minute. Serve with meat and veggies of your choice.

Heat oil in skillet over medium high heat. Add veal and cook until browned. Add garlic and cook 1 minute. Add wine and cook until liquid is evaporated. Add chopped tomatoes and cook until thick. Season with oregano and salt & pepper. Serve with spaghetti and sprinkle with parsley.

Melt margarine over medium heat, add onions and mushrooms. Cook until tender, about 10 minutes. Remove from heat and stir in flour until blended. Return to heat and stir in soy milk and garlic powder until smooth and bubbly. Remove from heat and stir in green beans and pepper. Pour into a 9 x 13-inch baking dish and sprinkle with fried onions. Bake at 375 degrees for 30 minutes or until bubbly and golden brown.

In a medium bowl combine broccoli, olive oil spray, teriyaki sauce, and pepper. Place in a shallow pan and bake uncovered for 20-25 minutes or until crisp tender. Remove from oven and garnish with fresh parsley and serve immediately.
Cook rice. Add water to rice. Let stand to cool. Add other ingredients to the rice. Add vanilla and the heavy cream. Refrigerate for 2 hours.

In a 9x13 casserole dish layer the chicken, mushrooms, spinach and half the cheese. Repeat. In a bowl mix together the chicken stock and the soup mix. Add to casserole dish. Bake uncovered at 350F for 40 minutes or until bubbly and golden brown. Top with remaining cheese. Bake uncovered for 5 minutes more or until cheese is melted.

Boil potatoes until tender. In a heavy skillet, heat 2 tablespoons of the butter with the olive oil. Add the sprouts. Stirring frequently, cook them over moderate heat until they are browned. Add the potatoes and bay leaf. Stir in the stock. Cover tightly and cook over moderate heat until the potatoes are heated through. Season with salt and pepper. Sprinkle with parsley.

Preheat the oven to 400 degrees F. Line a rimmed baking sheet with foil. In a large bowl, toss the beets, parsnips, carrots and mushrooms with the brown sugar and 1/4 cup of the olive oil. Season with the salt and pepper. Spread vegetables in a single layer on the baking sheet. Roast for 20 minutes. Drain the vegetables into a colander set over a medium bowl. Return the vegetables to the baking sheet. In a medium saucepan, combine the remaining 1/4 cup of the olive oil with the vinegar. Bring the mixture to a boil. Pour the hot mixture over the vegetables. Roast for 10 minutes more. Toss the vegetables again and return to the oven. Roast for another 20 minutes, or until the vegetables are tender. Cool for 5 minutes. Serve warm or at room temperature.

Place all the marinade ingredients into a plastic bag, add the chicken and seal. Refrigerate the chicken for about 3 hours. Preheat oven to 400 degrees. Line a baking sheet with foil. Place the chicken thighs onto the baking sheet, and bake for 40 minutes.

Make 2 patties out of the sausage. Toast the english muffins. Add the sausage patties to a skillet with a bit of oil and cook until browned on both sides. Beat the eggs in a small bowl and add to the skillet. Cook until eggs are done. Top the english muffins with the sausage and eggs. Place a slice of cheddar on top of each sandwich. Bake in a preheated oven until the cheese is fully melted. Serve hot.
Brown meat in skillet. Add mushrooms and saute until tender. Add soup mixture. Bring to boil. Reduce heat. Cover and simmer. Stir occasionally. Add parsley. Serve over rice.

Soak radishes in water for 15 minutes. Drain. Mix flour with 1/2 cup of water. Add vinegar and remaining water. Bring to a boil. Add radishes. Cook until tender. Add cucumber. Cook 1 minute. Remove from heat. Cool. Peel potatoes. Slice thinly. Add to radish mixture. Toss well. Add salt and pepper to taste. Refrigerate several hours to blend flavors.

In a bowl, combine the salt, pepper, and basil. Rub the salt mixture over the chicken. In a skillet over medium-high heat, brown the onions in the oil for about 2 to 3 minutes. Add the garlic and basil and cook for about 30 seconds. Add the chicken and balsamic vinegar to the skillet. Cook until the vinegar is absorbed by the meat. Add the wine to the skillet and cook until almost all of the wine is absorbed. Pour the mixture into a crock pot. Cover and cook on low for at least 6 hours. Remove the chicken from the balsamic mixture and keep warm. Add the fresh herbs and gently stir into the balsamic sauce. Pour the sauce over the chicken and garnish with additional parsley.

Mix flour with salt and baking powder and set aside. Beat together dates, eggs, vanilla extract and sugar. Add walnuts and cherry pieces. Add flour mixture and mix well. Pour into greased pan and bake at 350 degrees until brown and toothpick comes out clean when inserted in the middle of the cake. Cool before removing from pan and cutting into squares. Store in an air-tight container.

Butter one side of each slice of bread. Put one slice of bread butter side down in a pan. Put 2 slices of tomato (1 slice per sandwich) in the center of each slice of bread. Lay 2 slices of cooked bacon, 1 slice per sandwich, across the tomato slices in the center of the bread (the tomato will be in the middle of the sandwich). Place the other slice of bread butter side up over the tomato slices. Pour 1-2 tbsp of water over the top of the sandwich. Microwave the sandwich until the water is boiling (about 1 minute). Remove the sandwich from the microwave and place a slice of monterey jack pepper cheese on top of the tomato slices (the tomato will be in the middle of the sandwich). Place the pan back in the microwave and microwave the sandwich until the cheese is melted (about 1 minute). Remove the sandwich from the microwave and serve.

Mix together the rhubarb, the sugar, the flour, the nutmeg, and the salt. Stir in the eggs. Pour the mixture into a greased 10-inch deep dish pie plate. Dot the top of the mixture with the butter. Cover the top of the mixture with the remaining unbaked pie crust. Bake the pie at 350 degrees F (175 degrees C) for 45 minutes.
Combine all ingredients. Spoon into 9x13 inch baking dish. Bake at 350 degrees for 45 minutes or until crust is browned.

In a deep saute pan, heat the olive oil. Add garlic and saute until lightly browned. Add broccoli florets and saute until bright green. Add chicken and saute until hot. Add lemon juice and basil and stir. Add pasta and saute for one minute. Add tomatoes and cheese. Heat through. Serve immediately.

Preheat an outdoor grill for high heat. Lightly coat the lemongrass sticks with the peanut oil and thread the chicken and lemongrass onto the skewers. Combine the lime rind and coriander leaves and rub the mixture over the top of the chicken. Brush the chicken with the lime juice and sprinkle the bird’s-eye chiles on top. Grill the chicken for 4 to 5 minutes per side or until the chicken is cooked through. Remove from the grill and brush with the macadamia nut oil. Sprinkle with the raw sugar and serve with the garlic clove.

Cook pasta according to package directions. Drain. Heat olive oil in a skillet. Add sausage and cook until browned. Drain and set aside. Heat stewed tomatoes in a large skillet over medium heat. Stir in oregano, parsley, salt and pepper. Stir in ziti and sausage. Transfer to a 13x9-inch baking dish coated with cooking spray. Top with breadcrumbs. Bake uncovered for 15 minutes. Sprinkle with cheese. Broil for 2-3 minutes or until cheese is melted.

Bring water to a boil, remove from heat and add tea bags to hot water and steep for 2 minutes. Meanwhile peel 10 navel oranges and 5 lemons and cut into slicesset aside. Squeeze juice from the 10 navel oranges and 5 lemons to make 5 cups of juiceset aside. Remove the tea bags from hot water and discard. Add citrus juice to hot tea and stir until blendedadd honey to taste. Add 1 cup ginger ale to each quart of tea and refrigerate for up to 2 days. Serve over ice with lemon and orange slices and ginger ale.
Put all the ingredients into the bread machine pan in the order recommended by the manufacturer. Select the basic cycle.

Rub the pork with the spices and place it on a cookie sheet. Add some chopped onions. Pour about 1/3 of the ginger ale over top of the onions and the pork. Cover tightly and refrigerate overnight. The next day put the rest of the ginger ale on top of the meat and onions. Cover and place in a 200 degree oven for 16 hours. When done remove from oven and cover again. Let it rest for at least one hour. Pull and enjoy.

In large bowl, combine the chocolate chips, marshmallow cream and nutsset aside. Cream the butter. Add the powdered sugar, 1 cup at a time beating well after each addition. Stir in the vanilla. Stir in the marshmallow mixture. Refrigerate the dough for at least 1 hour or overnight. Preheat oven to 350 degrees F (175 degrees C). Line a baking sheet with parchment paper or waxed paper. Roll the dough into 1/2 inch balls. Place 1 1/2 inches apart on the prepared baking sheet. Bake for 6 to 8 minutes in the preheated oven, or until the edges are set. Allow to cool for 2 minutes before removing from the cookie sheet to a wire rack to cool completely.

Place beef and onions in the bottom of a crock pot. Add bouillon cubes over top and sprinkle with cornstarch, salt and pepper to taste. Pour red wine over all. Cook on low for 10 to 12 hours. Serve over cooked noodles or rice.

Combine sugar, dark corn syrup and water in 5-quart saucepan. Bring to a boil over high heat. Cook without stirring until mixture reaches a light brown color. Remove from heat. Quickly stir in butter, cream and vanilla until mixture is smooth. Stir in almonds. Pour mixture onto lightly greased baking sheet. Let cool completely before cutting into 1-inch squares.
Combine all ingredients in a large bowl and toss well. Serve on a bed of romaine lettuce leaf.

Cut each chicken breast in half lengthwise to form two thin strips. Set aside. Combine onion and jalapeno pepper in a food processor. Chop until smooth. Transfer to a medium bowl. Add the remaining ingredients and stir. Reserve 1 tablespoon. Pour marinade over chicken. Marinate 2 hours or longer. Grill 5-6 minutes per side or until no longer pink. Serve immediately. Sprinkle the reserved marinade over the top.
Cream sugar and butter. Add eggs. Add milk. Add dry ingredients. Mix well. Pour into greased muffin tin. Bake 400 for 15 to 20 minutes.
Place all ingredients except roast in crock pot. Add roast. Cook on low for 6-8 hours. Slice roast. Serve over rice.

Combine butter, brown and white sugars and eggs in a mixing bowl. Beat with a mixer until light and creamy. Add the dry ingredients, except the walnuts. Mix well. Stir in the walnuts. Drop by tablespoons onto ungreased cookie sheets. Bake 8-10 minutes or until lightly golden brown around the edges. Cool on wire racks.

Beat sugar and salt into potato flour. Beat in eggs one at a time, then mash in the banana. Pour into greased and floured pan and bake for one hour at 180C or until a skewer inserted in center comes out clean.
Mix together in crockpot and cook on low 2 to 3 hours. Serve with tortilla chips or bread.

Cook bacon until crisp. Crumble bacon. Set aside. In large skillet heat 2 tablespoons of the olive oil. Add the garlic and saute for 1 minute. Add the yellow onion and cook 3 minutes. Add the beet leaves, wine, and 1/2 of the bacon. Cook 5 minutes or until the leaves are wilted. Season to taste with the salt and pepper. Toss with remaining 2 tablespoons of the olive oil. Serve hot.
In a large bowl, beat topping and milk until smooth. Stir in pudding and let stand 5 minutes or until thickened. Fold in Cool Whip and spread into crust. Top with toffee bars. Refrigerate.

In a large skillet, saute the chicken in oil until no longer pink. Add the juice concentrate and butter. Stir until heated. Remove from heat and stir in the soy sauce. Serve over rice or noodles. Garnish with chopped green onions.

Bring barley and 4 cups water to boiling in a large saucepan over medium-high heat. Cover, reduce heat to low, and simmer until barley is tender and liquid is absorbed, 20 to 30 minutes. Drain barley in a colander set in the sink. Transfer barley to a large bowl. Add vinegar and basil to barleystir to combine. Add oil and stir until coated. Add corn and tomatoes. Mix to combine. Add more vinegar or oil if desired. Refrigerate at least 2 hours to allow flavors to blend. Toss before serving.

Place brisket in slow cookerplace garlic salt, salt-free lemon pepper and spicy brown mustard in a bagroll brisket in bagplace in slow cookeradd onions and remaining ingredientscook on low 8 to 10 hours, until tender and falling apart. Remove from slow cookerdrain excess liquid and serve. Serves 8-10 people.

Preheat oven to 375 degrees F (190 degrees C). In a large bowl, combine the oats, walnuts, raisins, flax seed and brown sugar. In a small bowl, combine the oil, honey and vanilla. Pour the oil mixture over the oat mixture and toss to coat evenly. Spread onto a baking sheet and bake for 15 to 18 minutes in the preheated oven, stirring once halfway through the baking time. Remove from the oven and let cool on the baking sheet. Store in an air tight container.

Mix together margarine, powdered sugar and flour. Beat in egg and milk until blended. Add lemon juice concentrate and lemon extract. Stir in coconut. Bake in greased 11x17 inch pan at 350f for 20 minutes or until lightly browned. Cool in pan on wire rack. Cut into squares or rectangles.

Wash the blueberries thoroughly to remove any grit. Combine the blueberries, sugar, lime juice and zest, lemon juice, and dry pectin in a 6-cup or larger bread pan. Place the pan into a bread machine with the recommended amount of bread flour or all purpose flour according to the manufacturer's directions for making jam. Press the "dough" cycle button, or program the machine to knead the dough for 10 minutes. Check the consistency of the dough. If it is too dry to spread, add 1 tablespoon of water at a time until it reaches the proper consistency. Spread the dough evenly into a 9-inch square pan. Bake at 350 F for 20 minutes. Cool completely before unmolding.

Cut a slit in the top of each berry to form a lid. Mix cream cheese with 1 teaspoon splenda and orange extract until smooth. Fill each berry with 1 teaspoon of this mixture. Place a walnut on top of each berry to seal it. Chill until serving.

Saut the onions in butter until tender. Add in the garlic and cook until tender. Add the ground beef and saute until lightly brown. Add in the bell peppers and cook until tender. Stir in the tomato sauce and add in the canned tomatoes and cook until thick. Stir in the rotel tomatoes and the cabbage. Add in the seasonings and cook until well blended. Serve over rice or noodles.

Soak dried ancho chiles in hot water for 20 minutes. Drain. Place in blender or food processor. Add remaining ingredients. Puree. Add vegetable oil. Blend until smooth. Marinade meat in mixture for several hours. Grill or broil until done.
Toss everything in a large bowl. Top with feta cheese. Serve with crusty bread.

In a large saucepan, sautee the onion with olive oil, until tender. Add ginger and sautee 1 minute. Add carrots to pot and stir in 2 cups of chicken broth. Bring to a boil. Reduce heat to low. Add honey. Salt to taste. Serve hot or cold.

Preheat oven to 375 degrees. With a sharp knife cut off the top of the squash. Remove the seeds and place the squash on a baking sheet or large baking dish. Mix together the melted butter, sugar, and cinnamon together. Spread this mixture over the top of the squash. Sprinkle on some chopped walnuts or pecans if desired. Place the squash back on the baking sheet or dish. Bake for 1 hour or until tender. Remove from the oven and serve with a scoop of ice cream or a scoop of vanilla bean gelato if you can find it or whipped cream if you can't.

Cut beef into thin strips. Season with salt & pepper. Coat in flour. Brown in hot butter. Add beef stock and cook until almost dry. Add tomato. Cover and simmer for 10 minutes. Add the prepared mustard. Add the onion and the white mushrooms. Heat through. Serve hot with the sour cream.

Preheat oven to 350 degrees F. Grease a 13 by 9 by 2 inch baking dish. Arrange the bacon and chicken overlapping in one layer in the baking dish. Mix the butter with the flour and white pepper. Add the milk and cream and stir until smooth. Add the oregano. Pour the sauce over the bacon and chicken. Sprinkle the cheese over the top. Bake for 20 minutes. Serve hot. Serves 4.
Saute celery and green onion in butter until tender. Add the rice and saute for 2 minutes. Add the water and cook until the liquid is absorbed. Stir in the orange juice. Stir in the almonds. Serve.

In a large skillet cook onion and beef until meat is no longer pink. Drain meat mixture and add water, sweet corn and taco seasoning. Mix well and set aside to cool while you prepare the next steps. Grease a 2-quart casserole dish. Layer half of the prepared beef mixture, the macaroni and green pepper over the bottom of the dish. Top with the remaining beef mixture and the remaining macaroni. Sprinkle with shredded cheese and the black olives. Bake for 30 minutes or until hot and bubbly. Let stand for 5 minutes before serving. Serve with sour cream and salsa if desired.

Sift together the flour and the baking powder and set aside. Cream together the butter and the sugar until light and fluffy. Beat in the eggs one at a time until smooth. Stir in the lemon juice and the vanilla. Stir in the dry ingredients just until smooth. Pour into a greased 10-inch tube pan and bake at 350 for 40-45 minutes or until a tester comes out clean. Cool in the pan for 20 minutes and then turn out to cool completely on a wire rack. Serve plain or with strawberries and whipped cream

Heat olive oil in skillet on medium-high heat. Add shallots and cook for 2 minutes or until lightly browned. Stir in button mushrooms and cook for 15 minutes or until tender and lightly browned. Stir in red wine vinegar and cook for 2 minutes. Stir in salt and thyme. Remove from heat and cool to room temperature. Place in airtight container and refrigerate for up to 2 days.
Heat olive oil in a skillet over medium heat. Saute garlic until lightly browned. Add tuna and chicken broth and bring to a boil. Add the pasta and toss to coat. Top with parsley and serve.

In a large bowl, whisk together the mustard, vinegar, lemon juice and dill. Toss in the cucumbers. Let stand for 30 minutes to 1 hour. Just before serving, stir in the diced tomatoes. Drizzle with flaxseed oil. Sprinkle with garlic. Serve.
Peel bananas and slice into thirds lengthwise. Combine all ingredients in a blender and process for 1 to 2 minutes, or until the mixture is thick and smooth. Serve immediately.

Preheat oven to 400F. In large mixing bowl combine all dry ingredients and set aside. In large mixing bowl combine milk, egg and vegetable oil. Stir in rhubarb and strawberries and mix well. Add dry ingredients and mix well. Spoon batter evenly into 12 well greased muffin cups. Bake for 20 minutes. Cool in pan 10 minutes then remove to cool on wire rack.

Grind bread in food processor. Place bread crumbs in greased 9x13 pan. Beat egg yolks in large bowl. Blend in milk, mustard & pepper. Stir in bread crumbs. Beat egg whites in small bowl till stiff peaks form. Fold into bread mixture. Bake at 350 for 45 minutes or till brown on top. Serve as is or with chili.

Preheat the oven to 400 degrees f. Spray a 13x9 inch baking pan or casserole with cooking spray. Sprinkle the butter over the bottom of the pan or casserole, then place the garlic clove in the center of the pan or casserole. Sprinkle the parmesan cheese over the butter and garlic, then spread the seasoned stuffing on top of the parmesan cheese. Place the chicken breasts on top of the stuffing mixture and bake for 15 minutes. Sprinkle the chicken breasts with the remaining parmesan cheese and bake for 20 minutes longer or until the juices run clear when the thickest part of the chicken is cut to the bone. If the chicken browns too quickly before it is done cooking, cover the pan or casserole with aluminum foil. Makes 4 servings. Serve the chicken over the cooked rice or pasta.
Mix all together and put on fish and bake at 350 for 20 minutes.

Preheat oven to 400f. Cut the pears in half and remove the cores with the tip of a knife. Place the pears in an oven proof dish and drizzle the cut sides with the melted butter. Sprinkle the cut sides of the pears with the spice and sprinkle with the nuts. Bake until tender and the skins are crisp. Serve with ice cream.

Boil the apples until tender. Mash the potato and add the apples. Cut the sausage into small chunks and add it too. Add the spices and stir well. Bake for about 45 minutes at 180 C or till golden brown.

Preheat oven to 350 degrees. Place salmon in a shallow baking dish coated with cooking spray. Combine tomatoes, mushrooms, green onions, italian dressing and pepper in a bowl. Spoon mixture over the salmon. Bake for 20 minutes or until fish flakes easily with a fork.

Melt olive oil in large skillet over medium-low heat. Add green onions and garlic. Cook and stir 3-4 minutes. Add shrimp, salt and lemon juice. Cook and stir until shrimp are pink and opaque in the center. Sprinkle with parmesan cheese if desired. Serve with rice or pasta. Delicious.

Melt the butter in a frying pan over medium heat. Slice the leeks and add them to the pan. Cook for 5 minutes. Add the milk and simmer for a few minutes. Remove from the heat and add the eggs, a little salt and pepper and nutmeg and a splash of paprika. Divide between 4 ramekins or small pie plates and bake for 10 minutes or until the egg is set. Serve warm.
Grate fresh ginger. Add rest of ingredients. Bring to a boil. Remove from heat. Cool.

Drain the dates by putting them into a strainer over a bowl. Add the butter to the bowl and let it melt over medium heat. Add the brown sugar, ginger and the drained dates. Beat well, then add the eggs one at a time, stirring well after each addition. Sift the flour and bicarbonate of soda together into a large bowl, then add the date mixture and mix well. Grease a 23cm square tin and line the bottom with baking paper. Pour the mixture into the tin, then bake for 35 minutes until the cake is golden brown and a skewer comes out clean when inserted into the centre. Allow the cake to cool in the tin for 10 minutes before removing from the tin. Makes 16-20 servings.

Heat butter and oil together over medium-high heat. Add pepper and mushrooms and cook until lightly browned. Add tomatoes and cook for 5 minutes. Add garlic powder and seasonings and cook 2 minutes more. Stir in rice and cook for 2 minutes more. Stir in broth and water and bring to a boil. Reduce heat to low and cover. Cook for 20 minutes or until water is absorbed and rice is tender and fluffy. Remove from heat and let stand covered 5 minutes. Stir in parsley and serve.

Cook bacon. Remove from pan and drain off fat. Add the chopped onion and garlic to the pan and saute for 5 minutes or until the onions are transparent.
