Stir in the Jalapeno pepper, brown sugar, and cooked bacon. Drain the spinach well and add to the pan with the apple cider vinegar. Salt and pepper to taste and stir well to combine. Serve immediately or chill before serving.

Heat 2 tablespoons of oil in a large skillet over medium heat. Add the garlic and onion and cook for 5 minutes or until the onions are translucent. Add the Brussels sprouts and cook for 5 minutes or until tender. Add the balsamic vinegar, butter, 2 tablespoons of water, and the salt and pepper. Cook for 5 minutes or until heated through. Garnish with more balsamic vinegar.

Place sunflower seeds into a food processor or blender. Cover with a lid and process until the seeds have broken down into a smooth puree. Add sunflower oil and blend until you achieve a thick creamy consistency, adding more oil as needed. Add the sugar and sea salt to taste. Refrigerate until ready to serve.

Pour 1 can of popcorn into a large bowl. Add 1/2 cup of walnut pieces and 1/2 cup pecans. In a medium saucepan over med heat melt 1/2 cup butter. Add 1/4 cup vanilla and 1 1/2 cups white sugar. Stir until melted. Cook 5 minutes. Pour over popcorn and nuts. Mix thoroughly. Spread on a large jelly roll pan. Bake for 30 minutes at 250f. Let cool and break into clusters.

Preheat the oven to 325 degrees F (165 degrees C). Beat together the eggs and milk in a large bowl. Stir in the flour and the hamcontinue stirring until the mixture is smooth. Pour the mixture into the unbaked pie shellsprinkle the cheese evenly over the top. Bake in the preheated oven until the filling is set and the top is lightly browned, about 45 minutes.
Combine 1 cup of each in a blender with 3 cups of ice. Blend and chill for 2 hours before serving. Serve in margarita glasses with a lemon wedge.

Preheat oven to 350 degrees F (175 degrees C). Grease 8x8-inch square baking pan.Combine garbanzo beans and 1/2 cup water into food processorpuree until smooth (about 3 minutes).Add eggs one at a time, beating well after each addition. Combine granulated sugar, canola oil and vanilla in a medium bowlstir to blend. Stir sugar mixture into bean mixture.In a large bowl, combine baking powder and saltstir with a whisk. Add to bean mixture and stir to blend. Fold in oats and chocolate chips. Spread evenly into prepared pan.Bake for 25 minutes in the preheated oven. Cool completely before cutting.

Mix together breadcrumbs and parsley. Heat oven to 400. Heat oil in skillet over medium high heat. Add cutlets and saut until browned. Place cutlets in baking dish. Mix apricot jam and chicken stock. Pour over cutlets. Sprinkle with bread crumb mixture. Bake 20 to 30 minutes or until cooked through. Serve with corn.

In a large saucepan or Dutch oven over medium heat, combine the stock and pumpkin puree. Bring to a boil over medium heat and cook for about 5 minutes or until the mixture thickens. Remove from heat and stir in the remaining ingredients and whipping cream. Heat through and serve hot. Garnish with cilantro if desired.

Preheat oven to 400 degrees F (200 degrees C).Lightly grease baking dish.Mix together the butter and the flour. Add the milk and the sour cream. Cook over low heat until the mixture thickens. Cool to room temperature.Cut each tortilla into 4 equal pieces. Place 1/4 of the tortilla pieces on the bottom of the baking dish.Place half of the chicken on top of the tortillas.Spoon half of the cream cheese mixture on top of the chicken.Add the green pepper and onion to the mixture.Sprinkle half of the cheese on top of the filling.Place the remaining pieces of the tortillas on top of the filling.Spoon the remaining cream cheese mixture on top of the tortillas.Sprinkle the remaining cheese on top of the filling.Bake at 400 degrees F (200 degrees C) for 20 minutes.Allow to cool for 10 minutes before serving.Serve with lettuce and tomatoes.

In shallow dish, combine egg substitute, milk, cinnamon and nutmegmix well. Dip each slice of bread in mixture, turning to coat both sides. In large skillet or griddle over medium heat, melt butter or margarinecook the soaked bread slices 2 minutes on each side or until golden brown. Sprinkle with cereal just before serving.

Using a small sharp knife, carefully slit the side of each olive to create a pocket. With a teaspoon, fill each olive with a dollop of cream cheese. Place olives in a small bowl. In a small bowl combine dressing, parsley and garlic. Pour mixture over olives. Stir gently until cheese spread is covered. Chill at least one hour before serving.

In a large bowl combine 1 cup of graham crackers, 1 cup of flour and 1/2 teaspoon of baking powder. Cream margarine and add 1/2 cup of condense milk and mix well. Add dry mixture and mix well. Add 1 cup of raisins and 1 cup of chopped walnuts and mix well. Drop by heaping teaspoon onto ungreased cookie sheet. Bake at 375f for 8-10 minutes.

In a large bowl, combine the garlic salt and pepper. Add the meat and mix thoroughly to coat evenly. In a large skillet, heat the oil until it is smoking hot. Add the meat and cook until it is done to your taste. Remove the meat and cut into 1-inch cubes. In a medium bowl, combine the meat with the parsley and enough water to make a good sauce. Place a slice of cheese into each roll and fill with the meat mixture. Top with a slice of cheese and cover with the other half of the roll. Makes 4 sandwiches.

Separate red pepper leaves from peppers. Prepare stuffing by mixing breadcrumbs with garlic salt, pepper and Tabasco sauce. Add beef and lemon juice. Mix well. Remove core from peppers. Stuff each with about a teaspoon of mixture. Wrap in aluminum foil. Bake at 375 degrees for about 30 minutes. Serve with pasta.

In a large stockpot, heat the oil and saute the curry paste and dried shrimp until the paste turns dark and fragrant. Add the pork and brown. Add the chicken stock and bring to a boil. Add the fish sauce and palm sugar. Simmer until the liquid thickens. Taste and add more fish sauce if necessary. Serve with green beans and fresh lime leaves.

Prepare chicken by cutting a pocket into the largest part of the breast, about 1 inch deep. Lay one piece of bacon into the pocket. Spoon in 1/4 cup of the cream cheese mixture and spread to edge of the pocket. Lay the other piece of bacon on top of the cream cheese mixture. Sprinkle the remaining 1/4 cup of the mixture over the top of the chicken. Place stuffed chicken on a greased broiler pan. Sprinkle the top with parsley and garlic salt. Bake at 400 degrees for 25 minutes or until chicken is cooked through.

In a large bowl combine limeade and lemonade. Add orange extract. Fill punch bowl with ice. Pour mixture into bowl. Add 7-up. Let stand for 1-2 hours. Stir before serving. Add tequila. Serve in punch cups or glasses.

Preheat oven to 375 degrees F (190 degrees C). Prepare pastry shells according to package instructions. Slice broccoli into 1/4 inch slices and set aside in a bowl of cold water to prevent discoloration. Beat eggs with milk and cream in a large bowl. Add in salmon, cheese, dill weed, and peppermix well. Lay one crust in a 9 inch pie pan and spoon in salmon mixturetop with the remaining crust. Bake in preheated oven until quiche is set and golden on top and bottom, about 40 minutes. Cool before slicing. Garnish with fresh chives before serving.

In a shallow dish, mix eggs, milk, sugar and vanilla extract. Dip cinnamon-swirl bread into egg mixture. Place on a hot skillet with melted butter. Cook on each side for 2-3 minutes or until golden brown. Spread with cream cheese. Serve with fruit and sweet cream for dipping.
In a small bowl, mix together butter, lemon juice, and seasoningsplace in shallow dish and add shrimp. Bake at 400 degrees for 12-15 minutes. Serve with lemon wedges.

Bring berries and sugar to boil. Cook and stir 1 minute. Stir in tapioca and lemon juice. Cook and stir 2 minutes. Remove from heat. Stir in cinnamon. Cool 5 minutes. Pour into unbaked pie shell. Beat sour cream and 1/2 cup sugar until smooth. Spoon over berries. Bake at 375 for 30 minutes. Makes 6 to 8 servings.

Place biscuits in a food processor and process until fine crumbs form. Add the butter and process until well blended. Add the syrup and condensed milk and process until well combined. Divide the mixture into 4 portions and press into a 20x30cm tray lined with non-stick baking paper. Bake for 20 minutes. Cool in the tray for 5 minutes before cutting into squares or slices. Place a layer of copha on a chopping board and place the slices on top. Place a layer of slivered almonds on top and roll up to form a log. Place into the fridge to set for 30 minutes. Slice into pieces and serve.

Beat egg in small bowl and place in fridge until ready to use. Grate zucchini, chop onion, place in mixing bowl, add egg mixture and mix well. Add mayonnaise, italian seasoning, old bay seasoning and mix well. Add bread crumbs 1 cup at a time and mix well. Form into 4 large crab cake shapes with wet hands. Place in fridge for 1 hour to firm up. Fry in hot oil until golden brown, flip over to brown other side. Serve with tartar sauce or cocktail sauce.

Combine the butter, sugar, egg, and flour in the bowl of an electric mixer. Beat on low speed until combined. Add the vanilla. Increase speed to medium and beat for 1-2 minutes or until the mixture is smooth and fluffy. Spoon into four serving dishes or small bowls. Refrigerate for 30 minutes. Preheat the oven to 350F. While the pudding is chilling, combine the milk, water, orange zest, juice, and cocoa in a saucepan over medium heat. Cook and stir until boiling. Reduce the heat to low and simmer for 1 minute or until thickened. Pour the sauce evenly over the puddings. Bake for 10-12 minutes or until lightly browned. Cool on wire racks for 15 minutes before serving. Serve with whipped cream and sliced oranges if desired.

Heat oven to 350f. In a 9 x 13 pan, melt together butter & granulated sugar. Add milk & cocoa, beat until smooth. Blend in oats & coconut. Stir in salt & vanilla. Add nuts & spread into pan. Bake for 20 minutes or until set. Cool & cut into bars or squares.

Preheat the oven to 180c/gas mark 4. Line a baking tray with baking parchment. Beat the butter with the brown sugar until light and creamy. Beat in the eggs a little at a time with the treacle, then beat in the plain flour with the self-raising flour, ginger, cinnamon and bicarbonate of soda. Tip onto a work surface dusted with a little plain flour and roll out into a rectangle 1/2cm thick. Sprinkle with the desiccated coconut. Starting at one of the 2 shorter ends roll up the mixture lengthwise like a Swiss roll. Place on the prepared tray, seam side down, then brush with beaten egg to glaze the top. Bake for 30-35 minutes until the top is golden brown. Cool for 5 minutes then remove the Lebkuchen from the tray to cool completely on a wire rack. Store in an airtight container for up to 3 days or in the freezer for 2 weeks.

1. Heat oven to 350 degrees. Coat a 9x13-inch baking dish with cooking spray.2. In a large skillet cook onion in vegetable oil over medium heat until golden brown, about 10 minutes. Set aside.3. In a medium bowl combine corn kernels, salt and black pepper, ground nutmeg. Set aside.4. In a large bowl beat eggs and milk. Add onions and corn mixture. Mix well.5. Pour into prepared baking dish. Sprinkle evenly with shredded cheese.6. Bake until set in the middle, 30 to 35 minutes. Serve warm.

Steam the vegetables in a small amount of water over medium-high heat until tender. Drain and set aside. Combine margarine, lemon juice, basil, marjoram and onion. Mash in the vegetables to your desired consistency. Serve warm.

In a heavy saucepan, heat the heavy cream and whole milk until just steaming. Do not boil! In a blender combine the brown sugar, honey, gingerroot, and the egg yolks. Blend until smooth and add the hot liquid slowly. Return this mixture to the pan over low heat (medium-low) and cook, stirring constantly until thickened. Remove from the heat and strain through a fine sieve into a bowl. Pour the mixture through a sieve into a clean bowl. Cool thoroughly, about 3 hours or overnight. Churn according to your ice-cream makers instructions, until the mixture is thick enough to mound on a spoon. Add the vanilla extract when the mixture is almost done churning. Pour into a freezer-safe container, cover, and freeze until firm.

In a medium saucepan, bring milk to a boil. Add the sugar, honey and spices. Boil for one minute. Remove from heat and stir in cocoa. Add vanilla and mix well. Serve in a large mug and top with the whipped cream. Serves 4.

Cook spaghetti according to package directions. In a saucepan over low heat, melt butter. Add mushrooms and onion and cook until tender. Add turkey and mix well. Add cream of chicken soup and milk and stir well. Bring to a boil. Remove from heat and add sour cream. Mix well. Fold in cooked pasta and sprinkle with parsley. Serve warm.

Combine cereal and cheese. In a small saucepan, combine spaghetti mix, water, and garlic powder. Heat until boiling. Pour over cereal and mix well. In a small bowl, combine oil and pretzel nuggets. Spread the pretzel nuggets over the cereal mixture. Bake for 10-15 minutes at 250 degrees F, stirring every 5 minutes. Allow to cool.
Brown chops in oil. Add rice. Mix soup and broth. Add veggies and heat through. Pour over rice.

Clean mushrooms by removing the stalk. Wash the caps in salt water, then dry them on a paper towel. Heat the oil in a frying pan over medium heat. Add the cleaned mushroom caps, cooked for 30 seconds on each side until they become golden brown. Add the butter and the garlic. Cook until the butter melts. Add the chives. Salt and pepper to taste. Serve warm.
Heat milk. Add tea and sugar. Add 2-3 drops of rose water. Add cinnamon. Heat well. Serve warm.

Heat oil in frying pan. Fry the onions until golden. Add the garlic cloves. Fry for about 2 minutes. Add the passata. Stir well. Add the turmeric and the spice powders. Add the water and bring to the boil. Add the green cardamom seeds. Simmer for about 10 minutes.

Melt butter in skillet over medium heat. Add shallot and cook 1 minute. Stir in paprika and tomato pastecook 1 minute more. Stir in chicken stocksimmer 5 minutes. Add sour creamstir well. Cook 1 minute more. Season with salt and pepper. Serve with cooked potatoes.

Cut each flour tortilla into six triangles. Mix refried beans and enchilada sauce in casserole dish. Place tortilla pieces in dish. Top with sour cream and melted cheese. Bake at 400 degrees for 10 minutes. Serve with lettuce, tomato, salsa and sour cream.

Wash the broccoli and separate the florets from the stems. Blanch the florets briefly, then refresh them under cold running water to stop the cooking process. Heat the oil over medium-high heat and add the chili and garlic. When the aroma is released from the garlic, add the stems and stir-fry for a few minutes. Add the florets and stir-fry for a further few minutes. Add the dark soy sauce and season with salt to taste. Transfer to a serving plate and sprinkle with chopped spring onions or chives if desired.

Melt butter in a skillet over medium heat. Add mushrooms and cook until browned. Add garlic salt and paprika and cook 1-2 minutes longer. Remove from heat and stir in sour cream and soup. Arrange chicken on top of mushroom mixture. Sprinkle with swiss cheese and bake at 350 degrees for 30-35 minutes or until done. Serve on a bun.
Beat the double cream with the lemon juice and lemon zest. Blend in the sugar. Chill in refrigerator until set. Scoop out with a spoon and serve.

Heat butter in skillet. When butter is melted add garlic cloves and cook for about 30 seconds. Add white wine. Stir and cook 1 minute. Add parsley. Add scallops. Add salt and pepper. Turn scallops and cook additional 1 minute. Add cream. Heat through.

Preheat oven to 350F/180C/Gas 4. Lightly grease cookie sheet and set aside. Mix neufchatel cheese with egg, beating until well blended. Add in cake mix, then add in vanilla extract and mix well. Drop by tablespoonfuls onto the prepared cookie sheet. Bake for approximately 10 minutes or until edges are slightly brown. Cool on a wire rack and serve immediately or store in an airtight container at room temperature up to two days. You can also freeze these for up to two months.

Halve tomatoes lengthwise. Scrape out the seeds and pulpreserve pulp. Cut tomato halves into 1/2-inch slices. Put breadcrumbs in a shallow dishstir in cheese and chives. Place butter in another shallow dishadd pulp and basilmix well. Dip each slice of tomato into butter mixture then coat evenly on both sides in breadcrumb mixture. Heat oil in heavy skillet over medium-high heat until hot but not smoking. Fry coated tomato slices until golden brown, about 2 minutes on each side. Remove from skilletdrain on paper towelssprinkle with salt and pepper to taste. Makes 4 servings.
Slice bananas into roundsset aside. In a large bowl, combine all ingredients except the lettuce leaves and the cherries. Divide mixture among 6 lettuce leavesgarnish with cherries.

Soak pork in boiling water 30 minutes. Drain, rinse and pat dry. Heat oil in a heavy-bottomed stockpot over medium heat. Add pork, and cook until browned on all sides. Add broth and bring to a boil. Add remaining ingredients, cover and simmer for 30-40 minutes. Stir in cabbage, cover and simmer 10 minutes more. Add the noodles, cover and simmer 5 minutes more. Serve hot.

Heat the oil in a large skillet over medium-high heat. Add the onion and cook until tender. Add the garlic and cook for 1 minute. Add the baby spinach. Cook until the spinach wilts. Remove from the heat. Add the creme fraiche and stir to combine. Stir in the feta. Season with salt and pepper to taste. Serve warm.

Preheat oven to 400 degrees f. Unwrap the chickens and rinse thoroughly inside and out. Pat dry. Place butter in shallow baking pan. Place each chicken breast side down on butter. Sprinkle with breadcrumbs and season with salt and pepper. Add 1 tsp romano to each chicken. Top each with 1 tsp parsley. Bake 1 hour or until juice runs clear when chicken is pierced with knife or meat thermometer reads 180 degrees f when inserted into thickest part of thigh. Serves 4 people.
Boil water and add the pasta. Cook for 8-10 minutes or until al dente. Drain the pasta and add the rest of the ingredients to the pasta. Toss until evenly combined. Serve chilled.

Preheat oven to 400 degrees F (200 degrees C). Butter and lightly flour two 9x13 inch baking dishes.In a large mixing bowl, combine 6 cups of white bread crumbs, 2 teaspoons onion salt, and 1 teaspoon garlic saltmix well. In a small saucepan over medium heat, stir together 3 cups margarine and 1 cup waterbring to a boil and remove from heat. Pour margarine mixture over bread crumbs and toss until coated well. In a separate mixing bowl, combine 1 cup corn flakes, 1 cup parmesan cheese and 1/2 teaspoon garlic powder. Spread one-half of the cornflake cheese mixture on top of the bread crumbsspread evenly with your hands. Top with remaining cheese mixture and press gently to combine. Spray with cooking spray and bake at 400 degrees F for 30 minutes. Serve warm or at room temperature.

Beat egg yolks until thick. Gradually beat in the milk, and add salt and nutmeg. Cook over a double boiler over simmering water. Cook about 10 to 15 minutes. Cool, and refrigerate until ready to serve.

Brown ground beef and onion and green pepper together and drain off excess fat. Stir in mushrooms and relish. Add ketchup and mustard and continue cooking while stirring frequently. Sprinkle with cheese and serve immediately on hot dog bun. Serves 2.

In a large bowl, combine ground pork, green onions, hoisin sauce and soy sauce. Stir to combine. In another bowl, combine the water chestnuts with the egg and stir well. Place a wrapper in your hand and place about 1 1/2 teaspoons of the filling in the center. Add a little water chestnut mixture to the filling and bring the sides of the wrapper together. Pinch the sides to seal. In a large skillet, heat 1 inch of oil over medium-high heat. Add the dumplings and fry for 2- 3 minutes or until golden brown. Remove from the heat and drain the dumplings. Serve with hoisin sauce for dipping.

Cut chicken into 1/4-inch slices. Combine soy sauce, vinegar, sugar and oilmarinate chicken 1 hour. Drain. In a large skillet heat oil. Cook chicken 4 minutes or until no longer pink. Add chiles. Cook until crisp-tender. Remove from heat. Combine chicken, chiles and 1 cup of marinade. Spoon 2 tablespoons chicken mixture onto each roll bottom. Top each roll with 1 tablespoon pepper cheese. Cover with roll tops. Serve immediately.

In a large pot of boiling water, cook the pasta until tender but firm. Drain and return to pot to keep warm. Meanwhile, in a large skillet, heat the butter and garlic over medium heat. Cook until fragrant. Whisk in the flour and cook for 1 minute. Add the chicken broth and bring to a boil. Add the milk and cook until thickened. Add the dried parsley flakes and season to taste with salt and pepper. Add the cooked penne to the skillet and toss to coat. Sprinkle the Parmesan cheese on top. Serve immediately.

In a large skillet, saute onion and garlic in oil until onion is transparent and garlic is golden brown. Add cayenne pepper to taste. Drain the oysters and add to skillet along with the bacon pieces and the oyster liquor. Cover and cook for about 5 minutes or until the oysters are just heated through and the bacon is crisp. Place about 1/2 cup of the bread crumbs in a shallow bowl and season with cayenne pepper to taste. Dip the oysters in the seasoned crumbs and place in a baking pan. Cover with the remaining seasoned crumbs and sprinkle the top with the parmesan cheese. Bake in a preheated 350f oven for about 5 minutes or until the crumbs are browned.

Melt the butter, add the flour and stir well to make a brown roux. Add the milk all at once and cook until thickened. Add the broth and seasonings to taste. Whisk the egg yolks together with the parsley. Strain the soup into a clean pot and slowly pour in the egg yolks, stirring constantly to prevent curdling. Serve hot with grated cheese.

In saucepan over low heat combine butter, orange rind and orange liqueur. Let simmer 2 minutes. Pour mixture over nuts in a large bowl and stir. Stir in salt until nuts are evenly coated. Spread nuts on wax paper to cool.
Preheat grill to medium heat. Rub all sides of each pork loin with olive oil. Combine brown sugar with next 4 ingredientsrub mixture over pork loins. Grill until cooked through.

Melt margarine in skillet. Spread margarine over one side of one slice of whole wheat bread. Spread 1 ounce of swiss cheese over another slice of whole wheat bread. Layer tomatoes, bell pepper and olives. Top with remaining slice of whole wheat bread. Cook in skillet until both sides are golden brown and cheese is melted.

Saut carrots and onion in butter until tender. Add flour and mix well. Add milk and dry mustard. Cook and stir until thickened. Stir in cheese and breadcrumbs. Pour into a one-quart casserole dish and bake at 425 for 25 minutes, or until bubbly. Serve immediately.

Combine the first four ingredients in a small bowl and rub all over the roasting chickens. Grill over medium high heat until juices run clear when the thickest part is cut. In a small bowl combine the sweet chili sauce and apricot preserves. Drizzle over the chicken. Sprinkle the ginger and scallions over the top. Serve with rice and soy sauce.

Preheat oven to 350. In a large mixing bowl combine all the ingredients except the eggs. Mix until just blended. Add the eggs and mix until thoroughly combined. Form into 2 inch meatballs. Place the meatballs in a single layer in a baking pan and bake uncovered for 40 to 50 minutes. Serve with spaghetti sauce or with barbecue sauce.

Preheat oven to 425F. In a large bowl, whisk the honey and water until the mixture is well combined. Add the remaining ingredients, except for the pheasant. Pour mixture over the pheasant pieces. Toss to coat well. Arrange the pheasant pieces on a baking sheet coated with nonstick spray. Bake for 30 minutes, or until pheasants are cooked through. Let rest for 10 minutes before serving.

In a heavy skillet or saute pan over medium heat, saute the edamame in the butter and oil until they are a light golden brown. Add the corn and saute until heated through. Add the red onion and continue to cook over medium heat until the corn is soft. Add the sherry wine and cook for 1 minute. Season to taste with the basil. Serve warm.

Put plums in a large pot with 1 cup of the water, bring it to a boil, reduce heat and simmer uncovered for 5 minutes or until plums are softened. Add remaining water, lemon juice and ginger. Simmer uncovered for 10 minutes or until plums are very soft. Remove from heat and add lemon rind. Cool for 30 minutes. Force mixture through a sieve into another pot and bring to boil. Simmer for 20 minutes or until it forms a drop from a teaspoon on a plate. Pour into sterilized jars and seal.

Melt butter and sweetened condensed milk in the top part of a double boiler over hot water. Add marshmallows and stir until thoroughly mixed. Remove from heat and stir in vanilla and peanut butter chips. Add the nuts and stir until evenly coated. Spread onto a waxed paper-lined cookie sheet. Refrigerate until firm. Cut into squares.

Preheat oven to 350f degrees F. Lightly coat a rimmed baking sheet with cooking spray or line with foil and coat with cooking spray. In a small bowl, beat egg white and set aside. In a large bowl, combine pecans, almonds, cashews and brown sugartoss to coat. Add seasoning salt and curry powdertoss to combine. Transfer to prepared baking sheet. Bake for 10 minutes or until the nuts are lightly browned and coated with the seasoning mixture. Stir in the egg white and continue to bake for 5 minutes longer or until the nuts are coated and lightly browned. Transfer to a large bowl or waxed paper to cool. Store in an air tight container for up to 2 weeks.

Brown the chicken legs in the butter and then add the onion and carrot. Cook a few minutes longer and then add the water. Simmer until the chicken is tender. Add the sour cream and milk. Cook a few minutes longer. Add the pepper to taste. Serve over noodles or rice.

Combine egg, milk and brown sugar. Stir in crackers. Stir in baking powder and flourmix to a dough-like consistency. Press into greased 13x9 inch pan. Bake at 350f for 20-25 minutes. Cool in pan 10 minutes. Crumble. Place in large bowl with coconut, maraschino cherries (reserved syrup), almonds, nuts, and candy. Stir until blended. Spread onto crust. Cool completely before cutting into squares.

Fire roast the poblanos over an open flame. Cut the stem off and remove the seeds and veins. Cut the poblanos in half and scoop out the seeds and veins. Prepare the stuffing by cooking the potatoes in the enchilada sauce until soft. Add the cheese and sausage and mix well. Scoop the mixture into the poblano peppers. Sprinkle the tops with the cheese and bake for about 20 minutes or until the cheese is melted. Serve warm.

Melt the butter and saute the mushrooms until the liquid has evaporated. Season with salt and freshly ground pepper and set aside. In a small saucepan bring the white wine to a boil. Add the salmon and cook for 30 seconds to 1 minute. Remove the pan from the heat and set aside. In a medium saucepan over medium heat whisk the cream until just about to boil. Remove from the heat and add the butter and mushrooms. Whisk until smooth. Add the cooked salmon and the tarragon and whisk until well combined. Taste and adjust seasoning if needed. Serve with a slice of toasted bread and the remaining mushrooms.

Place the potatoes in crock pot. Add onion and layer with the potatoes. Sprinkle with half the cheddar cheese. Top with the cream of mushroom soup, evaporated skim milk and the remaining cheddar cheese. Cover and cook on high setting for 2 hours. Uncover and stir gently. Cover again and cook for an additional hour. Stir gently again. Sprinkle with pimiento. Serves 6.

Combine the butter and sugar in a saucepan and heat gently until butter has melted and mixture is smooth and shiny. Beat the eggs into the butter-sugar mixture one at a time, beating well after each addition. Beat in the almond extract and then the flour and baking powder. Pour batter into a greased and floured tube pan and bake for 1 hour at 350 degrees or 40 minutes at 375 degrees. Remove from oven and cool for 5 minutes. Turn the cake out onto a cooling rack and cool for 10 minutes more. Fill the center with jam and top with whipped cream. Drizzle with chocolate syrup or sprinkle with powdered sugar.

Peel potatoes and cut into bite-sized pieces. In a frying pan, melt margarine. Add green pepper and onion (cut into small pieces). Cook until tender. Mix in potatoes and onion soup mix. Cook until hot. Season with salt and pepper to taste.

Boil 3 cups fresh peas until tenderdrain and cool. Combine in a bowl with 1 finely chopped onion3 hardboiled eggs1/2 cup chopped pimientoand 1/2 cup chopped celery. Add 1/4 cup mayonnaise and 1/4 teaspoon salt and 1/4 teaspoon pepper.

In a heavy saucepan over medium heat, melt the butter, add the onion, cook 3 minutes. Stir in the condensed soups, milk, half-and-half and sherry. Cook over low heat 10 minutes, stirring constantly. Add the crab meat, stirring gently. Heat through but do not boil. Stir in salt and pepper. Serve over rice or with crackers.

Slice the strawberries in half and add them to a bowl with the orange juice and lemon juice. Muddle the mixture with a fork or small wooden spoon until the fruit is broken down and the liquid is thick. Add the pomegranates and the mint leafs. Mix well and serve cold.
Mix the whiskey, sugar syrup and lime juice in a cocktail shaker with some ice. Shake well. Strain into glass. Top up with lemon-lime soda. Garnish with a lime slice.
Blend mint and rosemary in a food processor. Add sugar and vinegar. Process until well mixed. Season with salt and serve with grilled lamb.

Drain and dice hamburgers and combine with eggs and cheese in a bowl. Stir and pour into a greased 13 x 9 pan. Bake at 350 for 1 hour until set and golden brown. Let cool before cutting into squares and serving.

Heat oven to 350 degrees F. Grease a 13-by-9-inch baking dish. Sift flour, granulated sugar and salt into a bowlset aside. Beat butter and cream cheese in a medium bowl with an electric mixer until smooth. Beat in eggs one at a time, then orange extract and zest. Add flour mixturebeat just until combined. Spread batter into baking dish and bake for 25 minutes or until a wooden pick inserted in center comes out clean. Cool in dish on a wire rack. In a medium bowl, beat powdered sugar with enough orange juice to make an icing that is thick enough to spread but runny enough to drizzlespread over warm blondies and allow to set. Yield: 16 servings (2-inch squares)

Sift flour into medium bowl. Add salt and pepper. Stir in chopped mint and the tomato and onion mixture. Bring the mixture together with your hands. Divide mixture into 12 small balls. Press each ball into a 6 cm. diameter circle. Dip into beaten egg and roll in bread crumbs. Heat the oil in a frying pan. Gently cook each keftedakia until crisp and golden. Serve with tomato sauce and sprinkle with parsley. Makes 12.

In a large bowl, combine the remaining ingredients. Add the shrimp. Mix thoroughly. Marinate in the refrigerator for 1 hour. Preheat the oven to 350 degrees F. Spray a baking sheet with nonstick cooking spray. Spread the marinated shrimp in a single layer over the baking sheet. Bake until the shrimp is opaque in the centre, 15 to 20 minutes.

In a large pot of boiling salted water, add the carrots, and bring to a boil over high heat. Reduce the heat to medium low and simmer until the carrots are tender crisp. Drain the carrots and return to pot off heat. Melt butter in a small saucepan over medium heat. Stir in brown sugar until melted and well blended. Whisk in bourbon and simmer for 1 minute. Pour bourbon mixture over carrots, toss to coat evenly, and serve at once, garnished with fresh parsley

Slice the prosciutto into four pieces and wrap each piece around a ball of mozzarella. Heat a little olive oil in a frying pan and fry the mozzarella balls until browned on the outside and molten inside. Season with pepper. Serve immediately with salad greens and cranberry sauce. Drizzle with balsamic vinegar to taste. Serve with toothpicks.

Heat oven to 350 degrees. In a large bowl combine cauliflower, margarine, 1/4 cup of the bread crumbs. In another bowl combine remaining 1/2 cup bread crumbs, garlic powder, basil, oregano. Spoon the mixture into a greased 1-1/2 qt. baking dish. Bake until heated through. Remove from oven. Top with parmesan cheese. Serve.
Whisk the olive oil and mustard together. Combine the remaining ingredients. Toss with the dressing. Serve chilled.

Heat oil in large stockpot. Add sausage and cook, stirring frequently until brownedabout 6-8 minutes. Add onion, carrot, and garlic to sausage, cooking for another minute or two until fragrant. Add seasoning to sausage mixture. Add broth and bring to a boil. Add ditalini. Boil for about 10 minutes or until pasta is almost al dente. Add kalecook for an additional minute or two or until kale is wilted to desired tenderness. Serve hot in bowls and top with parmesan cheese. Serve hot in bowls and top with parmesan cheese.

Heat oil in a large pan. Add the pine nuts and fry until golden brown. Add the onion and cook for a few minutes until softened. Add the stock cube, the vegetable stock and the spices. Bring the mixture to the boil and simmer for 5-7 minutes. Add the couscous, cover the pan with a lid and leave for 5 minutes until the couscous has absorbed the liquid. Stir in the chicken, apricots, sultanas and mint leaves. Serve garnished with the french dressing.

Bring 1/2 cup water to a boil in a saucepan. Add lemon juice to taste. Add mushrooms. Cook until mushrooms are tender. Set aside. Melt butter in a saucepan. Add italian salad dressing, mushrooms and lemon juice. Cook over medium heat until mixture boils. Arrange fish in a shallow baking dish. Pour mixture over fish. Cover dish. Bake in a 350 degree oven for 10 minutes or until fish is tender. Serves 6.
Rinse and cut into 1-inch pieces. Toss with lime juice. Let stand 30 minutes. Toss with honey. Add yogurttoss to blend. Toss with honeydew balls. Refrigerate several hours.

Heat oil in wok 375 degrees. Add fish fillets. Cook 3 minutes on each side or until fish flakes easily with fork. Remove fish and cut into thin strips. Add remaining vegetables and cook 1 minute. Add noodles. Add teriyaki marinade. Toss and heat through. Serve.

Cook shallots and margarine over medium heat until shallots are translucent. Stir in broth and cook until reduced by half. Add green beans and toss to coat. Sprinkle with parmesan cheese. Serve immediately.

Combine first 4 ingredients in a shallow dish or ziploc bag. Place catfish in dish or bag with seasoning. Shake until completely coated. Let sit for 15 minutes or overnight. Heat oil in a cast iron skillet over medium heat. Fry catfish until golden brown. 4-5 minutes per side. Serve with melted butter, hot sauce or lemon wedges.

Puree the berries in blender or food processor. Add sour cream and beat with electric mixer until creamy. Fold the whipped topping into the berry mixture. Chill overnight before serving. Garnish with more berries if desired.

Prepare rice according to package directions in a large saucepan. Cook and drain mushrooms and onion in the water remaining in the saucepan. Add cream cheese and milk to the saucepan and stir until cheese is melted. Add rice and stir until thoroughly coated. Spoon mixture into a lightly greased 9 inch pie pan. Bake for 30 minutes at 325 degrees. Makes 6-8 servings.

Combine cocoa and splenda brown sugar blend in a medium saucepan. Whisk in the water and bring to boiling. Boil 2 minutes. Stir in the milk and vanilla. Remove from the heat and stir in the cinnamon stick. Serve with whipped cream.

Cook spaghetti according to package directions. Meanwhile, fry bacon in a skillet over medium heat until crisp. Set aside. Cut zucchini into strips and lightly saute in pan drippings with cherry tomatoes over medium heat for about 5 minutes until tender-crisp. Drain pasta and stir in pesto sauce and bacon. Toss well to blend. Sprinkle with cheese.

Cook the bacon in a large skillet, remove to paper towels to drain. Cook the onion and red pepper for about 3 minutes or until tender. Add the green pepper cook for 1 minute longer. Add the eggs, cooking until just set, season with salt & pepper. Remove from heat, stir in bacon & cheddar & colby cheese. Serve on toasted bun or biscuit.

Place chickpeas in a food processor. Add all other ingredients except for the red pepper sauce. Process until the mixture is smooth. Pour in the hot sauce and process until the mixture is smooth. Taste the mixture. Add more salt if desired. Chill until serving time. Serve with pita chips.

Place coffee beans in a cheesecloth sachet and place in a 6-cup French press. Add crushed red pepper flakes, whole cloves, and cinnamon sticks to filter of French press. Pour in 12 cups of boiling water. Steep for 10 minutes, then press and discard contents of filter into mugs. Add coconut milk and honey to taste. Serve immediately.

Cover the potatoes with water in a medium-sized pot. Bring to boil. Reduce heat to medium and simmer for 10 minutes. Drain. Toss in the olive oil, mustard, and chicken broth. Season with the salt and pepper. Toss to combine. Bake in the oven for about an hour. Remove from oven and let cool. Top with the green onions and parsley. Serve.

Grease and flour 9 x 13 inch pan. Sift dry ingredients together into a large bowl and set aside. Cream together the butter and sugars. Add the vanilla and egg and mix well. Stir in the sifted dry ingredients and mix well. Stir in the chocolate chips. Spread in the prepared pan and bake for 40 minutes or until lightly browned and a knife inserted in the centre of the brownie comes out clean. Cool for about a minute and cut into bars.

Cut chicken into cubes. Heat oil in large skillet. Add chicken and cook until no longer pink. Add curry powder and seasonings. Cook 1 minute. Add couscous, broth, peas, raisins. Bring to boiling. Cover tightly. Let stand for 5 minutes. Fluff with fork. Serve immediately.

Spread butter on top of two slices of the bread. Layer the two other slices of bread on top of the butter-spread slices of the bread. Spread a thin layer of olive salad evenly over each of the bottom two slices of the bread. Layer the cheese over the salad on the bottom two slices of the bread. Layer the ham, mortadella, and salami over the bottom two slices of the bread. Place the sandwich into the press or cook the sandwich in a skillet. Fry the sandwich for 3 to 5 minutes on each side or until the cheese is melted. Serve immediately.
Combine first 5 ingredients. Cook in a large skillet over low heat. Stir until sugar dissolves. Add almonds. Cook 10 minutes or until bubbling. Spread onto waxed paper. Cool completely.

Bring the milk to the boil with the amaretti biscuits broken up inside. Simmer until the amaretti have dissolved. Stir in the short-grain rice, and simmer for about 10 minutes or until the rice is tender. Add the sugar and stir until dissolved. Take off the heat. Pour into 4 small bowls or ramekins, divide the white chocolate between them and stir. Serve warm or cold.

Saute ground beef and onion in a heavy pot with a lid. Add enough water to cover the bottom of the pot and simmer for 15 to 20 minutes, until the beef is tender and the liquid evaporates. Add the pasta sauce and simmer for 5 to 10 minutes more. Cook the pasta according to the package directions and drain thoroughly. Add to the pot and stir gently. Sprinkle with sliced mushrooms and shredded cheese. Cover the pot and cook for 10 to 15 minutes more or until the liquid is absorbed and the mixture is bubbly and thick.

Cut steak into serving pieces. Brown in oil over medium heat. Add onions. Saute until tender crisp. Add carrots and potatoes. Stir until covered with liquid. Add green pepper. Stir well. Blend broth, gravy mix and water. Add to skillet. Bring to a boil. Cover and simmer for 30 to 40 minutes or until meat is tender. Stir occasionally. Serve over hot cooked rice or noodles.

Cook bacon over medium heat until crisp. Drain off all but 1 tablespoon of the fat from the pan. Saute the onion and celery in the pan until tender. Stir in the chicken broth and rice and bring to a boil. Reduce heat and simmer until the liquid is absorbed and the rice is tender and slightly creamy, about 5 minutes. Remove from heat and stir in the parsley and cheese. Spread half of the mixture in a 13-inch-by-9-inch baking pan. Spread the corn over the rice mixture. Sprinkle with the remaining rice mixture and the cheese. Cover with foil and bake for 1 hour. Uncover and bake for 10 to 15 minutes longer or until browned on top.

Place sugar in a 12 inch fry pan with 1/2 cup of water. Cook on medium high until sugar melts and turns amber. Add nuts. Cook for 5 minutes. Stir constantly so nuts don’t burn. When the nuts are lightly coated with caramel remove from pan. Quickly stir in vanilla and 1 Tbsp of egg white. Place on wax paper and sprinkle with remaining egg white and cinnamon. Let cool and serve.

Heat oil in a skillet over medium-high heat. Add in the garlic. Cook until golden brown. Add in the red pepper. Continue to cook until tender. Add in the spinach. Cook until tender. Season to taste with salt and hot pepper flakes. Serve over rice.

Cook ziti as directed on package. Melt butter in pan and add garlic powder and cook garlic powder until fragrant about a minute or so. Then add cream cheese and stir until creamy about 3-5 minutes. Add milk and cook on medium low until heated through stirring often about 10-12 minutes. Stir in parmesan and pepper and cook for an additional 2-3 minutes stirring constantly to allow the cheese to melt and incorporate into the sauce. Drain ziti and toss with the sauce and parsley flakes. Serve immediately.

Remove kernels from cob. Add to 16 cups water. Simmer for 30 minutes. Remove from heat. Remove seeds from chiles. Add to water with salt. Let sit for 10 minutes. Add feta cheese. Serve with a spoonful of chiles.

Heat oven to 350 degrees. Lay chips on oven safe platter. You will be layering this so split them. Warm beans and chili on stove or in microwave. Stir beans until smooth. Spread beans over tortillas. Top with onion, cheese, jalepenos, chili and cheddar cheese. Repeat by layering tortilla chips and toppings until gone. Place in oven and bake until cheese is melted. Dollop with sour cream. Add tomatoes and green onions on top.

Heat a Dutch oven over medium heat. Add vegetable oil to the pan. Season the pork with cracked black pepper and salt to taste. Add the pork to the pan and brown the meat. Add the mushrooms and onion. Cook for 1 minute. Add the red wine. Add the parsley. Bring the mixture to a simmer and then cover the pan. Reduce the heat and simmer for 1 hour. Check the meat periodically and add additional wine if necessary. Remove the meat from the pan and serve.

Heat oil in a large saucepan or wok. Add onion and ginger. Cook for 1 minute. Stir in okra, chilies, spices and water. Bring to boil. Cover. Cook for 10 minutes. Remove from heat. Stir in lemon juice. Serve immediately.

In a large bowl combine the sweetened condensed milk and the egg yolks. Beat well with a mixer at medium speed. Stir in the key lime juice. Pour into the graham cracker pie crust. Bake at 400 degrees for 10 to 15 minutes or until the filling is set but not browned. Cool to room temperature. Garnish with whipped cream, a sprinkle of lime zest and a slice of lime.

Preheat oven to 350 degrees F (175 degrees C). Grease and flour two 8x4x2 inch loaf pans. Sift the flour and baking powder together twice, then set aside. Beat the eggs and oil together until light and fluffy. Mix in the white and brown sugars and the vanilla extract. Blend in the flour mixture and oats just until combined. Fold the rhubarb and cinnamon into the batter. Pour half the batter into each pan and bake for about 55 minutes, or until a toothpick comes out clean. Cool for about 20 minutes before removing from pans and cooling completely on wire racks.

Cream together the sugar and butter. Add the eggnog. Beat in the vanilla and egg yolks. Sift the dry ingredients together. Add them to the creamed mixture in 3 additions. Beat in the nutmeg. Drop from a teaspoon onto greased cookie sheets. Bake at 350 degrees for 10 to 12 minutes or until golden brown. Cool on wire racks.

In 2-quart saucepan over medium heat, combine pasta, 3 cups water and salt to taste. Cook covered 9 minutes or until pasta is tender, adding more water if necessary to prevent sticking. Meanwhile, heat 1 tablespoon butter in large saucepan over medium heat. Add flourstir 1 minute until smooth. Gradually whisk in evaporated milk and remaining 2 cups water. Cook 2 minutes or until thickenedstir in 1 cup cheddar cheese until melted. Stir in remaining cheeses, cayenne and remaining 2 tablespoons butterremove from heat. Drain pastastir into sauce in large bowl. Pour into 2-quart baking dishsprinkle with paprika. Bake 25 minutes or until bubbly. Let stand 5 minutes before serving.

In a large bowl combine the frying chickens, lemon juice, vegetable oil, soy sauce, and gingerroot. Marinate for 2 to 4 hours or overnight. In a separate bowl combine the onion salt and garlic powder. Remove chickens from lemon juice mixture and roll in the garlic powder mixture. Broil for 3 to 4 minutes per side.

In skillet add ground beef and pork sausage. Brown. Add celery and bell pepper and cook until tender. Add long grain rice and season to taste with black pepper, cayenne pepper and salt. Cook until rice is tender and fluffy. Serve hot.

Preheat oven to 350 degrees F (175 degrees C). Grease and flour one 9x13 inch baking pan. Mix together the flour, sugar, baking powder and cardamom. Rub in the butter. Add the egg and beat until smooth. Spread half of the batter in the pan. Spread the lingonberry preserves on top. Sprinkle with the oatmeal. Spread the remaining batter on top. Bake in the preheated oven for 30 minutes. Sprinkle the streusel topping over the cake while it is still warm. Serve warm.

Place the kosher dill pickles in a large glass bowl and cover with the water. Let sit for 10 minutes to soften the brine. Drain the brine and save. In a large saucepan, combine the sugar and the water and bring to a boil. Add the remaining ingredients and bring to a boil again. Pour the hot mixture over the softened pickles and let cool. Place the pickles in sterilized jars and cover with the brine. Seal the jars and store in a cool place.

Peel and grate 1 lb of potatoes. Heat 1 tsp butter. Add grated potatoes and 1/4 cup of water. Cook on medium heat until all liquid is gone. Add 1/2 tsp of cream and 1/4 tsp of butter. Add 2 cups of flour and mix. Add 1 tsp of salt and mix. Roll out to 1/4 thickness. Cut with lefse knife. Bake at 350 degrees for 15 minutes on each side.

In a large bowl combine pumpkin, evaporated milk, sugar, spices, salt and egg white. Stir until well mixed. Microwave on high 10 minutes. Remove from oven and beat in egg. Microwave an additional 6 to 7 minutes or until knife inserted 1 inch from edge comes out clean.

Brown the chicken breasts in a skillet. Remove from pan. Saute the green onions and add the wine. Add the flour and cook 1 minute. Add the soup and the sour cream. Stir in the chicken breasts. Cover and simmer 10-15 minutes or until done. Remove from heat and sprinkle with the seasoning salt and paprika. Serve over hot cooked rice with gravy browner.

Heat a large skillet over medium high heat. Add the oil and garlic. Saute for 2 minutes or until the garlic is lightly browned but not dark brown. Add the onions and zucchini and cook for 1-2 minutes or until the vegetables are crisp tender. Add the diced tomatoes, roasted red peppers, cod, seasoning, and parsley. Cook for 1-2 minutes or until the fish flakes easily when tested with a fork. Serve immediately over pasta or rice.

beat eggs in a bowl. add in sugar, unsweetened cocoa powder and heavy cream. stir in milk, and vanilla extract. pour mixture into your ice cream maker and freeze according to manufacturer instructions. melt a couple squares of a hershey bar on a plate in the microwave for 20 seconds. place one graham cracker square on a plate followed by a hershey bar square, a scoop of the frozen chocolate mixture on top of the bar then finish with a mini marshmallow. repeat until you have used up all of your graham crackers, chocolate mixture and marshmallows. serve immediately.

Heat a large skillet. Melt butter. Add onion and garlic. Saute 2 minutes. Add oysters. Stir to mix well. Add water. Bring to a boil. Add potato and milk. Reduce heat to low. Cover. Cook 15 to 20 minutes or until potato is tender. Add Worcestershire. Stir to mix well. Add nutmeg and white pepper. Serve.

Heat olive oil in skillet over medium-high heat. Add the yellow squash and garlic and cook for 3 minutes or until the garlic is golden brown and the squash is slightly browned. Add the water and cook for another minute or two or until the squash is tender. Stir in the salt and freshly ground black pepper and the fresh basil and serve immediately.

Steam green beans until tender. Melt butter in a skillet. Add mushroomssaute until tender. Add granulated sugar, seasoning salt, garlic powder and black pepper. Continue cooking over medium heat until mixture thickens. Stir in whipping cream. Drain beans welltoss with mushroom mixture. Serve warm or at room temperature. Makes 4 servings.

Place one family size tea bag in each person’s mug. Add hot water. Add one packet of baking soda to each mug. Stir well. Add sweetener of choice to taste. Let stand for one minute. Remove baking soda. Serve.

In a bowl combine breadcrumbs, apples and brown sugar. In an 8 x 8 inch baking dish spray with cooking spray. Melt butter in a medium skillet over medium heat. Add cabbage and saute until wilted. Spread half the cabbage in the baking dish. Layer with the apple mixture. Layer with remaining cabbage. Bake in the preheated oven for 25 minutes. Uncover and bake until the apples are tender and the cabbage is slightly browned.

Beat the eggs together with the light cream in a bowl. Add the seasonings and mix well. Heat a skillet over medium-low heat. Add the butter and let it melt. Pour the mixture into the skillet and stir as it cooks until it is no longer runny but still soft. Serve immediately with buttered toast or muffins on the side for dipping.

Place wine, salt, and 1/2 cup water in a saucepan over high heat. Bring to a boil. Place halibut in the saucepan and cover. Cook until the halibut flakes when tested with a fork. Remove from heatremove the fillet from the wine mixture and rinse in cold water to stop the cooking. Pat the fillet dry. Place on a baking sheet lined with wax paper, skin side down. Preheat oven to 375 degrees. Combine breadcrumbs, mayonnaise, sour cream, onion, paprika, salt, and pepper in a bowlspread mixture evenly over the top of the fillet. Bake the fillet for 20 minutesserve immediately.

In a food processor add cheese, pine nuts and green chilies. Process until chopped. Add garlic. Process until smooth. Add parsley & cilantro. Process to combine. Add olive oil. Blend until smooth. Pour into a bowl. Season with salt & pepper. Add shrimp. Serve on a bed of lettuce. Garnish with more parsley.

In a large skillet over medium-high heat, stir-fry the snow peas and radish in the sesame oil with the ginger for 2 minutes. Add the soy sauce and vinegar and stir for 1 minute. Add the cashews and chili sauce and stir until heated through. Transfer to a serving dish and sprinkle with the scallions.

Place fillets in a shallow dish. Dip each fillet in the butter mixture. Sprinkle the fillets with panko crumbs. Combine the dried cranberries with the green onion. Place in the center of each fillet. Place in the oven. Bake until fish flakes easily. Serve with lemon wedges.

In a large bowl combine apples, radishes and onion with the lemon rind, lemon juice and cashews. In a smaller bowl, whisk together mayonnaise and apple cider vinegaradd to fruit mixture. Toss well to coat. Chill at least 1 hour.

Mix flour, sugar, egg and salt in a bowl. Melt butter in another bowl. Add flour mixture and beat until smooth. Divide into 2 parts and add red currant jam to one part. Beat well and return to bowl. Knead until smooth. Roll out on lightly floured surface to 1/2-inch thickness. Cut into 1-inch squares. Sprinkle each square with poppy seeds and 1 teaspoon of jam. Place squares on baking sheets 1 inch apart. Bake at 325 degrees until edges are golden brown.
Preheat oven to 180. C. In a large bowl mix all the above ingredients together and then place into a greased fry pan over medium heat. Cook for about 3 minutes on each side or until cooked through.

Heat 2 tbsp of olive oil in a large saute pan over medium heat. Add fennel bulbs, toss and cook 10 minutes or until softened. Add 1 tbsp of olive oil, toss again and add bucatini pasta and cook 2 minutes more or until al dente. Add the fennel fronds, toss 1 minute more then add 1 tbsp each of chopped wild fennel and anchovy fillets and cook 1 minute more until the anchovies melt into sauce. Season with red pepper flakes, black pepper, and sea salt and serve immediately.

Place cheddar and cream cheeses in medium bowl and mix until well blended. Blend in remaining ingredients except stuffed olives. Chill until ready to serve. Arrange olives on serving platter and top with cheddar and cream cheese mixture. Serve with cracker.
In a bowl combine all dressing ingredients except tortillas. Place tortillas in a flat place, place some lettuce. Layer with turkey. Fold up like a burrito. Serve with the dressing.

Cook pasta as directed on package. Drain well. Add tuna, frozen peas, onion, roasted red pepper and mayonnaise. Mix well. Add red wine vinegar and parsley. Season with salt and pepper to taste. Refrigerate until ready to use.

In a medium saucepan over high heat, bring 4 cups of water to a boil. Add the beans and reduce heat to mediumcook until tender-crisp, about 2 minutes. Drain and cool under cold running water for 1 minute. In a large skillet, heat the oil over medium heat. Add the onion and cook until translucent, about 1 minute. Add the beans and cook for 3 minutes. Season with the salt and pepper and sprinkle with the parsley. Serve immediately.

Combine the first four ingredients in a large bowltoss well. Add remaining ingredientstoss again. Chill, covered at least 2 hours. Serve on lettuce leaves with crackers or pumpernickel bread cubes. Garnish, if desired, with additional cranberries or pecans.

Place the lentils in a large pot. Add the celery ribs and onions. Add enough water to cover the vegetables. Bring to a boil. Turn down to a simmer. Add the pork hocks. Simmer for 45 minutes. Add the sugar. Simmer for 1 hour or until the lentils are tender. Serves 6.

Preheat oven to 350 degrees F (175 degrees C). Grease a 13x9 inch baking dish. Cut the potato into 1/2 inch cubes. Slice the tomatoes into thin slices. In a bowl, combine the onions, potato, tomato slices, herbs, and margarine. Mix until thoroughly blended. Transfer to prepared dish. In a medium bowl, combine the flour, milk, and salt and pepper to tastestir until smooth. Pour the mixture over the vegetable mixture in the dishstir to combine. Bake in the preheated oven for 1 hourtop with cheese and bake for another 10 minutes.

In double boiler combine 2 cups sugar with 1 cup hot water, corn syrup, egg whites (beaten stiff) and salt. Cook to 238 degrees Farenheit. Remove from heat, add orange rind, vanilla & mayonnaise. Blend well. Pour into greased pan& refrigerate until thick& hard. Cut into squares. Serve with fruit plate.
Blend together first 4 ingredients. Add milk to thin to desired consistency. Stir in olives. Serve with crackers or vegetable slices.
Preheat oven to 350 degrees. Mix marmalade and butter. Add Bisquick and cold water. Drop by teaspoon on a greased cookie sheet. Bake 8 to 10 minutes. Makes about 12 biscuits.

Preheat the oven to 350 degrees F (175 degrees C). Grease a 9x13-inch baking dish. Mix the flour, baking soda, and salt togetherset aside. In a large bowl, cream the butter and sugar together. Beat in the eggs one at a time, then stir in the flour mixture alternately with the milk. Fold in the oatmeal. Pour into the prepared baking dish. Bake for 25 minutes in the preheated oven.
Cover chicken with marmalade mixture. Bake 1 hour 20 minutes. Remove from oven. Add remaining ingredients. Cover. Cook 1 hour 20 minutes longer. Serve over cooked rice.

Place bread in a baking dish. Add butter on top of bread and bake until crisp. Remove from oven and let cool. Cut up bread into cubes, add apples cut into wedges and bake for 10 minutes until the apples soften and the bread cubes get golden. Add white wine, sugar and orange zest to taste. Beat the eggs with the cream and pour over bread and apples and bake for an additional 20-25 minutes or until the mixture sets.

In a skillet cook onion gravy mix over medium heat until gravy is bubbly. Add beef, onion gravy mix, biscuit mix, milk and hot water. Simmer 2 minutes. Turn out into greased 1-1/2-quart baking dish. Cover with brow gravy mix. Bake at 400 degrees F 15 minutes or until heated through. Serve with biscuits or crackers.

In a small bowl, combine corn starch and water. Set aside. In a large bowl, combine all other ingredients. Heat over medium heat until mixture boils and mixture is thickened. Remove from heat. Add the cornstarch mixture and stir until mixture thickens. Serve warm or room temperature.
Preheat oven to 350. Combine dry ingredients. Add wet. Mix well. Pour into greased 8x8 pan. Bake 25 minutes.

Mix all dry ingredients. Add berries and toss. Pour into pie shell. Mix together all wet ingredients. Add to berries. Mix well. Pour over top. Sprinkle with extra cinnamon. Bake at 350f until golden brown.

Combine ricotta, cheese with 1/2 teaspoon cinnamon in small saucepan over medium heat. Stir constantly until cheese melts and mixture is smooth. Set aside to cool. Meanwhile, beat eggs until blended. Add cream and beat well. Add cheese mixture and remaining cinnamon and nutmeg, and stir well to combine. Cook in nonstick skillet over medium heat until eggs are set but still moist in center. Garnish with additional cinnamon.

Preheat oven to 350 degrees F. Grease cookie sheet or spray with cooking spray.In large bowl, beat together egg whites until soft peaks form. Add corn syrup and beat until stiff. Add vanilla.In another bowl, combine flour, cocoa powder, baking powder and salt. Combine with egg white mixture. Stir in rice krispies.Drop by tablespoons onto cookie sheet. Bake 8-10 minutes. Remove from cookie sheet to wire rack. Makes 3 dozen.

Heat the oil in a large saute pan over medium-high heat. Add the garlic and saute until it turns golden. Add the bell peppers and onions and saute 4 minutes. Add the ground cumin and oregano and saute 1 minute. Add the hot chile and saute 1 minute more. Add the chicken and saute until browned. Add the stock and bring to a boil. Cover the pan and simmer until the chicken is tender, 20 minutes. Season with the lemon juice and serve over rice.

Wash and boil lentils with plenty of water for 10-15 minutes or until tender. Drain and rinse with cold water and set aside. In a deep pot, saute the onion in olive oil until tender. Add the spices and the rice. Stir for a few seconds and add the boiling lentils and enough hot water to cover the rice and lentils by 1 inch. Reduce the heat to very low and let it simmer covered for 40-50 minutes or until the water is almost evaporated and the rice is tender and the grains separate easily when prodded with a fork.

In large skillet heat oil and saute onion for 3 minutes. Add tomatoes and cook 10 minutes. Add spinach and cook until spinach is wilted. Combine tomato mixture, green chilies, and cheeses. Microwave until cheeses are melted. Add half-and-half and vinegar and cook until heated through. Season with salt and pepper. Serve with your favorite Mexican crackers and enjoy.

Mix sausage& egg together. Stir in garlic powder& salt and pepper. Set aside. Open crescent rolls. Roll out into rectangle about 11x15. Spread sausage/egg mixture over dough. Sprinkle with cheese. Roll up jelly roll style. Wrap up in plastic. Refrigerate at least one hour. Unwrap and place on greased baking sheet. Bake at 350 for about 30 minutes. Let cool. Slice into six pieces.

Cook rice according to package directions in water with 1/4 teaspoon salt until tender (about 40 minutes). Drainrinse with cool waterdrain well. Combine the coconut milk, milk, sugar, and coconut extract in a large saucepan over low heatbring just to a simmer. Stir in the rice and simmer, stirring often, until the mixture is thickened slightly, about 15 minutes. Remove from heat. Let cool for 2 minutesstir in the coconut flakes.

Process the graham cracker crumbs and margarine in a food processor until smooth. Press the mixture into a 9 inch pie plate. Spread the soy cream cheese in the bottom of the prepared pie plate. Add the pumpkin puree, light brown sugar, rum extract, ground cinnamon and ground nutmeg. Mix well. Bake for 55 minutes. Cool to room temperature before serving.
Mix eggs and water and blend well. Add biscuit mix and onions. Sprinkle with cheese and cayenne. Bake at 350 deg. F for 25 to 30 minutes. Serves 4 to 6.

In a small bowl, combine syrup, mustard, molasses, vinegar and cumin. Rub mixture over both sides of each chop. Place in a baking dish. Combine remaining ingredients in a bowl. Pour over chops. Cover loosely with foil. Bake at 350 degrees F for 1 hour.
Boil potatoes until soft. Mash. Add coconut and almonds. Let cool. Add melted dark chocolate. Add vanilla and powdered sugar to taste. Refrigerate until set. Unmold.

Separate dough into triangles and roll each into a 5 inch round. Place 1 tablespoon of chicken mixture on the dough. Roll up and pinch to seal. Place on ungreased baking sheet. Sprinkle with cheddar cheese. Bake at 400 degrees for 10-15 minutes. Cool 1 minute before serving.

Melt the butter in a large pan. Add the onion and saute until soft. Add the courgette and cook until tender. Add the pasta and stir to combine. Add the walnuts. Stir in the cream and simmer until thickened. Season with the salt, pepper and parmesan. Stir in the parsley.
Mix coffee, brown sugar and vanilla bean in blender. Blend until smooth. Add bananas and ice cubes. Blend until creamy. Garnish with almonds. Serve immediately.

Preheat oven to 350 degrees. Mix the mushroom soup and milk together. In a large mixing bowl combine the remaining ingredients. Add the mushroom mixture. Blend well. Spread into a greased loaf pan. Bake for one hour. Slice and serve.

Cook rice as directed on package. Heat the olive oil over medium-high heat. Add the tomato paste and cook until darkened. Add the rice, black beans, mexicorn, seasonings and water to the skilletstir to combine. Bring to a boil. Reduce heatcover and simmer for 20 minutes. Stir occasionally. Remove from heatstir in the shredded lettuce, green onions and cilantro. Stir until just combined. Let stand for 5 minutes before serving. Serve with optional toppings.

Place ham shank in pressure cooker with 4 cups cold water and bring to pressure. Reduce heat to low and cook 25 minutes. Remove ham shank, drain. Place potato in pressure cooker with 6 cups cold water, cook 15 minutes until potato is tender. Remove potato with slotted spoon to serving dish. In same pressure cooker with liquid, add carrots and cook 10 minutes or until tender. Add cabbage and cook 2 minutes. Season with pepper to taste. Remove from heat. Serve ham with vegetables and potato. Serves 8-10.

Boil water. Add spinach and potatoes. Cook until potatoes are tender. Drain. Mash spinach and potatoes. Add egg yolks and mix until creamy. Add salt and flour. Knead dough until smooth. Roll out into small gnocchi. Boil in boiling water until they rise to surface. Drain and saute in butter. Add parmesan cheese and serve.

Mix the sugar, corn syrup, and water in a large heavy saucepan over a medium heat. Stir constantly until mixture bubbles and reaches a boil (3 minutes). Boil for one minute until the mixture is clear. Remove from heat and add the nuts and rice flour all at once. Beat vigorously with a wooden spoon until the mixture is smooth and creamy (3 to 5 minutes). Dust the work surface with confectioners sugar. Place the mixture in the center of the surface. Form the mixture into a 12 inch by 6 inch rectangle with the help of a knife or spatula. Cut the rectangle into 36 one-inch pieces with a sharp knife or scissors. The pieces should be smooth and soft, like taffy.

Preheat oven to 425 degrees F (220 degrees C). In a bowl combine flour, salt and baking powder. Cut the butter into the dry mixture using two knives or pastry blender until the mixture resembles coarse meal. Add the eggs and beat lightly with a fork or whisk. Add the milk and stir until just combined. Pour into muffin tin (1/2 full). Bake for 20 minutes or until golden brown.

Cook the meat and onion together. Stir in the tomatoes and cook for about 10 minutes. Add the peppers and cook for about 5 minutes. Add the beans and cook for about 5 minutes more. Remove from heat and stir in the Monterey Jack cheese and butter. Sprinkle with paprika for garnish and serve immediately.
Brown the ground turkey in a large skillet. Add the onions and garlic. Saute until tender. Add the remaining ingredients and stir until well blended. Simmer for 20 minutes. Serve over rice.

In 12-inch non-stick skillet heat 1 teaspoon oil. Add pine nuts. Cook and stir over medium heat until golden brown, about 4 minutes. Transfer to small bowl. Heat remaining 1 tablespoon oil in same skillet over medium-high heat. Add garliccook 1 minute. Add pastacook 1 minute or until browned. Add red swiss chard. Add broth and stir until pasta is coated. Add balsamic vinegartoss to combine. Stir in sun-dried tomatoes. Add pine nutstoss. Serve with parmesan.

Rub chicken with sesame oil and season with salt and pepper. Place in 9 x 13 baking dish and set aside. In a medium bowl mix together soy sauce and brown sugar. In a small bowl, combine gingerroot and hot water. Stir into the soy mixture. Pour over the chicken. Bake for 45 minutes. Sprinkle with scallions and bake for 15 minutes more. Serves 4.

Trim and halve the brussels sprouts. Melt butter in a large heavy saucepan and add the halved sprouts and the water to cover the bottom of the pan. Cover and cook on medium low for about 8 minutes. Stir in the sugar and 1/2 teaspoon of the kosher salt. Continue to cook uncovered until the water has evaporated and the brussel sprouts are glazed. Stir in the lemon juice and the remaining kosher salt and black pepper to taste. Cook uncovered on low for 2 more minutes until the glaze is thickened.

In a medium saucepan, heat buttermilk and mustard over medium heat until just heated through. Remove from the heat and stir in the salt and sugar until dissolved. Whisk in the shrimp and continue whisking until they are cooked through and opaque. Stir in the cucumber and green onions and serve immediately. Serves 4.

Combine apples, orange juice, zest of orange, cinnamon, sugar and salt in a large saucepan over low heat. Cook until softened, about 5 minutes. Pour filling into a baking dish. Preheat oven to 180c fan-forced. Roll out pastry thinly on a lightly floured surface. Cut pastry into strips about 1cm wide. Fit pastry strips in lattice design over filling. Bake until pastry is golden brown and filling is bubbling, about 30 minutes.
Toss together baby spinach leaves in bowl. Add soy sauce, sugar and rice wine vinegar. Add dijon mustard. Toss well. Add sesame oil and toss well. Top with toasted sesame seeds and serve.

Dissolve gelatin in boiling watercool slightly. Combine milk, sugar and gelatin mixtureadd lime rind and lime juicechill thoroughly. Beat cream to soft peaksfold into chilled gelatin mixturechill again. Beat egg whites to soft peaksadd 1 teaspoon of the granulated sugarbeat to stiff peaksfold into pie mixturepour into pie shellchill again at least 2 hours or overnight. Before serving, mix the remaining granulated sugar with green food coloring to desired shadesprinkle over top of pie.

Cream butter and sugar, add eggs one at a time beating well after each addition. Sift together the cocoa and flour then add vanilla and nuts. Pour into a greased and floured 9 x 13 inch pan. Bake at 350 for 20 minutes or until a skewer comes out clean. Cool and cut into squares.

Place 2 teaspoons of dried lavender into 2 cups of hot water. Let steep for 5 minutes, strain and discard lavender. Add 2 cups of fresh lemon juice to lavender water. Stir until sugar is dissolved. Serve hot or cold with a lemon slice garnish.
Melt graham crackers in microwave or in pan on stove top. Stir in brown sugar and nuts. Press into greased 13 x 9 pan and bake at 350 degrees for 10 minutes. Cool completely and cut into squares.

Slice carrots on bias into rounds about 1/8 inch thick. Heat oil in large skillet over medium high heat until it sizzles when a drop of water is added. Cook onions and carrots until crisp tender, stirring often. Season to taste with salt and pepper. Serve immediately.

Using a food processor, combine the cornstarch and lemon juice until smooth. Add the egg whites and pulse until the mixture is frothy. Transfer the mixture to a large bowl and add the parsley, kosher salt and pepper and stir to combine. Place the bread crumbs on a plate. Cut the chicken breasts lengthwise (not all the way through) and then open like a book. Put a few tablespoons of the chicken mixture in the middle of each breast and then place another piece of chicken on top of it, creating a sandwich. Place the sandwich between two pieces of plastic wrap and pound with a flat-bottomed meat tenderizer or the bottom of a heavy skillet until the sandwich is about 1/2" thick. Dip both sides of the sandwiches in the egg white mixture and then dip in the cornstarch mixture. Shake off any excess and place on a plate with the remaining mixture. Heat 1" of olive oil in a large heavy-bottomed pot until very hot and then fry the sandwiches, a few at a time until golden brown on both sides, turning only once. Remove

Dissolve gelatin in boiling water. Add lemonade concentrate. Cool to room temperature. Beat cream cheese until fluffy. Fold in gelatin mixture. Fold in frozen whipped topping. Pour into 13 x 9 glass baking dish. Refrigerate until set. If desired, tint with yellow food coloring.

Preheat oven to 350F. Put the potatoes in a large bowl and toss with the olive oil, kosher salt and fresh ground black pepper. Toss to combine. Place the potatoes in a single layer in a large shallow baking pan. Bake for 45 minutes to 1 hour or until the edges are crisp and the centers are tender. Toss with the minced garlic just before serving.

Combine first four ingredients in a saucepan and bring to a boil. Remove from heat. In another bowl combine all dry ingredients. Add to molasses mixture and mix until well blended. Roll into 1 inch balls. Place 2 inches apart on ungreased cookie sheet. Bake in a preheated 375 degree oven for 8 to 10 minutes until edges are golden brown. Remove from oven and let cool on cookie sheets 5 minutes. Remove to wire racks to cool.

Boil water. Cook orzo in boiling water according to package directions. Add frozen chopped spinach. Remove from heat. Drain. Add butter, lemon juice, parmesan cheese, onion powder, salt and pepper. Mix well. Serves 4.

Fry bacon until crispdrain on paper towels. Spread mayo on breadspread onion over bacon. Sprinkle with oregano. Top with tomatosprinkle with cheese. Bake at 350 degrees for 15 minutes or until cheese is melted. Makes 1 sandwichcut each loaf into 4 piecesmakes 4 sandwichesserves 2.
Mix juices and honey in a pitcher. Add lime juice and ginger ale and stir well. Add rum and stir well. Chill until ready to serve. Add pineapple chunk and garnish with melon ball before serving.

In a large bowl, whisk together eggs and water. Heat canola oil in a skillet over medium heat. Add bok choy, onions and bamboo shoots. Cook for 3 minutes or until the bok choy is crisp-tender. Add the garlic powder and salt and pepper. Add the cooked egg mixture and cook for 1 minute. Remove from heat. Add the shrimp and cook until just pink. Serve immediately.

Combine egg whites, 1/4 cup water and sesame seeds in medium bowl. Mix well. Dip chicken in egg white mixture. Sprinkle with nuts. Fry in hot oil in nonstick pan until golden and tender. Drain. Combine remaining 1/4 cup water, hoisin sauce and mustard in small bowl. Stir in preserves and heat through. Serve with tenders.

In a blender or food processor, puree chicken broth, green onion, garlic and lemon juice until smooth. Add avocados, yogurt and crabmeat. Blend until smooth. Season with salt and white pepper to taste. Chill thoroughly before serving. Garnish with green onions. Serve in chilled bowls.

Combine all but pretzels and pour into 9x13 pan. Bake at 350 degrees for 10 minutes. Cool. Mix pretzels and butter together and sprinkle on top of cooled jello. Refrigerate. Dissolve jello in boiling water. Stir in raspberries. Let set. Spread on top of cooled crust. Cool. Beat together cream cheese and one cup of sugar. Stir in cool whip and spread on cooled pretzel crust. Dissolve jello in boiling water. Stir in strawberries and let set for ten minutes. Pour on top of cheese mixture and chill until firm.
Mix together beef, black beans and salsa. Add hash browns and soup. Top with cheese. Bake at 400 degrees for 25 minutes.

Preheat oven to 350 degrees. Lay half the chicken in a 2-quart baking dish. Sprinkle with half the celery. Repeat layers. Combine breadcrumbs and parsleysprinkle over chicken. Beat eggspour over top. Bake uncovered for 45 minutes or until a knife inserted near center comes out clean. Makes 6 servings.

Melt 1 tablespoon butter and sautee the garlic, shallots, tarragon, and thyme for about 3 minutes. Add the parsley and chives. Cook for about 1 minute. Add the ale and bring to a boil. Add the mussels. Cover and microwave for about 2 minutes or until the mussels open. Serve with the remaining butter for dipping. Serve with crusty bread.

Mix together the salad dressing mix, wine, soup, and 1/2 cup of water. Cut up the chicken into bite sized pieces. Place the chicken in a baking dish. Pour the sauce over the chicken. Bake at 350 degrees F for 30 minutes or until the chicken is done. Cook the pasta according to package directions. Place the pasta on a serving platter. Add the cream cheese and stir until melted. Pour the sauce over the top. Garnish with chives. Serve.
Mix cream, lemon juice, sugar and salt. Add coloring until desired color is reached. Add bananas and fruit. Chill. Serve topped with nuts and cherries.

In a large bowl or the bowl of your stand mixer combine flour, sea salt, soda and set aside. In another bowl cream together butter, cane sugar, and vanilla until light and fluffy. Then add mashed bananas and eggs. With the mixer on low speed combine dry and wet mixes until just combined. Fold in pecan pieces. Pour batter into greased loaf pan. Bake in preheated 350 degree oven until golden and a toothpick inserted in center comes out clean, about 60 to 65 minutes. Let cool in pan for 10 minutes then remove to wire rack to cool completely. Serve slices with a scoop of vanilla ice cream or a spoonful of creamy vanilla yogurt or a smear of fresh whipped cream. Or all of the above!

Heat oven to 350. grease and flour a 9 inch round pan. mix cocoa,flour,baking soda and sugar. add buttermilk and oil. mix until smooth. add eggs and beat for one minute. add boiling water and mix again. pour into prepared pan. bake for 35 - 40 minutes. cool for ten minutes before removing from pan. frost as desired.

Saute onion in butter. Add rice, stirring until heated through. Add broccoli, salt, pepper, and cheese whiz. Stir well. Pour into 9 x 13 casserole dish. Bake 10 minutes at 400 degrees. Spread sour cream on top of casserole. Bake 5 minutes longer. Serves 6-8.

Combine first 5 ingredients in small bowlmix well. Spread half of mixture over 4 slices bread to within 1/8 inch of edges. Top each slice with 1 slice turkey breast, 1 slice provolone cheese, 2 roasted sweet peppers, and 1/2 of spinach leavestop with remaining bread. Spread remaining cream cheese mixture over sandwichesspread remaining bread with mayonnaisecover sandwiches. Cut each sandwich diagonally in half. Yield: 8 servings (serving size: 1 sandwich).

Peel and slice apples into the pie shell. In a bowl combine the remaining ingredients and sprinkle over the apples. Dot with butter. Bake for 40 minutes or until the juices are bubbling and the apples are tender.

Heat water to boiling. Add vegetables and cover. Cook until tender, about 5 minutes. Drain and place vegetables in serving bowl. Stir in slivered almonds. Pour soy sauce over vegetables. Toss lightly. Serves 4.

Melt the butter in a large saucepan. Saute the onions and garlic in the hot butter until tender. Add the mushrooms and saute until browned. Sprinkle with flourmix well. Stir in the pearl barley. Add the chicken brothbring to a boil. Reduce the heat to lowcover tightly. Simmer 1 hour. Season with black pepper and salt.

Preheat oven to 350 f. Unroll each crescent roll. Place one slice of apple in each triangle of dough. Fold over to form a triangle. Place in a greased 13-in. X 9-in. X 2-in. Baking dish. In a bowl, combine the sugar and butter and sprinkle over the rolls. Slowly pour the soda around the rolls. Sprinkle with the cinnamon. Bake, uncovered for 35-40 minutes or until golden brown. Serve warm with vanilla ice cream.

In a mixing bowl combine the evaporated milk, light brown sugar, kahlua and light corn syrup. In a separate bowl, combine the eggs, pumpkin and pumpkin pie spice. Add the milk mixture and combine well. Pour into prepared crust. Bake at 350f for 45 minutes. Cool completely and serve.

Preheat oven to 400. Spray 13x9 baking dish with cooking spray. Sprinkle fish with oregano. Season with salt and pepper. Place fish in baking dish. Spoon sauce over fish. Sprinkle with cheese. Bake 15 to 20 minutes or until fish flakes easily. Sprinkle with parsley. Serve over spaghetti.

Wash and clean cauliflower and leeks. Remove any tough outer leaves from cauliflower and chop into small florets. Slice leeks thinly. Heat oil in large saucepan or stockpot over medium heat. Add leeks and cook for 5 minutes, until they are softened. Add stock and cauliflower and bring to a boil. Lower heat to a simmer, cover, and cook for 20 minutes or until cauliflower is tender. Remove from heat.
