Using an immersion blender or food processor with a food processor with a food processor with a food processor with a food processor with a food processor with a food processor with a food processor with a food processor with a food processor with a food processor with a food processor with a food processor with a food processor with a food processor with a food processor with a food processor with a food processor with a food processor with a food processor with a food processor with a food processor with a food processor with a food processor with a food processor with a food processor with a food processor with a food processor with a food processor with a food processor with a food processor with a food processor with a food processor with a food processor with a food

Place butter in slow cooker. Combine chicken broth, cream of chicken soup, and butter in a bowl. Place seasoned chicken in slow cooker. Cover with mixture from bowl. Cook on low for 7 hours or high for 4 hours. Serve over egg noodles.

Butter each bagel slice on both sides and toast it on both sides until lightly browned. Crack an egg into each slice and sprinkle it with cheese and salt and pepper. Cook for 2-3 minutes more or until egg is done to taste. Serve hot.

Preheat oven to 375F. Spray a 9 x 13 inch baking pan with cooking spray. Peel and core apples. Cut into 1 inch chunks. Add to baking pan. Add raisins and cinnamon. Stir. Add oats. Stir. Add soymilk and salt. Stir. Bake 45 minutes. Remove from oven. Stir in maple syrup and nuts. Cool 10 minutes. Serve warm.

Combine relish, salt, pepper and lemon juice in small bowl. Place chicken in gallon-size zip-lock plastic freezer bag. Add relish mixture and seal bag. Refrigerate for 3 to 4 hours. Heat oil in 12-inch heavy nonstick skillet over medium-high heat until hot but not smoking. Add chicken, cut side down. Cook 2 minutes. Turn and continue to cook 2 minutes. Transfer to plate. Cook until well browned on both sides. Sprinkle with relish mixture. Serve immediately.

Heat the oil in a large saucepan over medium-high heat. Sauté the onion until tender. Add the garlic and saut until lightly colored. Add the tomatoes, chili flakes and balsamic vinegar and simmer 10 minutes. Stir in sugar and basil. Serve with hot pasta.

Cook the rice according to directions. Meanwhile, heat oil in a large skillet over medium heat. Add the onion, garlic, carrot, celery and herbs. Cook for a few minutes to soften the vegetables. Add the frozen vegetables. Cook a few more minutes until the vegetables are tender. Add the rice to the vegetables and mix together. Cook a few minutes more to heat the rice. Sprinkle with Parmesan cheese.

Cook the pasta shells according to the instructions on the box. Brown the ground beef and drain the fat. Add the spaghetti sauce and cook until heated through. Combine the sour cream and the whipping cream and heat until smooth and well-blended. Add the cooked pasta shells and the beef mixture and stir. Sprinkle with the shredded parmesan and mozzarella cheeses and mix well. Bake at 350 degrees for 20 minutes or until the cheeses have melted and are bubbly. Serve with a salad.

Preheat oven to 400f. In a 2-quart casserole dish combine cooked mac and cheese mix and cheddar cheese. Sprinkle with tuna and crumbs. Bake 12 min or until hot and bubbly. Serve with potato chips on top.
Crumble tofu into a bowl. Stir in remaining ingredients. Cover and chill 1 hour. Stir before serving.
Heat olive oil and add garlic. Cook 1 minute. Add shrimp and cook 1-2 minutes or until pink. Add dry sherry and Old Bay seasoning. Toss. Sprinkle with parsley. Serve immediately.

Preheat oven to 350F. Cut dry white bread into 1 inch cubes. Melt butter in ovenproof dish or baking dish. Add bread cubes and toss to coat with butter. In medium bowl, whisk together eggs, heavy cream, milk, vanilla, superfine sugar and salt until well combined. Pour egg mixture over bread cubes. Bake until bread is set and egg mixture is almost set in the center but still very wet, about 20-25 minutes. Sprinkle with golden raisins and bake until set, about 15 minutes more. Sprinkle with nutmeg before serving.

Peel and dice the sweet potatoes into 1/2 inch cubes. Combine with the rest of the ingredients in a large mixing bowl. Spread the mixture into a buttered 8x8 inch glass dish and bake at 350F for 20-25 minutes or until set. Remove from oven and sprinkle with the blanched almonds. Serve warm.
Slice the leeks and the garlic and saute them in olive oil until soft. Add the carrots and cook until done. Sprinkle with salt and pepper and serve.
Combine all in a large bowl and toss. Serve.

Place almonds in a food processor. Process until almonds are finely ground. Add cocoa powder and process until well combined. Add white sugar and instant coffee. Process to combine. Add coffee liqueur and corn syrup. Process to combine. Using a small cookie scoop or your hands, scoop and shape mixture into 1 inch balls. Roll in cinnamon sugar. Refrigerate until firm. Store in an airtight container for up to 2 weeks.

Preheat oven to 350f. Cut the biscuits in half. Beat the butter until creamy. Stir in the sugar and the cinnamon. Roll the half biscuits in the mixture. Place them in a sprayed 9 x 13-inch baking dish. Sprinkle the chopped nuts over the top. Bake uncovered for 25-30 minutes or until the biscuits are golden.

Peel the kohlrabi and slice it into half-inch-thick rounds. In a skillet over medium-high heat, melt the butter in the pan. Add the kohlrabi, sprinkle with salt and pepper, and toss well with the butter. Cook until the kohlrabi is golden brown, turning once or twice as it cooks. Stir in the parsley. Stir in the flour and cook briefly to make the flour brown. Add the chicken broth and mix well. Cook until the mixture thickens slightly. Serve immediately. Makes 2 cups.

In a large bowl combine the butter, icing sugar, cornstarch, and flour together. Beat until smooth. Add the vanilla extract and beat until well blended. Store in the refrigerator until ready to use or freeze for up to 6 months. Makes about 6 cups.

Melt butter in large skillet over medium-high heat and cook carrot until crisp-tender about 5 minutes. Add apple cider and bring to a boil. Reduce heat to medium-low and cook until liquid is reduced to 1/4 cup. Stir in brown sugar and tarragon and cook 1 minute longer. Season with pepper and salt.

Place cashews and almonds in a small food processor. Process until finely chopped. Heat oil in a skillet over medium high heat. Add broccoli and beans. Sprinkle on nuts and season to taste. Cook and stir until vegetables are crisp tender and nuts are golden. Makes 4 servings.

Place egg yolks into saucepan and beat with hand-held electric mixture or whisk until yolks are light yellow. Add condensed milk to yolks and whisk to combine. Add vanilla extract. Place over low heat and cook, stirring constantly, until mixture thickens like custard or pudding. Remove from heat and place saucepan in sink of cold water to cool quickly. Churn as directed. Before freezing, add the cookies into the ice cream.

In sauce pan, melt 2 tablespoons butter. Add 1/2 cup sugar, stirring to combine. Add 2 tablespoons cocoa. Stir constantly until mixture thickens. Remove from heat and stir in 1 teaspoon salt. Cool to room temperature. In large bowl, beat 6 large egg yolks until thick and lemon-yellow. Add cooled mixture. Beat until well blended. In another large bowl, beat 6 egg whites until stiff peaks form. Gradually beat in remaining 1 tablespoon sugar. Fold egg whites into yolk mixture. Pour into prepared graham cracker crust. Bake at 350 degrees F for 20 minutes. Cool completely. Top with sweetened whipped cream and nuts. Garnish with chocolate curls.

To make the sauce, whisk together coconut milk, orange juice, zest, fish sauce, and chile sauce in a small saucepan over medium heat until well combined and the sauce is just simmering. Stir in garlic and gingercook for 1 minute more. Taste and season with salt and more fish sauce if needed. Add the mint and cilantro and cook for 1 more minute, then remove from heat and let cool slightly. Preheat the oven to 350 degrees F. Lay the salmon in a 10x15-inch rimmed baking sheet and brush with a little oil. Roast until the top of the fish is just browned and the inside is cooked through, about 8 minutes (check the thickest part of the fish with a knife to make sure it's done). Meanwhile, remove the mint and cilantro from the sauce and pour the sauce over the fish. Cook for an additional 2 minutes or so until the sauce thickens just a bit and the fish is warm again, then serve. Serves 4.

Combine first 4 ingredients in heavy duty 12 inch saucepan. Cook over low to medium heat. Stirring frequently until mixture begins to bubble. Add maple syrup. Stirring frequently until mixture reaches 230degrees f. or soft ball stage in candy thermometer. Remove from heat. Stir in vanilla. Cool completely.

Slice bread in half horizontally. Spread sausage, then layer with cheese on each slice. In a bowl, whisk eggs with milk. Pour over bread. Sprinkle with salt and pepper to taste. Bake uncovered at 350 for 45-50 minutes. Serves 4.

Split jalapenos in half lengthwise and remove seeds and veins. Stuff each half with a teaspoon of the cheese mixture and a slice of bacon. Wrap each stuffed pepper with a strip of bacon and secure with toothpick. Bake at 350 degrees for 20 minutes or until bacon is crisp. Cool slightly before serving.

Heat oven to 400 degrees. Whisk together the first 4 ingredients in a large bowl. Combine the remaining ingredients in another bowl, and beat well. Stir the liquid mixture into the dry mixture just until combined. Turn onto a lightly greased baking sheet. Bake for 15 minutes or until golden brown. Makes about 12 4-inch pancakes. Serve hot with syrup and fruit slices.

Chop the garlic granules very fine. Heat the oil and butter together in a frying pan over a moderate heat and saute the chopped garlic for a minute or two without browning. Add the mushrooms and cook for about five minutes longer, then add the red wine and simmer gently for a few minutes longer. Add the lemon juice or white wine vinegar, season well with salt and pepper and serve at once.

Beat eggs well, then add milk and seasonings. Heat a large skillet over medium low heat. Add the butter, then the egg mixture and stir until cooked through but not set too firm. Sprinkle on the cheese and stir until melted. Serve on hot buttered toast.

To assemble the hotdog rolls, place 2 slices of white bread together on a flat surface. Spread the mustard evenly over each slice of bread. Place the hotdog inside the center of the slice of bread. Top with the slices of cheese. Place the second slice of bread on top of the sandwich. Dip the sides of the sandwich into the beaten eggs. Coat the sides of the sandwich with the breadcrumbs. Place the coated sandwiches into the hot oil. Cook until the sides of the sandwich are golden brown. Serve immediately.

In large saucepan, combine rhubarb and waterbring to boilcover and simmer 5 minutes. Add raspberries and currant jellycook until mixture is slightly thickened and rhubarb is tender. Spoon filling onto pie crustcover with second pie crust. Bake at 400 for 20 minutes or until crust is golden brown. Serve warm or cold with powdered sugar.

In a large pot bring the dried apple, sage, cinnamon stick and boiling water to a boil, cover and simmer for 10 minutes or until the apple is tender. Add the whisky and stir to mix well. Strain the mixture into mugs and stir in the honey to taste. Serve hot topped with a few whole dried apple rings.

Steam the zucchini for 3 minutes. Set aside to cool. In a medium mixing bowl combine the zucchini, corn, pimiento and garlic. Add the oil. Salt and pepper to taste. Spread in a 1-1/2 quart casserole. Top with the mozzarella. Bake at 350 for 20 minutes or until lightly brown.

Cook potatoes and green beans in boiling water until tender. Drain and return to the pot. Melt butter over medium heat. Add the onion and garlic and saute until tender. Stir into potato and bean mixture. Add creole seasoning. Stir until blended. Serve immediately.

Combine all ingredients in a jar or container and shake vigorously to mix. Use immediately. To use, generously cover meat or fish with the spice mixture and let it sit for at least 1 hour before cooking.

Combine first 4 ingredients in a 1-qt saucepan. Bring to a boil over medium-high heat. Reduce heat to low. Cover and simmer 25 minutes, stirring occasionally. Stir in oxtail soup mix and serve. Makes 6 servings.

Preheat oven to 350 degrees F. In a large bowl combine the dry ingredients. Add the wet ingredients and stir just until combined. Spoon the batter into a greased and floured 12 cup muffin pan. Bake for 25 minutes.

Beat together eggs, oil and sugar until fluffy. Add vanilla. Mix well. Beat in baking powder and salt. Sift in the flour 1 cup at a time. Mix thoroughly. Refrigerate overnight. Divide dough into 20 pieces. Roll out each piece into a 3-inch circle. Place a small spoonful of preserves in center of each circle. Bring edges together over filling. Press edges together firmly. Pinch ends together. Place on ungreased cookie sheet. Bake at 350 for 12 to 15 minutes. Remove from oven. Cool on wire racks.

Crush vanilla wafers and pour into medium bowl. Add powdered sugar and oleo. Stir to combine. Press into 13x9 pan. Combine frozen orange juice and coconut. Spread over cookie base. Refrigerate until firm. Cut into squares. Store in tightly covered container. Makes 15 dozen.

Put the pork into a large kettle over low heat with the onion and cover with boiling water. Skim off the fat and remove the pork when it is tender. Add the codfish and boil for 10 minutes. Remove the fish and put it in a colander in the sink with cold water running over it for 10 minutes. Skim off the fat and add the codfish with the vegetables and boiling water to the kettle. Add the canned corn niblets and milk. Simmer for 20 minutes. Add the salt and pepper to taste. Serve hot.

Separate the eggs, beat the egg yolks with a little of the sugar until very light and frothy, then add the cream slowly beat until the mixture is smooth, then strain into a heavy saucepan. Add the rest of the sugar and whisk over a gentle heat until the mixture thickens and reaches the simmering point. Do not boil. Stir in the liqueurs and remove from the heat. When the mixture has cooled, pour into a serving dish and refrigerate overnight. Sprinkle chocolate chips over the top and let melt slightly in the fridge, then stir in gently so the chocolate melts into the pots de crme. Serve with whipped cream. Makes 4 servings.

For the macadamia nut crumbs, in a large mixing bowl combine the coconut and corn flakes. Add the nuts and stir to combine. Set aside. In a separate mixing bowl combine the beaten eggs and milk. Set aside. Heat a skillet over medium heat. Add the vegetable oil and swirl around. Dip the Hawaiian sweet bread in the egg mixture and then in the macadamia nut mixture. Add the slices to the hot skillet and cook until golden on both sides. Serve hot with a dollop of whipped cream. Makes 3-4 servings.

In a large saucepan prepare the noodles according to the package instructions and drain well. Melt the butter in the saucepan and then add the pot cheese. Stir well and cook until heated through. Add the sour cream and the cooked noodles. Stir and serve.

Cook bacon in a large skillet until crisp. Drain on paper towels. Add onion to drippings in skilletsaute until golden brown. Sprinkle in flourstir until smooth. Gradually add the milk, salt and pepper. Cook over medium heat until smooth and thickened. Add canned tomatoes and their liquid. Bring to a boilstir in sugar, bay leaf and celery leaves. Remove bay leaf. Serve over noodles. Garnish with a little fresh celery if desired.

1. Combine parsley, mustard powder, salt and black pepper. 2. Dip each trout in the buttermilk then coat with the breadcrumb mixture. 3. Spread the butter in an 11 inch by 7inch baking dish. Arrange the fish in the baking dish with the skin side up. 4. Sprinkle the remaining breadcrumb mixture over the fish. 5. Bake at 400F for 10 minutes or until fish is cooked through. 6. Sprinkle with the slivered almonds. Serve with mashed potatoes and green vegetables.
Mix spiced rum and milk with 1/3 cup of sugar and cinnamon, heat and serve.

Preheat oven to 375 degrees F. Place wonton skins on a lightly greased baking sheet. Beat together egg with water. Brush egg mixture over the skins. Bake for 6 to 7 minutes, or until they puff up. Remove from oven. Melt the butter. Cook the onions and peppers until soft. Add the broccoli. Season with thyme and pepper. Spread mixture onto the wonton skins. Bake for 5 minutes. Sprinkle with cheese. Bake until the cheese is melted. Serve hot.

Saute onion in butter until tender and add flour. Cook for about 5 minutes stirring constantly. Stir in milk. Bring to a boil, add cheese, salt and pepper to taste. Pour into a greased 2-quart baking dish. Layer the potato patties in the dish. Top with remaining cheese. Bake at 350f for 30 minutes or until potatoes are tender and cheese is melted. Makes 6-8 servings.

Peel and slice the russet potatoes and place in boiling water for 15-20 minutes until tender and fully cooked. In the meantime heat a large skillet over medium heat and saut the onions and cook until soft and fragrant. Remove from pan and set aside and drain the potatoes. In the same pan that you cooked the onions in add the olive oil and heat until hot and then add the potatoes and cook for about 10 minutes until lightly golden and crispy and slightly browned. Season with salt and pepper and serve immediately.

Preheat oven to 350 degrees F. Cook elbow macaroni in boiling water 6 to 8 minutes. Drain well. Place in ungreased 1-quart casserole. Stir in diced tomatoes. Sprinkle with salt and pepper. Melt butter in saucepan over medium heat. Add flour. Stir until smooth. Stir in milk. Cook and stir until thickened and bubbly. Pour over pasta and tomatoes. Bake uncovered 35 minutes. Serves 4.

Heat oil in wok or skillet over medium high heat. Add broccoli, mushrooms, red pepper flakes, onion and carrot. Cook for about 3 minutes or until crisp tender. Stir in soy sauce and honey. Cook until liquid evaporates. Stir in peanuts. Serve over rice.
Place fish in a baking dish. Add olive oil, lemon juice, capers and sea salt to taste. Toss to coat. Roast for 15 minutes until fish is flaky.
Cook pasta according to package directions and drain. Add all other ingredients together in a 9x13 baking dish. Bake for 30 minutes at 350 degrees. Let cool and serve.

Heat oil in skillet. Add garlic and cook until golden. Add spinach and cook until wilted. Add beans and cook until hot. Add broth. Bring to a boil. Cook until thickened. Stir in cooked angel hair. Toss to mix. Garnish with fresh parsley and sprinkle with parmesan cheese.

Preheat oven to 350. Cook bacon until done. Add onion and cook until onion is transparent. Drain bacon fat and add butter. Add mushroom and cook until lightly browned. In a large bowl combine bacon, onion and mushroom mixture with cheddar cheese and set aside. In a medium bowl, combine milk, eggs and italian seasoning. Lightly sprinkle flour on work surface. Roll out pie crust. Fold in half. Lay in pie plate. Add cheese mixture. Pour milk mixture over top. Bake at 350 for about 45 minutes. Cool slightly before slicing.

Preheat oven to 350 degrees. Season the drumsticks with sea salt and black pepper, rubbing it all over the drumsticks. Place them in a baking dish and bake for 45 minutes, turning once halfway through the baking time. Remove from the oven and let cool. In a small bowl, whisk together the molasses, red wine vinegar and ketchup until smooth. In a medium saucepan over medium-high heat, combine the red wine vinegar and ketchup mixture with the worcestershire sauce and red onion until simmering. Pour the glaze over the drumsticks and toss to coat. Bake for 5 more minutes or until heated through and the glaze has thickened slightly.
Mix greens, strawberries, onion and red pepper. Mix coriander in the vinaigrette and pour over the salad. Toss well. Serve.

Preheat oven to 350 degrees F. Prepare and bake cake as directed on box. Cool completely. In a small bowl combine the coconut and raspberry jello powder and boiling water. Add the diet soda and stir until dissolved. Cool completely. Beat the egg whites until soft peaks form, add the cream of tartar and beat until stiff peaks form. Beat in the coconut mixture and the cool whip until well mixed. Spread over the top of the cooled cake. Refrigerate at least 4 hours or until ready to serve.

Beat together dressing mix and sour cream until smooth. Dip chicken in mixture and roll in bread crumbs. Spray a baking dish with cooking spray. Place chicken in dish. Cover with foil. Bake at 350 for 25 minutes or until done.

In a bowl, beat together the egg whites and the ranch dressing until thoroughly blended. In a nonstick skillet over medium heat, heat the oil. Add the egg mixture and cook the mixture until it begins to set. Stir in the spicy brown mustard. Add the parsley and the garlic powder to the skillet. Stir until the parsley is wilted and the garlic powder has blended into the mixture. Remove from heat. Sprinkle the cheese evenly over the eggs. Cover the pan with a lid or foil and allow the cheese to melt, about 3 minutes. Serve warm.

Preheat oven to 350F. Grease a 10-inch round cake pan or 8-inch square pan. To prepare cake batter, grate carrotsadd to ginger, lemon peel, eggs and honey. Mix well. Add cinnamon to carrot mixture. Add breadcrumbs, nuts and cream cheese. Mix well. Pour batter into pan. Bake for 1 hour. Cool. Spread icing on top.
Combine all ingredients in a large bowl. Serve with vegetable dippers or tortilla chips.

Cook rice in 2 cups of boiling water for 30 minutes or according to directions on package. Combine juice, onion, ginger, thyme and parsley in a 3 quart saucepan. Bring to a boil. Reduce heat and simmer for 10 minutes. Remove from heat. Add in cinnamon. Stir in chicken. Cook until heated through. Serve with rice. Garnish with parsley.

Season pork chops on both sides with 1/4 teaspoon of salt and 1/4 teaspoon of pepper. Heat 1/4 inch of vegetable oil in a large skillet over medium-high heat. Cook the pork on both sides for 5 minutes. Add the wine to the skillet. Cover and cook until the pork is cooked through but still tender. Uncover and add the honey to the skillet. Stir to coat the pork. Spoon the honey over the pork. Serve sprinkled with the Dijon mustard.

Melt the butter in a large skillet over medium-high heat. Add the fish to the pan and saut until cooked through, about 2 minutes per side. Combine mustard and honey and brush over the fish. Top with pecans and parsley and sprinkle with parmesan cheese. Bake until cheese is melted and browned and fish flakes easily with a fork, about 5 minutes. Serve immediately. I like to serve this with a side of rice pilaf and california blend veggies.

In a small bowl, combine juice of 1 orange, 1/4 cup water, 2 tablespoons oil and juice of 1 lemon. Place fish in a shallow dish. Pour marinade over fish. Cover and refrigerate 1 hour. Preheat oven to 425 degrees F. Drain fish from marinade. Combine flour, 2 teaspoons pepper, 1/2 teaspoon salt. Dredge fish in flour mixture. Heat 2 tablespoons oil in a 12-inch nonstick skillet. Add fish. Cook 3 minutes per side. Remove fish. Add green onions. Cook 1 minute. Add orange juice mixture. Simmer 3 minutes. Serve.

In blender container combine heavy cream, condensed milk and yogurt. Blend until smooth and set aside. In a bowl combine instant espresso with a pinch of salt and a sprinkle of cinnamon. Add ground coffee and a pinch of salt to taste and stir. Pour mixture into blender container and blend on high speed until foamy. Freeze in ice cream maker according to manufacturers instructions. Dip ice cream in crushed nuts. Sprinkle with cinnamon and garnish with figs. Serve immediately or freeze until firm.
peel and pit avocados. slice in half and remove flesh and seeds. mix with rest of the ingredients. let stand for 30 minutes before serving.
Dissolve the jello in the boiling water. Stir in the cold water. Chill until partially set. Add the sugar-free whipped topping. Chill until firm.

In 12 inch skillet brown frankfurters in butter. Add onion. Cook over medium heat for 5 minutes. Stir in soup and milk. Cook until heated through. Stir in remaining ingredients except noodles. Cook for 1 minute. Stir in noodles. Cook 5 minutes or until heated through. Serve in bowls garnished with parsley.

Beat together the first three ingredients. Spread onto one end of each tortilla. Sprinkle with bacon and top with tomatoes and lettuce. Roll up and slice into 1/2 inch strips. Serve at room temperature.

Bring a large pot of water to boil. Cook rigatoni according to package directions until tender, about 10 to 12 minutes. Drain. Heat oil in a large skillet over medium heat. Add sausagecook until browned, about 5 minutes. Add tomatoes with their liquid, water, basil, and beans. Bring to a boil. Reduce heatcover and simmer until thickened, about 10 minutes. Stir in pastatoss. Sprinkle with cheese. Serve with salad.

Prepare asparagus by washing and snapping off tough end. In saucepan, heat 2 Tbsp. water over medium heat. Add lemon juice and Dijon mustardcook 1 minute. Add remaining 2 Tbsp. water. Add 1 Tbsp. olive oil. Stir in salt and pepper. Add asparagus. Cook until crisp-tender. Add remaining 1 Tbsp. olive oil. Serve with shallot.

Preheat oven to 350 degrees f. Lightly sprinkle the inside of a large roasting pan with the seasoning. Sprinkle the breasts with the seasoning. Heat the oil in a small skillet over medium heat. Add the garlic and saute for 2 minutes or until golden. Stir in the wine and the rosemary. Transfer the mixture to a blender and process until smooth. Pour the sauce over the breasts. Bake for 30 minutes in the preheated oven. Turn the breasts over. Bake for 30 minutes longer or until the breasts are thoroughly cooked. Increase the heat to high. Pour the remaining sauce from the skillet over the breasts. Broil for 2-3 minutes. Makes 4 servings.

Cook brussels sprouts and green beans in boiling water until tender. Drain well. Heat butter in skillet. Saut garlic until golden. Add brussels sprouts and green beans. Stir in salt and pepper. Add balsamic vinegar and toss well.

Combine breadcrumbs, cheese, thyme, and pepper. Set aside. Beat egg and milk in a bowl. Combine with flour in another bowl. Dip chicken in flour mixture. Dip in egg mixture. Roll in breadcrumb mixture. Place on a baking sheet. Spray with cooking spray. Bake uncovered for 40-45 minutes. Turn once. Makes 8.

Melt the butter in a large sauce pan. Sweat the shallots and mushrooms until translucent. Add the dry white wine. Boil until almost completely evaporated. Add the artichoke hearts. Cook until tender. Add lemon juice. Remove from heat. Add the chives. Spoon into a serving bowl. Cover with plastic wrap to keep warm. In another sauce pan, heat olive oil over medium high heat. Add pimiento. Add shrimp. Sauté until just opaque. Add to bowl. Garnish with parsley. Serve over rice.

In small saucepan, heat water to lukewarm. Mix dry ingredients in large bowl. Add water and egg mixturemix well. Let rise about 1 hour or until doubled in size. Punch downknead until smooth and elastic. Divide into 36 portionsshape into balls and place in greased 9x5x3-inch loaf pans. Coverlet rise until doubled in size. Preheat oven to 350f. Bake 18 to 22 minutes or until light golden brown. Makes 36 rolls.
Finely chop chicken and hard boiled eggs. Add relish and mix well. Add mayo and mix. Season with salt and pepper. Garnish with parsley. Serve with crackers.
Place coffee and water in a small saucepan. Bring to a boil. Let boil 5 minutes. Add remaining ingredients and cook over medium heat until thickened. Serve warm.
Mix dry ingredients with soda and spice. Whisk egg and milk together. Fold in plum. Melt butter with extract and pour into batter. Spoon into cups and bake at 425f for 20 minutes.

Boil the potatoes in a medium-sized pot of lightly salted water over medium heat until they are fork-tender. Drain the potatoes and place them back into the pot. Add the garlic powder and the parmesan cheese and mix well with a fork. Add the chicken broth and butter and stir well to combine. Add the chopped kale and stir well to combine. Add additional chicken broth as needed to reach the desired consistency of your mash. Serve immediately as a side dish or with your favorite stew or soup.

Cut stewing beef into 1-inch cubes. Drain italian sausage and cut into bite-size pieces. Heat oil in Dutch oven over medium heatcook beef and sausage 10 to 12 minutes or until meat is lightly browned, stirring frequently. Stir in onions and garlic. Cook 5 minutes or until onions are tender. Stir in green pepper and cook 2 minutes. Stir in potatoes. Cook and stir 5 minutes or until potatoes are lightly browned. Stir in beans and basil. Stir in broth and season to taste with salt and pepper. Bring to boilingreduce heat. Cover and simmer 1 1/2 hours or until beef and potatoes are tender. Yield 8 servings (2 1/2 quarts).

In a large pan, heat the oil over a medium heat. Add the basil, garlic, beans and asparagus. Add the chicken breasts and turn after a couple of minutes. Continue to cook for another couple of minutes. Add the vinegar, mustard and pine nuts and turn off the heat. Cool for 30 minutes. Serve in a large bowl with the baby leaves. Drizzle with extra virgin olive oil.

Preheat oven to 375 degrees. Grease a 9×13 inch baking pan. In a medium bowl whisk together milk, eggs and ham. Pour into baking pan. Sprinkle with cheddar cheese. Sprinkle with half of the chiles and half of the green onions. Bake 25 minutes. Uncover and sprinkle with remaining chiles and green onions. Bake an additional 5 minutes. Serve with sour cream.

Cook bacon and remove from pan. Cook onion in remaining fat until tender. Add grits and milk, stirring until blended. Simmer for 45 minutes stirring occasionally. Add tomatoes, bacon pieces and salt to taste. Simmer 15 more minutes until thickened.

In 2 quart saucepan heat tomato sauce over medium heat. Add lemon juice, brown sugar, vinegar and dijon mustard. Cook for 10 minutes stirring occasionally. Add ground pepper, red pepper and garlic powder. Cook another 5 minutes stirring occasionally. Remove from heat. Serve warm or cold over ribs or chicken.

Roll out pastry. Cut into 6 inch rounds. Lay pastry rounds on a baking sheet. Blend fruit, walnuts and brown sugar. Place on half of pastry rounds. Brush with beaten egg. Sprinkle with icing sugar. Bake for 20 minutes at 400f. Remove from oven. Spread fruit mixture on tart. Dot with glace cherries and drizzle with lemon juice. Bake for 5 minutes more. Let cool on racks.

Preheat oven to 400 degrees F (200 degrees C).Wash and scrub the potatoes. Cut them into 1/4 inch thick slices. Sprinkle with thyme, cumin powder, ground sumac and salt. Coat the slices with a light coating of flour and cooking spray. Place in a single layer in a baking dish. Bake for 25 minutes.Melt the butter in a saucepan over medium heat. Stir in the flour until smooth and bubbly, about 2 minutes. Add the milk, thyme and cumin powder, stirring constantly until thickened, about 5 minutes. Serve over the baked slices. Makes 4 servings.

Cook hamburger and onion in skillet with 1/4 cup water and seasoning mix until done. Drain and add 1/3 cup water. Stir in tomato paste and let simmer for a few minutes. Pour into a 2 1/2 quart casserole dish. Top with 1/2 cup shredded cheese and a sprinkling of taco chips. Bake at 350 degrees F for 20 minutes or until cheese is melted. Serve with more chips and salsa.
Add flour to 1/4 cup water. Heat to boiling. Add salt & pepper. Cook until thick. Add tomatoes, onion & peppers. Cook until thick. Add minced garlic. Cook 2-3 more minutes. Serve over rice.

Steep rhubarb in boiling water for 30 minutes or until very tender. Strain and chill. Squeeze out excess moisture from the rhubarb. Set aside. Beat evaporated milk until it forms peaks. Add gelatin and beat until smooth. Add rhubarb and stir until combined. Refrigerate until set. Serve chilled with additional milk or cream on top.

Prepare pasta according to package directions. Set aside. Melt butter in large skillet over medium heat. Whisk in flour and cook 2 to 3 minutes until lightly browned. Whisk in soup. Cook and stir over medium-high heat until thickened. Add milk and stir until smooth. Remove from heat and stir in cheddar cheese and paprika. Fold pasta into mixture. Place in a 9 x 13 inch baking dish. Bake uncovered at 350 degrees fahrenheit for 30 to 40 minutes or until lightly browned. Serve hot.

Mix yogurt, cucumber, mint leaves and 2 tablespoons sugar in large bowl. Sprinkle with salt and cumin. Refrigerate until serving. Season to taste with additional sugar and/or cayenne. Serve with crackers.

Heat oil in 3 1/2 quart casserole dish. Brown chicken in oil about 2 minutes per side, then cover dish with water. Add milk and mustardbring to boiling point. Add soup mix and cook, uncovered, 20 minutes or until chicken is tender. Meanwhile cook rice according to package directions. Add frozen broccoli and cook uncovered 2 minutes. Remove chicken from liquid with slotted spoonset aside. Add pepper and cook 2 more minutes. Remove from heat. In casserole dish combine rice, soup mixture, broccoli and cheddar cheesetop with chicken. Bake uncovered 15 minutes or until cheese is melted.

Rinse fish, pat dry with paper towels. Season fish with salt and pepper to taste. In a large skillet heat 4 tsp of the oil over medium high heat. Add fish and onion. Cook 1 minute, turning once. Top fish with tomatoes, olives and thyme. Reduce heat. Cover and cook 2 minutes. Drizzle with remaining 4tsp oil, sprinkle with basil. Cover and cook 2-3 minutes more or until fish flakes easily with a fork.

Combine yogurt, mustard and ginger. Dip the chicken in the mixture and let stand for 10 minutes. Remove and place on a baking sheet. Bake in a preheated 350 degree oven for 45 minutes. Melt 2 tablespoons butter and 2 tablespoons lemon juice in a small saucepan. Serve over the top of the baked chicken.

Heat a large skillet over medium-high heat. When the skillet is hot add olive oil. Toss in the Spanish onions and cook until they begin to turn golden brown about 3 to 5 minutes. Lower the heat to medium-low and add thyme leaves and cook until they begin to turn golden brown about 3 to 5 minutes. Lower the heat to medium-low and add the sliced sweet potatoes to the pan in a single layer. Cook until they begin to turn golden brown about 3 to 5 minutes. Sprinkle the sweet potato slices with the butter and a generous sprinkling of the fresh ground pepper. Cook the sweet potatoes until they are tender about 5 to 6 minutes stirring the potatoes occasionally so they cook evenly. Meanwhile in a small bowl whisk together the sour cream, salt and fresh ground pepper to taste. Spoon the sour cream over the top of the cooked sweet potatoes and serve at once.

Combine cream cheese, milk, mayonnaise and onion in a bowl. Beat until smooth. Add horseradish, red pepper sauce and worcestershire saucemix well. Add tunamix well. Season with paprika. Serve with crackers or veggies.

Heat oven to 350 degrees. Grease an 8 x 12 inch pan. In large bowl mix together all the ingredients until well blended. Spread evenly on the bottom of the pan. Bake for 25-30 minutes or until golden brown. Let cool for 15 minutes before serving.

Slice the english muffins so there are two halves for each. Lightly toast the halves. Cook the bacon until crisp and brown. Warm the canadian bacon. Warm the hollandaise sauce. Cook the eggs so the yolks are runny. Season the eggs with salt and pepper. To assemble the dish, place the bread halves on two plates. Lay the crisp cooked bacon slices over the halves of the bread. Place the warm canadian bacon over the bacon. Top with the runny egg. Sprinkle with black pepper and cayenne pepper. Spoon the warm hollandaise sauce over the top of the egg and garnish with chives. Serve with fresh fruit and hot tea or coffee.

Place oil in a large skillet over med-high heat. Add butter. Once butter is melted, add sage leaves and garlic and saut 1 minute or until sage leaves begin to brown. Add chicken. Saute 3 minutes per side or until chicken is lightly browned. Reduce heat to med-low, add potato and cook for 5 minutes or until potato begins to brown. Add broth, cover skillet with lid and cook 10 minutes or until chicken is done. Remove chicken from pan and place on plate to rest for 5 minutes. Remove lid from pan. Add parsley to skillet. Stir in chicken broth mixture with chicken and potato in skillet. Stir 2 minutes or until mixture is heated through. Serve chicken with sauce over top.

In large skillet, melt butter over med heat. Stir in flour. Gradually stir in milk and cook over low heat until thick and smooth (do not boil). Add salt, pepper and paprika. Stir in bouillon granules. Spoon over cooked potatoes in casserole dish. Cover with foil and bake at 350 for 30 minutes. Sprinkle with velveeta and bake 10 more minutes. Makes 6 servings.
Saute onion in butter. Add flour, salt and pepper. Mix in sugar and sour cream. Blend well. Add beans and cheese. Pour into 9x13 baking dish. Top with cornflakes. Bake at 400 degrees for 20 minutes.

Slice bread. Spread hot pepper jelly on one side. Place ham and turkey on 2 of 4 slices. On remaining 2 slices top with eggs. Cover sandwiches with remaining slices of bread. Heat a large nonstick skillet over medium heat. Melt butter in skillet. Cook sandwiches in skillet until golden brown on each side. Spread hot sauce on one side of each sandwich. Cover with monterey jack pepper cheese and serve.

Boil the chicken breasts and remove skin. Cool and then shred. Add to bowl with celery, bell peppers and dill weed. Add ranch dressing mix and mayonnaise. Mix until well combined. Add salt and pepper. Chill. Serve.

Mix together the sausage, scallions, garlic and egg until smooth. Stuff the mixture into the caps of the mushrooms. Dip both sides of the caps into the soy sauce, then roll into the crumbs until well coated. Bake at 350 degrees until crumbs are browned and the caps are tender when pierced with a fork.

In a sauce pan combine sugar and water. Bring to boil on medium high heat. Boil for 3 minutes then remove from heat. Stir in peanut butter until smooth. Divide ice cream between two glasses. Add hot peanut sauce slowly. Top with salted peanuts.

Preheat oven to 350 degrees F (175 degrees C). Grease a 2-quart casserole dish. In a large bowl, combine the mashed sweet potato,. Mix in the sugar,. Add the evaporated milk,. Beat the eggs in a separate bowl, then stir them into the mixture. In a separate bowl,. Add the butter,. Add the vanilla extract,. Add the coconut,. Stir in the flour,. Stir in the nuts,. Pour into the prepared casserole dish. Bake in the preheated. Oven for 45 minutes,. Serves 10.

Bring 4 cups of water to boil. Add couscous to boiling water. Stir well. Remove from heat and cover. Let stand for 5 minutes. Fluff with a fork. Add 1/2 cup of milk, 1/2 cup of the fruit, 2 tablespoons of nuts, 2 tablespoons of honey, 1/2 teaspoon of vanilla extract, and 1/4 teaspoon of ground cinnamon. Mix well. Add more milk if needed to moisten. If desired, garnish each serving with 1 tablespoon of heavy cream and sprinkle with additional nuts. Serve immediately. Makes 4 servings.
Cook pastina according to package directions. Strain. Add milk, eggs and cheese. Season to taste. Serve hot or cold.
Cut potatoes into thin slices. Brush with oil and grill for about 5 minutes. Mix together all the sauce ingredients. When the steak is cooked, add a good splash of sauce and serve with the potatoes.

Preheat oven to 350 degrees F (175 degrees C).Line 2 baking sheets with foil, letting the foil extend beyond the edge of the pan.Place the rolls on the baking sheets.Bake for 5 minutes in the preheated oven.Remove from the oven.Spread the cream cheese mixture on the top half of the rolls.Top each roll with the ham, gruyere, and parmesan cheese.Place in the oven and bake for 5 minutes, or until the cheese is melted.Remove the rolls from the oven.Place the rolls on the foil to cool for 5 minutes.Melt the butter in a large skillet over medium heat.Add the onion flakes to the pan along with the Worcestershire sauce, salt, and pepper.Cook until the onions are translucent, about 5 minutes.Place the rolls onto the serving plates and top with the onion mixture.

Preheat oven to 425° F. Separate the dough into 4 biscuits. Bake for 10 minutes. When biscuits are golden brown, remove from oven. Cook vegetables in olive oil. Drain off excess liquid. Spread pasta sauce over biscuits. Top with vegetables and cheeses. Bake 10 minutes longer or until cheese is golden. Let stand 5 minutes. Cut biscuits into wedges. Sprinkle with chopped parmesan cheese. Serve with pepperoni.
Brown meat and onions. Drain. Season with garlic salt. Add water and peppers. Cover and simmer. Serve over cooked rice.

Preheat oven to 350 degrees F. Grease and flour a 10-cup bundt pan. Combine cake mix, pudding mix and eggs in large bowl. Mix until blended. Add oil and water. Stir until well mixed. Pour half of the batter into the pan. Sprinkle with the cocoa. Add the rest of the batter. Bake for 60 minutes. Remove from the oven and let cool for a few minutes. Stir together the strong black coffee and the liqueur. Drizzle over the top of the cooled cake. Dust with the powdered sugar. Serve with ice cream.

Rinse pink beans. Put in large soup pot or dutch oven. Cover with water. Bring to boil. Add onion, garlic cloves, ham hock. Bring to boil. Turn burner to low. Let simmer for at least an hour. Add water if necessary. Add more salt and pepper to taste. Makes enough for 10-12 people.
Halve the avocados lengthwise. Scoop out the pulp into a bowl. Mash the pulp with a fork. Add the remaining ingredients. Mash until chunky but smooth. Chill. Serve with tortilla chips.

Preheat oven to 350f. In large bowl, combine flour, baking soda and salt. In small bowl, mash bananas. Combine flour mixture with bananas, margarine and eggs. Stir in sugar, vanilla and nutmeg. Spread into greased 15 x 10 inch jellyroll pan. Bake for 25 minutes. Sprinkle with chocolate chips and return to oven for 5 minutes. Cool. Cut in 1. 5 inch squares.

Preheat oven to 350f. Roll dough out on a floured surface. Cut into 3-inch squares. Fill squares with the following mixture: 1/4 cup miracle whip, 1 teaspoon lemon juice, 1/4 teaspoon pepper, 1/4 cup sharp cheddar cheese, 1/3 cup imitation crab meat, 1/3 cup chopped green onion, 1/3 cup chopped parsley. Place on greased baking sheet. Bake at 350f for 10-12 minutes or until golden brown. Serve warm. Makes 3 dozen squares.

Mix together the panko crumbs, parmesan cheese and garlic powder. Melt the butter in a large skillet over medium heat. Dip the fish in the flour. Then dip the fish in the egg mixture. Then dip the fish in the panko crumbs. Put the fish in the skillet and cook for about 3 minutes per side. Sprinkle with salt and pepper. Serve with lemon wedges.

Combine brown sugar and flour in a medium bowl. Add eggs, salt and stir with a whisk until well blended. Combine milk and vanilla in a small bowl. Gradually add milk mixture to the egg mixture stirring constantly until well mixed. Pour mixture into 3-quart baking dish coated with cooking spray. Bake at 350 F for 40 minutes or until knife inserted near center comes out clean. Cool for 15 minutes. Serve warm or cold with or without ice cream.

Bring water for pasta to a rolling boil. Add a generous amount of salt to water. Cook pasta according to directions on package. Heat olive oil over medium high heat in a large skillet. Add garlic, stirring until just lightly browned. Remove from heat add parsley and red peppers, if using. Drain the spaghetti in a colander over the hot skillet. Toss pasta with garlic sauce. Serve immediately.

Pre-heat oven to 400. Place the chicken in a shallow glass baking dish. Sprinkle both sides of the chicken with the salt and freshly cracked black pepper. Layer rosemary and orange marmalade over the chicken. Drizzle with the sherry wine vinegar and olive oil. Bake for 30 minutes. Turn the chicken over and bake for an additional 30 minutes. Remove from the oven and let the chicken rest for 5 minutes before serving.

Boil the potatoes until tender. Remove from heat and mash. Add the watercress, peas, corn and the rest of the vegetables to the mashed potatoes. Add the butter and season with salt and pepper to taste. Serve hot.
Place mashed potatoes in microwave safe bowl. Add remaining ingrediants and stir. Microwave for 2 minutes on high. Stir and heat an additional 2 minutes. Add baby spinach and stir.

Preheat oven to 350 degrees. Lightly grease a 13-inch by 9-inch pan. In a large bowl beat together the mayonnaise, eggs and sugar until fluffy and well blended. Stir in the dry Jiffy mix until well combined. Spread half the mixture in the pan and sprinkle with half the chocolate chips and half the nuts. Spread the rest of the mixture over the top. Sprinkle with the remaining chocolate chips and nuts. Bake until golden brown, about 30 minutes. Cool completely in the pan before cutting into squares. Makes about 2 dozen squares.

Heat olive oil in a 6-quart stockpot over medium-high heat. Add onion and carrot and saute until the vegetables are soft and lightly browned. Add the garlic and saute for 1 minute. Add the split peas and continue to saute for 2 minutes. Add the dried marjoram. Stir in the water and bring to a boil. Reduce the heat to medium and simmer for 25 minutes. Add the turkey ham and simmer for 2 minutes longer. Season the soup with salt and fresh ground pepper. Makes 6 servings.

Season beef with salt and pepper. Form into four patties. Grill or fry to your taste. Toast buns. Spread with butter. Place fries in the center of the bottom bun. Top with gravy. Place burger on the gravy covered fries. Top with cheese. Enjoy.

Prepare the slow cooker with the water and then add the lemon juice and the ginger and clove to the water. Cut the peaches and add them to the water. Cook on high for 3 hours, and then turn down to low and cook for 1 hour longer. Cool before putting into jars and storing them in the refrigerator.

Preheat oven to 325 degrees F (165 degrees C). Grease and lightly flour 10 inch tube pan. Sift together flour, sugar, and salt in a large bowlmix well. Beat together eggs, Crisco, and vanilla in a separate bowlstir in flour mixture and milk until smooth. Pour into prepared pan. Bake in the preheated oven until toothpick inserted in the center comes out clean, 1 1/2 to 1 3/4 hours. Let cool in the pan on a wire rack for 10 minutesinvert onto a wire rack to cool completely. Slice and serve, or wrap in plastic wrapstore in the refrigerator.

In a large bowl, toss together the spinach, strawberries and kiwi. In a small bowl, combine the red onion rings and poppy seeds. Add to the spinach mixture. In another small bowl, whisk together the olive oil and lemon juice. Pour over the spinach mixture and toss to coat. Arrange the mixture on a serving platter. Slice the chicken breasts and arrange over the top. Garnish with the almonds and feta cheese. Serve immediately.

Combine first 4 ingredients in a bowl until crumbly and set aside. Season tenderloin with salt and black pepper. Dip in crumb mixture, coating all sides. Brown tenderloin in a hot skillet for about 3 minutes per side or until cooked through.

Brown brats in a small amount of oil until they are well browned and the fat has rendered. Add onions and saute until translucent. Add the paprika and caraway seed. Add the peppers and water. Bring to a boil. Reduce to a simmer and cover. Cook about 10-15 minutes or until the water has evaporated and the peppers are tender. Remove from heat and serve.

In a skillet over medium heat, saute chicken breasts with olive oil until no longer pink. Remove from heat and cool slightly. Cut into bite size pieces. Heat the oil again over medium heat. Add the onions and cook until soft, about 5 minutes. Add the carrots and cook for 1 minute. Add the broth and cauliflower florets and cook until the carrots are tender, about 10 minutes. Add the pasta and cook for about 5 minutes. Stir in the herbs and season to taste with salt and pepper. Garnish with parmesan cheese.

Heat the oil in a large saucepan over medium heat. Add cumin seeds and when they begin to pop add the garlic, onions and salt. Cook until the mixture is fragrant. Add the green lentils, water and cayenne to the saucepan. Cover with a lid and cook for 10 minutes. Reduce the heat to medium low and cook uncovered for 35 minutes or until the green lentils are very tender.

Cook pasta according to package directions. Drain and set aside. In a bowl, combine ham, celery and onion. In a small bowl, whisk together mayonnaise, lime juice and honey. Combine with pasta and ham mixture. Stir in cilantro. Stir in honeydew. Chill before serving. Serve on bed of lettuce.

Lay chicken breasts in a 9x13 inch baking dish. Sprinkle with half the seasoning. Arrange ham and spinach evenly over the top. Top with the remaining bread crumbs and seasoning. Drizzle with olive oil. Bake for 30 minutes, turning once. Sprinkle with parsley and serve.

Cut chicken into 4 pieces. Dust with flour and season with salt and pepper. Heat the olive oil in a large nonstick skillet over medium-high heat. Brown the pieces of chicken, turning once. Add the fresh thyme and the sherry. Simmer over low heat for 10-15 minutes or until chicken is done. Garnish with olives.

Bring a large pot of water to boiling. Cook gnocchi until tender. Meanwhile, in a large skillet over moderately low heat, combine gnocchi, garlic, cheese and basil. Toss until well coated. Add prosciutto. Toss until heated through. Add more black pepper to taste. Serves 4.

Preheat oven to 375f. In a large skillet, brown pork chops on both sides in hot oil. Place in a baking dish. Combine the rest of the ingredients in a bowl and pour evenly over the chops. Bake uncovered for 30 minutes or until done (pork chops should be cooked to 160f). Serve with rice or noodles.

In a large skillet heat 1 teaspoon canola oil over medium-high heat. Add garlic and cook for 1 minute. Add snow peas and cook for 2 minutes. Add cooked brown rice and cook for 2 minutes more. Stir in cilantro.

In saucepan, mix 1/4 cup sugar, butter and 1/4 cup milk. Cook and stir over medium heat until mixture boils. Add 1/4 cup flour and cook until thickened. Add remaining milk. Heat to a boil. Add 1/2 cup sugar, 1/4 cup milk and 1/4 cup flour. Stir until thickened. Add 1/4 cup milk. Cook and stir until thickened. Add 1/4 cup milk. Cook and stir until thickened. Add 1/2 cup milk. Cook and stir until thickened. Remove from heat. Add 1 tsp. unsweetened cocoa and 1 tsp. vanilla. Pour over biscuits.

In a large saucepan, combine the sugar, water, cinnamon, and vanilla extractstir until dissolved. Stir in the soymilk and soy yogurt. Pour into 4 frost-free dessert cups or a shallow 13 x 9-inch baking dish. Freeze for 4 hours or until solidly frozen but not entirely frozen. With a fork, scrape the frozen dessert into small pieces (about 1/2 inch) and freeze for another hour or so or until ready to serve. Sprinkle with almonds just before serving. If desired, garnish with mint sprigs. Serves 4.

Preheat oven to 425 degrees f. Combine dry ingredients in a large bowlmake a well in center and add all remaining ingredientsmix well and pour into a greased 8-inch square baking dishbake uncovered for 20-25 minutes or until golden browncool in pan on a rack for 5 minutes before servingcut into 9 pieces.

Combine the dry ingredients in a large bowl. In a smaller bowl, combine the applesauce, granulated sugar, egg whites, vanilla extract, mashed bananas, and cinnamon. Mix until blended and then add to the dry ingredients. Stir until just combined. Turn into a greased 8 inch square pan or two loaf pans. Bake at 350 for 35 to 45 minutes. Cool on a wire rack.

Heat oven to 375 degrees F. Combine flour, cocoa powder and saltset aside. Melt baking chocolate with butter over low heatstir in egg yolks, one at a timestir in vanilla. Gradually add 3 cups flour mixture, stirring until smooth. Beat egg whites until stifffold in 1/3 of whites to batterfold in remaining whites. Spoon batter by teaspoonfuls onto greased cookie sheetsbake 10-12 minutes or until puffed and set. Cool on sheets 1 minuteremove to wire racks to cool completely.

Mix the dried italian seasoning with the salt and pepper in a plastic bag. Place the potatoes in the bag. Add the boneless pork chops. Close the bag tightly. Massage the seasonings into the potatoes and pork chops. Place the bag in the crockpot. Add the apples, sauerkraut, kielbasa, and the sweet white wine. Cook on low 8-9 hours or until the meat is tender. About halfway through cooking time add the frozen peas.

Combine softened cream cheese and vanilla in a bowl and beat until smooth. Add powdered sugar and mix until well combined. Add chocolate chips and mix well. Shape into a ball and roll in chopped pecans. Serve with graham cracker sticks.

Cook potatoes in microwave until done, mash together with filling mixture until well combined. Place in a baking dish sprayed with cooking spray. Bake at 350 degrees for 25 minutes, sprinkle with nuts and bake 5 more minutes until nuts are golden. Cool completely before serving. Serve with cinnamon whipped cream if desired.

Heat olive oil in skillet. Add garlic and saute until golden brown. Remove garlic and set aside. Add sherry vinegar to skillet and heat until slightly thickened. Add salt and pepper to taste. Stir in garlic and heat through. Stir in onions, jalapeno peppers, and cilantro. Cool slightly and serve at room temperature. Serve with tortilla chips or as a condiment for grilled meat.

Boil the kernels in a large pot of water. Remove from heat and add the shallots and the fish sauce. Cool to room temperature. Combine the cornflour with a little water to make a smooth paste. Add this to the corn and stir well. Add the red pepper flakes. Heat a little oil in a saucepan. Shape the corn mixture into balls and drop into the hot oil. Cook until golden brown. Drain and keep warm. Serve hot with a dipping sauce of your choice.

Brown ground turkey in olive oil. Add garlic, cook for 1 minute. Add spaghetti sauce, sweet corn, onion and italian seasoning. Bring to boil. Add elbow macaroni to sauce and return to boil. Reduce heat to low and simmer until macaroni is cooked through.

Bring water to a boil in large saucepan. Remove from heatadd tea bags. Let steep 5 minutesremove tea bags. Stir in cranberry juice. Heat over low heat until mixture is warm. Stir in apple cider, brown sugar, cinnamon stick, ginger, cloves, and cinnamon sticks. Serve in cups topped with orange slices.

Preheat the oven to 425 degrees F (220 degrees C). Place the sweet potatoes on a large baking sheet. Drizzle the vegetable oil over them. Sprinkle with the pineapple. Season with salt. Bake for 45 minutes in the preheated oven. Combine the pecans, maple syrup, marmalade, lemon juice, and mustard in a small bowl. Mix well. Drizzle over the potatoes. Serve warm.

In a large saucepan or Dutch oven, heat the oil over moderately high heat. Add the onion and cook until it is soft and lightly browned, about 6 minutes. Add the carrot and cook for 2 minutes. Add the celery and cook for 4 minutes. Add the chicken broth and bring to a boil. Add the rice and cook uncovered for about 20 minutes or until the rice is tender. Season the soup to taste with salt and pepper. Add the chicken and cook until heated through. Serve hot.

Mix honey, soy sauce, vinegar and water in a small bowl and set aside. Rub the pork chops with the ginger and garlic and sprinkle them with the salt and pepper. Place the pork chops on the grill and cook over medium heat until the chops are browned and the juices run clear. Brush the barbecue sauce on both sides of the chops. Cook the chops until the meat is no longer pink. Sprinkle the cilantro on top of the chops and serve.
Dissolve gelatin in hot water. Add sour cream, mix well. Stir in fruit and nuts. Fold in whipped topping. Chill until firm. Cut in cubes. Garnish with celery and carrot curls.

Mix all dry ingredients together. Add garlic and chilis. Stir in cream. Roll out on lightly floured surface. Cut with biscuit cutter. Bake at 425 for 15 minutes. Dust with cayenne. Serve with salsa. Makes 12.

Preheat oven to 400 degrees F. Wash the beets. Remove the greens and rub off the skins of the beets with a paper towel. Cut the onions into thin slices. In a roasting pan, layer the onions and the beets with the butter on top. Bake for 40 minutes or until the onions are tender and the beets are done. In a saucepan, bring the balsamic vinegar to a boil. Stir in the onions and beets. Cover and cook for 10 minutes or until the beets are soft. Sprinkle with the sugar and season with the salt and pepper. Serve hot or cold.

Sautee onion and bell peppers over medium heat for 5 minutes or until tender. Add vegetable broth and bring to a boil. Add lentils and cook for about 15 minutes until tender. Add remaining ingredients and bring to a boil for 2-3 minutes. Reduce heat to low and allow to simmer for 5 minutes. Serve with crackers or toasted bread slices.

Cut the butter into small cubes and heat in a small saucepan. Add the onions and garlic and saute until translucent. Add the bay leaf, black peppercorns, cloves and salt. Simmer over low heat for about 15 minutes or until the liquid evaporates. Remove the bay leaf. Preheat the oven to 400 degrees. Roll out the puff pastry and place in a greased and floured 9-inch springform pan. Sprinkle the cheese over the pastry and top with the thyme. Spoon the onion mixture over the cheese. Brush the edges of the pastry with the egg and fold over to form the crust. Crimp the edges with your fingers to seal and sprinkle with flaky sea salt. Brush the top with the egg wash. Bake for 20 minutes or until the crust is golden brown. Serve hot.

Prepare stuffing as directed on package. Set aside. Mix chicken, soup and water in a large mixing bowl. Add sour cream and cheese and stir well. Spread half the mixture in a greased 13x9-inch baking pan. Cover with stuffing. Spread remaining mixture over the stuffing. Top with vegetables. Bake for 20 minutes or until thoroughly heated.

Mix together the first seven ingredients in a bowl. Set aside. Bring a large pot of water to boiling over high heat. Add the soba and cook for 4-6 minutes or until tender but still firm to the bite. Rinse under running cold water until well chilled. Add the green onions to the dressing mixture. Pour over the cooked pasta. Toss until evenly coated. Add salt to taste. Garnish with sesame seeds if desired. Serve chilled or at room temperature.
In a bowl, mix together cottage cheese, cucumber, dill, green onion, Tabasco sauce and pepper. Refrigerate. Serve cold.

In a large bowl mix butter, applesauce, sugar until smooth. Blend in eggs and vanilla until smooth. Fold in applesauce, bananas and chocolate chips. In a small bowl stir together the flour, baking soda and oats. Stir into applesauce mixture until blended. Drop by teaspoon onto a nonstick baking sheet. Bake for 12 minutes or until golden brown.

Preheat oven to 375 degrees F (190 degrees C). Heat olive oil in a skillet over medium-high heatsaute onions until soft. Sprinkle with garlic and parsleystir 1 minute more. Stir in tomato saucecook 2 minutes. Season with salt and pepper. Spread sauce in a shallow 1 1/2-quart casserole dish. Place fish in the sauce. Dot the fish with buttersprinkle with bread crumbs. Bake for 15 minutes in the preheated oven, or until the fish is opaque and flakes easily when tested with a fork.

In 12-inch skillet over medium-low heat, cook broccoli in 2 tablespoons water until crisp-tender, about 4-5 minutes. Meanwhile, cook pasta in large pot of boiling water until al dente. Drain and return to pot. Stir in 2 tablespoons milkcook over medium heat until hot. Stir in broccoli, 3/4 cup milk, flour, salt, pepper and mustardcook 1 minute or until thickened. Stir in 1/2 cup cheese until melted. Stir in remaining milkcook until heated through. Divide pasta mixture among 4 bowlstop with remaining 1/2 cup cheese.

Saute garlic and onion until fragrant. Add shrimp and fish sauce and stir until shrimp turns white. Add jasmine rice and sugar and stir until rice is heated through. Add pineapple and stir until heated through. Garnish with chopped green onions.

Marinade chicken in hot pepper sauce, vinegar and ranch dressing mix overnight. Preheat oven to 400f. Remove chicken from marinade and place in a baking dish. Bake 25-30 minutes basting frequently with melted butter. Serve warm.

In a 9x13 glass baking dish combine pretzels and white sugar. Melt margarine and combine with cream cheese. Mix well. Spread over pretzels. Dissolve jello in boiling water. Stir in frozen raspberries. Spread over pretzels. Refrigerate until firm. Top with cool whip. Sprinkle with pretzels.

In a large bowl combine the jello and boiling water and stir until completely dissolved. Add the raspberries and stir until mixed. Stir in the cranberry sauce and lemon juice. Chill until firm. Serves 6.

Preheat oven to 350 F. Cook pasta al dente in a large pot of boiling salted water until tender but firm to bitedrain and rinse with cold water. Heat oil in a large skillet over medium heat until hot. Add onion and cook until lightly brownedstir in beef. Cook, stirring occasionally, until no longer pink. Stir in spinachcook until just wilted. Remove from heatstir in mozzarella, ricotta and parmesanseason with salt and pepper. Spoon ravioli mixture into an 11x7-inch baking dish coated with cooking sprayspread evenly. Top with remaining cheesescover with foil. Bake for 20 minutesremove foilbake 5 minutes more. Sprinkle with parsley.

Drain tuna, reserving liquid for sauce. Combine with cream cheese. Spread mixture between pita bread slices. Top with vegetables of your choice. Sprinkle with cheddar cheese. Broil 3 minutes or until cheese melts. Serve with sauce.

Soak the dried bonito flakes and kombu in water for 30 minutes. Strain and discard kombu. Place bonito flakes and water in a small pot and bring to boil. Cook until reduced by half. Remove from heat and let cool. In a bowl combine sesame seeds and dressing ingredients and blend well. Mix together the dressing and cooked bonito flakes and pour over the spinach and toss until well coated.

In large skillet brown and crumble meat, onion and garlic. Add carrot and cook for 3 minutes. Stir in the egg and combine. Add the seasoned bread crumbs and the worcestershire sauce. Stir until combined. Let cool for 5 minutes. Press into greased 9 inch pie pan. Bake for 15 minutes. While crust is baking fry the hash browns. Combine hash browns and the cheese in a bowl. Spread evenly over the crust. Bake 10-15 minutes or until the crust is golden brown. Cool for 10 minutes before cutting into 4 wedges.

Beat egg yolks with sugar until light and thick. Beat in vanilla and lemon rind. Stir in the nuts. Drop by spoonfuls on a baking sheet. Bake at 375 degrees for 10 minutes until set but still soft inside. Cool on wire rack. Yields 1 dozen 2 1/2 inch cookies.

Place bread slices in bowl. Cover with half-and-half. Let soak 5 minutes or until softened. Drain excess liquid from bread, reserving liquid. Place bread in food processor or blenderprocess until fine crumbs are formed. Combine ground turkey, egg, salt, and fresh ground black pepper in medium bowl until well blended. Shape mixture into 24 (1-inch-thick) oval cutlets (about 1/2 cup mixture each). Combine 1/2 cup of crumbs with dried dill. Coat cutlets evenly with crumb mixturepress crumbs firmly against cutlets. Heat oil and 1 tablespoon butter in heavy large skillet over medium-high heatsaut turkey cutlets until golden brown on both sides. Drain cutlets on paper towelsset aside. Reserve skillet. Melt remaining tablespoon butter in same skillet over medium-high heatwhisk in flour. Whisk constantly until mixture is light golden brown and slightly thickened, about 2 minutes. Gradually whisk in reserved bread liquid and next 2 cups

Mix mayonnaise, honey and vinegar in small bowl. Stir in poppy seeds. Divide dressing evenly between 4 bread slices. Spread 2 bread slices evenly with dressing. Top each with 1/4 of chicken mixture. Top each with 1/4 of dried cranberries. Top each with 1/4 of Fuji apple slices. Top each with remaining 2 bread slices.

Cream together butter, powdered sugar and vanilla. Roll into balls about 1" in diameter. Place in refrigerator for 1 hour. Roll into balls again and put in freezer for 1 hour. Roll into balls again and place in wax paper covered container.

In a large skillet over medium heat, combine 2 tablespoons butter, the onions and garlic. Saute for 15 minutes or until the onions are golden. Stir in the brown sugar. Add the beef stock. Simmer for 5 minutes. Add the steak. Season with salt and pepper. Cook for 2 minutes per side for rare to medium. Serve with the pan juices over the beef. Garnish with fresh parsley.

In a large bowl, combine bread cubes with meat and eggs and mix well with your hands. Add garlic and spices and mix well. Form meat mixture into small balls about 1-inch wide. Place in a greased casserole dish or heavy saucepan and cover with tomato paste and tomato sauce. Bake at 350 degrees for 1-hour, uncovering after 1/2-hour to brown sauce. Serve over spaghetti with grated cheese.

In a small bowl, combine the honey, eggs, sugar, milk, vanilla, salt and pepper. In a frying pan melt a tbsp of butter over medium heat. Soak one side of each slice of bread into the egg mixture. Add slices to the frying pan and cook until browned on both sides. Remove from pan and place on plate. Add a slice of brie cheese to each slice of bread. Serve hot.

Preheat oven to 450 degrees F. Divide pie crust in half. Roll each half into a 11 inch circle on a lightly floured surface. Place one half of dough on an ungreased baking sheet. Spread with butter. Arrange mushrooms and onions on top of crust. Sprinkle with 1/3 of cheese. Cut spinach into 1-inch pieces, then spread on top of onions. Sprinkle remaining cheese over all. Roll up dough on long side to enclose filling in a long roll. Cut roll into 1-inch slices. Arrange slices, cut-side down, on mushroom and onion layer. Bake for 20 minutes or until crust is golden brown.

Combine first 4 ingredients in a bowl. Cover. Let stand until mixture is cool. In blender or food processor, process mixture until smooth. Add beer. Process until smooth. Store at room temperature. Makes about 1 cup. Yield: 3 cups.

Preheat oven to 350 degrees F. Line muffin pan with paper or foil liners. In small bowl, combine applesauce, egg whites and vanilla until well blended. Beat with electric mixer on medium speed until smooth. Stir in brownie mix until well blended. Spoon about 1/4 cup batter into each cupcake liner. Place about 1 teaspoon topping onto each muffin. Bake for 10 to 12 minutes or until toothpick inserted near center comes out clean. Cool completely. Meanwhile, melt chocolate chips in microwave or double boiler. Dip top of each cupcake in chocolatesprinkle with candy corn. Refrigerate until chocolate sets. Store in refrigerator. Makes 16 muffins.

Sift all dry ingredients into a bowl. Mix with a whisk or fork until smooth. Add the egg and mix in. Add the butter and milk and mix in with a spoon or fork until smooth and evenly mixed. Spoon into a greased sponge tin and bake in a moderate oven for 30-40 minutes until well risen and golden brown. Turn onto a rack to cool before cutting into slices.

Preheat oven to 350 degrees F. Grease a 9X13-inch pan. Combine eggs, sugar and oil. Beat on high speed for 10 minutes or until mixture is thick and pale in color. Add flour and salt. Beat for 2 minutes on medium speed. Add vanilla. Pour batter into pan. Bake for 40 to 45 minutes or until done. Cool for 5 minutes. Invert onto serving plate. Spread with frosting. Top with coconut. Sprinkle with oranges.

Heat oil in a large saucepan over medium heat. Add onions and cook until translucent, stirring frequently. Add garlic and continue to saute 1 minute. Add potatoes and cauliflower. Add chicken broth and water. Bring to a boil. Cover and simmer until potatoes are fork tender, about 15 minutes. Carefully puree in a blender in batches. Return to heat. Adjust seasoning with salt and pepper. Stir in chives. Garnish with chives.

Cook the onion in butter until tender. Add celery ribs and carrot, cooking until tender. Add the broth, corn and diced tomato. Bring to a boil and then add the cooked chicken and season with salt and pepper. Simmer until heated through. Makes 6 servings.

In a small bowl, combine soy sauce, rice wine and brown sugar, stirring well. Heat oil in a wok or large skillet over medium-high heat until hot. Add gingerroot and garlic and stir-fry until crisp-tender. Add beef, stirring frequently until browned. Add soy sauce mixture to beef mixturestir until sauce thickens and beef is tender. Stir-fry snow peas until crisp-tenderadd to beef mixture and toss lightly. Serve at once over rice.

Saute onions in butter until translucent. Add curry powder and aroma seasoning. Add chicken broth. Simmer for 5 minutes. Add cooked chicken and long grain rice. Simmer until rice is heated through. Sprinkle with corn flake crumbs.

Brown ground beef with onion and drain fat. Add spaghetti sauce and tomato sauce. Mix well. Cook pasta according to package directions and drain. Add to meat mixture. Spoon into a greased 13 inch x 9 inch baking dish. Top with pepperoni slices, then mozzarella cheese. Bake in preheated oven at 350 degrees for 30 minutes. Serve warm.

Cut chicken breasts into 1/2-inch cubes. Heat olive oil in large skillet over medium heat. Cook chicken until just browned. Add eggplant to skillet. Cook until just tender. Remove from skillet. Heat marinara sauce in skillet. Add chicken and eggplant back to skillet. Stir to combine. Cook 3 minutes. Add cooked rigatoni to skillet. Heat until thoroughly combined. Sprinkle with mozzarella and romano cheese. Serve immediately with fresh basil.

Heat margarine and powdered sugar until melted and thickened. Add vanilla and flour. Stir until well blended and mixture leaves sides of pan clean. Chill until firm enough to handle. Roll into 1 inch balls. Roll balls into finely grated walnuts. Place balls on waxed paper covered trays. Makes about 100 balls.

Bring water to boil in large saucepan over medium-high heat. Add smoked sausagereduce heat. Cook 10-12 minutes or until sausage is heated through, stirring occasionally. Pour 1/2 of barbecue sauce over sausagemix well. Divide sausage mixture among Hawaiian rolls. Top with remaining barbecue sauce. Serve immediately.

Heat a charcoal or gas grill to medium-hot. Combine 2 tablespoons butter, 1/4 cup orange juice concentrate, and 1/2 can of chipotle chiles in adobo sauce in a blender and whirl until smooth. Spray corn with cooking spray. Cook until browned in spots and tender when pierced with a knife, turning several times during cooking. Remove from grill. Brush with chipotle mixture and sprinkle with remaining 1 tablespoon chipotle mixture. Sprinkle with remaining 1/4 cup orange juice concentrate and 2 tablespoons molasses. Sprinkle with remaining 1/4 teaspoon salt. Top with remaining 2 tablespoons melted butter. Sprinkle with remaining 2 tablespoons cilantro. Serve immediately.

Put flour, lard and salt in a bowl. Beat in egg. Add vinegar. Knead. Form into a ball. Roll out. Cut into 4 pieces. Roll out again. Cut into strips. Roll out again. Cut into squares. Bake 20 minutes at 375.

Preheat oven to 350 degrees F. Grease a 9x13-inch baking dish with butter. Combine crushed pineapple with eggs and sugar in a large bowl. Stir in bread cubes. Place bread mixture into the baking dish. Bake for 45 minutes or until the edges are browned and the center is set. Cool. Serve warm or at room temperature.

In a small skillet over medium heat, saut the shallot& mushrooms in butter until soft. Add the tomato& basil. Add wine. Cook until the liquid has almost evaporated. Remove from heat. Skewer 3 shrimp, 3 scallops,& 3 mussels on each of 8 skewers. Arrange the skewers on a baking sheet. Top each with a heaping spoonful of the tomato mixture. Bake for 4 minutes. Turn the skewers. Bake for 3 minutes more. Remove from oven. Garnish the skewers with the lemon wedge. Serve at once.

Slice tomatoes open lengthwise. Season with salt and pepper. Spread a bit of the pesto on the inside of each half of each slice of tomato. Top each half of each slice of tomato with a few slices of mozzarella and a bit of the parsley. Place on a cookie sheet. Broil for a couple of minutes until the cheese is melted.

Prepare quesadilla by layering 1 tortilla with 1/4 cup salsa, 2 tablespoons miracle whip, 1/4 teaspoon chili powder and 1/4 of the chicken. Top with 1/4 cup of the remaining salsa and 1/4 of the cheese. Top with the remaining tortilla. Heat quesadilla in nonstick skillet over medium-high heat until crisp and golden on both sides. Cut into wedges and serve.

Place apples and cranberries in an 8" x 8" baking dish. In a medium saucepan combine the sugar and water and bring to a boil. Once boiling, cook for 3 minutes, stirring occasionally. Remove from heat and stir in the flour, butter and vanilla extract. Spread this mixture evenly over the top of the apple/cranberry mixture. Sprinkle the top of the cobbler with the oats and pecans. Bake at 350 degrees F for about 40 minutes. Serve warm.

Cut halloumi into slices about 1cm thick and grill until golden and bubbling. Remove and cool slightly. Cut tomatoes into quarters. Place a piece of halloumi on top of a tomato quarter and drizzle with olive oil and lemon juice. Sprinkle with basil leaves and serve immediately. Serve remaining halloumi alongside for dipping into the lemon-oil dressing.

Fry bulk sausage in large skillet until browned. Break up with spoon, drain off fat. Add hash brown potatoes to skillet with the sausage and fry until done. Add eggs to skillet. Break yolks with fork to coat potatoes. Stir in cheese and heat through. Serve immediately with toast.
Tenderize cube steaks. Place in a large zip lock bag with the other ingredients. Seal the bag and shake to coat the steaks. Place in a baking dish. Cook at 350 for 25-35 minutes or until done.
Slice 1 cantaloupe and 1 strawberry into pieces. Mix rose water and icing sugar together. Stir in both fruits. Serve chilled.

Heat the olive oil in a large saucepan over medium heat. Add the celery and onion and saute for 5 minutes or until translucent. Stir in the flour and cook for 1 minute. Add the broccoli, 1 cup of the stock, the thyme, the potatoes, 1/4 teaspoon of the salt and the half-and-half. Bring to a simmer. Add the remaining stock, remaining 1/4 teaspoon salt and the pepper. Add the half-and-half and stir well. Remove from heat. Stir in the cheese until melted. Serve immediately.

Preheat oven to 400 degrees. Combine biscuit mix with water to make dough. Roll dough out on lightly floured surface to form a large rectangle. Place half the beef mixture on one half of dough rectangle, roll up jellyroll style (like cinnamon rolls) and place seam side down into greased casserole dish. Top with remaining beef mixture. Combine soup, onion soup mix, and waterpour over beef mixture. Bake uncovered for 30 minutes or until golden brown. Makes 12 servings.
Beat cream cheese and sugar in a large mixing bowl until smooth. Beat in melted chocolate. Fold in whipped topping. Spoon into crust. Cover and refrigerate.

In a large bowl toss together picante sauce, lime juice and olive oil. Add salt, pepper and potatoes. Toss well. Place on lettuce leaf. Top with roma tomato slice and black olive. Sprinkle with fresh cilantro.
Place all ingredients into food processor. Process until smooth. Serve with pita bread and veggies.

Add ghee to a pan and bring it to medium heat. When it starts to melt add saffron and green cardamoms. Add milk and sugar and mix well. Add rava and mix until it turns into one big ball. Add coconut flakes and mix well. Roll into ladoos.

Preheat oven to 375. In a large ovenproof skillet or Dutch oven, heat the olive oil over medium heat. Add the shallot and cook until tender. Add the broth, wine, and 1/2 tsp of the tarragon. Bring to a boil. Add the chicken, reduce the heat to low, cover and simmer until the chicken is just cooked through, about 5 minutes. Remove the chicken from the pan. Add the potatoes to the pan. Add the remaining 1/2 tsp of the tarragon. Cover and cook until the potatoes are tender. Remove from the heat. Stir in the parsley. Spoon the potatoes and broth over the chicken. Garnish with additional parsley.
Brown sausage and onions in large skillet. Drain grease. Stir in rice. Add stock, tomatoes, garlic and seasonings. Cook until heated through. Makes six servings.

To make dressing combine lemon juice, hazelnut oil and black pepper. Season with salt if necessary. Mix in parmesan. In a large bowl combine pears and arugula. Toss with dressing. Top with walnuts and blue cheese. Serve.

Soak apricots in water overnight. Drain and cut into pieces. Peel citrus fruit and remove white pith. Shred colored peel and chop fruit finely. Add lemon juice and apricots. Add pineapple. Measure fruit and add an equal volume of sugar. Cook until thick, stirring carefully to prevent scorching. Add pine nuts, if desired. Fill sterilized jars, cover and process in a boiling water bath for ten minutes to seal.

Prepare cake mix according to directions on package. Add eggs, vegetable oil, pudding mix, lemon juice and water. Stir well. Add poppy seeds. Pour into greased and floured 9x5 inch loaf pan. Bake at 350 degrees for 50-60 minutes or until toothpick inserted near center comes out clean. Cool in pan for 10 minutes. Remove from pan. Cool completely on wire rack.

Melt butter in a large saucepan over medium-high heat. Add flour and whisk until mixture is light brown and begins to smell nutty, 3-5 minutes. Gradually whisk in the stock. Cook until mixture thickens and begins to bubble, 3-4 minutes. Remove from heat and stir in the dill. Return the mixture to the heat and whisk in the vinegar. Whisk in the yolk. Season with salt and pepper and transfer the mixture to a blender or food processor. Puree until smooth, about 30 seconds. Let cool. Transfer the mixture to an airtight container and refrigerate until ready to use. Yield is estimated.

Preheat oven to 450 degrees. In a bowl combine meat, stuffing mix, and eggs. Mix well. Add seasonings to taste. Form into 2 inch balls. In a large roasting pan, add all remaining ingredients except cranberries. Place meatballs in saucepan and cover. Bake for one hour. Add cranberries and return to oven for an additional 20 minutes or until sauce thickens. Serve over rice.

Preheat oven to 400. Line a cookie sheet with aluminum foil. Place croissant halves on the foil and brush with butter. Bake 6 minutes. Remove from oven and spread with mayonnaise. Top with tomato and bacon. Add butter leaf lettuce and parsley and serve.
