Blend cream cheese with salad dressing. Spread on bottom of 13x9x2-inch pan. Layer crabmeat, shrimp, onions and pepper evenly over top. Blend cocktail sauce with enough water to make 1 cup liquid. Pour over mixture in pan. Top with cheddar cheese. Refrigerate 2 hours or overnight to blend flavors. Serve with assorted crackers.
Combine all in a bowl. Cover and chill. Just before serving, add a few drops of olive oil and toss to coat.

Heat the oil in a large saucepan over medium heat. Add the onion and carrot and saute until lightly browned. Add the green beans and stock and bring to a boil. Simmer for about ten minutes. Add the almond milk and salt and continue to simmer for 5 minutes. Add the fresh herbs and fresh parsley. Serve immediately. Serves four.
Place all the ingredients in a large slow cooker. Stir to combine. Cook on low for 8 hours. Remove meat from the liquid. Slice thinly across the grain. Serve with vegetables and liquid.
Slice onion very thinly. Sprinkle with flour. Add mint, beaten egg, and water. Form into balls. Heat oil. Fry until golden brown. Drain. Season with salt and pepper. Serve hot.

Preheat oven to 375 degrees F (190 degrees C). In a medium bowl, combine cream cheese, tomatoes, bell pepper and bacon. Unroll crescent rolls. Place 1 teaspoon of cream cheese mixture in the wide end of each triangle. Roll up dough. Place seam side down in a greased 15x10 inch pan. Bake in the preheated oven for 12 to 15 minutes, or until golden brown.

Melt butter with sugar. Cream together well. Add eggs, one at a time, beating well after each addition. Add the flour, ground ginger, orange juice & zest & beat until well blended. Pour mixture into a greased & floured 8 x 12 baking dish. Bake at 180C for about 30-40 minutes or until the top is golden & a skewer inserted comes out clean. Cool slightly & sprinkle with dried cranberries. Cut into 12 squares & serve.

Preheat oven to 350f. In a 13 by 9-inch baking pan, layer the chicken breast with the diced tomatoes with green chilies, onions, green pepper, and red pepper. In a small bowl, combine the canola oil, cumin, salt, and chili powderdrizzle over the vegetable mixture. Cover tightly with aluminum foil. Bake for 1 hour. Serve with flour tortillas.

Wash and soak dried beans for 12 hours. Rinse and place in a large pot. Cover with 1 inch of cold water and bring to a boil. Reduce heat and simmer until tender (about 1 hour). Remove from heat and discard bay leaf. Add olive oil and stir. Add garlic and saute for a few minutes until fragrant and translucent. Add thyme, chicken stock and salt and black pepper to taste. Serve hot.

Place apricots and cranberries in a food processor with the zest. Process until chopped. Transfer to a small bowl. Add chocolate and process until smooth. Using a teaspoon, shape into 1 inch balls. Roll each ball in your hands to form a truffle. Place on waxed paper. Refrigerate until firm. Store in an airtight container in the refrigerator. Makes about 2 dozen truffles.

Heat oil in heavy skillet over moderate heat. Add chicken. Cook until no longer pink. Remove from pan. In same pan, add onions and garlic. Cook until tender. Add tomato sauce. Bring to a boil. Add chicken. Cook for 5 minutes or until chicken is done. Stir in peanut butter and coriander. Cook for 1 minute. Sprinkle with red pepper flakes. Serve over hot cooked rice.

Wash and trim leeks. Slice them lengthwise into 1/4" thick strips. Heat the butter in a large pan, add the leeks and cook until soft and translucent - about 10 minutes. Sprinkle the flour over them and stir until incorporated. Add the chicken stock gradually, stirring constantly until well blended and smooth. Season to taste with salt & pepper. Mash potatoes with butter & milk (or cream) and add them to the leeks to thicken the mixture. Bring to a boil then remove from heat and add double cream. Stir and bring to a boil again then turn off the heat. Serve immediately garnished with chives.

Brown ground beef with chopped onions and jalapenos. Drain fat. Add tomato paste and tomatoes. Simmer 10 minutes. Add beef broth and beans and rice. Simmer for another 10 minutes. Salt and pepper to taste. Serve with tortilla chips.

Sprinkle unflavored gelatin over cold waterstir until dissolved. Add lemon juicestir until dissolved. Add sugarstir until dissolved. Cool slightly. Beat cream until stiff peaks formfold into mixture. Fold in orange juice and extractpour into a freezer containerfreeze until solidlet stand at room temperature for a few minutes to soften slightly before serving.
Mix butter and spices in small bowltoss with popcornsprinkle with lemon pepper.

Beat together peanut butter, splenda, egg, and vanilla. Drop by spoonfuls onto a cookie sheet lined with parchment paper or waxed paper. Let sit at room temperature for about 10 minutes. Remove from cookie sheet to cool completely on a wire rack. Store in an airtight container.

In a small bowl combine cornstarch with cold water until smooth. In another small bowl combine the cornstarch mixture with the apple juice and vinegar. Cook and stir until thickened. Stir in the brown sugar and orange zest. Cut the pepper and onion into chunks. Skewer the peppers, onion and pineapple chunks alternately with the kielbasa. Brush the skewers with the glazecook over medium heat for 4 minutes per side, turning once. Serve with the remaining glaze drizzled over the top. Serve over rice.

Prepare pie shell according to directions. In a large bowl beat pudding mix and milk 2 minutes. Stir in vanilla protein powder until blended. Fold in half of cool whip. Layer pie shell with slices of banana and 1/2 of the pudding mixture. Top with remaining cool whip. Garnish with remaining banana slices. Refrigerate several hours or until ready to serve.

Preheat oven to 400 F. Coat a baking sheet with cooking spray. Toss potatoes with 1 tablespoon olive oil and a large pinch of salt in a bowltransfer to sheet. Roast until tender when pierced with a fork, 20 to 25 minutes. Let cool slightly. In a small bowl, mash the potatoes with remaining 2 tablespoons oil, cream, 1/2 teaspoon salt, garlic, and parsleytaste and adjust seasonings. Serve the smashed potatoes with the green garlic butter. Serves 2 as a main course.

Melt 1 tablespoon of the butter with the garlic and add the soy sauce, white wine and Worcestershire sauce. Let cool slightly. In a large bowl, combine the Monterey Jack cheese with the cracker crumbs. Stuff the mushrooms with the filling mixture. Bake 10 minutes at 350 degrees F until lightly browned. Garnish with more cracker crumbs.

Preheat oven to 350f. Cut bacon into 40 slices about 1 inch long. Wrap each slice around a jalapeno half, securing with a toothpick. Bake until the bacon is crisp, about 10 minutes. In a bowl mix together the cream cheese and cheddar cheese. Divide the filling between the jalapeño halves. Bake until the filling is warm, about 15 minutes. Serve with extra salsa.

Preheat oven to 400 degrees. In a large mixing bowl, combine all ingredients. Spray a large roasting pan with cooking spray. Place vegetables mixture evenly into roasting pan. Bake for 1 hour. Serve immediately.

In a medium bowl combine the broth and waterwhisk in the cornstarch until smooth. Place over medium heat and stir constantly until thickenedremove from the heat and stir in the vinegar. Add the roasted garliclet cool slightly. Transfer the mixture to a food processorprocess until smooth. Add the mustard and honeyprocess until well-combinedtransfer the mixture to a serving bowlstir in the peanut oil. Coverrefrigerate at least 2 hours or until chilled. Season with the salt and pepper. Serve at room temperature with vegetables and crusty bread. Makes 2 cups.

Sprinkle chicken with salt and pepper. Heat butter in frypan. Add chicken and brown. Remove from heat and stir in sherry. Heat to boiling. Reduce heat and add lemon rind and juice. Cook over low heat 3-4 min. or until done. Stir in cream and heat thru. Sprinkle with parmesan cheese. Can be served over noodles or rice.

Put the unthawed raspberries into a saucepan and add sugar. Cook on medium, stirring occasionally until all the sugar ahs dissolved. Using a potato masher, mash the raspberries and syrup thoroughly. Pour the mixture through a strainer, extract all the juice. Squeeze two of the lemons and strain the juice, add it to the raspberry juice. Add the boiling water to the raspberry juice. Allow the cordial to cool, then chill it in the refrigerator. Serve cordial with a thin slice of lemon in each glass.
In a saucepan, combine all ingredients and cook over medium heat until mixture is thickened. Stir occasionally. Serve on hot dog or hamburger buns with sliced onion and dill pickles.

Spread the nuts evenly on the bottom of an ungreased 15x10x1-in. baking pan. In a heavy 3-qt. saucepan cook the brown sugar, the butter, the milk and the salt over low heat, stirring constantly, until the mixture comes to a full rolling boil. Remove from the heat. Pour the hot toffee mixture over the nuts and spread evenly. Sprinkle the chocolate chips evenly over the top. Allow the mixture to cool, about 15 minutes. Break the candy into pieces with your fingers. Makes about 48 pieces.

Saute garlic, onions, celery in olive oil until softened. Add crushed tomatoes, chicken stock and spices. Bring to a simmer and simmer for 10-15 minutes. Puree with hand blender or food processor. Stir in sour cream. Reheat. Serve with crackers or croutons or crispy tortilla strips or sliced avacado or grated cheese.

Cook the tortellini according to the package directions. Drain and rinse with cold water. Heat 2 tablespoons of the butter in the skillet over medium heat. Add the Westphalian ham and cook, stirring often until browned and cooked through. Stir in the cream and continue to stir until the mixture comes to a simmer. Add the tortellini to the skillet. Cook for 1 to 2 minutes, or until the sauce thickens. Garnish the pasta with the remaining 2 tablespoons butter, Parmesan cheese, chives, and peas.

Unfold puff pastry. Peel and core the apples and slice them thinly. Spread the sliced apples in an even layer onto the puff pastry and sprinkle with the brown sugar and salt. Sprinkle the brown sugar and salt over the apples and bake for about 20 minutes or until the top is golden brown and the apples are cooked through. Serve the warm apple tart with vanilla ice cream and caramel topping and a drizzle of powdered sugar on top.

Spread the mayo on both sides of the white bread slices. Arrange the lettuce leaves, tomatoes and bacon in layers. Top with the chicken breasts. Finish with the remaining slices of bread. Press the layers together and secure with toothpicks. Cut into triangles to serve.

Heat oven to 350 degrees F. Grease two 8-inch loaf pans. Cream together butter & sugar until light. Beat in eggnog until well blended. Stir in vanilla & rum extracts. Sift together flour, baking powder & salt. Add to mixture alternately with eggnog. Beat well after each addition. Pour into prepared loaf pans. Bake until toothpick inserted in center comes out clean. Cool in pans 10 minutes, then remove & cool completely on wire racks. To prepare glaze, whisk together powdered sugar & rum until smooth. Drizzle over bread slices. Makes 2 loaves.

Combine all salmon ingredients in a slow cooker. Cook on low for 4-6 hours or until fish is tender. Meanwhile, heat remaining curry paste in pan and cook over medium heat until fragrant. Add vegetables and cook until soft. Season to taste. Serve over rice. Garnish with basil.

Preheat oven to 350 degrees f. Butter 6 1/2-inch miniature party rye rounds. Lay them out in a baking pan. In a small bowl, beat together the eggs, salt, pepper, and fresh dill sprigs until well blended. Pour the mixture over the rounds. Bake about 10 minutes or until the eggs are cooked. Cut the eggs into halves or quarters. Spread the top half of each round with 1 teaspoon of the salmon. Put the egg halves or quarters on top. Top each with 1 teaspoon of the remaining salmon. Makes 6 servings.

Preheat oven to 350 F. Combine crumbs and sugar in medium bowl. Add buttermix well. Press into bottom of ungreased 13x9 inch baking pan. Bake for 10 minutes. Cool. Combine condensed milk and jam in large bowl. Heat in microwave oven for about 6 minutes or until very hot, stirring every minute. Stir in coconut, cashews and white chocolate. Spread over crumb crust. Chill for at least 1 hour or until firm. Cut into bars.

Combine club crackers, butter, milk, sugar, brown sugar and graham cracker in a large bowl. Mix well. Press mixture into an 11x13x2-inch pan. Bake for 15 minutes at 350 degrees or until lightly browned. Cool for 5 minutes, then crumble. Reserve 1 cup crumbs for topping. Spread peanut butter on bottom of pantop with remaining crumbs. Chill 1 hour or until firm. Melt the chocolate chips and the crunchy peanut butter together until smoothpour over the crumbs. Refrigerate for at least 4 hours or until firm. Cut into bars.
Place all ingredients into 5-6 quart crock pot. Mix thoroughly. Cook for 8-10 hours or until desired tenderness is reached. Serve with potatoes and onions.
Toss the spinach with the dressing. Add the fruit and nuts. Chill until ready to serve.

Cook potatoes according to package directions. Drainreturn to the hot pan. Add cream cheese, sour cream, cream, butter, eggs and garlic salt. Mash together well. Pour into 2 qt casserole. Bake at 350 f for 30 minutes.

Preheat a griddle or frying pan over medium heat. In a medium bowl, stir together the rolled oats, skim milk, whole wheat flour, raw sugar, baking powder, salt, ground cinnamon. In a separate bowl, beat the egg whites until stiff peaks form. Gently fold the egg whites into the dry ingredients until just combined. Heat the oil in the pan over medium heat. Using a measuring cup or scoop to hold 1/4 cup batter, pour the batter onto the pan. Bake until the bottoms are golden brown, about 2 minutes. Flip the pancakes over and bake until the other side is golden brown, about 1 minute more. Serve immediately.

Cut each breast in half horizontally to make four thin cutlets. In a skillet melt 1 T. butter. Add cutlets and cook for about 3 minutes on each side. Heat remaining 1 T. butter in a saucepan over medium heat. Add flour. Stir well to combine. Add ranch dressing and cook over low heat until thickened. Dip cutlets in ranch sauce, then roll in bread crumbs, then egg yolks and then in bread crumbs again. Fry cutlets in the hot oil for about 2 minutes per side. Top with bacon and American cheese. Serve on rolls with lettuce tomato and mayonnaise.

Preheat the oven to 350F. Prepare the baking potatoes according to the package directions. Bake until the potatoes are tender when pierced with a knife. Place the baking potatoes on a cutting board. Cut them into quarters. Put the quartered potatoes into a large bowl. Add the sour cream, Cheddar cheese and chives. Mash the mixture with a fork. Stir in the butter until well blended. Spoon the mixture evenly into the skins. Place the potato skins on a baking sheet. Bake for 10 minutes or until the cheese is melted. Garnish with cooked bacon if desired. Serve immediately.

Soak tapioca in water for 30 minutes. Strain and bring to boil in a pot with sugar, grenadine, pomegranate seeds, lemon peel. Once tapioca is cooked, remove from pot and let cool. Scoop into serving dishes and top with whipped cream and pomegranate seeds.

Heat olive oil in a large saute pan over medium heat. Add beef and cook until browned on all sidesabout 5 minutes. Remove beef and set aside. Add onion and bell peppers to pan with olive oil. Cook until tenderabout 5 minutes. Stir in garlic powder, salt and pepper and cook for 1 minute more. Stir in beef, hoisin sauce and 1/4 cup of water. Cover and cook on medium-low heat for 15 minutes or until beef is tender. Serve over rice.

Cut each breast in half lengthwise to make two thin fillets. Mix together mustard, honey, salt, pepper, paprika, and garlic powder. Dip fillets into mustard mixture on both sides, then press the corn flakes into the mustard mixture on both sides of each fillet to coat evenly. Heat the oven to 350 degrees F (175 degrees C). Place fillets on a lightly greased baking pan, and bake until no longer pink inside (about 20 minutes). Makes 4 servings.

Wash and cut potatoe slices into 1/4-inch thick slices and set aside. In large skillet, melt butter over medium heat. Stir in potatoe slices and sprinkle with salt and pepper to taste. Cook for 5 minutes or until golden brown. Sprinkle with cheese. Continue cooking until cheese melts. Stir in onion and parsley. Serve hot.
Combine all ingredients in a blender or processor and blend well. Use to baste roasts or pork or chicken.

Mix the first four ingredients well. Sift the dry ingredients together and add to the liquid mixture. Chill for 2 hours or until firm enough to roll into balls. Roll into balls and roll in granulated sugar. Place on greased cookie sheet 2 inches apart and bake at 350 degrees for 7 to 8 minutes. Cookies will flatten out while baking.

Cut onion in half lengthwise. Lay cut side down on a cutting board. Chop onion into small dice. Cook bacon over medium-high heat in a large skillet until crisp. Remove bacon from pan, leaving fat behind. Add onion to skillet. Cook, stirring occasionally until onion is very soft but not browned. Pour in beer, add clams. Cover and cook until clams just open. Serve with buttered toast.

Combine the first 3 ingredients in a blender. Blend until smoothstir in remaining ingredients. Spoon mixture in a 1-1/2-quart casserole dish coated with cooking spray. Bake at 350f for 20 minutes or until hot and bubbly. Garnish with parsley.

Bring water to a rolling boil, then remove from heat. Stir together boiling water and powdered gelatin in a mixing bowl. Stir constantly until gelatin is completely dissolved. Stir in cold water and alcohol. Pour mixture into, individual shot-size plastic or paper cups. To make the jello easier to consume, buy plastic cups that also have lids. Pour the mix into the cup, add the lid, then turn it upside down prior to refrigeration. Place shots on a tray in refrigerator. Chill until firm. Refrigerate until served.

While crepes are cooking, heat 1/4 cup butter in a skillet over medium heat. Add onion. Cook until tender. Stir in frozen spinach. Cook until thawed. Add milk. Cook until thickened. Stir in mozzarella cheese and salt. Spread on crepe. Roll up. Sprinkle with Parmesan cheese. Bake at 375 for 10 minutes or until cheese is melted. Serve immediately.

Preheat oven to 350 degrees. Mix together butter and vanilla. Blend in egg. Beat in cheese and mix well. Spray a 9 x 13 inch pan with cooking spray. Pour in batter and bake for 20 minutes. Cool and sprinkle with powdered sugar.

Saute the olive oil, onion, and garlic until golden brown. Add the parsley, pimiento, and seasonings to taste. Add the chicken broth and bring to a simmer. Peel and slice the potatoes into the simmering broth, cover, and cook until the potatoes are just tender. Remove from heat and add the egg yolks, beating with a fork or whisk. Stir in the parsley and season with additional salt and pepper if desired. Serve immediately or chill until ready to serve. Serve warm or hot.
Cut white bread into cubes and fry in butter until golden brown. Beat together eggs, milk, cheese and seasonings. Pour over bread cubes and cook until set. Serve with bacon slices.

Line bottom of 9 x 13 inch pan with graham cracker squares. Mix pudding and milk. Fold in whipped topping. Spoon layer of pudding mixture over cracker squares. Add another layer of squares then pudding mix again then final layer of squares. Spread chocolate frosting over top. Chill in refrigerator for at least 2 hours.
Beat the eggs with the milk and the spices. Dip the bread into the mixture. Cook in a skillet with butter. Serve hot with butter and syrup.

Cut onions and bell pepper into 1/2 inch cubes. Cut dove breasts into 1-inch cubes. Thread dove cubes, onions and bell pepper onto skewers. Grill on medium heat for 4-5 minutes or until done. Slice tomatoes and place on platter. Arrange skewers on tomatoes. Sprinkle with mushrooms. Drizzle with Teriyaki sauce. Garnish with parsley. Serve with hot cooked rice.
Season chops with flour, salt and dry mustard. Fry in hot oil for 5 minutes. Sprinkle with garlic powder and turn. Add chicken rice soup to pan and cover. Simmer 10 minutes. Serve with rice.

In a large skillet over medium heat, add olive oil. Saute the onions in the oil until softened and lightly browned, 5-7 minutes. Season the onions with salt and pepper. Season the steak with the steak seasoning and garlic salt and pepper and place it in the pan with the onions. Cook until the steak is browned on both sides, about 5 minutes per side. Slice the steak thinly against the grain and serve in hoagie rolls with provolone cheese.

In a large skillet, heat oil over medium-high heat. Saute onion and bell pepper until tender. Add mushrooms and garlic and continue sauteing until tender-crisp, about 3 minutes. Season with Cajun seasoning and salt and pepper to taste. Stir in rice and stir-fry until heated through, 2 to 3 minutes. Transfer to a serving platter and top with the pecans.

In a frying pan over medium heat, cook garlic in the olive oil for 1 minute. Add courgettes. Add lemon juice. Add tagliatelle. Add the basil. Stir. Toss and cook for 2 minutes. Add the parmesan cheese. Serve hot.

In a bowl, mix together the pancake mix, 2 eggs, and the 1/2 cup water. In a deep pan or skillet, heat about 2 inches of oil to 375 degrees F. Line a plate with a double layer of paper towels for draining the donut holes. Using a teaspoon or 1/4 cup measure, scoop out the batter and carefully lower into the hot oil. Fry in small batches and turn once until golden brown, about 1 minute per side. Remove the donut holes from the oil with a slotted spoon and place on paper towel-lined plate to drain. Sprinkle with sugar and cinnamon. Serve warm or at room temperature.

Cook potatoes in boiling water until they are tender. Drain. When cool enough to handle, peel and dice. Combine diced potatoes and chopped onions in a mixing bowl. Stir in sour cream, lemon juice and Dijon mustard. Toss to coat well. Add chopped eggs and chopped parsley. Toss again. Garnish with a few sprigs of parsley.
Spread each side of bread with butter. Spread each slice with cream cheese. Sprinkle with swiss cheese. Serve open face.

In a medium saucepan, melt caramel ingredients over medium low heat until smooth. Remove from heat. Line a 13x9 inch baking dish with non-stick aluminum foil which extends the 2 inches beyond the edges. In a saucepan, melt the butter over medium low heat. Stir in marshmallows, with a rubber spatula, and continue stirring until almost melted. Stir in vanilla, 1 teaspoon of the sea salt, and 1 cup of the melted caramel stirring until smooth. Remove from heat. Stir in cereal and press mixture into prepared baking dish. Spread the remaining caramel over top and sprinkle with sea salt. Let cool completely, peel off foil, and cut into 24 squares.

Preheat oven to 400. Coat chicken with sauce and sprinkle with cheese. Bake for 30 minutes. Remove from oven. Beat eggs and milk in small bowl. Remove chicken from oven and place in egg mixture. Sprinkle with more cheese and bread crumbs. Bake for 30 more minutes. Remove from oven and sprinkle with parsley and parmesan cheese. Serve over noodles.

Cook macaroni in boiling water for 8 minutes or until tender. Drain. Meanwhile, cook beef in skillet until no longer pink. Stir in pizza sauce and garlic. Heat through. Spread half the sauce in bottom of a 1-1/2-qt. casserole. Layer with 1/3 of the macaroni, 1/3 of the cheese and 1/3 of the meat mixture. Repeat layers. Cover and bake for 15 minutes. Uncoversprinkle with remaining cheese. Bake for 5 minutes more or until cheese is melted.

Melt 2 tbsp. Butter in skillet. Add garlic and cook until garlic is golden brown. Sprinkle with cayenne pepper. Remove garlic from skillet and set aside. Add 2 cups milk and bring to boil. Remove from heat. Blend in cream cheese and garlic until smooth and well blended. Pour into 2 qt. Casserole. Top with remaining 1/2 cup milk and 1 cup parmesan cheese. Bake at 350 degrees for 20 minutes. Remove from oven and sprinkle with fresh ground black pepper. Let stand for 10 minutes before serving.

Preheat the oven to 375f. Mix the sugar and butter in a large bowl until light and fluffy. Beat in the buttermilk and eggs until smooth. Add the vanilla and mix well. Fold in the bananas. In a separate bowl combine the all-purpose flour, baking soda and salt. Add the flour mixture to the butter mixture and stir just until combined. Stir in the blueberries and pour the batter into a greased 12 cup muffin pan. Bake for 17-22 minutes or until golden brown and a cake tester inserted in the center comes out clean. Let cool in the pan for 10 minutes before removing. Makes about 12 muffins.

Wash and peel the potatoes and cut them into small cubes. Place them into a large bowl and add the red wine vinegar and vegetable oil. Stir to mix thoroughly. Then add the dill and season with salt and pepper to taste. Cover and refrigerate for at least 3 hours before serving. Stir the potatoes once more before serving and sprinkle with the feta cheese and top with the red pepper, green onion and any other desired garnishes. Serve chilled or at room temperature.

Combine all ingredients in a shallow bowl. Add the pork to the mixture and turn to coat well. Place the coated loin on an aluminum foil lined baking sheet and bake for 30 minutes in a preheated 350 degree oven. Cook until the internal temperature is 145 degrees. Let stand for 10 minutes before slicing.

In crock pot saute leek in oil for 3 minutes or until softened. Add butternut squash and seasonings. Stir to coat evenly and cook for 2 minutes, stirring occasionally. Add beans and tomatoes. Stir to combine. Cover and cook on low 6 to 7 hours or high 3 to 4 hours. Top with cheese and bacon and broil for 2 minutes or until cheese is melted. Serve over mashed potatoes.

Cream butter with custard powder. Beat well. Gradually add caster sugar and continue beating until the mixture is light and creamy. Gradually add the flour until the mixture comes together. Add the vanilla essence and mix well. Roll into tablespoon balls and place on a greased oven tray. Flatten with a fork to create a squishy design. Bake at 180 degrees celsius for 10-15 minutes until lightly browned on the edges. Cool on a wire rack. Melt the chocolate and drizzle over the cooled cookies. Makes 25-30 small cookies.

Mix together dark brown sugar, flour, and sugar. Add egg yolks. Beat until mixture is smooth. Add milk and beat until smooth. Heat in saucepan over medium heat until mixture comes to a boil. Remove from heat. Stir in butter. Serve warm over pie crust. Top with whipped cream.

Combine sugar, salt and red wine vinegar in a small bowl. Add onion and let stand for 15 minutes. Add oil and mix well. Stir in poppy seeds. Add strawberries and toss to coat. Add baby spinach leaves and toss to coat. Divide among serving plates. Sprinkle with cheese and nuts. Serve immediately.
Split hot dog buns in half. Spread with melted butter. Top with parmesan cheese and sprinkle with sesame seeds. Bake at 350 degrees for 15 minutes or until buns are crisp. Makes 12 servings.

In a slow cooker combine the first five ingredients. Add the pork roast and cook on low for 8-10 hours. Remove the pork and shred with two forks. Add the cooked onions to the meat and stir well. Serve over buns with a dollop of coleslaw and a pickle spear.

Beat together the butter and sugar until creamy and light, beat in the eggs, one at a time, beating well after each addition. Beat in the flour and vanilla until just combined. Bake in a greased and floured loaf pan at 325 degrees for 1 hour and 15 minutes or until a toothpick inserted in the center comes out clean and the top is golden brown. Cool in pan for 10 minutes before removing to cool completely on a wire rack.

In a 1 quart saucepan combine sugar and cornstarch. Gradually stir in water until smooth. Cook over medium heat stirring often until boiling. Boil 1 minute stirring constantly. Remove from heat. Stir in butter, juice and rind until butter is melted. Serve warm. Top with strawberries and shortbread cookie.
Combine all ingredients except cabbage. Bring to boil. Stir in cabbage. Cover and simmer 5 minutes or until cabbage is tender. Serve at room temperature.

Sauté onions in oil with salt until tender. Drain turnips. Puree turnips with 1/2 c of the milk to make a smooth puree. Slowly add the rest of the milk. Bring to a boil, then simmer for 20 minutes. Season to taste with salt and pepper. Place 1/2 cup of the turnip puree in the bottom of 4 small oven-safe bowls or ramekins. Top with the caramelized onions. Bake for 15 minutes or until hot. Serve with french baguettes or toast slices.

In medium bowl stir together cheddar cheese, cream cheese and pumpkin until well blended. Form into ballrefrigerate until firm. On waxed paper roll ball in pineapple preserves. Roll in ground spices and pretzel stick pieces. Cover and refrigerate until ready to serve. Serve with crackers.

Trim base and leaves from fennel. Cut each bulb in half lengthways and slice crosswise into 1/2-inch-thick coins. In a large skillet, melt 2 tablespoons butter with the garliccook over moderate heat until fragrant, 1 minute. Add the fennel and cook, stirring occasionally, until beginning to soften, 3 to 4 minutes. Stir in the thyme and season with salt and pepper. Add the wine and cook until almost evaporated, about 3 minutes. Add the stock and bring to a boil. Cover partially and simmer over moderately low heat until tender, about 10 minutes. Uncover and continue to cook until almost all the liquid has evaporated and the fennel is glazed, about 10 minutes. Stir in the remaining 2 tablespoons butter and season with salt and pepper. Transfer to a bowl.

Cut the potatoes in half lengthwise then into quarters. Boil the potatoes in salted water until tender but not mushy. Cool completely. Peel the eggs, slice them in half lengthwise then remove the yolks. Add the yolks to the dressing, mixing well. Slice the whites of the eggs as thinly as possible then layer them in a casserole dish. Top the egg whites with the yolks and the dressing mixture. Cover with plastic wrap and refrigerate overnight. Remove from the refrigerator about 1 hour before serving to let the flavors meld. Just before serving sprinkle the top of the salad with the sweet gherkins and the chopped onion. Drizzle with the remaining dressing then sprinkle with the salt and pepper.

Beat 3 eggs together in a bowl. Beat in 1/2 cup milk and season to taste with salt and pepper. Heat 1 tablespoon butter or cooking spray in an 8-inch skillet over medium-high heat. Add egg mixture, lower heat to medium-low and cook 2-3 minutes or until the eggs begin to set, then fold over half the omelet to fill the skillet. Cook until the underside is lightly browned about 1 minute. Fold the other half over the top of the first half to enclose the filling. Continue cooking until the filling is heated through about 1-2 minutes. Slide onto a plate. Serve immediately.

Mix the soy sauce, garlic, wine, and five spice powder together. Heat a skillet over medium heat and add the oil. Add the pork chops. Cook for 5 minutes on each side until browned. Add the soy mixture and cook for another 2 minutes. Add the water. Cover the pan and cook on low for 20 minutes. Remove the cover and stir. Add the cornstarch and water mixture. Stir until thickened. Serve on rice.

Wash and peel the parsnips. Cut them into thick slices. Put into a large bowl and add the oil and salt. Toss to coat. Spread on to two baking trays lined with greaseproof paper. Bake for 30 minutes turning once halfway through. Transfer to another baking tray and leave to crisp for 10 minutes. Sprinkle over herbs.

Combine all the above ingredients, except the last 2, and mix with an electric mixer. Add the last 2 and mix again. Bake for 45 minutes at 350 degrees F in a water bath, or for 50 minutes at 325 degrees F. Cool for a few hours before slicing.

Beat ricotta cheese in large bowl. Gradually add sugar. Mix well. Fold in chocolate chips. Spoon into 6 small dessert dishes. Garnish with a dollop of whipping cream and a pecan. Chill. Serve with a mini maraschino cherry.

Place dried and fresh cranberries in a large saucepan. Add port and bring to a boil over high heat. Lower heat to a simmer and cook for 15 minutes or until cranberries are soft. Remove from heat. Stir in sugar. Cool to room temperature. Discard cinnamon sticks before serving. Can be served hot or chilled.

Preheat oven to 375 F. Grease 12 muffin cups or line with paper muffin cups. In large bowl, mix together cornmeal, flour, sugar and baking powder. In small bowl, blend together egg yolks, margarine, jam and buttermilk. Add to dry ingredientsmix well. Add egg whites and stir to combine. Spoon into prepared muffin cups. Bake for 20-25 minutes. Cool on wire rack. Makes 12.
Melt chips and butter in small saucepan over low heatstir until melted. Remove from heat. Stir in cereal and nuts. Press into greased 9x13 pan. Cool and cut into bars.

Place chicken halves in the bottom of crock pot. Put sauerkraut in a layer over the top of the chicken halves. Place a slice of swiss cheese and a piece of bread on top of the kraut. Sprinkle dressing over the top of the bread. Cover and cook on low for 6-8 hours. Serve open faced on pumpernickel bread with the cheese and kraut melted.

Cook sausage and onions in olive oil until brown. Add black-eyed peas, navy beans, rice, broth and seasonings. Bring to a boil. Reduce heat and simmer, uncovered for 1 hour. Serve with hot sauce and cornbread.

Combine pumpkin and milk. Add egg yolks and beat well. Add salt, clove and cinnamon. Combine egg whites and beat until stiff. Add to yolk mixture and mix well. Pour into unbaked pastry shells. Bake in a preheated 350f oven for one hour. Cool and serve with whipped cream.

Cook rotini pasta according to package directions. Meanwhile, saute onion in butter until tender. Add zucchini and cook 3-4 minutes. Add tomatoes and cook 2-3 minutes longer. Drain pastaadd to vegetables along with lemon juice and parmesan cheese. Toss to combine. Garnish with dried basil leaves. Add more lemon juice if desired.

Saute the onion in butter until tender. Add the tomato juice and water and bring to a boil. Add the macaroni and salt and pepper to taste. Cook for 5 minutes and then add the bread crumbs and cook for another 5 minutes. Serve hot.

Mix together all of your dry ingredients, then add your oil. Knead until dough is smooth and elastic, adding water as needed. Roll out dough very thinly, and cut out circles of your desired size with a cookie cutter or drinking glass. Use water to seal your dough together, and then cook as normal.

In a medium bowl, beat the egg, milk, cream cheese and seasonings together. Heat a large nonstick skillet over medium-high heat. Coat pan with cooking spray. Add egg mixturecook 3 minutes or until firm, stirring frequently. Remove from the heat. Stir in chives and serve immediately.

Preheat oven to 375 degrees F. Peel and core apples. Place in a greased 9-inch deep-dish pie plate. In a small bowl, mix together the first 6 ingredientsset aside. Melt butter in a large skillet over medium heat. Add applescook 2 minutes on each side or until lightly browned. Pour butter mixture over apples. Sprinkle with remaining ingredients. Bake uncovered 20 to 25 minutes or until apples are tender. Serve warm.

In a small saucepan, combine 1/2 cup water with the lemon juice, granulated sugar, cornstarch, and salt, stirring well to dissolve the cornstarch. In a small mixing bowl, combine the soymilk and margarine and set aside. Heat the cornstarch mixture over medium heat until it boils and thickens enough to coat the back of a spoon (about 5 minutes). Remove from the heat and whisk in the soymilk mixture until it is smooth. Pour into small custard cups or small glasses (such as jelly jars) or into a small glass loaf pan with a cover. Cover the cups or loaf pan with plastic wrap or foil, and chill for 4 hours or until set. Serve cold with crackers or bread or fresh fruit.

Place pineapple and mango in blender and puree until smooth. Stir in remaining ingredients and chill until serving time. Season sea scallops with salt and pepper and sear in hot oil for 2 minutes per side or until done to your liking. Place scallops in serving dish and top with salsa. Serve with tortilla chips or lettuce leaves and enjoy.

Melt the butter and cocoa in the top of a double boiler over hot water. Remove from the heat and stir in the vanilla and the sugar. Add the egg yolks and beat well with a hand whisk. Sift together the flour and the salt and stir into the egg mixture. Stir in the walnuts. In a separate bowl beat the egg whites until stiff and fold into the brownie batter. Pour the batter into a greased and floured baking pan and bake at 350 degrees for about 35 minutes. Remove from the pan and cool completely on a rack before cutting into squares.

Pork steaks are a little like the flattened stew meat you buy in supermarkets. They are very lean and have no fat on them. They are excellent to grill because of this. To make the rub, combine the paprika, sage, garlic powder, onion powder, and pepper in a small bowl. Rub the pork steaks with the mixture and let stand for 1 hour. Preheat the grill to medium-high heat. Brush the grill with olive oil and grill the pork steaks for 2 minutes on each side or until done to your liking.

Boil water in sauce pan over medium high heat. In small bowl, beat eggs lightly, then slowly add to boiling water, stirring constantly. Add onion, celery, green bell pepper and ramen noodles. Simmer 30 minutes or until thoroughly heated.

Heat oven to 350 degrees F. Mix together muffin mix, chilies, water, and egg. Press the mixture evenly into an 8" square baking dish. Bake for 20 minutes until set. Top with cheese. In another baking dish, mix together the refried beans and enchilada sauce. Heat for 10 minutes in the oven. In another baking dish, mix together the scrambled eggs and cilantro. Heat for 10 minutes in the oven. Top with more cheese. Serve with warm corn muffin and enchilada mixture.

Remove the paper that wraps around the heads of garlic and set aside the tops for another use. Cut off the top of each head of garlic, leaving about 1/2-inch of garlic on the head of garlic. Place the heads of garlic in a small saucepan and fill the saucepan with enough water to cover the heads of garlic. Cover the saucepan and bring the water to a boil over high heat. Turn the heat to medium and cook until the water has evaporated and the heads of garlic are soft and brown, about 30 minutes. Meanwhile, preheat the oven to 375 degrees F. Heat a large baking pan in the oven until hot, about 10 minutes. Remove the pan from the oven and add the canola oil and extra virgin olive oil. Swirl the oil in the pan and set aside to cool while the heads of garlic are cooking in the saucepan. When the water has evaporated and the heads of garlic are soft and brown, remove from the heat and let the heads of garlic cool in the saucepan until they can be handled. Peel

Heat oven to 350 degrees F. Line a cookie sheet with foil. In a small bowl, combine chicken and coleslaw mix. Heat half the oil in a large nonstick skillet over medium heat. Add chicken mixture. Cook until chicken is no longer pink. In a medium bowl, combine mayonnaise, lemon juice and remaining oil. Cool chicken mixture to room temperature. Spread each tortilla with 1/4 cup mayonnaise mixture. Top each tortilla with chicken mixture and sprinkle with remaining 1/4 cup mayonnaise mixture. Bake for 8 minutes or until heated through. Turn and bake an additional 3 minutes. Serve immediately. Makes 4 wraps.

Boil water. Add pasta. Cook about 5 minutes or until al dente. Drain well and rinse with cold water. In a small bowl combine tahini, soy sauce, sesame oil and pepper. In another bowl combine gingerroot and onion. Add garlic and let it cook for 1 minute. Add the pasta and tahini mixture. Toss to coat. Toss with cilantro. Serve immediately.

Preheat oven to 400 degrees f. Place fillets in a wide baking dish. Squeeze lemon juice over cod and sprinkle with pepper. Arrange tomato slices over top and bake 20 minutes. In a small bowl combine breadcrumbs with basil. Drizzle with oil and mix. Sprinkle evenly over top. Bake 20 minutes more or until cod is opaque. Makes 4 servings.

Pare the lemon rinds. Remove the seeds and grate the rind. Put the rind and the caster sugar in a saucepan and add just enough water to cover. Bring to the boil and simmer until the rind is soft and translucent. Cool. Put the rind and 1/2 pint mineral water in a jug with the lemon juice and the remaining 2 pints mineral water. Stir and chill for 2 hours. Serve in tall glasses with ice cubes and mint leaves.

In a large pot add enough chicken stock to cover and bring to a boil. Add ravioli and cook for 10 to 12 minutes or until tender. Add spinach and cook for 2 minutes longer or until wilted. Drain, reserving 1/4 cup of liquid. Transfer raviolis and spinach to a large serving bowl. Add reserved liquid and stir to mix. Sprinkle with parsley and parmigiano-reggiano cheese. Serves 6 to 8 people.

Brown italian sausage in skillet with oil over medium heat. Drain excess fat. Stir in onion and green bell pepper. Cook and stir until crisp tender. Add diced tomatoes and stewed tomatoes. Stir until well combined. Bring to boil. Stir in ketchup and cook 1 minute stir in pasta and water. Bring to boil. Reduce heat to medium-low. Simmer 10 minutes or until pasta is tender. Remove from heat. Stir in mozzarella cheese. Cook 5 minutes or until melted. Serve warm.

Heat the olive oil in the dutch oven over medium heatadd the sausagecook, stirring frequently, until browned and cooked throughremove the sausage to a bowl with a slotted spoonadd the oreganoadd the winescrape the browned bits off the bottom of the pan with a wooden spoonadd the tomato saucebring to a boilreduce the heat to medium-lowcook, stirring frequently, until the liquid has reduced to about 1/2 cupstir in the mushroomstir the sausage back into the pancook for 1 minute moreserve over pasta.

Preheat broiler. Cut the sirloin into 1-inch cubes. Add 1/2 cup of the water. Bring to a boil in a large skillet over high heat. Reduce the heat to medium-low. Cover and simmer for 10 minutes. Uncover and simmer 1 minute more. Stir in soy and worcestershire sauces. Sprinkle with the remaining 1/2 cup of the water and vinegar. Bring to a boil. Reduce the heat to low and simmer for 1 minute. Broil the steaks 4 in. from the heat for 3 minutes. Turn and broil for an additional 2 minutes. Remove from broiler and serve with the sauce.

Heat the oil in a large sauce pan over medium heat. Add the onion, carrot and celerysaute until the onion is translucent. Add the salmon, pearl barley and the ricesaute for 3-4 minutes. Add the brothbring to a boil. Reduce heatcover and simmer for 45-50 minutes or until the liquid is absorbed. Garnish with the cilantro.
Mix all ingredients together in blender or food processor. Blend until smooth. Chill before serving.

In large saucepan combine first three ingredients over low heat until mixture bubbles up over sides of pan. Stir in cereal. Remove from heatstir in morsels until melted and well blended. Spread into 9x13 inch pan. Chill until firm. Cut into squares.

Melt butter in stockpot over medium heat. Add onion and cook until softened. Add all purpose flour and stir until lightly browned. Add milk and sherry and stir until smooth. Add salt and paprika. Bring to a simmer and cook until thickened. Add lobster meat and stir. Garnish with fresh chives.

In a large skillet, saute celery and onion in 2 tablespoons of the butter until tender, 10 minutes. In a large bowl, combine the remaining 4 tablespoons of butter, the rice and the orange rind and salt and pepper to taste. Stir in the celery mixture, 2 cups of the broth and the parsley. Spoon the mixture into a shallow 2-quart baking dish. Cover with foil and bake 30 minutes. Remove the foil, pour in the remaining 1 cup of broth and the orange juice and bake until the liquid is absorbed and the rice is tender, 15 minutes longer. Sprinkle with almonds and serve.

Bring a large pot of water to a boil. Add the sauerkraut and cook for 15 minutes. Drain the liquid from the sauerkraut. Add the water, sugar, caraway seeds and cooking apples. Simmer over medium-low heat for 15 minutes. Meanwhile, heat a large skillet over medium-high heat. Add the frankfurters and cook until browned. Add the sauerkraut mixture to the skillet. Cook until heated through. Garnish with parsley.

Preheat oven to 400 degrees. In small bowl mix together vinegar, honey, soy sauce and brown sugar. In another bowl toss together chicken and vinegar mixture. Place chicken on baking sheet. Roast 40 minutes or until done. Sprinkle with sesame seeds. Garnish with parsley.

Combine sugar and mustard in a large bowlmix well. Place the ham in an ungreased roasting pan. Pour the mustard mixture over the ham. Bake for 45 minutes or until ham is heated through and the mustard is bubbly and beginning to brown. Serve warm.

Whisk first 4 ingredients in small bowl to blend. Gradually whisk in oil. Season dressing to taste with salt and pepper. Toss greens in large bowl with enough dressing to coat. Divide greens among 6 plates. Top with pear slices, dividing equally. Sprinkle with cheese and walnuts. Drizzle lightly with remaining dressing and serve.

Sift together the whole wheat flour, all-purpose flour, salt and baking soda. Add sugar and mix well. Add skim milk. Mix well. Knead into a smooth dough for 3-4 minutes or until smooth and elastic. Let the dough rise in a warm place for about 30 minutes or until doubled in bulk. Preheat oven to 350 degrees. Dust hands with flour and pat dough into an 8-inch round. Place on a greased baking sheet. Bake for about 35 minutes or until golden brown. Remove from oven and brush with lemon juice. Cool on wire rack.
Boil the potatoes with the skins on, peel them when soft and boiling hot. Mash them up well using the back of a wooden spoon and add the other ingredients. Mix well and serve hot.

Sift together dry ingredients. Beat margarine and sugars until creamy and light. Beat in eggs until well blended. Add dry ingredients alternately with applesauce, beginning and ending with dry. Drop by teaspoons onto ungreased baking sheet. Bake at 375 degrees for 8-10 minutes or until edges are lightly browned. Cool for 1 minute before removing from sheet. Yields about 4 dozen.

Preheat oven to 350 degrees F (175 degrees C).Line a baking pan with aluminum foil.Place pork shoulder on baking pan and sprinkle with salt and pepper.In a small saucepan over medium heat, combine tequila, molasses and brown sugar.Cook until sugar is melted and syrup is bubbly.Pour over pork and coat evenly.Bake in the preheated oven for 3 hours, basting pork every 30 minutes.Remove pork from oven and let sit for about 1 hour.When ready to serve, remove meat from bones and shred with two forks.Place shredded pork in a warmed tortilla and top with salsa and shredded lettuce and cheese.

Preheat oven to 350 degrees F (175 degrees C). Grease a 9×13 inch pan. Sift together the sugar and baking powder. Cut in the shortening until it resembles coarse crumbs. Stir in the milk and vanilla. Slowly beat in the eggs until the mixture is smooth. Mix in the flour. Turn into the prepared pan. Bake for 35 to 40 minutes in the preheated oven. Cool in the pan for 15 minutes before removing to wire racks to cool completely. Dust with confectioners sugar before serving.

Cook the elbow noodles. Drain. Rinse under cold water. Add the mayonnaise. Add the seasonings. Add the baby shrimp. Add the pickles. Stir until the shrimp are coated. Refrigerate for a couple of hours. Serve.

Preheat oven to 450 degrees. Spritz pan with pam. Brown chops in pan 2- 3 minutes per side. Place chops in baking dish. In same pan, saute onions in butter until tender. Stir in soup mix and water. Bring to boil. Spoon over chops. Combine mayo and cheese. Spread over chops. Bake for 10 minutes or until chops are done. Serve.

Heat the oven to 400 degrees. Grease a muffin tin. In a small bowl, combine the flour and baking powderset aside. In a medium bowl, combine the butter and both sugarsmix until creamy. Blend in the vanilla and salt. Beat the egg yolk until lightly mixed. Stir it into the butter mixturestir until mixed well. Stir the dry ingredients into the butter mixturestir until the batter is mixed well. Fold in the chocolate chips. Spoon the batter into the prepared muffin cups. Bake until the edges are golden brown, about 12 minutes. Remove from the ovencool slightly. Makes 8 mug cookies.

Peel pickling cucumbers. Slice lengthwise in thin strips. In a jar with a tight fitting lid combine vinegar, sugar, salt and mustard seeds. Add the garlic and chilies. Place the cucumbers in the jar. Put the lid on the jar and shake well. Set aside for 2 hours. Top with the tomato halves. Drizzle with olive oil. Sprinkle with the fresh ground black pepper. Serve over lettuce or arugula.

Marinate chicken in hoisin sauce for at least 2 hours. Broil chicken until cooked through. Remove from broiler. Toss together chopped scallions. Drizzle with red wine. Garnish with ginger root, garlic slices, and black pepper. Serve over chicken.
Combine chili sauce, horseradish sauce, lemon juice and Worcestershire. Adjust seasoning with salt and pepper to taste. Pour over grilled fish and shrimp and serve immediately.
Heat oil in a pan. Fry the chopped onions. Add all the other ingredients and simmer for 10 minutes. Pour over the meat or vegetables of your choice.

Preheat oven to 325 degrees f. Spray muffin tins with cooking spray or line with paper liners. In a mixing bowl, beat together spice cake mix and water until combined into a smooth batter. Spoon batter into muffin cups, filling each about 2/3 of the way full. Bake for 22-25 minutes or until a toothpick comes out clean. Cool for about 10 minutes before removing from pans. Frost with icing or vanilla yogurt frosting.

In a large bowl combine the whole wheat flour, salt and honey. Mix well. Stir in the egg yolk and milk. Turn out onto a lightly floured board and knead until smooth. Divide into 8 equal portions. Shape each portion into a ball and place on an oiled baking sheet. Let rest for 15 minutes. In a small bowl, mix together the egg white and the water to make an egg wash. Brush each ball with egg wash and bake in a preheated oven at 350 degrees F for 20 to 25 minutes or until lightly browned.

Rub the balsamic vinegar all over the chicken breasts. Sprinkle the chicken breasts with the extra virgin olive oil and the rosemary leaves. Season with the salt and coarse black pepper. Place the chicken breasts on a baking tray and bake for 25-30 minutes until cooked through. Serve with garlic cloves.

Rinse and pat dry filletsseason with salt and pepper. In a shallow dish combine milk with flakes until thick and smoothcover and refrigerate 1 hour or until ready to use. Mix the butter with the flakesset aside. Beat egg yolk with 1/2 teaspoon water to blend. Place breadcrumbs in a shallow dish. In another shallow dish combine flour with pepper and 1/4 teaspoon saltmix well. Dip each fillet in flour mixture to coat wellshake off excess. Dip in egg mixture, allowing excess to drip back into bowlshake off excess. Press into breadcrumb mixture to coatplace in a single layer in a shallow baking pan. Bake at 450 degrees F for 15 minutes or until golden brown. Turn filletsbrush with some melted butter and sprinkle with remaining 1/4 teaspoon saltbake 5 minutes more or until fish flakes easily when tested with a fork. Serve with lemon wedges.

Combine the first four ingredients in a food processor and blend to form a paste. Heat the oil in a large saute pan. Add the paste and stir-fry for 1 minute. Add the broth and the split peas and bring to a boil. Reduce the heat and simmer for 30 minutes. Stir in the almonds and apricots. Cook for 2 minutes. Makes 4 servings.

Drain beans in colander and set aside. In a large skillet, heat 2 tablespoons olive oil over medium heat. Add the garlic and rosemary and saute until the garlic is golden brown. Add the beans and stir to combine. Add the remaining 2 tablespoons of olive oil and toss to coat thoroughly. Season with salt and serve immediately.

Heat the olive oil in a large skillet over medium heat. Add the okra and cook for 5 minutes, stirring occasionally. Add the red onions, garlic, ginger, cardamom, and jalapenos and cook for 10 minutes or until the vegetables are softened and the liquid has evaporated. Season with salt and pepper to taste. Serve hot.

Cover wheat with 2 cups (500ml) cold water and soak overnight. The next day drain the wheat and add 6 cups (1500ml) boiling water and 1 1/2 cups (350ml) yogurt. Cover and let stand 12 hours or until the wheat is very soft. Drain and puree the mixture with the egg and 1 cup (250ml) boiling water. Season with the salt and 1/2 teaspoon (2ml) pepper. Put the yogurt in a large bowl and add the hot wheat mixture, stirring until well mixed and very smooth. Chill. Garnish with the onion rings and springs of mint and parsley when ready to serve. Serve with pita bread and sour cream.

Cook the beans with the white onion and garlic until they are soft. Add the avocado and blend until smooth. Add the tortilla and the chili guajillo, and cook the soup again until it thickens. Serve hot with white cheese and tortillas.

To prepare the dough, combine the flour and salt in a large bowl and toss with the shortening. Cut the shortening into the flour mixture with a pastry blender or two forks until the mixture resembles coarse meal. Add the water a tablespoon at a time until a soft dough forms. Roll the dough out on a lightly floured surface and fit into a 9-in. deep-dish pie plate. Refrigerate for 30 minutes. Preheat the oven to 375°. To prepare the filling, combine the cranberries and tapioca in a saucepan. Add the water and orange zest. Stir until the tapioca is softened and the mixture is thick. Remove from the heat and cool. Core and slice the apples. Spread the cranberry mixture in the bottom of the prepared crust. Arrange the apples in concentric circles over the mixture. Combine the flour and brown sugar and sprinkle over the apples. Dot with the butter. Bake until the filling is bubbling and the crust is golden brown, about 1 hour

Season the breasts with salt and pepper. Dip them in the flour. Heat olive oil in a large frying pan. Brown the chicken on both sides. Deglaze the pan with the white wine and add the broth. Simmer on low heat for 10 to 15 minutes. Remove the chicken from the pan. Stir the mustard into the broth and bring to a boil. Remove from heat, add the butter, and pour over the chicken. Sprinkle with sage leaves.

Preheat oven to 350 F. Peel potatoes and place them in a large saucepan of salted boiling water. Cover and cook for 20 minutes or until tender. Drain potatoes and mash them with a potato masher or food processor. Add orange juice, orange zest, brown sugar,. And nutmegblend well. Add coconutmix well. Form mixture into 1-inch balls. Place the balls on a greased cookie sheet. Bake for 10 to 12 minutes or until golden. Remove from oven and drizzle with glaze. For glaze combine the granulated sugar and ground cinnamonsprinkle over cookies. Bake for 5 minutes. Remove from oven and sprinkle with marshmallows. Bake for 2 minutes or until marshmallows are toasted.

Preheat oven to 350. In a bowl combine the sour cream, mayo and salt and pepper. Mix well. In a 9"x13" baking dish layer 1/2 the ramen. Sprinkle half the cheese on top. Pour 1/2 the sauce on top. Layer with the remaining ramen. Sprinkle with the remaining cheese. Pour the remaining sauce on top. Bake in a 350 degree oven for 30-40 minutes or until bubbly. Remove from the oven and serve. You can substitute the mushrooms for celery. You can substitute the broccoli for spinach.

Cut pears into slices. Combine oil, vinegar, sugar, and Tabasco in bowl. Stir until smooth. Add pears and toss lightly to coat. Add blue cheese and toss lightly again. Top with walnuts and serve immediately on bed of greens or on plates.

Cook onion, garlic in 2 tbsp olive oil until tender but not brown. Add tomatoes, olives and spinach. Cook 1-2 minutes until spinach wilts. Season with salt and pepper. Cook pasta until al dente. Drain, reserving 1/2 cup of pasta water. Add pasta to tomato mixture. Toss with reserved pasta water until sauce is desired consistency. Add parsley. Stir to combine.

Prepare the bread by cutting the crusts off then slicing into 1/2-inch thick slices. Cut each slice into 3 even pieces then arrange them on an oven tray lined with baking paper. Preheat the oven to 200C (400F). In a large saucepan over medium heat, melt the butter, then add the garlic. Stir for 1 minute until the garlic is cooked. Add the mushrooms and cook for 5 minutes until browned then add the lemon juice, salt and pepper. Turn the heat down and simmer for 10 minutes until the liquid has reduced by half then add the whipping cream and nutmeg and cook for 5 minutes longer. Remove from the heat and keep warm while the toasts are cooking. To prepare the toasts, place the slices on the tray then brush them lightly with the melted butter. Place them in the oven for about 3 minutes until lightly browned. To assemble the toasts, spread 1 slice of toast with a little of the mushroom sauce.

Heat oil to 375 degrees F in a large cast-iron skillet. Coat a wire rack with cooking spray. Coat a large plate with cooking spray. Cut chicken into pieces. In a shallow bowl, combine salt, black pepper and all-purpose flour. In a shallow dish, beat milk and egg together until well blendedplace on a plate. Dip the chicken into the milk mixturethen coat with the seasoned flour mixturedip again into milk mixture and then into seasoned flour mixture. Fry the coated pieces of chicken until golden brownremove the pieces from the skillet as they are cookedplace on the wire rack to drainrepeat with remaining pieces of chickenplace pieces of chicken on the platesprinkle with additional seasoned flour mixtureserve with your favorite side dishes.

Combine 1 cup of sugar and 1 cup of water in a medium saucepan. Cook over low heat, stirring constantly until the mixture is clear and the sugar has dissolved. Add the dried apricots and the 4 cups of apricots and boil for 2 minutes. Remove from the heat and set aside for 1 hour. Strain the mixture through a sieve into an ice cream freezer canister. Freeze for 1 hour. Repeat the straining process and freeze for another hour. Add the lemon juice and almond extract. Freeze overnight or for 3 hours in the ice cream maker. Serve garnished with chopped almonds.

Blend flour, powdered milk, cinnamon, baking powder and Splenda. Combine with applesauce and egg whites and stir well. Add raisins and oatmeal and mix well. Drop by spoonfuls on wax paper and let cool and harden.

Trim off excess fat from brisket. In food processor combine onion and garlicpuree until smooth. In medium bowl combine puree with chili powder, beef base, worcestershire sauce, cumin, liquid smoke, and 1/2 cup waterblend well. Place brisket in shallow roasting panpour marinade over topturn to coat thoroughly. Marinate brisket 24 hours. Heat oven to 225 degrees F. Place brisket in shallow panadd 1 cup water to pan bottom. Bake 10 hoursturn brisket every 3 hours. Remove brisketlet stand 15 minutes. Remove any excess fatdiscard. In small bowl combine 1 cup water with remaining marinadepour over brisketturn to coat thoroughly. Place brisket in shallow roasting panadd 2 cups water to pan bottom. Bake 4 hoursturn brisket every 2 hours. Remove brisketlet stand 20 minutes. Slice brisketserve warm.
Heat butter in saucepan. Stir in flour and make paste. Add water and stir well. Simmer for 15 minutes. Beat eggs and add to mixture. Cook for 10 minutes more. Serve with butter.

Boil the potatoes until tender but not mushy. Drain, peel and chop. Mix the oil, vinegar, onions, celery and seasonings in a large bowl. Add the potatoes and yogurt to the dressing mixture and toss until well mixed. Serve at room temperature or refrigerate until cold.

Preheat oven to 350 degrees F (175 degrees C). Prepare pie crust as directed on package. Layer pie crust with the bacon, breakfast sausage and swiss cheese. Whisk together eggs, sour cream and parsley. Pour egg mixture over bacon and sausage. Bake for 45 minutes in the preheated oven. Remove from oven and let stand for 5 minutes. Serve with hash brown potatoes.
Spread spaghetti sauce over each pie crust. Layer with cheese and mushrooms. Sprinkle with cooked chicken. Fold over edges of crust to create a pocket. Bake according to pie crust instructions.

Preheat oven to 400 F. Beat butter with an electric mixer on medium speed until creamy, about 1 minute. Beat in the lemon juice and zest and continue beating until well blended. Beat in the egg and blend well. Combine the flour and baking soda in a small bowl and add to the butter mixture, mixing just until blended. Drop the dough by teaspoons 2 inches apart onto lightly greased cookie sheets. Bake in the preheated oven for 6 to 7 minutes or until the edges are lightly browned. Cool on the baking sheets for 2 minutesremove to wire racks and let cool completely. Store tightly covered at room temperature. Yields about 4 dozen 3-inch cookies.

Combine the tuna, celery, onion and mayonnaise. Spread mixture onto hamburger buns. Place a slice of mozzarella cheese over the tuna mixture. Broil until cheese melts. Spread with mayonnaise if desired. Garnish with sliced tomato and lettuce.

Put water in a saucepan and add cardamom seeds, coffee and saffron. Boil the coffee until it reaches your desired strength. Add a little bit of rose water into the coffee. You can add some milk if you like too. Pour into cups.

Boil the pasta until al dente. Drain the pasta and set aside. In a large skillet over medium heat melt the butter. Stir in the flour. Slowly stir in the milk. Add in the pasta. Stir in the broccoli cheese soup and the meat. Cook until heated through. Serve hot.

Preheat grill to medium high. Prepare the marinade by combining olive oil, oregano, garlic, hot sauce and salt and pepper to taste. Place the shrimp into a resealable bag or large bowl. Add the marinade and toss. Cover and refrigerate for 20 minutes. Place the shrimp onto the grill and cook for 2 minutes per side. Remove and toss with the lemon juice and parsley. Serve immediately.

Bring whole milk, sugar, salt, and rice to a boil over high heat. Lower heat to simmer for 15 minutes. Add the butter and vanilla. Remove from heat. Let cool slightly. Beat eggs slightly and stir into the mixture. Add the cream and stir well. Pour into ramekins or individual servings cups and chill for 2 hours. Sprinkle with cinnamon before serving.

In a large stockpot, heat the oil over medium heat. Add onion, celery and carrotcook and stir until onion is softened and celery is tender. Stir in stewed tomatoes and broth. Bring to a boil. Reduce heat and add thyme, salt and cayenne pepper. Cover and simmer for 45 minutes. Add the chicken breasts to the pot. Simmer covered for 20 minutes or until chicken is cooked. Serve over cooked egg noodles.

Slice the tomatoes in 1/4 inch thick slices. Place them in a large glass bowl. Combine all the remaining ingredients and pour over the tomatoes. Toss to coat. Cover the bowl and chill overnight. The next day, turn the marinade over the tomatoes and chill an additional day. The third day, serve at room temperature.

Combine crushed pineapple with apricot brandy in a small saucepan over medium heat. Simmer until most of the liquid is absorbed. Add chutney and ginger. Cool. In a separate bowl, combine the cheeses, margarine and remaining apricot brandy. Beat until smooth. Stir in apricot mixture. Serve with crackers.

Cook corn as directed on package, drain and set aside. Heat oil in a large skillet over med-hi heat and brown beef with onion until browned. Drain fat. Stir in seasoning, sour cream, flour and sugar. Bring to a boil over med-hi heat, stirring constantly until thickened. Stir in corn. Spoon into an 11 x 7 inch baking dish coated with cooking spray. Sprinkle with cheese. Bake uncovered for 25-30 minutes or until bubbly. Serve warm.
Wash broccoli well. Combine all ingredients in a large bowl and toss to mix well. Store in refrigerator. Serve chilled.

In the bowl of an electric mixer, place 1 1/4 cups warm water, oil and honey. Beat with the paddle attachment for about 30 seconds or until well blended. In the mixer, place 1 1/2 cups warm water. Sprinkle with yeast and let stand for about 5 minutes or until yeast is dissolved. Add salt and maple syrup. Add the dry ingredients and mix until the dough is smooth. Place in a lightly greased bowl and turn the dough over until coated with oil. Cover with plastic wrap and let rise in a warm place until the dough has doubled in bulk. Knead the dough on a lightly floured surface and shape into a 12 x 10 inch rectangle. Place the dough in a greased 9 x 13 inch baking dish. Let rise in a warm place until doubled in bulk. Preheat the oven to 375 degrees F. Bake for 40 minutes or until golden brown. Sprinkle the top of the loaf with raisins. Bake for 5

Cook the sausage until it is no longer pink. Drain and set aside. In the same pan used for the sausage, heat the olive oil. Add the zucchini and summer squash and saute for 5 minutes or until they start to get tender. Add the onion and saute for 2 more minutes or until the vegetables are soft. Stir in the pasta sauce. Bring the mixture to a boil. Reduce the heat to low. Cook the pasta for 5 minutes or until it is tender but still firm to the bite. Drain the pasta and stir it into the vegetables. Heat the soup until it is hot. Ladle the soup into bowls and serve immediately.
Combine all the ingredients in a large bowl. Pour into a 9 x 5 inch loaf pan. Bake for 1 1/2 hours at 325 degrees F (165 degrees C). Let stand for 10 minutes before cutting into slices.

Heat the oil in a pan. Add the garlic and fry until golden. Add the stock and stir to combine. Add the bread cubes. Season with salt and pepper. Beat the egg lightly in a bowl. Stir the egg into the soup. Bring to the boil. Serve in deep bowls.

Place potatoes in a large pot. Add cold water to cover the potatoes by 2 inches. Bring to a boil over high heat. Reduce heat to lowcover and simmer until potatoes are tender when pierced with a fork, about 15 minutes. Drain potatoes in a colander over a bowl, reserving the potato water. Return the potatoes to the pot and mash well. Stir in the milk, sour cream and butter until smooth. Stir in the cheeses until melted and smooth. Add the chives and season to taste with the salt and pepper. Serve immediately.

Toss cooked chicken with celery, onion, and lemon juice in a large bowl until well mixed. Stir in grapes and mandarin oranges. Cover and refrigerate until ready to serve. Serve over romaine lettuce leaves or in a sandwich roll with the lettuce leaves. Sprinkle top of sandwiches with almonds.

Cream the butter and brown sugar together in a medium sized bowl. Add the eggs and vanilla essence. Mix well. Sift the flour and baking powder into the mixture and mix until well combined. Fold in the milo and chocolate chips. Roll into small balls and place on a lined baking tray. Flatten slightly with a fork and bake in the preheated oven for 12 minutes or until golden. Cool on a wire rack before storing in an airtight container.
Add all ingredients in a blender. Blend until smooth. Serve immediately.

In a large bowl, combine powdered sugar, marshmallow cream, vanilla and caramels. Stir until well blended. Shape into 2 logs on wax paper and refrigerate for 2 hours or until firm. Combine the chocolate chips and margarine in a small saucepan over low heat, stirring constantly until melted and smooth. Dip each log into the chocolate mixtureplace on wax paper and refrigerate until chocolate is set. Roll logs in pecans before serving. Makes 2 logs.

Thaw spinach. Drain well. Saute onions and garlic in 2 tbsp. melted butter. Mix together eggs, cottage cheese, flour, and the remaining 3 tbsp. butter. Add the sauteed onions and garlic. Season with salt and pepper. Pour into a 9 x 9 inch baking dish. Bake at 350 degrees for 1 hour.
In a food processor or blender combine all the ingredients except the parsley. Blend until smooth. Refrigerate until ready to serve. Serve with crudites. Garnish with parsley.

Rinse the codfish under cold running water for 2 minutes. Pat dry with paper towels and set aside. Slice the bacon into 1-inch pieces and cook in a skillet over medium heat until crisp. Add the onion and cook for 3 minutes, stirring occasionally until the onion is softened and transparent. Add the green peppers and cook for 5 minutes, stirring occasionally. Add the tomatoes and cook for another 3 minutes or until the tomatoes have softened and the mixture is dry. Add the codfish and cook for 2 minutes or until the fish is cooked through, breaking it up with a fork. Add the scallions and cook for another minute or until the scallions are softened but still have a bite to them. Remove the mixture from the heat and keep warm while the eggs are being prepared. In a large mixing bowl, beat together the eggs and milk. Season the mixture with the black pepper and salt. Heat a large skillet over medium high heat until the butter melts. Add the egg mixture and cook until the eggs are set. Serve immediately with the codfish mixture. Serve on hot buttered toast

Cut the eggplants in half lengthwise, and cut each half lengthwise into 1/2-inch slices. Place on a parchment-lined baking sheet. Bake for 20 minutes. Heat the oil in a small skillet over medium-high heat. Add the garlic and cook until fragrant, about 30 seconds. Stir in the chile paste. Cook for 1 minute. Whisk in the soy sauce, palm sugar, and water. Pour over the cooked eggplant. Sprinkle with the salt. Let cool for 15 minutes. Add the lime juice. Serve with the cilantro and scallions. Serve with sliced bread or crackers.

Clean and trim the ends of the asparagus. Peel the mushrooms if desired. Arrange the mushrooms on a lightly greased shallow baking pan in a single layer. Arrange the asparagus around the mushrooms. Drizzle the olive oil over all the vegetables. Sprinkle with the coarse salt and freshly ground black pepper. Roast for about 15 minutes or until the mushrooms are tender and the asparagus is crisp tender. Serve immediately sprinkled with the balsamic vinegar.

In a small bowl, combine the first four ingredients. In a small pan over medium heat, bring the water to a boil. Remove from heat. Stir in the flaked coconut and the condensed milk. Stir until the mixture is smooth. Add the sweetened condensed milk. Stir until well blended. Serve warm with the toasted coconut on top.

Heat oil in saucepan over medium heat. Add leek. Stir-fry until lightly golden. Add rice. Stir-fry until rice is opaque. Add wine. Cook until most of the liquid is absorbed. Add broth. Cook until most of the liquid is absorbed. Add chicken. Cook until chicken is cooked through. Stir in saffron. Cook 1 minute. Stir in peas. Add lemon zest, lemon juice, and parsley. Season with salt and pepper. Serve.

Preheat oven to 350 degrees F. Saute onions and celery in a large skillet with butter over medium heat until onions are tender. Add rice to panstir and cook for 1 minute. Stir in soup, broth, salt and pepper. Cook on low heat until rice is tender. Cook chicken breasts in a shallow pan with water to cover for 20 to 25 minutes until no longer pink in the middle. Drainadd to rice mixture. Mix well. Spoon mixture into a 9x13-inch glass casserole dishsprinkle with cheese. Cover with foilbake 15 minutes. Remove foilbake for 10 minutes more to brown top. Serves 6 to 8.

Cream together the butter, sugar and eggs until smooth. Sift in the self-raising flour. Stir until just combined. Add the lemon rind. Turn into a greased loaf pan. Bake in a preheated oven at 160 degrees celcious for 40-45 minutes. Turn out onto a wire rack to cool. Dust with icing sugar. Serve with whipped cream or creme fraiche.

Cook noodles in boiling salted water according to package directions. Drain. Heat oil in large non-stick skillet over medium-high heat. Brown beef in oil, stirring to crumble. Stir in onion, green pepper, garlic and crushed tomatoes. Cook and stir 2 minutes. Stir in tomato pastecook 1 minute. Stir in salt and pepper. Add waterbring to boil. Cook 5 minutes or until thickened, stirring occasionally. Stir in noodlescook 1 minute or until heated through. Sprinkle with cheese. Serve immediately.
Cook the noodles according to the package directions. Drain well. In a large bowl, combine the cooked noodles with the herbs. Add the butter and toss to coat.

Mix together flaxseed meal, almond flour, splenda granular, and cinnamon. Add water and mix thoroughly. Roll out to desired thickness. Cut into shapes with cookie cutter. Place on ungreased cookie sheet. Bake at 250 degrees for about 15 minutes or until golden brown. Cool on wire racks. Enjoy!

Mix together all ingredients except the chicken. Place chicken in a shallow dish, pour the marinade over the top. Marinate for at least 2 hours or overnight. Place the thighs on the grill and baste with the marinade. Grill until cooked through (160°).

Heat oven to 375. Mix soup & milk in large bowl. Cut chicken into small piecesadd to soup mixture along with onion, broccoli & garlic salt. Combine well. Place 3/4 cup soup mixture on bottom of 9x13x2 baking dish. Combine rice & butterspread evenly over soup mixture. Sprinkle with cheese. Add remaining soup mixture over top. Bake for 20 minutes or until golden brown.

Boil potatoes in a large saucepan of boiling water until tender. Drain and cool slightly. In a large bowl combine sour cream and mayonnaise. Add celery, onion, garlic and salt and pepper. Fold in the diced potato. Refrigerate until serving. Garnish with additional dill.

Heat the butter over medium heat in a large pot or skillet. Add the shallots and garlic. Stir frequently until the shallots are soft. Add the white beans to the pot and stir. Pour in the vinegar and add the mustard. Stir to blend. Add the olive oil and stir. Season with salt and pepper. Transfer the contents of the pot to a serving bowl. Garnish with parsley. Makes 4-6 servings.

Slice the mushrooms thinly. Add the chicken stock to a saucepan. Stir in the ginger. Add the mushrooms and cook for about 10 minutes. Add the water. Bring to a boil. Add the noodles. Cook until done. Add the soy sauce. Serve in soup bowls. Garnish with spinach. Squeeze on the lime juice.

Heat dressing over low heat until hot and bubbly. In a large skillet over medium high heat, brown the sausage, breaking it up as it cooks. Add the squash and continue cooking until the squash is just tender and the sauce has thickened. Remove from heat. Serve on top of the bread with the oregano leaves sprinkled on top. Top with parmesan cheese.

In a saucepan over medium heat melt butter. Add onions and cook until tender. Add water and bring to a boil. Add rice, bay leaf and seasonings. Reduce heat to low. Cover and simmer 20 minutes until rice is tender. Add frozen peas. Cover and simmer until heated through. Stir in parsley. Serve.

Preheat oven to 350. Cut butternut squash in half lengthwise. Remove seeds. Spray with cooking spray. Season with salt and pepper. Place in baking dish cut side down. Bake for 40 to 60 minutes. In saut pan heat oil. Add rosemary. Add onion. Cook for 2 minutes. Add rice. Cook for 1 minute. Add stock. Cook on low heat 10 minutes. Add garlic. Cook 3 minutes. Stir in cream cheese. Add balsamic vinegar. Add salt and pepper. Add butternut squash. Stir until blended. Top with parmesan cheese. Serve in butternut squash halves. Yields 2 servings. 3 points per serving.

In large bowl beat eggs and sweetened condensed milk until smooth. Stir in butter and pecans. Pour into 9" graham cracker pie crust. Refrigerate 4 hours or until firm. Drizzle with caramel ice cream topping and serve.

Wash and rinse lentils and combine with 2 quarts of water and 2 teaspoons of salt. Bring to a boil and reduce heat and simmer until lentils are tender. Drain and set aside. In a large skillet, cook ground beef and garlic cloves over medium heat until beef is no longer pinkdrain well and stir in 2 cups of water and ketchup. Stir in lentils and mustard until heated through and well blended. Stir in vinegar. Serve over hot cooked rice. Serves 4 to 6 as a side dish.

Preheat oven to 400f. Boil potatoes until tenderdrain and return to pan. In a small bowl mix sour cream with soup and add to pantoss lightly to coat. Transfer to a 1-1/2 qt. casserole. Mix butter with cheesespread over top. Bake, uncovered, until cheese is golden brown, 15 to 20 minutes. Makes 6 servings.
Sprinkle both sides of each tuna steak with jerk seasoning. Heat a grill pan over medium heat. Cook until fish flakes easily. Brush fish lightly with lemon or lime juice. Serve over rice.

Soak the beans overnight. Drain them and put them into the slow cooker. Add the sugar, catsup, barbecue sauce, dry mustard, bacon. Mix it all up and cook. The recipe is from Margaret Lefever. She was born in 1919. She is my husbands mothers sister. Her cooking was always so good. The beans were wonderful.

Cut the oranges in half to remove the pith from the middle. Remove the seeds and cut into 1 inch chunks. Chop the romaine lettuce. In a large bowl, combine the orange chunks, romaine and avocado. Add the balsamic vinegar. Toss to coat. Serve immediately.

In a small bowl mix together the cream of chicken soup and milk. Pour the cream of chicken soup and milk mixture into a crock pot. In a small bowl mix together the italian seasoned breadcrumbs and the garlic powder and onion powder. In a small bowl combine the swiss cheese and deli ham. Spread a little bit of the cream of chicken soup mixture on the inside of each chicken breast. Then place a piece of the swiss and deli ham on each chicken breast. Roll up each chicken breast and then dip in the italian seasoned bread crumb mixture. Place each chicken breast in the crock pot. Bake on low for 5 hours or on high for 2 1/2 hours. Enjoy!

Place broccoli florets in a large bowl and add almonds. In a medium bowl, whisk together the juice and zest of the orange. Add sugar and whisk again. Add the dressing to the broccoli and toss well. Add the onions and mandarin orange sections and toss again. Refrigerate until serving.

Pre heat oven to 180c. Grease a 20cm round tin. Melt the butter and chocolate in a heatproof bowl over a saucepan of simmering water. Remove from the heat. Add the eggs, one at a time, whisking well after each addition. Sift together the gluten-free flour, baking powder and salt. Fold into the chocolate mixture with the syrup until smooth. Pour into the prepared tin. Bake for 25-30 minutes until firm to the touch. Cool in the tin. Cut into wedges and serve with thickened cream and raspberries.
