Drain the chick-peas and mash to a fine paste. Add the remaining ingredients and mix well. Shape into 24 oval croquettes. Heat the oil and fry the croquettes in small batches until golden brown. Remove and drain. Sprinkle with lemon juice. Serve with salad.
Slice apples thinly or leave whole. Melt butter and brown sugar in a pan, then add spices and raisins and cook until tender. Serve over pancakes or waffles.

Spread bread on one side with chutney. Top with a slice of cheddar cheese and then ham and pickled onion. Cover with the remaining slice of bread. Toast until golden brown. Makes 1 ploughman s lunch style toasted sandwich.

Boil white asparagus for 20 minutes, drain and let cool. Cut the white asparagus into pieces of 1 inch long. Now mix the butter with the eggs and season with salt. Spread the egg mixture on the white asparagus. Sprinkle with chopped ham or bacon and grill until the ham is crisp and the top is golden brown. Serve warm.

Combine warm water with oil and sugar and allow to sit for 5 minutes. Add dry active yeast and stir well with wooden spoon until dissolved. Stir in salt and allow to sit for 10 minutes or until dough is very foamy and has a very strong yeast aroma. Stir in the eggs and mix well. Add the flour one cup at a time. Beat mixture with wooden spoon for a couple of minutes or until a ball is formed. Cover and allow to rise until doubled in size. Punch down and allow to rise until doubled again. Punch down and shape into desired loaves and allow to rise until doubled again. Bake at 350 for 30-40 minutes or until browned and firm to the touch.
Slice tomatoes in half. Mix together yogurt, mayonnaise, and lemon zest. Season with salt and pepper. Add capers and lemon juice. Spread sauce on tomato halves. Makes 2 servings.

Preheat oven to 350f. Grease 9x13-inch pan or line with parchment paper. Melt butter in a saucepan over medium-low heat. Stir in sugar and cook until mixture just starts to bubble. Pour into prepared pan. Sprinkle with amaretto, ground almonds, cocoa powder and walnuts. Bake until edges are set and center is still soft, about 15 minutes. Let cool completely before cutting into squares or rectangles.

Cook beef in skillet, drain. Add onions and cook until tender. Add zucchini and cook until tender-crisp. Drain beef mixture in a colander to remove excess liquid. Combine meat mixture with bisquick mix. Add milk and eggsmix well. Pour into an ungreased 9-inch pie plate. Sprinkle with italian blend cheese. Bake for 40-45 minutes or until knife inserted in center comes out clean. Makes 4 servings. Serve with tomato or pasta salad.

Cook and mash potatoes with the butter, salt, milk and pepper. Let cool until warm. Saute bacon until crisp, crumble it into the potatoes. Mix in the egg yolks, then the flour. Stir in the cheese. Divide the mixture into 12 equal parts. Roll the parts into balls, dip in the egg whites, roll in the breadcrumbs and fry in deep fat until golden brown.

Combine buttermilk, mustard, garlic, pepper and sage and rosemary. Soak the chicken breasts for 15 minutes. Remove the breasts from the marinade, drain well, then dredge them in the cracker crumbs and parmesan cheese mixture. Place the breasts on a rack on a baking sheet or baking dish and bake for 10 minutes at 400 degrees. Turn the breasts over and bake for another 15 minutes at 400 degrees or until the chicken is cooked through. Serve with rice and vegetables.

Preheat oven to 350 degrees f. In a small bowl combine the sugar, ground cinnamon, nuts, and butter. Place on bottom of pan. Unfold biscuits and separate. Place biscuits on top of mixture. Bake 15 minutes or until done. Cool 5 minutes before serving.

Preheat oven to 250 degrees F (120 degrees C). In a large bowl, beat together egg white and sour cream until light and fluffy. Gently stir in sugar and cocoa until well combined. Fold in coffee granules and vanilla. Pour mixture into a lightly greased 8x8 inch baking pan. Bake in the preheated oven until set, about 25 minutes. Serve warm or cold with whipped topping.

Remove stems from figs, cut in half lengthwise, and arrange in serving bowl. Combine wine, orange juice and honey in small saucepanbring just to boiling over low heat. Simmer 1 minuteremove from heatcool completely. Pour Marsala mixture in bowl with figstoss gently. Garnish with mint leaves, if desired. Serve with crème fraiche on side.

Place 1/2 cup margarine in a 2-quart casserole dish. Bring 2 cups water to a boil in a medium saucepan. Add 1 cup rice to boiling water. Cook for 25 minutes. Drain. Stir rice into casserole dish. Mix 1 cup water with 1 cup milk and 1/4 cup onion soup mix. Add to casserole. Bake uncovered for 30 minutes or until heated through. Serve.

Heat oven to 400 degrees. Combine oats, cinnamon and nuts. Set aside. In a large bowl combine filling and oat mixture. Pour into a greased 9x13 inch pan. Crumble topping over the top of the fruit. Bake 40 minutes or until lightly browned and bubbly. Cool. Makes 8 servings.

In a small bowl, combine the whipping cream with the sour cream and chicken basemix well. In another small bowl combine the clarified butter with the flour, making a pasteadd the paste to the whipping cream mixture and whisk thoroughlybring the mixture to a boilcook for one minuteadd the jalapenos and jalapeno juicemix wellseason with salt and pepperremove from the heatadd the monterey jack and cheddar cheese blendmix thoroughlyserve immediately over chips or with your favorite dishstore in the refrigerator for up to two weeks.

Melt butter and add flour and baking powder and mix well. Cut almonds in half lengthwise and place in mixture and stir well. Lightly beat eggs and stir into mixture and mix well. Dip each half almond in mixture and place on cookie sheet and bake at 400 degrees for about 10 minutes. Remove from oven and place on rack and allow to cool completely and then store in airtight containers or bags.
Cut tempeh into 1/2 inch cubes. In large bowl, combine all ingredients, tossing well. Let stand 10 minutes before serving. Yields about 5 cups. Serve with crackers or bread. Makes 4 to 6 servings.

In a medium bowl, combine cocoa powder, granulated sugar, vegetable oil, eggs, pure vanilla extract. Stir well. Add flour, baking powder, and salt. Stir well. Pour batter into a 9 by 12-inch pan that has been sprayed with a baking spray or a 9-inch springform pan that has been sprayed with a baking spray. Bake for 20 to 25 minutes, or until puffy. Cool completely. Sprinkle with powdered sugar and press down gently with your hands. Let sit for 30 minutes before cutting.

Brown sausages in a large skillet with a little olive oil and then set aside. Saute the mixed veggies and onion in the same skillet until the veggies are soft. Add a little water to the pan to help the vegetables get soft. Sprinkle the flour over the veggies and stir until it is completely blended in. Add the curry powder and mix well. Add the sausages and stir to combine. Cover with a lid for a few minutes and then serve over rice or potatoes.

In a large pot of boiling, salted water cook the pasta to al dente and drain. Return to the pot and melt in the butter. Toss to coat. Whisk together the eggs, milk, hot sauce, salt, pepper, and mustard. Stir into the pasta and add the cheese. Over low heat continue to stir for 3 minutes or until creamy.

In a medium skillet over medium heat, melt 3 tablespoons of the butter. Add the snow peas and the tiny peas and cook for 4 minutes or until the snow peas are tender-crisp, stirring frequently. Stir in the chives and sprinkle with the remaining 1 tablespoon of butter. Season with salt and pepper to taste.

Preheat oven to 350 degrees F. Line an 8x8x2 inch baking pan with foil and grease the foil with cooking spray. Melt the butter with the brown sugar and cocoa in a 3-quart heavy saucepan over low heat, stirring occasionally. Remove the pan from the heat. Stir in the sugar. Whisk in the eggs and vanilla. Sift the flour and salt over the mixture and stir until just combined. Spread the batter in the pan. Bake the brownies until they are set and a toothpick inserted in the center comes out clean, 20 to 25 minutes. Cool on a rack. Remove the brownies from the pan using the foil and cool completely. Cut the brownies into 16 squares.

Beat butter, white and brown sugars until creamy. Beat in vanilla and egg until smooth. Add dry ingredients and mix well. Stir in nuts and oats. Drop by teaspoonfuls onto baking sheet. Bake at 350 for 8 minutes. Cool on wire rack. Makes about 4 dozen.

Prepare jell-o according to package directions. Pour into mold. Refrigerate for 3-4 hours or until jell-o is firm. Cream the softened cream cheese with the cola. Blend in the cherries and nuts. Spread over jell-o. Refrigerate for 1 hour or until set. Garnish with nuts.

Prepare noodles according to package directions. Add frozen broccoli for the last 3 minutes. Drain noodles. In same pot add soup, half-and-half, butter and garlic. Simmer for 5 minutes. Add noodles. Stir until thoroughly mixed. Sprinkle with parmesan cheese. Serve immediately.

In a skillet over medium heat, heat olive oil. Add fish and cook for 3 minutes per side or until opaque and flakes easily. Add parsley and crushed red pepper and stir for 30 seconds. Add tomatoes and cook for 1 minute more. Add olives and capers and cook for 30 seconds more. Stir in garlic and wine. Cook until fish is cooked through. Serve immediately.

In a small sauce pan, combine all ingredients. Bring to a boil. Reduce heat to a simmer until the sauce is thickened. Remove from heat. Set aside. In a medium sauce pan, bring salted water to a boil. Add shrimp. Cook for about 4 minutes or until cooked through. Remove the shrimp and place on a plate. Pour glaze over the shrimp. Serve over rice or pasta.

In a medium saucepan add all the ingredients except the rice and stir. Cover and bring to a boil. Lower heat and simmer for 30 minutes or until beans are tender. Add rice and stir. Sprinkle with salsa and serve.

Boil the new potatoes until tender. Drain, cool. In a large bowl combine the potatoes, celery, onion and Italian dressing. Add the eggs and sour cream and mix well. Add the mayonnaise and dry mustard and blend. Add horseradish for flavor and serve on your favorite bread.

Preheat oven to 350 f. Peel potatoes and cut in half lengthwise. Place cut side down in a baking pan. Bake for 45 minutes or until tender when tested with a fork. Combine yogurt, tomato, olives, herbs and pepper in a bowl. Top baked potatoes with yogurt mixture and bake 5 minutes or until heated through.

Butter two slices of bread. Top one slice with mozzarella slices. Top with roasted red peppers. Top the other slice of bread with mozzarella slices. Top with roasted red peppers. Put in skillet over medium heat. When the butter melts, turn down heat to low. Put the other slice of bread on top. Cook until the bread is done. Remove from the heat. Top with parmesan. Sprinkle with basil. Serve immediately.

In large stockpot, melt the bacon drippings over medium heat. Saute the onion until translucent. Add the garlic cloves and saute until fragrant. Add the frozen beans to the pot and stir until evenly coated. Pour the chicken broth over the beans. Bring the liquid to a simmer. Reduce the heat to low, cover and simmer for 12 minutes or until the vegetables are tender. Remove the cover, add the bacon, salt and pepper and tabasco sauce (if using). Toss until evenly blended. Serve immediately or at room temperature.

In a large skillet, cook onion until tender. Add potatoes and cook until tender. Add seasonings to taste. Mix in stuffing. Spread in a 1-quart casserole dish. Bake in a preheated 350 degree oven for 20 minutes or until lightly browned. Top with cheese and pimento. Bake an additional 5 minutes or until cheese is melted and browned. Serves 4.

Boil perogies in salted water until tender. Melt olive oil in large skillet over medium-high heat. Add bacon and cook until crisp. Add onions and garlic and cook until tender. Add cabbage and water. Cover and cook until tender. Season with salt and fresh dill. Add perogies and toss to blend.

Rinse the sole under cold running water. Pat dry with paper towels. Place each fillet on a separate plate. Combine the lemon juice, butter, sherry, soy sauce, parsley and egg yolk in a small bowl. Spoon the mixture evenly on top of each fillet. Let stand at room temperature for about 1 hour. Heat the oven to 400. Bake the sole uncovered for 10 minutes.

Cream butter and sugar together until fluffy. Beat in egg and vanilla extract until well blended. Combine flour, baking soda and salt in a small bowl and add to creamed mixture. Divide the dough in half and add in candy bars. Shape into balls and place 2 inches apart on an ungreased baking sheet. Bake at 350 degrees for 8-10 minutes or until golden brown. Cool for 5 minutes before removing from cookie sheet to wire rack.

Wash oranges well. Cut in 1-inch chunks. Cover with cold water. Let soak 30 minutes. Drain well, saving water. Combine water, egg, and 1 cup of the drained orange juice. Beat until smooth. Add sugar and remaining juice. Blend thoroughly. Sift together flour, baking powder, and salt. Gradually add to fruit mixture. Stir only until combined. Pour into greased loaf pans. Sprinkle top of loaf with nuts. Bake at 350-degrees for 1 hour. Makes 2 loaves.

In a large pot, heat the coconut milk until almost boiling. Add the eggplants. Cook and stir until the eggplants are soft. Add the curry paste and the fish sauce. Cook and stir until fragrant. Add the chicken and cook and stir until done. Add the sugar, lime leaves and thai chiles. Cook and stir until well blended. Serve over the hot pasta.

Preheat oven to 350 degrees f. Wash potatoes well. Place in a large baking pan and cover with fresh cold water. Bring to a boil over high heat. Cook about 15 minutes or until a knife easily pierces the center of the potato. Drain in a colander. Place potatoes in a large bowl and mash with a potato masher. Stir in remaining ingredients with a wooden spoon until smooth. Place in a baking dish sprayed with cooking spray. Bake for 20 minutes or until bubbly.
In a dutch oven or similar pot, brown hamburger and mushrooms. Add remaining ingredients except for the noodles and mix. Simmer until noodles are tender. Serve hot. Serves 4 to 6.

Sift together flour, baking powder and salt. In a mixing bowl cream together sugar and butter. Beat in egg and milk until smooth. Stir in dry ingredients. Fold in walnuts and olives and chopped pimiento. Bake in a greased 8x4x2 inch loaf pan at 325 for 1 hour and 15 minutes or until a toothpick comes out clean. Makes 1 loaf.

In large bowl beat cream cheese until smooth. Add powdered sugar one cup at a time until mixture is soft but not runny. Beat in milk until blended. Add vanilla and cool whip. Blend until smooth. Fold in oreo cookies. Place in pie crust, top with more oreos. Chill until ready to serve.

Preheat oven to 350 degrees F (175 degrees C). Grease 9x13 inch baking dish. Place bread in bottom of dish. Melt butter in large mixing bowl over low heat. Stir in eggs and vanilla essence until well blended. Stir in sugar until mixed. Add cinnamon and nutmeg. Pour over bread in baking dish. Sprinkle with chocolate chips. Bake uncovered in the preheated oven until center is set, about 30 minutes.

Cook the pasta according to package directions and drain. In a small bowl, toss the sauce, tomatoes and bacon until well combined and the bacon is evenly distributed throughout the tomatoes. Add the cooked pasta and toss to coat evenly. Top with basil and pepper before serving.

In a large bowl, beat margarine with essence until smooth and creamy. Add golden syrup and beat until combined. Fold in coconut, rice bubbles and dark chocolate chips. Roll into 16 small balls. Place on a tray. Chill in a cool place for 1 hour or until firm. Melt dark chocolate in a small saucepan over low heat. Dip each ball in chocolate, then place on a tray lined with baking paper to set. Repeat with remaining balls. Store in an airtight container in a cool place for up to 1 week.

Combine ricotta cheese, 3 eggs, flour, parmesan cheese and seasonings to taste. Knead until smooth. Cover and set aside for 30 minutes. Roll into 2 inch balls. Boil in lightly salted water until they float to the top. Drain and add to your favorite sauce.

Cook sugar and cornstarch together in medium saucepan over medium heat until boiling. Add half-and-half and butter. Boil 1 minute or until thickened. Remove from heatstir in brown sugar and vanilla. Stir in ground cinnamon. Spoon into crust. Refrigerate until firm. Garnish with whipped cream and sprinkle with additional ground cinnamon.

Peaches are best when ripe for this recipe. Cut the peaches into slices and blend in a blender until smooth. Add ice cream and brown sugar. Puree until smooth. Stir in salt and vanilla. Pour into glasses and serve immediately or cover and place in the refrigerator until ready to serve.

In a mixing bowl, combine braunschweiger with cream cheese and spread evenly in a shallow baking dish. In a separate bowl, combine green onions and milk. Blend in worcestershire sauce and garlic powder. Pour over meat mixture and bake in a preheated oven (325 F.) for 45 minutes or until well heated. Serve with crackers.

In a large skillet brown the potato and onions in the olive oil and cook until golden. Add the smoked bacon and continue cooking until crispy. Add garlic powder and continue cooking for a few more minutes. Season the mixture with paprika and salt and pepper. In a separate bowl whisk the eggs and cream together. Add the potato and bacon mixture and mix well. Pour the mixture into a greased casserole dish. Bake at 350 degrees for 45 minutes. Garnish with shaved cheese and serve with corn chips.

Sift together bisquick and 1/2 cup sugar. Cut in margarine or butter until mixture resembles coarse crumbs. Add beaten egg and enough milk to make a soft dough. Turn onto lightly floured board or counter. Knead dough until smooth. Roll or pat into a rectangle about 1/2 inch thick. Cut into squares and place on greased baking sheet. Bake at 400 degrees for 8-10 minutes or until lightly browned. Sprinkle with additional 1/2 cup sugar. Makes 2 dozen cookies.

In a medium saucepan over medium heat, melt the vegetable oil. Add the onion and carrot and cook 4-5 minutes. Stir in oregano and cook for another minute. Add the quinoa and broth and bring to a boil. Cover and reduce the heat to low. Simmer 15 minutes or until the liquid is absorbed. Remove from the heat. Stir in peas and lemon juice. Sprinkle with black pepper and serve.

Mix together first 5 ingredients. Shape into patties. Brown patties. Add soup, water, mushrooms. Cover and simmer 10 minutes. Remove patties. Stir in cheese. Cover until cheese is melted. Serve over toast.

Combine the water, peas and meat in a large saucepan. Season with the thyme, marjoram, seasoning and salt. Bring to the boil, reduce the heat and simmer for 45 minutes. Add the cornflour and stir well. Cook for a further few minutes until the mixture thickens. Meanwhile, melt the butter in a pan. Add the cornflour and stir well. Stir in the milk, bring to the boil then add the parsley. Serve the meat mixture in a bowl topped with the sauce. Garnish with parsley.

In a large frying pan melt butter over medium heat. Stir in onionscook until tender but not brown, about 5 minutes. Stir in flourcook, stirring constantly, until bubbly, about 1 minute. Stir in cake flourcook, stirring constantly, until mixture thickens and begins to turn golden, about 1 minute. Stir in curry powdercook, stirring constantly, until mixture is fragrant, about 2 minutes. Stir in cider vinegarcook until mixture is smooth, about 2 minutes. Stir in water and bring to a simmer. Cook until mixture thickens, stirring frequently, about 5 minutes. Stir in sugarcook until sugar is dissolved, about 2 minutes. Stir in eggscook until mixture thickens slightly, about 1 minute. Season with salt and pepper to taste.
Beat egg whites until stiff. Add in egg, milk and scallions. Heat skillet until hot. Pour in egg mixture. Fold in shrimp and swiss cheese. Cook until done.

Peel and cube the butternut squash. In large stockpot over high heat, combine the squash with the vegetable broth and bring to boil. Reduce heat and simmer for 35 to 40 minutes, or until the squash is very tender. Add the onion and cook for 1 minute. Add the carrots and cook for 2 minutes. Remove from heat. In small bowl, combine the baking soda and the 1 tablespoon of water. Stir into the mixture. Season to taste with cinnamon and ground black pepper. Ladle into bowls and serve garnished with fresh cilantro if desired.

Brush fish on both sides with vegetable oil. Combine orange juice, tomato paste, vinegar and brown sugar in small saucepan. Bring to a boil, then simmer until thickened. Add garlic cloves, orange zest, and ground ginger. Continue simmering for 2 minutes. Add hot red pepper flakes to taste. Remove from heat. Arrange fish on grill and brush with half the sauce. Grill until fish is done through. Brush remaining sauce over fish. Serve immediately.

Preheat oven to 400 degrees. Wash potatoes well. Cut in half or quarters (depending upon size). Toss with olive oil, garlic and salt. Place potato halves in baking sheet. Bake for 15-20 minutes or until browned and tender.

Preheat oven to 425 degrees F (220 degrees C). Mix together basil, butter, garlic cloves, and hot sauce in a small bowl. Season salmon with salt and pepper to tasteplace the fish in a glass baking dish. Pour the hot sauce mixture over the fish and bake for 20 minutes in the preheated oven. Serve with lemon wedges.

Pour water and white sugars into a heavy bottom saucepan and stir to dissolve the sugar. Add the remaining ingredients and stir well to combine. Bring to a boil and cook for 1 minute. Remove from the heat and stir in the nuts. Pour the mixture onto a silpat lined baking sheet and spread out evenly. Place in the oven for 30 minutes and then turn off the heat and let the nuts dry in the oven for an additional 2 to 3 hours. Store in an air tight container.

In a medium saucepan combine the brown sugar, heavy cream and salt. Heat over medium heat until it comes to a rolling boil. Boil for one minute then remove from heat. Add in the almonds and stir to combine. Pour mixture into a foil lined jelly roll pan and spread out evenly. Cool at room temperature for at least one hour then cut into squares.

Heat olive oil in a large heavy-bottomed stockpot over medium heat. Add the mushrooms, onion, and garlicsaute for about 10 minutes to soften. Add the herbes de provence. Cook for 2 minutes longer. Add the vegetable broth and tomatoesbring to a boil. Reduce to a simmer and cook for 5 minutes. Add the white wine and cook for 3 minutes longer. Stir in the beansseason with salt and pepper to taste. Simmer for 5 minutes longer. Serve topped with a sprinkling of fresh chopped herbs, if desired.

Preheat oven to 425 degrees F (220 degrees C). Beat together eggs and water in a small bowl. In a large bowl combine bacon, spinach, cheese, black pepper, and eggs. Unroll pizza crust onto a lightly greased baking sheet. Spread with tomato sauce. Top with cheese mixture. Sprinkle with parmesan cheese. Bake for 10 to 12 minutes in the preheated oven, or until crust is lightly browned and cheese is melted. Cut into wedges to serve.

Preheat oven to 350 degrees F (175 degrees C). Grease a 13x9x2 inch baking pan with vegetable oil. In a large bowl, combine the cake mix, pudding mix, and vegetable oilmix thoroughly. Beat in the water until smooth. Beat in the eggs one at a time, until smooth. Stir in the walnuts. Pour into the prepared pan. Bake in the preheated oven for 35 minutes, or until a toothpick inserted in the center comes out clean. Let the cake cool in the pan for 10 minutes before inverting onto a wire rack to cool completely. Drizzle with chocolate syrup and sprinkle with chocolate sprinkles to serve.

Saut onions over medium heat until lightly browned. Add garlic and ginger, stirring constantly for two minutes. Add seasonings and saute for two more minutes. Stir in yogurt and saute for two more minutes. Sprinkle frozen spinach over top of yogurt mixture, cover and cook over medium heat for five to seven minutes or until spinach is tender and bright green. Serve over basmati rice with grapeseed oil drizzled over top.

Boil potato in its skin until tender. Drain water and mash the potato with the cheese. Stir in the egg, butter and salt. Divide the mixture into 8 portions and roll each portion in the hand into a ball. In a heavy skillet or a flat iron skillet heat a little shortening or lard or bacon drippings until hot enough to brown the cakes. Fry the cakes for about 1 minute on each side or until golden brown. Serve hot with gravy or ketchup or tomato sauce.

Drain excess liquid from meat before cooking and brown meat in hot butter in large skillet. Add scallions and mushrooms. Cook until vegetables are tender. Stir in paprika, flour and 1 cup of water. Cook, stirring constantly, until thickened, about 3 minutes. Add the wine and the remaining 1/2 cup water. Bring to a boil over medium-high heat. Cook until slightly thickened, 4 to 5 minutes. Stir in the whipping cream and season to taste with salt and pepper. Serve over rice.

Preheat oven to 350 degrees f (175 degrees c). Grease and line a 9 inch (23 cm) springform pan with parchment paper. Beat eggs in a large bowl until light in color and thickened. Add brown sugar and beat well. Add cinnamon, vanilla and oil and stir well. In another bowl combine the flours and baking soda and stir well. Add the flours to the egg mixture and stir well. Fold in the nuts. Pour into the prepared pan and place in the oven. Bake for 45-50 minutes or until the top is golden brown and the sides are set. Let cool completely before removing from the pan.

Boil potatoes in salted water until tender. Drain in a colander. When cool enough to handle, cut into 1/2 inch cubes. Toss with oil and lemon juice to coat. Combine broccoli florets and green beans in a large bowl. Toss with olive oil. Add potatoes. Add dill. Season to taste with salt and pepper. Crumble in the goat cheese. Toss. Serve sprinkled with pine nuts.

In a large skillet, cook sausage until brown. Remove and drain fat from pan. Add onion, chile and bell pepper to pan and cook 10 minutes or until vegetables are tender. Add tomatillos to pan and cook 10 minutes longer. Add rice to pan and cook until heated through. Season to taste with salt and white wine. Serve with green salsa and sour cream if desired.

Cut squash and onion into pieces. Boil together until tender. Drain and mash some. Combine squash, onions, eggs, breadcrumbs, butter, sugar, salt and pepper. Bake in a 3 quart dish that has been oiled. Bake at 350 until lightly browned. Sometimes I toss in some velveeta - when the kids were small they liked it with cheese.

Season halibut steaks with salt & pepper. Heat olive oil in large skillet over medium high heat. Saute halibut steaks for 2 minutes per side or until lightly browned. Remove from skillet & set aside. Add zucchini and onions to skillet & saute for 4 minutes or until lightly browned & crisp-tender. Add garlic & saute 1 minute longer or until fragrant. Add tomatoes, lemon juice & parsley to skillet & stir well. Divide vegetable mixture evenly among 4 plates. Top each serving with one halibut steak & sprinkle with fresh lemon juice before serving.

Preheat oven to 400f degrees. In a food processor, process 1 cup of pecans until they are finely ground. Set aside. In a large saucepan, bring 1 cup of water and 2 cups of sugar to a boil. Add 2 tablespoons of butter and cook for 2 minutes or until a candy thermometer reads 240 degrees. Remove from heat and pour into a large bowl. Stir in 4 egg yolks, 1 teaspoon of almond extract and 1 cup of all-purpose flour. Stir in the finely ground pecans. Pour batter into 24-36 standard size muffin cups that have been sprayed with cooking spray or lined with paper liners. Bake in a preheated 400 degree oven for 8 minutes or until edges are golden. Remove from oven and immediately sprinkle with 1/2 cup of powdered sugar. Cool for 10 minutes. In a small bowl, combine 1/3 cup of powdered sugar with 2 teaspoons of dark corn

Preheat oven to 400f. Combine lemon pepper, minced garlic and olive oil to make a paste. Season duck with paste. Place on foil lined baking tray and cook until cooked through and brown about 10 minutes per side. Remove from tray and slice. Squeeze fresh lemon juice over top. Serve with green beans.

In a large pan, add oil and heat over medium-high heat. Add the chopped onion and saut until soft and translucent. Add the flour and stir for two minutes. Add the chopped chili peppers, the garlic and the stock. Simmer for 10 minutes. Season with salt.

Mix the butter and brown sugar together in a bowl. Peel, core, and slice the apples and place in a skillet with the sugar mixture. Cook for 30 minutes or until the apples are tender. Cut the bread into 1/2-inch slices. Coat a skillet with cooking spray and toast the slices until golden brown on both sides. Serve the fried apples on top of the toast slices.

Mix the first 4 ingredients together and set aside. Melt margarine. Add milk and vanilla. Beat until thickened and smooth. Add dry mixture and stir until combined. Spread on the bottom of a greased 13x9x2 pan. Sprinkle with cinnamon chips. Let stand until set. Cut into squares and serve warm with whipped cream or cool with whipped cream or ice cream.

In a large bowl, combine the flour and salt. Make a well in the center and add the eggs and milk and beat until smooth. Fold in the melted butter and the Brie cheese. Heat a large skillet over medium heat and add a 1/4-inch butter swirl. Cook 1 pancake at a time. Cook until golden brown. Flip once and continue cooking. Remove from pan and add chives and cayenne pepper. Repeat until all batter is used.

Preheat oven to 350 degrees F (175 degrees C). Mix the soup, sour cream, water, and dill weed together. Place potatoes on the bottom of a greased 9x13 inch baking dish. Season the chops with salt and pepper. Heat 1 tablespoon oil in a large non-stick skillet over medium heat. Brown the chops on both sides. Remove from heat, and place the browned chops on top of the potatoes in the baking dish. Pour the cream mixture evenly over the chops. Bake uncovered for 1 1/2 hours. Serve topped with parsley.

Cook pasta according to package directions, omitting salt and fat. Drain pasta in a colander over a bowl, reserving 2 tablespoons cooking liquid. Return pasta to pan. Add reserved 2 tablespoons cooking liquid, onion, and remaining ingredients. Toss well. Top with parsley before serving. Serves 4 as a main dish or 6 as a side dish.

Thaw crusts in the refrigerator the night before you bake the quiche. Preheat oven to 350 degrees F (175 degrees C). Roll out one of the pie crusts into a 9 inch pie plate. Spoon about 3/4 cup of the hash brown potatoes into the pie shell. Top with about 1/2 pound of the beef. Sprinkle with about 1/2 cup of the sharp cheddar cheese. In a medium bowl, beat together the cream, eggs, salt, and pepper until smooth. Pour over the filling in the pie shell. Bake in the preheated oven for 40 minutes, or until the top is golden brown. Remove from the oven and sprinkle with the onion salt. Let cool for a few minutes before cutting into wedges to serve.

Preheat oven to 350 degrees. Spray a 9 x 13 inch pan with cooking spray. Pour 1/2 cup of pineapple into the bottom of the pan. Spread the cherry pie filling evenly over the pineapple. Crumble the chocolate cake mix evenly over the cherries. Melt the margarine in a saucepan over low heat until it is completely melted and smooth. Add the flaked coconut and stir until combined. Pour over cake mixture. Bake for 35-40 minutes or until cake is set. Cool on a wire rack for at least 2 hours before cutting. Serve warm with vanilla ice cream.

Mix soup, water, rice, onion powder and black pepper in 2-qt shallow baking dish. Top with chicken. Sprinkle chicken with additional pepper & salt. Cover and bake at 375 for 45 min or until chicken is no longer pink and rice is done. Uncover and sprinkle cheese over chicken.

Heat oven to 375 degrees F. Grease 9 by 13 inch pan. Mix butter and brown sugar until light. Add egg. Add cocoa. Add flour. Mix well. Pour into pan. Bake 25 minutes. After removing from oven, pour coconut over top. Drizzle with icing.

Preheat oven to 350 degrees F. In large bowl combine flour and brown sugar. In another bowl mix together oil, vanilla and egg. Add to flour mixture and stir well until just blended. Fold in morsels and nuts. Spread evenly into greased 13x9 inch pan. Bake for 30 minutes or until center is set and top is lightly browned. Cool on wire rack. Cut into bars.

In a heavy-based saucepan saute garlic in olive oil and margarine until soft and fragrant. Add tomatoes and cook until softened, stirring occasionally. Add onions and capsicum and saute until soft and golden. Add pepper and cooked rice and stir over low heat for 1 to 2 minutes. Stir in boiling water and bring to a boil. Remove from heat. Serve immediately with lamb and salsa verde or at any time as a side dish. This recipe can be doubled for larger quantities.
Puree all ingredients except the cheese in a blender until smooth. Stir in cheese. Chill until ready to serve. Serve with tortilla chips. Garnish with additional cheese if desired.

Preheat oven to 350 degrees. Grease a 2 quart baking dish with shortening. Beat together cream cheese, milk, and eggs until blended. Stir in corns. Pour into baking dish. Sprinkle with cheddar cheese. Bake for 40 to 45 minutes until golden brown and bubbly. Serves 4 to 6.

Melt honey. Add chocolate chips. Stir in millet& wheat germ. Add puffed kashi& oatmeal. Stir in natural-style peanut butter& raisins. Press mixture into a 9x5x2-in pan. Let cool before cutting into squares.

Heat oil in large saucepan over medium heat. Add onion and garlic and saute for 2 minutes or until golden brown. Add curry powder and zucchini. Cook for 1 minute. Stir in broth, cover and simmer for 10 minutes or until vegetables are tender. Add potato and cook for 10 minutes or until tender. Season to taste. Serve warm.

Place the horseradish in a bowl with the lemon juice and garlic. Allow to infuse for 10 minutes. Strain and reserve the liquid. Dry the fillets in paper towels. Combine the fennel seed and panko. Beat the egg whites. Dip each fillet in the egg white and then roll in the panko mixture. Heat the olive oil in a fry pan. Cook the fillets until golden. Serve the horseradish sauce on the side. Garnish with the parsley.

Place carrots in a large saucepan. Cover with water. Bring to a boil and cook over high heat until tender-crisp. Drain well. In a saucepan over medium heat, combine brown sugar, butter, vinegar and water. Cook until thickened and bubbly. Pour over hot carrots. Sprinkle with parsley.

In a large skillet over high heat, saute mushrooms and onions in oil until tender and browned. Add water and balsamic vinegar. Simmer for 10 minutes. In a small bowl combine lemon juice and mustard. Pour over mushrooms and onions and toss gently to mix. Serves 6.

Preheat oven to 375 degrees F (190 degrees C). Grease cookie sheets or line with parchment paper. In a medium bowl, cream the peanut butter and fat-free margarine until smooth. Beat in the banana until well blended. Beat in the egg until smooth. Beat in the vanilla, then the flour, Splenda granular, baking soda and salt. Stir until well blended. Roll the dough into 1 inch balls and place 2 inches apart on the prepared cookie sheets. Bake for 8 to 10 minutes in the preheated oven, until the edges are lightly browned.Remove from the oven and let sit on the cookie sheets for a minute or two before transferring to a wire rack. Let cool before eating or storing in an airtight container.

Finely chop garlic and mince the mint. Chop the tomatoes. Heat oil in a heavy skillet. Add garlic and mint and cook until fragrant. Add tomatoes and cook over high heat about 10 minutes or until the liquid evaporates. Add seasonings and cook 1 more minute. Cool. Stir in parsley. Serve.

Combine sugar and eggs in a large bowlbeat well. Stir in kahlua, vanilla extract and pecans. Pour into pie shell. Bake for 15 minutes at 350 degrees. Reduce heat to 325 degrees and bake for 45 minutes more or until center is set. Cool on wire rack. Sprinkle pie with chocolate chips just before serving.

Cream together sugar and oil. Add milk and vanilla and beat well. Add two well beaten eggs and mix thoroughly. Sift together dry ingredients and add to creamed mixture and mix well. Add chopped apples and nuts and mix well. Bake in greased and floured cake pans at 350 degrees for 45 minutes or until toothpick comes out clean. Serve warm with whipped cream and ice cream if you like.

Place morsels in small microwaveable bowl. Microwave on high for 1 minutestir and continue to microwave in additional 30 second intervals until melted and smoothset aside.In another bowl combine brown sugar and flour.Cut apples into wedgesplace in bowl with melted morsels, apples and flour mixturestir until well coatedtransfer to baking dishsprinkle with nutsbake for 30 minutes or until apples are tenderserve warm or cool.

Heat the oil in a large pan and cook the sausages until the meat is no longer pink. Add the oregano and garlic and cook for a minute or two. Add the tomatoes and stock and cook for 30 minutes until the sauce is thick. Add the olives and mushrooms and cook for a further 5 minutes before serving with pasta or rice.

In heavy skillet, heat oil. Dip pork chops in flour and fry in hot oil. Add wine and broth. Simmer uncovered for 10 minutes. In a separate pan, saute onions in butter until tender. Stir in cornstarch and water. Add to meat mixture and simmer until thickened. Serve with rice.

Saute onions, celery, garlic cloves in olive oil until soft. Add cumin and stir for 2 minutes. Add tomatoes, vegetables and water and cook for about 10 minutes, until veggies are tender. Cool and spoon into a pastry crust. Bake for about 20 minutes at 350 degrees.

In a large saucepan, combine the water and vermouth and bring to a boil. Add the salt and the fish. Cook until the fish is opaque and flakes easily, about 2 minutes. Remove the fish from the broth and let cool. Cut the fillets into 1/4-inch slices. In a large skillet, melt the butter over medium heat. Add the almonds and cook until they begin to turn golden brown. Add the fish and parsley. Cook until heated through, stirring constantly. Season to taste with salt and pepper. Serve in chilled martini glasses. Garnish each serving with lemon wedges.

Preheat oven to 350 degrees F. In an 8-inch square baking dish, mix together margarine, maple syrup and lemon juice. Add the beets to the dish. Cover the dish with foil and bake for 1 hour and 15 minutes or till tender. Uncover the dish for the last 15 minutes of cooking. Sprinkle the beets with the lemon slices. Serve.

In a large bowl mix together all ingredients, except for the parsley and garlic, until thoroughly combined. Divide the mixture evenly between the 6 ramekins or muffin tins. Place the muffin tins in the preheated oven for 40 minutes. Remove from oven and let sit for a few minutes. Serve with barbecue sauce for dipping or drizzling over the top of the meatloaf.
Mix first five ingredients together until smooth and creamy. Pour into a small baking dish and bake for about an hour at 350F. Serves two as a main course or four as a side dish.

Clean the sprouts by cutting off the stem. In a large saut pan melt the butter over medium heat. When the butter has begun to brown, add the sprouts, salt and nutmeg. Cook for 10-12 minutes or until the sprouts are lightly browned. Serve immediately.

In saucepan, cook bacon until crisp. Pour off fat, leaving some bacon grease in pan. Add onions and cook until soft. Add sugar, soy sauce and salt& pepper and stir until sugar is dissolved. Add beans and toss to coat. Cook about 10 minutes more or until hot. Sprinkle with garlic powder before serving.

Mix bread crumbs with 1/2 cup of parmesan cheese and 1/2 teaspoon of black pepper. Beat egg in a shallow dish. Dip chicken into egg and then into breadcrumb mixture. Heat olive oil in a large skillet. Add chicken and saute until lightly browned. Remove chicken. Add shallot and cook until tender. Add portabello mushrooms and cook until tender. Remove from heat. Top chicken with shallots and mushrooms. Sprinkle with remaining 1/2 cup of parmesan cheese and 1/4 teaspoon black pepper. Top with slices of mozzarella cheese. Bake at 350 for 10 minutes or until cheese is melted.

Mix all the dry ingredients together and set aside. Cut the apple in 1/4 inch slices. Add the apple slices to the dry mixture. Fold in the whipping cream. Sprinkle on the powdered sugar. Serve chilled.

Heat vegetable oil and butter over medium heat in large skillet. Add onion and green pepper to skilletcook and stir until onion is tender. Add garliccook 1 minute longer. Add frozen hash browns and seasoningscook and stir until browns are crisp and golden brown. Stir in ham and cheese. Cook for 2 minutes longer or until cheese is melted. Serve immediately.

Mix together tuna, mayo, pickle relish and honey mustard until blended well. Taste and adjust seasoning with salt and pepper. Serve on toasted white or wheat bread, as a sandwich spread, or on crackers.

In a 1-quart saucepan, saute onion and celery in butter until tender. Stir in flour and cook for 1 minute longer. Stir in apple juice, apple, and curry powder. Bring to a boil, reduce heat, and simmer uncovered for 15 minutes or until apples are tender. Sprinkle with salt and pepper to taste. Makes 4 servings.

Preheat oven to 180C. Grease a 20cm square tin. Put chocolate and butter into a saucepan over low heat. Stir until melted and smooth. Cool. Beat together eggs and caster sugar until thick and pale. Stir in cooled chocolate and then flour and salt. Pour into tin and bake for 30 minutes. Leave in tin to cool. Cut into squares and serve with an espresso.

In a large saucepan over medium heat, saute the onion, carrot, celery ribs and apple until tender. Add garlic and saute 1 minute longer. Add dry red wine and cook until reduced by half. Stir in stock and cook until reduced by half again. Strain mixture through a fine-mesh strainer into a 2-cup glass measure. Discard solids and transfer to airtight container. (Can be prepared 3 days ahead. Cover and chill.)

Combine the dry ingredients in one bowl and the wet in another. Add the dry to the wet and stir till just moistened. Fold in the carrots. Pour the batter into 2 9" round pans or 3 8" round pans. Bake in preheated oven 350 degrees for 30-40 minutes or until done. Cool on racks.

Preheat oven to 400f. Cream butter and sugar together until light and fluffy. Beat in eggs one at a time. Combine flour, cocoa, baking soda, and salt. Gradually add dry mixture to creamed mixture. Stir in white chocolate chips. Drop by teaspoons on ungreased baking sheets. Bake for 8-10 minutes or until set. Let cool on wire racks.

Cut eggs in half lengthwise and scoop out yolks into a medium bowl. Mash yolks with a fork until smooth. Stir in salsa, jam and peppers until well blended. Fill egg halves with the filling and garnish with peach slices. Store in refrigerator until ready to serve.
Toss all the vegetables together. Add feta and yogurt. Season with salt to taste. Serve.

Preheat oven to 350 f. Line baking sheet with parchment paper or waxed paper. Mix first 3 ingredients in a large bowl. Beat in the eggs 1 at a time, then add the vanilla. Stir in the sifted dry ingredients and the hazelnuts by hand until well blended. Drop by large spoonfuls on the prepared baking sheet, leaving 1" between them. Bake for about 12 minutes or until the edges are firm and the centers are barely set. Transfer to racks to cool completely. Store in airtight container at room temperature for up to 1 week.

In a saucepan saute garlic in olive oil over low heat 1 minute. Add scallions, dill, garlic and saute 2 minutes longer. Add chickpeas. Add salt & freshly ground black pepper. Add Swiss chard. Toss. Remove from heat. Sprinkle with Feta cheese. Serve immediately.

In a wok or large skillet heat 1 tablespoon vegetable oil over medium high heat. Add pork and stir-fry until pork is no longer pink. Add green onions and stir fry until well mixed. Add garlic and stir fry until fragrant. Add soy sauce and stir fry until mixture becomes thickened. Add oyster sauce and stir fry until well mixed. Add water and bring to a boil. Reduce heat to a simmer. Add eggs and stir fry until eggs are cooked through. Add shrimp and stir fry until shrimp are cooked through. Stir in cornstarch until sauce is thickened. Serve over hot rice.
Dip each chicken breast in flour and place in slow cooker. In a medium bowl, stir together all remaining ingredients. Pour over chicken and cook all day on low.

Place water, salt and sugar in a large pot or crock. Add bay leaves and garlic and shallots. Bring to a boil. Add allspice berry and hot pepper sauce. Turn down heat to medium-high. Simmer for 15 minutes. Remove from heat. Allow to cool for 10 minutes. Add pork. Cover and refrigerate for 24 hours. Turn roast in brine several times during brining time. Remove from brine. Pat roast dry. Rub with olive oil and season with salt and pepper. Roast in preheated 325f oven for 1 1/4 hours. Baste with pan drippings. Cook for another 15 minutes. Remove from oven and let rest for 10 minutes before slicing.

Place roast in crock pot, add water, soy sauce, herbs. Cover and cook for 5-6 hours on high or until beef is tender. Remove meat from broth, shred with forks and keep warm. Strain broth, pour into cups for dipping. Serve meat on rolls.

Melt butter over medium heat in a large skillet. Add brussel sprouts and cook until they are golden brown, stirring occasionally. Add sage and cook another minute or so until sage is crisp. Salt and pepper to taste and serve immediately. Serves 2.
Brown pork in a little oil over medium-high heat. Add the remaining ingredients and simmer for 30 minutes.

Heat oil in heavy saucepan. Saute onions& celery until crisp tender. Add baby peas. Cook until heated through. Stir in pimientos. Blend cornstarch into water and add to skillet. Bring to boilreduce heat. Cook until thickened. Stir in salt& pepper. Stir in pimientos. Serve over rice or grits.
Beat eggs. Add milk and seasonings. Stir in bread and sausage. Pour into greased 9 x 13 inch baking dish. Sprinkle with cheese. Bake at 350 degrees until puffed and browned. Serve with toast.

Bring large pot of water to boiling. Add pasta. Cook until tender but firm. Drain. Rinse under cool running water. Combine asparagus and English peas. In large bowl, toss together asparagus and English peas. Add pasta, green onions and seasonings. Toss to mix well. Drizzle with olive oil and lemon juice. Toss to mix well. Garnish with tomatoes and tuna. Makes 8 servings.

In a saucepan, bring chicken broth to a boil over high heat and reduce heat to low. Add gingerroot and soy sauce and bring back to a boil. Boil for 2 minutes and then pour into a blender or food processor with the remaining ingredients (except the green onion and the peanuts). Blend until smooth. Bring a large pot of water to a boil over high heat and add spaghetti. Cook for 2-3 minutes (or until al dente) and then drain and rinse under cold running water for a few minutes in order to stop the cooking process and remove some of the starch. In a large bowl, mix the pasta with the sauce and add the green onions and the peanuts. You can add as much or as little of the green onions and the peanuts as you would like. If you want to add more gingerroot or chili paste or soy sauce or garlic cloves, do so until you reach the flavor that you desire. You can also add a bit of hot water to the sauce and the pasta if it is too thick and dry.

Marinate fish for 30 minutes by rubbing both sides of fish with mixture of garlic paste, garam masala, chili powder, turmeric and salt. Grill fish for about 5 minutes on each side or until fish flakes easily with fork. Serve immediately with lemon wedges and salad.

Pour ketchup in a 9 x 13 pan. Place the chicken on top of ketchup. Drizzle with italian dressing. Sprinkle with black pepper. Cover with foil and bake for 30 minutes at 350 degrees fahrenheit. Uncover, bake 15 minutes longer or until done.

Brown turkey sausage in skillet. Remove from skillet and set aside. Add cabbage and saute until tender. Add onion and saute for 2 minutes. Add mushrooms and saute for 2 minutes. Add sausage and garlic. Cook for 2 minutes. Stir in spaghetti sauce and italian seasoning. Simmer for 2-3 minutes. Serve over cooked spaghetti. Garnish with grated parmesan cheese.

Heat oil in a skillet over medium-low heat. Saute leek until translucent. Add the mushrooms. Saute until the liquid has evaporated. Stir in the broth. In a small bowl, combine the cornstarch with the lemon juice. Slowly add the mixture to the broth. Bring to a boil. Reduce heat to low. Stir in the sour cream. Season with the tarragon, salt, and pepper. Serve over hot cooked rice.

Combine 2/3 cup sugar, 1/3 cup white corn syrup, 1 teaspoon water in a heavy 2 quart saucepan. Stir to dissolve over medium heat until the mixture reaches 250 degrees on a candy thermometer. Remove from heat and stir in 10 drops of peppermint oil. Stir until oil is evenly distributed throughout the mixture. Add 1/4 teaspoon green food coloring if desired. Pour mixture into buttered 8 by 8 inch baking dish. Cool completely before cutting into small pieces with a sharp knife. Wrap pieces in waxed paper. Store in airtight container for up to 2 weeks.

Combine all the marinade ingredients in a shallow dish. Put the chops in the dish and turn to coat. Marinate overnight in the refrigerator. Grill the chops over medium-high heat for 8-10 minutes per side, or until done. Serve with salsa.

Brown onions and carrots and drain well. Add all remaining ingredients and mix well. Form into patties and brown in hot oil over medium heat. Bake uncovered at 350 for one hour or until done. Serves 4

Cube firm tofu and place in a bowl of cold water to drain the moisture from it. Drain and squeeze dry and place on paper towels and pat dry. Combine the egg, breadcrumbs and cheese in a small bowl and add the garlic powder and salt and pepper. Dip the cubes into the egg mixture and then into the slivered almonds. Place the cubes on a baking sheet and spray with nonstick cooking spray. Bake at 425 degrees for 20 minutes or until golden brown. Makes 20 cubes.
Combine mustard seeds with the beer. Let sit at least 48 hours. Strain the seeds from the beer. Put the beer in the blender with the remaining ingredients. Puree. Store in an airtight container.

Wash rice thoroughly and place in pot with water and salt. Cook until the water is absorbed and rice is tender. Add milk and bring back to the boil. Add sugar and vanilla essence. Stir well and add the cinnamon powder. Turn off heat and serve hot or cold.

Soak the tapioca for 1 hour in cold water. Place the tapioca, milk, egg, sugar, and salt in the Rice Cooker inner pot. Set on high for 1 1/2 hours or until the tapioca is tender and the mixture is thickened. Stir in the pure vanilla extract, mix well and serve warm or cold.

Heat olive oil in a Dutch oven over medium-high heat. Add meatcook until no longer pink. Add onionscook 1 minute, stirring occasionally. Stir in tomatoes. Bring to a boilreduce heat to medium-low. Cook 10 minutes. Stir in watercook 10 minutes. Stir in ricecook 10 minutes. Stir in green beans. Heat through. Season with black pepper. Sprinkle with parsley flakes.

Preheat oven to 325 degrees f. In a medium bowl combine coffee, mustard and vinegar and stir until smooth. Stir in maple syrup and brown sugar. Place ham in shallow pan and pour on the coffee mixture. Cover ham tightly with foil and bake for 45 minutes. Uncover and bake an additional 20 minutes, basting occasionally.
Combine all the ingredients in a food processor. Process until smooth. Spread over toast or crackers.

In a large skillet cook sausage and sauerkraut over medium heat until sausage is brown and kraut is crisp tender. Remove from heat and add cheese. Drain any fat from skillet. In a medium bowl combine Bisquick mix, milk and beer. Beat at medium speed 2 minues or until well mixed. Add sausage mixturestir just until combined. Pour into a greased 9-inch pie pan. Bake at 375 for 25-30 minues or until knife inserted in center comes out clean. Makes 6 servings. Shirley j hedrick. 9-27-05
Cook pasta according to package directions. Drain. Combine dressing mix, mayonnaise and milk. Stir in pasta. Add frozen peas, green onion, olives and tomato. Chill. Makes 8 servings.

Heat oven to 350. Melt butter and oil in a large saucepan. Add chocolate and stir until smooth. Remove from heatstir in cinnamon and vanilla. Cool slightly. In a large bowl, beat eggs and sugar until thick and pale yellowbeat in flour, salt and chocolate mixture. Spread batter evenly in a greased and lightly floured 13 x 9 x 2-inch baking pan. Bake for 30 minutes or until top is dry and a few moist crumbs cling when a knife is inserted into the center. Cool on a wire rack for 10 minutes before cutting into bars. Yield: about 16 servings.

Preheat oven to 400°F. In a large bowl combine zucchini and garlic. Drizzle with olive oil. Season with salt and pepper. Toss to coat and spread onto a baking sheet. Roast in preheated oven 15-20 minutes or until crisp-tender. Heat a large skillet over medium-high heat. Add red bell peppers and cook until tender-crisp. Transfer to a bowl. Add pasta to same skillet. Cook until tender. Add pesto and toss to combine. Add roasted zucchini and bell peppers to pasta. Add olives and sunflower seeds. Toss until evenly combined. Serve.

Peel and cut sweet potatoes into small cubes. Boil them in a small amount of water until they are very soft. Drain the water and add in the butter. Beat with a hand mixer until smooth. Add green onions and mix well. Salt and pepper to taste. Add in the sour cream. Mix well. Serve hot.

Spread 1/2 of polenta in bottom of a 9 x 13 baking dish. Spread 1/2 of marinara over polenta layer. Repeat layers 2 more times. Spread pesto over top layer of polenta and marinara. Sprinkle with pine nuts and mozzarella. Bake in 350 F oven for 20 minutes or until cheese is melted.
Combine first 4 ingredients in a small bowl. Stir until gelatin is dissolved. Pour into 6 small paper cups or molds. Freeze until set. When set, remove from molds and enjoy.

In a small bowl, combine soy sauce, satay sauce, lime juice and gingerroot and mix well. Marinate lamb in mixture for 4 hours or overnight in the refrigerator. Grill or broil chops 4 inches from heat source for 4 to 5 minutes per side for medium rare meat. Serve with satay sauce for dipping.

Wash and cut mushroom stems off. Dip stems in oil, salt and pepper. Sauté in oil for 5 minutes until tender, then remove from heat. Mix together onion powder, pepper and cayenne pepper. In separate bowl mix together cream cheese, garlic salt, black pepper, garlic powder and parmesan cheese. Fill caps with mixture. Place in small pan with remaining oil and onions. Cover with foil and bake in oven for 15 minutes at 350 degrees f. Remove from oven. Turn heat up to 450 degrees f for 5 minutes to brown top of mushrooms. Serve warm.
Cream together butter and cream cheese with a fork until well mixed. Add flour and salt and work quickly to form a soft dough. Chill until ready to use.

In a shallow dish combine lemon pepper and all-purpose flour. Dip each chicken piece in the mixture to coat, shaking off any excess. Place chicken on a rack on a rimmed baking sheet and bake for 45 minutes. Combine remaining ingredients and toss lightly. Place the baked chicken on top of the salad and serve immediately.

Cook the asparagus 3 minutes or until crisp-tender. Drain and rinse well under cold water. Combine the vinegar and water in a saucepan. Bring to a boil. Reduce the heat and simmer 2 minutes or until thickened. Stir in the sesame oil and sesame seeds. Cook and stir until the sesame seeds are golden. Remove from the heat. Add the lemon rind and juice. Serve over the asparagus. Sprinkle with the sesame seeds.

Heat the oil in a saucepan and saute the onions until they are transparent. Add the flour stir for 1 minute. Add the stock and bring to the boil. Add the zucchini and cook for 10 minutes. Blend the soup until smooth. Reheat the soup, add the cheese and adjust the seasoning.

Boil and drain potatoes. Put in a bowl and add sour cream and mayonnaise. Stir to coat. Add vinegar and stir again. Add onions and sprinkle with black pepper and dill. Let sit in fridge for 2 hours. Serve cold.

Combine all ingredients in a large pot. Bring to boil over high heat. Reduce heat to medium low, and simmer uncovered until reduced by half. Cool to room temperature before serving. Store in an air-tight container for up to two weeks.

Combine sausage, water and cooking spray in the inner pot and cook for 10 minutes on high pressure. Stir in the rice and cook for 10 minutes on high pressure. After cooking, remove the lid and stir in the green onions and cilantro. Sprinkle the top with sesame seeds and serve hot.

Beat together the graham cracker crumbs and the butter until they are evenly blended. Press into a greased 9x12 inch pan. Bake at 350 for 12-15 minutes or until the crust is golden. Cool slightly. Combine the brown sugar and the corn syrup in a heavy saucepan and stir over low heat until the mixture boils and begins to thicken. Remove from the heat and stir in the chocolate until melted. Spread the mixture over the cooled crust and top with the almonds. Cool in the refrigerator. Cut into squares.

Preheat oven to 250 degrees. In a large saucepan, melt together butter or margarine, sugar and vanilla. Add pecans and continue cooking over medium heat for about five minutes. Remove from heat and allow to cool slightly. Grease a cookie sheet and spread the mixture evenly over it. Break graham crackers into small pieces, about the size of peas. Toss them into the mixture with the pecans and spread evenly over the mixture. Bake for about an hour or until the mixture is hard and the crackers are toasted. Cool before breaking into pieces.

Pound out the chicken pieces until they are about an inch thick. In a medium bowl combine the soy sauce, lemon juice, ginger, black pepper, and garlic. Add the chicken and marinate for 30 minutes. Thread the chicken pieces onto skewers. Grill the kabobs over medium heat for 10 minutes. Turn the kabobs over and baste with the marinade. Grill for another 5 minutes.

Heat oil in large saucepan over medium heat. In small bowl, combine matzo meal and eggs. Stir in 2 cups of the wateradd oil. Beat until well blended. Pour into large pastry bag with a 1/2-inch round tip attached. Squeeze into hot oil to form 1-inch rounds. Fry, turning once until golden brown, about 5 minutes. Drain on paper towel-lined plate. Sprinkle with cinnamon-sugar mixture and toasted nuts, if desired.

Pour the water and sugar into a pot. Bring to a boil. Let cool. Stir in the lemon juice and lychee liqueur. Strain the mixture. Pour into glasses. Serve over ice. Top with the light syrup. Garnish with lemon and lychee.

Beat eggs in bowl with salt and pepper. Dip each oyster in eggs then breadcrumbs made from saltines. Drop into hot oil and fry until golden brown, turning once to brown on both sides. Remove to paper towel to drain and serve with hot sauce.

In a small bowl, combine the spices. Melt butter in a large saucepan over med-high heat. Add spinach and seasonings. Cook and stir until spinach wilts. Stir in rice, tomatoes and remaining spices. Cover and cook over med-low heat until liquid is absorbed and rice is tender. Stir in parsley and serve.

In a large skillet, combine the beans and corn. Heat over medium heat until the mixture is hot. Combine with the remaining ingredients in a slow cooker. Cover and cook on low for 6 to 8 hours. Ladle the soup into bowls and top with the toppings of your choice.

Prepare the rim by running the lime around the rim of the glass and then dipping it into the sugar mixture. Fill the glass with crushed ice. Pour in the amaretto and stir well. Fill with orange juice. Add the remaining ingredients and stir well. Serve immediately.

Beat cream cheese and sour cream at medium speed of a mixer until smooth. Gradually add sugar, beating at medium speed 2 to 3 minutes or until light and fluffy. Stir in coffee liqueurset aside. In a small bowl, combine whipped topping with vanilla extractmix well. Serve dip with fruit topping, if desired.

Place chicken in a large zip-top plastic bag. Add marmalade, soy sauce and sesame oil. Seal bag and turn to coat. Let sit 30 minutes to marinate. Remove chicken from bag. Lay a slice of bacon on a cutting board. Place a piece of chicken on a piece of bacon. Fold bacon over to encase chicken. Secure with toothpicks. Place on a baking sheet coated with cooking spray. Repeat with remaining chicken and bacon. Bake 20 minutes or until chicken is no longer pink. Remove toothpicks and serve.

In a small bowl combine the spices and mix well. Coat each side of the chicken with the spice mixture. In a baking dish place the chicken and drizzle the oil over the top. Bake for about 1 hour. Sprinkle with chopped spring onion.

Sift the all-purpose flour, baking powder and salt together into a mixing bowl. Cut in the shortening until the mixture resembles coarse crumbs. In a separate bowl, combine the milk and the egg. Stir into the flour mixture until just moistened. Spoon into greased muffin cups 2/3 full. Bake at 400 degrees for 15-20 minutes or until done. Cool for 10 minutes before removing from pans to wire racks to cool completely. Spread the top of each muffin with a layer of jam and sprinkle with nuts if desired.

Combine butter, sugar and peanut butter until creamy. Add eggs and vanilla. Combine flour, baking soda and salt. Stir into the peanut butter mixture until blended. Drop dough onto greased cookie sheet and bake for 10 minutes at 375F. Sprinkle with salted peanuts while still warm. Let cool slightly before removing from cookie sheet. Sprinkle with semisweet chocolate chips while still warm.

Brown the beef with the onions. Add the soup and water. Stir in the frozen vegetables. Put the tater tots in the baking dish. Pour the soup mixture over them. Bake for about 20 minutes, or until the tater tots are browned. Serve hot. Makes about 2 servings.

Preheat oven to 300 degrees F. Place pecans on an ungreased cookie sheet and bake until fragrant and golden brown, about 8 minutes. Remove from oven, transfer to a cooling rack to cool completely, and set aside for later use. Beat egg whites until stiff peaks form. Beat in confectioners' sugar until well blended. Beat in cornstarch, followed by cocoa and salt. Beat until smooth. Beat in egg whites until well blended. Stir in pecans. Drop by level tablespoons onto an ungreased cookie sheet. Bake at 300 degrees F. for 30 minutes. Let stand 2 minutes before removing from cookie sheets with a metal spatula. Cool completely on wire racks.

In a saucepan bring the water to boil. Add biscuits and cook 1 min. stirring constantly. Stir in the milk. Remove from heat. Stir in the cheese. Press into a 24 cm spring-form pan lined with non-stick foil. Chill. In a blender puree the strawberries with the syrup. Spread over the chilled cheescake. Chill overnight. Roll the chilled cheesecake into balls. Dip balls into melted chocolate. Allow to set.

Combine snow with sweetened condensed milk in a large bowl. Fold in vanilla. Pour into a 9x13 pan that has been sprayed with a non-stick cooking spray. Garnish with candies of your choice. Chill until set.

Cook rice mix as directed. When done, drain and stir in butter. In saucepan combine cheez whiz, broccoli, and milk. Bring to boil. Reduce heat. Stir in broccoli. Remove from heat. Stir in sour cream. Mix with rice. Arrange rice in shallow 2 quart baking dish. Arrange chicken breasts over rice. Pour cheese sauce over top. Sprinkle with black pepper. Bake at 350F for 15 minutes.
Split open each pita half and spread with yogurt. Heat beef and soup mix in a skillet and spoon into the pita halves. Garnish with mint leaves and tomato wedges. Serve immediately.

Combine all the ingredients in a glass bowl. Add the lamb and turn to coat. Refrigerate for at least 1 hour. Preheat the grill. Sear the lamb over high heat for 5 minutes. Reduce heat to medium and grill for about 10 minutes per lb. Serve hot or cold. Garnish with parsley.

Pour Southern Comfort into 2 ounces of the orange juice. Fill glass with ice cubes. Add more of the Southern Comfort if desired. Pour in the grenadine, then fill with remaining orange juice. Garnish with a twist of lime or an orange slice if desired.

In a large skillet with lid, saute leeks and garlic in olive oil until softened over low heat for about 10 minutes. Stir in dry white wine, increase heat to medium-high and bring to a boil. Reduce to simmer for 2 minutes. Add clams to skillet, cover tightly and cook until all clams have opened, 5 to 10 minutes. Stir in oregano, season with pepper to taste. Serve over cooked pasta.
Bring milk to a boil in a saucepan with a pinch of pepper and a sprinkling of chocolate. Add in a pinch of cinnamon. Add the rum to taste. Strain into cups and add a few shavings of chocolate.

Heat oil and saut onion and garlic until onions are soft and translucent. Add cabbage and stir-fry until tender. Add chilies and ginger. Season with turmeric and salt. Serve warm garnished with coconut.

Drain artichoke hearts. Combine lemon juice, sumac, dried tarragon. Add red pepper to taste. Toss in artichoke hearts. Cover and refrigerate overnight. Stir in fresh cilantro before serving. Serve with pita bread.

In a medium saucepan bring water to a boil. Add frozen berries and boil for 5 minutes. Stirring occasionally until berries pop. Remove from heat and let cool for about 10 minutes. In a medium bowl mix the water and sugar and whisk to combine. Add the berries and orange juice. Stir to combine. Add the spices and orange peel and stir well. Refrigerate for a few hours or until cold. Garnish with orange slices and crystallized ginger. Serve at room temperature.

Rinse salmon steaks and pat dry. Sprinkle both sides of the steaks with salt and crushed red pepper flakes. Combine olive oil, garlic cloves and tomato. Grill over medium high heat for 10 minutes per side, or until fish flakes easily when tested with a fork. Serve with white wine vinegar and basil leaves.

Place the sugar, corn syrup and heavy whipping cream in a heavy-bottomed saucepan. Cook over medium heat until the mixture comes to a boil. When the mixture comes to a boil, attach a candy thermometer and continue cooking until it reaches 240 degrees. Remove the pan from the heat and stir in the butter and vanilla. Pour the mixture into a 13x9x2-inch foil-lined pan. Sprinkle with the toasted pecans or chopped pecans. Chill the mixture until firm. When the mixture is firm, use a sharp knife to cut the mixture into 1-inch squares. Dip the squares into melted chocolate or drizzle the chocolate over the top of the squares. Let the chocolate set. Store the caramels in an airtight container.

Cook pasta according to package directions. Melt margarine in 2-quart saucepan over low heat. Stir in flourcook 2 min. Slowly stir in milkheat until mixture boils. Remove from heatstir in cheeses until melted. Stir in drained pasta.

Cut veal into small cubes. Saute onions and mushrooms in oil until tender. Sprinkle with flour and stir to coat with the flour. Add veal and stir to coat with the flour and brown the veal cubes well. Add white wine and lemon juice to deglaze. Add whipping cream and boil until thickened and bubbly. Season with salt and pepper to taste. Serve with noodles or rice.

For apricot lemon glaze combine apricot preserves with 1/2 cup water in saucepan. Simmer for 15 minutes. Strain through strainer. Beat egg yolks in large mixing bowl with an electric mixer. Add lemon juice and 1/4 cup hot apricot mixture. Beat until thoroughly combined. Stir in butter 1 tablespoon at a time. Pour in cream. Beat until mixture is well combined. Strain through strainer into serving bowl. Refrigerate for 1 hour. Serve with fruit slices. For daiquiri combine 1/4 cup daiquiri mix with 1 cup water. Add to blender. Add 1/2 cup ice cubes. Blend until smooth. Strain into glass. For lemonade combine 2 tablespoons liquid honey with 1 cup water. Add to blender. Add 1/2 cup ice cubes. Blend until smooth. Strain into glass. For lime combine 1/2 cup water with 1 tablespoon cornstarch. Blend in blender until smooth. Add 1/4 cup ice cubes

In a large saucepan, heat oil over medium heat. Saut onion 2 to 3 minutes. Add carrots. Cook 3 minutes. Add cauliflower. Cook 8 to 10 minutes until tender. Add broth, basil, salt and pepper. Bring to a boil. Reduce heat. Simmer 10 to 15 minutes. Add pasta. Cook 5 minutes more. Add spinach. Cook 2 minutes. Sprinkle with cheese.
In a small skillet combine catalina dressing, maple syrup, and butter. Bring to a boil over medium heat. Cook until thickened. Add carrots. Cook until glazed. Serve immediately over pecans.

Beat together the butter and sugars. Add the eggs and vanilla. Add the flour, baking soda, and quick-cooking oats. Stir until smooth. Add the morsels. Drop by teaspoonfuls onto ungreased cookie sheet. Bake at 350 for 12 minutes. Cool for 5 minutes before removing from the cookie sheet.

In a large mixing bowl combine all-purpose flour, baking powder, xanthan gum and salt. In another bowl combine butter, sugar and eggs until fluffy. Blend in vanilla extract and pudding mix until smooth. Stir in flour mixture and blend well. Chill dough for about 1 hour or until easy to handle. Preheat oven to 350f degrees. On a lightly floured surface roll dough 1/4 inch thick. Cut into 1-inch rounds with a cookie cutter. Place cookies on an ungreased baking sheet. Bake for 10 minutes or until golden. In a small bowl combine egg yolk and water. Brush over cookies and sprinkle with 1/2 tsp chopped pecans. Bake for 2 minutes longer or until golden. Cool on a wire rack. Makes about 4 dozen cookies.

Pre heat oven to 375f. Cream together the margarine and sugars. Add eggs, almond flavoring and vanilla. Sift together the flour, baking soda and salt. Stir into the creamed mixture. Stir in the milk chocolate chips. Drop by teaspoonfuls onto ungreased cookie sheets. Bake for 1012 minutes or until lightly browned. Cool on wire racks. Sprinkle with slivered almonds before serving.
In a pitcher, combine the vodka, lemonade concentrate and the first 6 ingredients (through spearmint)stir well. Chill for at least 4 hours before serving. Garnish, if desired.

Heat up the chicken stock in a large pot and add in all the ingredients except for the egg white. Season with salt and pepper according to your taste and bring it to a boil. Turn off the heat and add in the egg white. Stir until it has thickened and serve hot in individual bowls.

Put beans and enough cold water to cover in a pan and cook until crisp-tender. Drain. Heat 2 tablespoons olive oil in a skillet over medium high heat. Add tomatoes and cook 2 minutes. Add garlic and cook 1 minute more. Add the drained green beans and toss well to combine. Sprinkle with salt and pepper. Serve warm.

In a large bowl combine the flour and baking soda. In another bowl combine the cream cheese and sugar and beat until smooth. Add the egg and beat until well blended. Add the flour mixture to the cream cheese mixture and stir until well mixed. Add the vanilla, salt and sour cream. Beat for a couple of minutes. Fold in the chopped pecans. Pour into greased muffin cups. Bake at 350 degrees for approximately 20 to 25 minutes. Cool. Fill the wells of each muffin with the canned pineapple. Dust lightly with confectioner's sugar.

Heat oil in large skillet over medium-high heat. Add the onions and saute for 3 minutes until softened. Add the chickpeas, tofu and garlic and saute another 2 minutes. Add the zucchini and kale. Stir-fry 5 minutes. Add the lemon juice and zest. Serve over brown rice.
Spread cheese mixture over tortillas. Roll up tightly. Place on serving platter and serve with strawberries.
Combine mayonnaise and sour cream in a large bowl. Add chicken, celery and rice. Mix well. Fold in cashews. Serve on a lettuce leaf with an alfalfa sprout.

In a large bowl, combine the greens. Toss with the dressing and onions. Divide the salad among individual plates or in a large serving bowl. Arrange the satsuma slices over the top of the salad. Sprinkle with the almonds and blue cheese. Garnish with the cranberries. Can serve as a side or as a main course.

Preheat oven to 350 degrees F (175 degrees C).Butter a baking pan large enough to hold tomatoes in a single layer. Add garlic and orange zest to pan. Bake in preheated oven for 5 minutes. Remove from oven, add tomatoes to pan and toss gently to coat with garlic mixture. Sprinkle with salt and pepper. Return to ovenbake for 30 minutes or until tomatoes are very tender and juices are flowing. Serve warm or at room temperature.
Preheat waffle iron. Mix together filling and ice cream. Place filling on top of each waffle. Top each with pecans and cinnamon. Serve immediately.

1. Mix the ground chicken and coriander in a bowl. 2. Combine the oyster sauce, fish sauce, sugar, and garlic in a bowl. 3. Add the coconut milk and mix well. 4. Pour the sauce over the chicken and mix well. 5. Wet your hands with cold water and take a small amount of the mixture to form a ball. 6. Repeat with the remaining mixture. 7. Place the dumplings on a plate. 8. Boil water in a pan. 9. Put the dumplings in the pan. 10. Cook until the water boils again. 11. Dish up and serve.

Peel and slice the Hass avocados in half lengthwise. Remove the pit. Place one half cut side down in a plastic bag. Using a knife, cut across in a criss-cross pattern to make a mushroom pattern. Turn over. Scoop out flesh into a medium sized bowl. Mash well. Add goat cheese, cilantro, pistachio nuts. Season with crushed red pepper flakes. Serve with tortilla chips.
Follow package directions for Jello. After the jello is set up add the cottage cheese and Cool Whip. Chill for two hours. Before serving add the canned pineapple.

Cut pineapple into chunks. Slice tofu into cubes. In a wok, heat oil over medium heat. When oil is hot, stir fry pineapple for 3 minutes. Then add the sherry. Cook for 1 minute. Add soy sauce and continue to cook for 2 minutes. Add the tofu and stir fry for 2 minutes. Add the cornflour mixture and stir fry for 2 minutes. Remove from heat. Add green onion and bean sprouts and mix well. Transfer to a serving plate. Sprinkle with sesame seeds. Serve hot.

Beat the egg and the milk together. Add the sugar and the vanilla. Soak the bread on one side in the egg mixture and place on a griddle. Flip and toast the other side. Dust with the cinnamon. Serve hot with butter.

Cream butter with the cream cheese until smooth. Beat in the sugar until light and fluffy. Mix in the eggs and vanilla one at a time until blended well. Combine the dry ingredients in a separate bowl. Stir the dry ingredients into the creamed mixture alternately with the coffee mixture. Spoon into a greased bundt pan and bake at 350 for one hour or until the cake springs back when touched lightly with your finger. Cool the cake in the pan for 10 minutes on a wire rack. Turn out the cake on the rack and cool completely before frosting. Make frosting by combining the confectioners'sugar with the cream cheese until smooth. Stir in the vanilla until smooth. Spread on the cooled cake with a spatula or knife. Roll in chopped nuts if desired. Makes 12 servings.

Preheat the oven to 180C/350F/gas 4. Mix the salt, water and thyme together in a bowl. Put the turkey in the bowl, cover with the marinade and refrigerate for 12 hours or overnight. Remove from the fridge 30 minutes before roasting. Heat the oil in an ovenproof casserole. Roast the turkey on the breast for 10 minutes then turn over and roast on the other side for 10 minutes more. Pour over the chicken stock, sprinkle over the sage leaves then cover the casserole tightly with foil and bake for 1 1/4 hours or until the juices run clear when the thickest part of the thigh is pierced with the tip of a sharp knife. Remove the foil and bake for another 30 minutes or until the skin is golden brown and crisp. Stir the butter into the stock then baste the turkey all over while it is roasting. Remove the sage leaves then sprinkle over the black peppercorns. Serve

Boil water on the stove top, add Kool-Aid mix & stir well. Let it cool for about 10 minutes. In a large mixing bowl, beat together cream cheese and powdered sugar. Add cooled Kool-Aid liquid & beat well. Add heavy whipping cream & vanilla & mix well. Pour into a prepared graham cracker crust & chill for 2 hours. Garnish with whipped cream & an orange slice.

Bring the water to a boil. Add the vegetables. Cover and simmer for 10 minutes. Add the corn kernels and parsley. Cook for 10 minutes. Season with salt and pepper. Mix the maple syrup with 1/2 cup water. Stir into the soup. Serve with crusty bread.

Combine flour and salt to taste. Blend in 1/4 cup cold water and mix to form a soft dough. On a lightly floured surface, roll to 1/4 inch thickness and cut into 3 1/2 inch rounds. Put 1 teaspoon of butter in the center of each round. Put 1/2 teaspoon of bacon in the center. Fold dough over. Crimp the edges together to seal. Put the rounds in muffin cups and bake in a preheated 400 degree oven for 20 minutes. Melt 1 tablespoon butter in a fry pan. Add zucchini and basil and saute over low heat until tender. Add salt and pepper to taste. Pour the mixture into the muffin cups and top with olive oil. Makes 12 servings.

Carefully remove the ham bone from the pressure cooker. Set it aside. Stir in 15 bean soup mix, dried onion flakes, garlic powder, fresh ground black pepper. Stir well. Add the pressure cooker with ham bone. Stir well. Add the diced tomatoes. Stir well. Add the pressure cooker with the ham bone. Stir well. Add the pressure cooker with the ham bone. Stir well. Add the pressure cooker with the ham bone. Stir well. Cover with the lid. Lock the lid in place. Cook at high pressure for 15 minutes. Turn off the heat. Quickly release pressure using a quick pressure release method. Remove the lid. Stir in the cooked ham. Stir well. Cover with the lid. Serve. Enjoy.

Season chicken breast halves with garlic powder and pepper to taste. Saute chicken breasts over medium heat. Cook until done. Top each breast halves with pepper jack cheese. Bake uncovered at 350 for 5 minutes or until cheese is melted. Serve with salsa.

Cook the potatoes till soft, drain and let cool slightly. Combine mayonnaise with minced garlic and chopped parsley in a small bowl. Season with hot paprika. Toss with the potatoes and serve at room temperature.
Clean mushrooms. Rinse under cool water. Saute in oil until browned. Add seasonings. Add veges. Saute until veges are tender. Serve with toast.
