Microwave one egg at a time in a small bowl for 45 seconds, stirring after 30 seconds. Sprinkle with salt and pepper before serving. If desired, sprinkle with some cheese or ham. This recipe serves 1. This is also good for people who don't have the time to make a lot of breakfast in the morning.

Mushrooms, onions and bacon in a skillet over low heat until bacon is crisp. Remove bacon from skillet and set aside. Add evaporated milk. Stir in mushrooms, onion and bacon. Add sour cream. Stir until thickened. Add cooked pasta. Stir in parmesan cheese. Add sun-dried tomatoes, salt, and pepper. Toss and serve.

In medium bowl, cream together margarine and cream cheese until fluffy. Add sugar and flour until well blended. Add pecans and mix until incorporated. Divide dough into 24 equal pieces and shape into a ball. Place on wax paper or parchment paper. Refrigerate until firm. In another medium bowl, combine blueberries, 1/2 cup sugar and flour. Refrigerate for 1 hour. Remove dough from fridge. Flatten dough ball between your palms and place 1 teaspoonful of the filling in the center. Dip finger in warm water and seal edges to form a ball. Roll in remaining sugar. Place on wax paper. Refrigerate until firm. In a large bowl, combine remaining 1 cup sugar and 1 cup flour. Add the blueberry mixture and mix well. Place 1/2 cup of the filling in a small bowl. Dip finger in warm water and coat ball in filling. Place on wax paper. Refrigerate until firm. Melt chocolate chips in double boiler over hot water. Dip balls into

In a large bowl, combine the ground beef, onion, fat-free saltine crackers, garlic powder, kosher salt and black pepper. Add the basil and oregano. Using your hands, mix well. Shape into 24 balls (about 2 inches in diameter). In a small bowl combine the Worcestershire sauce and water. Place the meatballs in a single layer in a 9x13 inch baking pan. Cover with the sauce. Cover the pan with aluminum foil. Bake for 30 minutes. Remove the pan from the oven and carefully pour off the sauce. Remove the aluminum foil from the pan and bake for an additional 5 minutes. Serve with pasta and sauce.
Toast bread. Combine garlic, italian seasoning and olive oil and mix well. Slice grape tomatoes in half or quarters and place on bread.

In a skillet heat the olive oil over medium heat. Slice the potatoes as thin as possible and dry with a paper towel. Add potatoes and cook until golden brown. Meanwhile beat the eggs in a bowl with salt until foamy, 1-2 minutes. Pour the eggs over the potatoes. Cover, lower the heat to medium-low, cook for about 5-7 minutes until the omelette is set and the bottom is golden brown. Slide the omelette onto a plate. Flip it back into the pan so that the cooked side is on top. Cover and cook for about 5 minutes longer. Cut into wedges and serve.
Sautee onions and garlic in oiladd water and bouillon cubebring to boil. Add salt and pepper to tasteadd the raw chickencook 5 minutesadd ricecook 30 minutesserve hot!
Brown sausage in large skillet. Add cabbage and cook until tender. Add all remaining ingredients and bring to boil. Reduce heat and simmer covered for 15 minutes. Serve over hot cooked rice.

Preheat oven to 425 degrees fahrenheit. Butter a casserole dish, set aside. Peel and cut the potatoes into cubes. Place in a microwave dish and cover with water. Cook for 5 minutes in a microwave oven. Remove and allow to drain. In a mixing bowl combine the potatoes with the milk, cheese and bacon. Beat with a fork until thoroughly combined. Spoon into the prepared dish and bake for 20 to 25 minutes until lightly brown and bubbly.

Cream together the butter and sugar until light and fluffy. Mix in the condensed milk and combine well. In a separate bowl, sift together the dry ingredients and add to the wet ingredients and mix until well combined. Stir in the chocolate chips and place by spoonfuls on baking trays lined with baking paper, leaving room for them to spread out. Bake in a preheated oven at 175c for about 15 minutes until golden.

Split baguette in half and spread mustard on one side of the bottom half of the baguette. Spread mayonnaise on the other side of the baguette. Layer the baguette with ham and avocado. Sprinkle the coarse black pepper and sea salt over the top of the baguette. Serve.

In a saucepan stir together water, cornstarch, sugar, celery seed, salt, pepper and butter. Bring to a boil over high heat. Boil 2 minutes or until thickened stirring constantly. Cool. Add vinegar to taste. Will keep in refrigerator 1 week.

In a large bowl, whisk together all the dressing ingredients. Add the arugula and toss to coat. Divide the arugula between four serving plates. Top with the sliced peach. Sprinkle with the cheese, pecans and a pinch of salt and black pepper. Serve immediately.

Place the hamburgers in a large bowl. Add the celery. Cut the hamburgers into small pieces. Add the rest of the ingredients. Mix together well. Bake in a 325 degree oven for 45 minutes or until the liquid is reduced by half.

1. In a medium saucepan over medium heat, heat the olive oil. 2. Add the onion and cook for 5 minutes. 3. Add the cauliflower florets. Cook for 5 minutes. 4. Add the flour. Cook for 1 minute. 5. Add the chicken stock. Bring to a boil. Reduce heat to low. Cover. Simmer for 15 minutes. 6. Transfer the contents into a food processor. Puree. Return to the pot. 7. Add the milk. Bring to a boil. Cook for 1 minute. 8. In a small bowl, mix the cream cheese with the garlic. Add the garlic and herb cream cheese to the pot. Stir until completely melted. 9. Add the cream. Simmer for 1 minute. 10. Serve.

Heat oil in wok or pot. Add garlic and stir-fry briefly. Add mushrooms and stir-fry until they turn brown. Add water. Cover and simmer over medium heat for 30 minutes or until cabbage is tender. Serve hot.
Toast your bread. Spread peanut butter on toast. Add pumpkin. Sprinkle with pumpkin pie spice. Drizzle with honey. Eat and enjoy.
Drizzle caramel sauce in bottom of cup. Add cappuccino. Sprinkle with brown sugar cinnamon syrup. Top with whipped cream. Garnish with cinnamon.
Saut turkey in oil in a large saucepan. Add remaining ingredients. Cover and simmer for 30 minutes. Serve over couscous and stuff into bell peppers. Serve.
Season chops with salt and pepper. Brown in skillet. Add onion and cook until tender. Add lemon juice. Mix remaining ingredients. Pour over chops. Simmer for 1 hour. Serve over rice.

Combine orange marmalade and dijon mustard in a small bowl. Mix in garlic powder and 1/4 teaspoon each salt and black pepper. Spray a shallow baking dish with cooking spray. Place fish in dish and cover with marmalade mixture. Sprinkle with remaining salt and pepper. Bake at 375 degrees for 10 minutes or until fish flakes easily when tested with a fork. Serve with lemon wedges.

In a saucepan combine the thickened cream and the sugar. Cook over a medium heat until sugar dissolves. Stir constantly. Add the vanilla ice cream to the hot caramel sauce, then place the mixture into a freezer-proof container and freeze until set. Garnish with the toasted marshmallows just before serving.
In saucepan, melt margarine and marshmallows. Stir in rice krispies. Add dried cranberries. Press into 9x13 inch baking dish. Cut into squares. Makes 24 squares.

Heat the olive oil in a small skillet over medium heat. Saut the scallions, garlic cloves, and all-purpose flour until the scallions are tender. Add the low sodium chicken broth, mushrooms, and heavy cream. Season with the salt and freshly ground black pepper. Add the fresh tarragon. Let simmer for a few minutes. Serve.
Combine first 3 ingredients in saucepan and heat to boiling. Add milk and heat to serving temperature. Stir in vanilla and serve with a dollop of whipped cream and sprinkling of cinnamon.
Cut the tomato in half lengthwise. Cut the cucumber into 1/2 inch slices. Combine the tomato, cucumber, onion and mayonnaise in a bowl. Season with the salt.

Remove any liquid from tofu and squeeze gently into a bowl with your hands to remove more of it. Put tofu in a mixing bowl with a pinch of salt and stir to mix well. Dust with flour and then put into a plastic bag and shake until coated all over with flour. Heat about 1cm of vegetable oil in a frying pan. Once hot, remove tofu from bag and carefully lower into hot oil and fry for 2-3 minutes on each side, until crisp and golden brown. Remove and drain on kitchen paper. To make dressing, put all dressing ingredients into a mixing bowl and mix well together. Serve crisp tofu with dressing sprinkled over the top.

Preheat the oven to 350 degrees f. Cut off the bottoms of the sprouts and remove the outer leaves. Cut each sprout in half lengthwise and place in a single layer on 2 rimmed baking sheets. Drizzle with 1 tablespoon of the olive oil and toss to coat. Season with 1/2 teaspoon of the salt and 1/8 teaspoon of the pepper and arrange the sprouts in a single layer on the sheets. Roast until tender when pierced with a knife, 20 to 25 minutes. Toss the sprouts with the remaining 1/2 tablespoon of the olive oil and remaining 1/4 teaspoon of the salt and 1/4 teaspoon of the pepper and serve warm. If desired, garnish with the parmesan.

In a saucepan over medium heat, combine the unsweetened cocoa and cinnamon. Slowly add the boiling water, stirring constantly. Cook and stir until mixture comes to a boil. Boil and stir for 2 minutes. Remove from heat and stir in the sweetener and vanilla. Cool. Store in the refrigerator. Serve over ice cream or use as a topping for pancakes.

Preheat oven to 325 degrees. Butter and line with parchment paper 9 inch loaf pan. Combine flour, matcha green tea powder, baking powder and salt together. Beat together unsalted butter and 1 cup powdered sugar until light and fluffy. Beat in eggs one at a time and then add vanilla extract. Beat until mixture is light and fluffy. Fold in flour mixture into the batter. Pour batter into the prepared loaf pan and bake for 30-40 minutes or until toothpick inserted into the center comes out clean. Let the pan cool completely before removing from pan. Drizzle with glaze and sprinkle with matcha powder for serving.

Preheat oven to 350 degrees f. Line a large baking sheet with parchment paper. In a large bowl, toss the almonds, olive oil and paprika. Spread on the prepared baking sheet and bake for 5 minutes. Remove from the oven and add the coarse sea salt. Toss and bake for another 5 minutes. Repeat the process until the nuts are toasted and the coating is crispy.

Cut mushrooms into thin slices. Heat oil and saute mushrooms until crisp. Drain on paper towels. In bowl, combine bread crumbs, artichokes, sun-dried tomatoes and capsicums. Add to hot mushrooms and toss. Place in a serving bowl. Top with feta cheese and thyme leaves. Season with black pepper. Serve with fresh Italian bread or crusty rolls.
Mix all the above. Marinate in refrigerator overnight. Grill the next day to desired doneness.

Melt 2 tbsp butter in skillet and saute venison chops until browned. Add marjoram and sour cream and simmer 10 minutes. Add mushrooms and cook until tender. Add port wine and heat until heated through. Season with salt and pepper.
Place greens in slow cooker. Lay the chicken on top. Combine water, vinegar and seasonings in medium bowl and pour over. Cover and cook for 7-8 hours on low.

In a 16-ounce shaker, squeeze juice from the lemons and oranges. Add sugar. Add enough ice cubes to fill two-thirds full. Add water to cover ice. Cover and shake. Serve in a tall glass. Garnish with slices of either fruit or both fruits.

Heat butter over medium-high heat in skillet. Saute green pepper and ham until meat is no longer pink. Stir in tomatoes, juice and frozen peas. Bring to boil over high heat. Cover and reduce heat to low and simmer for 10 minutes. Stir in water and ricebring to boil over medium-high heat. Cover and reduce heat to low and simmer for 30 minutes. Stir occasionally until water is absorbed and rice is tender. Garnish with green onions and serve.

Heat oven to 350 degrees. In small bowl, combine flour, salt and pepper. In crock pot combine butter and flour mixture. Cook over medium heat, stirring constantly until mixture is bubbly. Remove from heat. Stir in milk. Stir in cheese and potatoes. Transfer to 1 1/2-quart baking dish. Bake uncovered for 40 minutes or until bubbly. Serve hot.

Place the tomatoes in a baking dish. Drizzle with olive oil and season with salt and pepper. Bake in the preheated oven until the tomatoes are very soft and juicy. Cut the tomatoes in half and place them in the oven again for about 5 minutes until the skins have become crispy and the flesh is starting to char. Drizzle the warm tomatoes with olive oil and season with salt and pepper to taste.

Preheat oven to 400f. Spray 13x9x2 inch baking pan with cooking spray. Unroll 1 can of biscuits and separate into 12 biscuit rounds. Press each round into baking pan. Bake 5 minutes. Sprinkle with half of the mozzarella. Bake 5 minutes more. Remove from oven. Sprinkle with remaining mozzarella and parmesan. Bake until cheese is melted. Remove from oven. Spray 13x9x2 inch baking pan with cooking spray. Unroll 1 can of biscuits and separate into 12 biscuit rounds. Press each round into baking pan. Bake 5 minutes. Sprinkle with half of the mozzarella. Bake 5 minutes more. Remove from oven. Sprinkle with remaining mozzarella and parmesan. Bake until cheese is melted. Remove from oven. Cut into 12 pieces. Place 3 pieces of biscuit in center of each serving plate. Top
Cook noodles until tender but firm. Drain in colander. Place butter in sauce pan used to cook noodles. Add noodles and toss to coat. Add the remaining ingredients and mix well. Serve immediately.
Blend colby-monterey jack cheese, bacon and flour. Stir in eggs and milk. Add horseradish. Bake in preheated oven 375f for 40 minutes. Serve with crackers.

Combine the cake mix and water. Add the lemon zest and raspberry filling. Spread evenly into a greased 9x13 baking dish. Beat together the cream cheese, powdered sugar and liquor. Spread over the cake. Refrigerate until ready to serve. Drizzle with more chambord if desired.

Preheat oven to 350F. Grease an 8x8 pan. Combine brownie mix and sweetened condensed milk. Spread in pan. Bake 20 - 25 minutes. Cool. Melt semi-sweet chocolate in the microwave. Spread over the top of the brownie. Sprinkle with Heath candy bars. Allow to set up. Sprinkle with powdered sugar. Store in the refrigerator.

In a large bowl, cream together the butter, sugar, sour cream and vanilla extract until light and fluffy. Combine the flour, baking powder and baking sodagradually add to creamed mixture and mix well. Divide dough into 2 portionswrap and refrigerate for 1 hour or until easy to handle. Heat oven to 375 degrees F (190 degrees C).On a lightly floured surface, roll dough 1/4 inch thick. Cut with 2 inch round cutter dipped in flourplace 1 inch apart on ungreased baking sheets. Bake for 10 to 12 minutes in the preheated oven. Let cool on baking sheets for 2 minutes before removing to wire racks to cool completely.

Preheat oven to 300 degrees f. Season shanks with cinnamon and sear in hot oil in a large heavy bottom pot. Cook for about 3 minutes per side or until brown on all sides. Remove from pot and place in the oven to cook for 1 hour. After an hour, add garlic to pot and saute for 1 minute. Add stock to pot and stir well. Bring to a boil and then reduce heat to a simmer. Cover and cook for 1 hour or until the meat is tender when pierced with a fork. Remove meat from pot and set aside to cool. Remove fat from top of sauce and then whisk in soy sauce and honey. Reheat sauce in a small saucepan for 3 minutes or until hot. Slice beef shanks into thin slices on the bias. Arrange over the rice and top with gai lan leaves. Pour sauce over meat and garnish with cilantro. Serves 6 to 8.

Preheat oven to 425 degrees F. Wash fish thoroughly and pat dry. In a small bowl combine dill, herbes de provence and mustard. Brush both sides of fish generously with oil and then spread mustard mixture over fish. Wrap tightly in foil and place on baking sheet. Bake for 10-15 minutes. Serve with lemon wedges and rice pilaf.

Prepare cheese sauce by combining the milk, wine and flour in a saucepan. Cook over medium heat until mixture thickens. Stir frequently. Add butter and cheddar cheese. When the cheese is melted, set aside. Beat the eggs with the salt and pepper. Heat the oil in a large skillet. Add the eggs and cook for 30 seconds. Turn the eggs and cook for another 15 seconds. Add the Canadian Bacon. Cook for 1 minute. Put 1 English Muffin half into each of two small bowls. Sprinkle with cheese sauce and top with the cooked eggs and Canadian Bacon. Garnish with parsley and serve immediately.

Slice apples thinly with a mandolin or a sharp knife. Lay apple slices onto a non-stick dehydrator tray. Drizzle with lemon juice (or apple juice) then sprinkle with nutmeg and cinnamon. Top with chopped pecans. Sprinkle with cheddar cheese then roll up into a long log. Dehydrate at 135 degrees for 1 hour then turn the temperature down to 115 degrees for 8-10 hours (or until the cheese is melted)

Place washed red bliss potatoes in a saucepan, cover with cold water and bring to a boil. Reduce heat to medium and cook until tender. Remove from heat, drain and return to pan. Mash with a potato masher until chunky. Stir in butter, herbs, salt and pepper until thoroughly blended. Serve hot.

Sift together the flour and baking powder and mix with the salt and sugar. Work the shortening into the dry mixture until it resembles coarse crumbs. Beat the egg with the milk and stir into the mixture. Stir in the lemon rind and mix just until the dough holds together. Place on a lightly floured surface and knead the dough 15 times to make the dough smooth and elastic. Roll out to about 1/2 inch thickness and cut into desired shape. Bake at 375f for 15 minutes or until lightly browned. Makes 8 servings.

In a large skillet cook noodles and mushrooms in broth until tender. Remove from heat. Add soup, sherry, and chicken. Stir well. Remove 1/3 of the mixture and place in a 1-quart baking dish. Repeat with remaining mixture. Top each portion with cheddar cheese and bake until golden brown. Garnish with almonds and pimientos.

Preheat oven to 350. Grease a 10 inch tube pan. Combine dry ingredients in a large bowl. Combine the remaining ingredients in a separate bowl. Stir together dry ingredients, alternating with the liquid. Beat well. Pour into prepared pan. Bake for 50-60 minutes or until done. Cool for 5 minutes in pan on wire rack. Invert on wire rack to cool completely. Beat together icing sugar, butter, milk, and almond extract. Spread on top of cake when completely cool. Cool completely before cutting.

Preheat oven to 350 degrees F. Prepare pie crust. In large bowl, beat egg whites and sugar on medium speed 5 minutes or until glossy peaks form when beater is lifted. Add cream of tartar and beat 2 minutes longer or until stiff peaks form. Add saltine crumbs and coconut. Beat on low speed 1 minute or until well combined. Add pecans and beat 1 minute longer. Pour into pie crust and bake 25 minutes or until crust is golden brown. In medium bowl, beat whipping cream on medium speed 1 minute or until stiff peaks form when beater is lifted. Remove pie from oven and let stand 10 minutes or until cooled slightly. In small bowl, dissolve gelatin in 2 tablespoons hot water. Let stand 1 minute. Stir in 1/4 cup cold water. Stir into whipping cream. Spread over pie crust. Chill 4 hours or until firm. In small bowl, stir together sugar and waterbrush over top of pie. Place 1/2 pint fresh st

Beat egg whites in a large bowl until stiff. Gradually add white sugar. Add brown sugar, vanilla, flour, baking powder and salt. Mix well. Fold in apples. Turn into a greased 13x9x2-inch baking pan. Bake at 350 degrees F for 30 to 35 minutes. Cut into squares. Makes 10 squares.
Brown roast with oil. Add onion and seasonings. Add broth. Cover and pressure cook on high for 20 minutes. Quick release pressure and stir in gravy mix. Simmer 10 minutes longer or until thickened.

Fry the bacon gently until crisp and dry. Remove bacon to paper towels to drain. Remove all but a couple tablespoons of bacon fat from pan. Add sprouts and fry over medium heat, stirring frequently until just tender, 5 to 7 minutes. Add onion and cook over medium heat for 1 minute. Stir in sour cream and heat through. Add bacon and season with pepper to taste. Makes 4 servings.

Wash lentils in several changes of cold water. Place lentils in a pot. Add water to cover lentils by one inch. Bring to a boil over high heat. Reduce heat to medium and cook covered for 20 minutes. Add ginger, turmeric, cayenne pepper and cumin seed. Simmer for 5 minutes or until lentils are tender. Season with salt. Add oil and dried onion flakes. Serve hot.

Separate cake into 16 slices. In a large bowl, combine 4 cups of the Cool Whip and the pudding mixstir well. Gently fold in the slices of the cakespoon into a 9-inch pie plate. Spread the remaining Cool Whip over the top of the cake layergarnish with the strawberries and chocolate chips. Refrigerate for several hours or overnight. Serves 8.

Sift together flour, baking powder, and salt. Cut butter into small pieces and stir into the dry ingredients. Stir in the ice water until dough forms and can be handled. Turn out onto a lightly floured board and knead gently. Roll out 1/2 inch thick and cut with a 3 inch round or scalloped cutter. Gather up the scraps and reroll until the dough is gone. Drop into boiling water and cook for 8 minutes or until they float. Remove with a slotted spoon and place on paper towels until ready to serve. Serve with your favorite gravy or meat juices over mashed potatoes.
Bring first 4 ingredients to a boil. Boil for 1 minute. Remove from heat. Add oats, peanut butter and oil. Mix well. Drop by spoonfuls to waxed paper. Chill. Makes 1 pt.

Cook beef and vegetables in skillet over medium heat until beef is no longer pink. Drain the fat. Stir in the barbecue sauce and season to taste. Cook until the liquid has thickened. Stir in the can of chili beans. Spread the corn muffin mix evenly over the top. Bake uncovered for 20 minutes. Sprinkle the Mexican-style corn over the top of the corn muffin mix and bake another 20 minutes. Serve hot.
Mix together pumpkin pie filling, applesauce, honey and lemon rind. Stir in pumpkin pie spice. Microwave on high for 1 minute or until heated through. Serve warm.

Place frozen cauliflower in the slow cooker with the onion, celery, chicken stock, cream, Worcestershire sauce, cheese, salt, and pepper. Cover and cook on high until the vegetables are tender. Serve hot.

In a large bowl, mix milk with oil, add flour, cornmeal and fast rise yeast. Add sugar, eggs, salt and mix well. Cover bowl with a towel. Let rise for 10 minutes at room temperature. Knead dough on lightly-floured surface for 5 to 7 minutes. Roll out to fit a 12-inch pizza pan. Bake at 425 f for 10 minutes or until lightly browned. Remove from oven and spread with sauce of your choice. Top with favourite toppings. Bake for 8 to 10 minutes longer or until heated through.

Marinate the chicken breasts in lemon juice and a little bit of salt and pepper. Melt the butter in a frying pan. Add the chicken breasts and fry over high heat for 3-4 minutes on each side. Remove the breasts from the pan and add the metaxa brandy. Stir and leave until the flamb is out. Add the cream and stir over low heat until boiling. Season with a little bit of fresh basil and serve.

In a large saucepan, cook the garlic in the olive oil over low heat for 10 minutes or until lightly browned. Add the chopped tomatoes, dried herbs and sugar, and simmer for 20 minutes or until the sauce has thickened slightly. Season with the salt and pepper. Cook the pasta in plenty of boiling salted water for 8 minutes or until al dente. Drain well. Add the cooked pasta to the saucepan with the bacon, mascarpone and parsley. Toss well over low heat for 1 minute until the cheese has melted and the dish is well combined. Serve immediately.
Brown beef and onion. Stir in remaining ingredients. Bring to a boil. Cover and simmer 15-20 minutes or until rice is tender and liquid is absorbed. Top with cheese.

Combine sugar and water and bring to the boil. Simmer 5 minutes to make a syrup.Allow to cool. Combine berry puree with lime juice and syrup. Place in a metal bowl or tray. Freeze till set. Place in glasses of your choice. Top with champagne.

Saute bacon until crispy. Set aside. Saute onion and green peppers until tender. Add cabbage and carrots and stir. Add roast pork and saute until heated. Add frozen peas and stir. Add cooked rice and mix thoroughly. Add soy sauce and stir. Remove from heat. Sprinkle with bacon.
Mix seasoning packets with vinegar, oil and sugar. Mix in cabbage and noodles. Let sit for 15 minutes. Add almonds and sunflower seeds. Toss. Chill for at least 1 hour. Toss again before serving.

In a medium bowl, beat the eggs with the cream cheese until smooth and well combined. Add the dill and the garlic powder and stir until combined. Season with the salt and the pepper. Melt the butter in a large nonstick skillet over medium heat and pour in the egg mixture. Cook for 2 minutes or until the mixture is almost set. Stir in the milk and the parsley and cook for another minute or until the mixture is completely set but still moist. Serve immediately.

Prepare the simple syrup by boiling sugar and water in a medium saucepan until the sugar has dissolved and the syrup is clear. Cool completely. Chill the martini glasses in the freezer. Pour the orange-flavored liqueur and lime juice into a shaker and fill with ice. Shake to combine the ingredients, then strain them into the martini glasses. Top with the cranberry juice. Garnish each glass with a raspberry.

Cook lentils in water for 10 minutes. Drain, rinse with cold water. Drain again. Add 1/4 cup balsamic vinegar. Combine with 2 tablespoons of olive oil. Salt and pepper to taste. Arrange tomatoes on a plate. Add mango and avocado slices. Drizzle with vinaigrette.

Sift flour into a bowl. Add mustard powder, salt, ground pepper, baking powder, tasty cheese and fat. Mix well. Add oatmeal and mix to a soft dough. Roll into small balls about 3/4 inch in diameter and flatten each one between your palms. Fry in boiling fat until golden brown on both sides. Drain and serve hot with mustard or tomato sauce.
Slice the carrot into fine julienne and put in a medium bowl. Sprinkle with the sugar and the salt and let stand for 10 minutes. Drain the carrot and mix in the remaining ingredients. Serve chilled.

Preheat oven to 350f in a 9x13 inch baking dish, arrange fruit in layer, sprinkle with sugar and cinnamon. Combine flour, oatmeal, brown sugar, butter and nutmeg, mix well and sprinkle over fruit. Bake 45 minutes. Cool 10 minutes before serving.

Preheat oven to 180 degrees C. Cream butter and sugar together. Beat in eggs one at a time. Mix in milk and then sift in flour. Pour into a 22 cm round cake tin lined with greaseproof paper. Bake for 35 - 45 minutes. Leave to cool in tin before turning out.

Boil water and add family-size tea bag (about 6-8 teabags). Steep for 5 minutes. Remove teabags and add sugar to taste. Stir until dissolved and add frozen lemonade concentrate and water. Refrigerate overnight or for at least 1-hour. To serve, pour over ice and top with ginger ale. Stir and garnish with mint or cucumber slices.

Boil the water and add the asparagus. Cook for 5 minutes. Cut the tuna in slices and mix it with the cornflour. Brown it in the frying-pan with a little bit of butter and a little bit of oil. When it has got a nice brown colour take it out of the frying-pan. Add the cream and the sauce. Boil the sauce for 2 minutes. Add the lemon juice. When the asparagus are ready, put them in the middle of a plate and arrange the tuna on top. Pour the sauce around it. Add hot pepper sauce and curry powder to taste. Serve immediately.
Combine all ingredients in blender and process until smooth. Store in a sealed container in the refrigerator for up to 3 weeks.

Saute chicken in olive oil and garlic until browned on both sides. Add water, tomato paste, soy sauce and lemon juice and cook until water almost evaporates. Add pasta shells and cook until shells are tender. Sprinkle parsley on top and serve.

Follow muffin directions on cornbread mix box but use half the milk called for in the directions. Add in the ham and cheese. Pour into greased muffin tins and bake at 400 for 20 minutes or until done. Serve with butter and jelly.

Rinse the chicken inside and out under cold running water and pat dry with paper towels. In a small bowl, mix together the parsley, caraway seeds, and salt and pepper to taste. Rub the spice mixture inside the chicken. Place the chicken on a rack in a broiler pan or in a roasting pan and roast for 1 hour to 1 hour 15 minutes, or until the juices run clear when pricked at the thickest part of the meat. Meanwhile, in a small skillet over medium heat, add the olive oil and the garlic and saut until the garlic is lightly browned and fragrant, about 1 minute. Stir in the carrots and potatoes and saut until they are tender and lightly browned, 4 to 6 minutes. Remove the pan from the heat and stir in the parsley. Transfer the vegetables to a bowl and keep warm until the chicken is done. Remove the pan from the oven and transfer the chicken to a cutting board and allow it to rest for 5 minutes before serving. To serve, slice the chicken and serve it with

In a large saucepan, heat olive oil over medium-high heat. Add garlic and saute until lightly browned. Add noodles and toss. Add butter and cook until butter is melted. Season with salt and pepper. Add Parmigiano-Reggiano. Stir until melted. Add balsamic vinegar and brown sugar. Cook for an additional 30 seconds. Serve immediately.

Place lamb cubes on a baking tray or roasting pan. In a saucepan combine the barbecue sauce, sweet chilli sauce and minced ginger. Heat through, stirring continuously for 2-3 minutes. Remove from heat, stir through the garlic and pour over the lamb cubes. Place lamb in the oven for 30 minutes at 180C. After 30 minutes remove the lamb from the oven and brush with honey. Return the lamb to the oven for 10 minutes at 180C until lamb is cooked through. Remove from the oven and allow to rest for 5 minutes. Slice the lamb into thin strips and serve with salad.

Cook soba noodles according to package directions. Drain and rinse with cold water. Set aside. Combine the remaining ingredients in a bowl. Toss the seitan pieces and vegetables with the marinade. When the vegetables are coated with the marinade. Add the cooked soba noodles and toss to combine. Serve immediately.

Melt butter in large skillet over medium heat. Add onion. Cook until translucent. Add flour. Cook 1 minute. Add stock. Bring to a simmer. Add cheese. Cook until melted. Add broccoli. Cook 3 minutes. Sprinkle with paprika.

Put 1/2 teaspoon each of sugar and lime juice in a tall glass and mash together until combined. Fill glass with ice cubes. Pour in white rum, 1 tablespoon each of pomegranate juice and soda water. Stir gently. Top with more pomegranate juice and ice cubes (optional). Garnish with a sprig of mint.

Peel baking potatoes. Cut into 1/2-inch-thick slices. Cut yellow squash into 1/4-inch-thick slices. Heat oil in Dutch oven over medium-high heat to 350 degrees F (175 degrees C). In medium bowl, whisk together flour and salttoss potato slices to coat evenly with flour mixture. Fry coated potato slices in hot oil 3 minutes or until golden browndrain on paper towels. In same Dutch oven, fry yellow squash slices 2 minutes or until golden browndrain on paper towels. Toss both with salt and pepper.

In a heavy saucepan cook bacon until crisp, remove and drain fat to a paper towel and set aside. Saute onions until translucent and add water and potatoes. Cook until tender. Add bacon and clams, cook for 3 to 4 minutes or until heated through. Add milk and season with pepper and salt to taste.

In a medium bowl, whisk together catsup, sugar, olive oil, vinegar, garlic, onion flakes, celery seed and parsley. Add cider and lemon juice. Refrigerate until ready to serve. Toss together beans and dressing in a large bowl.

Beat the sugar and eggs until light and fluffy. Add the water and oil. Stir in the pumpkin and dry ingredients. Mix well. Pour into greased bread pans. Bake at 350 degrees for 60-70 minutes or until done. Cool in pan for 10 minutes before turning out on wire rack to cool completely.

Heat the vegetable oil in a large saucepan. Add the onions and saute until they are golden. Add the dried lentils and stir to coat. Pour in the water and bring to the boil. Reduce the heat and simmer for around 20 minutes or until the lentils are tender. Season with salt and black pepper and serve immediately.

Cook noodles. Drain and set aside. Brown meat and onion in skillet. Add caraway seeds and sauerkraut. Heat until heated through. Add swiss cheese and stir. Pour milk over meat mixture. Add mustard to milk and stir. Add noodles and stir until well blended. Pour into greased 2 qt. Baking dish. Sprinkle top with buttered pumpernickel bread crumbs. Bake at 350 degrees for 45-50 minutes. Serve warm.

Preheat oven to 375 degrees F (190 degrees C). Mix mashed potatoes with garlic powder in a large bowlplace half in the bottom of a greased 9x13 inch baking dish. Place chicken pieces on top of the mashed potatoes. Spread the remaining mashed potatoes over the top of the chickendot with pieces of butter. Sprinkle with parmesan cheese.Bake in the preheated oven for 1 hour 15 minutes.

In a large bowl, toss the carrots, cauliflower florets, and onion. In another bowl, whisk together the mustard, vinegar, sugar, mayonnaise, salt and pepper. Pour the dressing over the vegetables. Fold in the capers and parsley. Chill the vegetables for 1 hour before serving.

Preheat grill for medium heat. Lightly coat both sides of the chicken breast with dried chipotle powder. Place on hot grill and cook until well done. (about 10 minutes) Slice into strips. Add picante sauce to taste. Top with shredded jack cheese. Garnish with green onion.

Place spinach in large mixing bowl. Add 2 tablespoons of the vinaigrette to the saladtoss to coat. Season to taste with salt and pepper. Add the remaining 1/2 cup vinaigrette. Add the sherry wine vinegar. Add the gorgonzola cheese. Add the shallots. Add the pecan halves. Toss to coat. Serve immediately.

Combine flour, salt and pepper. Heat butter. Add onion and saute until tender. Add flour mixture and cook 2 minutes. Add sour cream and heat until thickened. Add green beans and heat through. Pour into 1-1/2 qt. casserole. Combine breadcrumbs and cheese. Sprinkle over top. Bake at 400 degrees for 30 minutes.

Cut each slice of bread into 4 triangles. In a small bowl mix together the dijon and milk. Place 2 slices of ham and 1/4 of the gruyere on each triangle. Brush with the dijon mixture. Sprinkle with the cheddar. Place on a baking sheet and bake for 10 minutes.

Combine cheese with butter. Add flour, stirring until blended. Cut in cold water to form dough. Roll out on lightly floured board to 1/4 thickness. Cut into desired shapes. Bake at 350 degrees for 15 minutes. Makes approx 3 dozen.

In a large saucepan over medium heat, melt butter. Add leeks and saute 5 minutes, add garlic and onions, saute 3 minutes. Add water and bring to a boil. Reduce heat to lowsimmer 15 minutes until potatoes are soft. With an immersion blender, puree soup until smooth. Return to panadd chicken broth and bring to a boil. Reduce heat to lowsimmer 5 minutes. Stir in tarragonladle into bowls. Drizzle with whipping cream and a dollop of yogurt. Serve immediately.
Combine peas, chutney, milk, curry powder and peanuts. Chill, covered until ready to serve. Drain well before serving. Sprinkle with roasted peanuts. Serves 4-6 as an appetizer.

Beat egg in a large bowl. Stir in beer. Combine sugar, salt, baking powder, and flour in a sifter. Sprinkle over egg mixture and stir until well blended. Dip fish or chicken into batter. Place in hot oil in a skillet. Fry in hot oil for 4 minutes per side or until fish is lightly browned. Drain on paper towels. Serve with tartar sauce.

Bring water to boil in a large pot. Add salt and cook until asparagus is crisp-tender but still bright green, about 2 to 3 minutes. Plunge into ice water to stop cooking. Cut off and discard tough ends. Cut spears in half lengthwise. Slice melon in half lengthwise. Using melon baller, scoop out melon flesh and place in bowl. Add half of blue cheese and 1/4 of wine and stir well to blend. Add remaining blue cheese and wine and stir again. Add honeydew melon and orange juice and stir well to blend. Spoon into melon halves and garnish each with an asparagus half and 4 hazelnuts.

Pound steak with a rolling pin. Add bacon and onions to the pan. Add salt and pepper. Cook until meat is no longer pink. Cut into strips. Toss in the lime juice. Heat tortillas in microwave. Top with meat, salsa and guacamole. Add shredded cheese if desired. Serve with avocado and limes.

In a medium bowl, combine black beans, salsa and onion. Spoon into sweet red bell peppers. Sprinkle with cheese and place in baking dish. In a small bowl combine corn, rice and seasonings. Spoon into sweet red bell peppers. Combine all remaining ingredients in medium bowl. Pour over stuffed sweet red bell peppers. Cover and bake 2 hours. Uncover and bake 30 minutes longer. Let stand 10 minutes before serving. Serve with tortilla chips and salsa.

In a bowl mix the egg with the milk and melted butter and set aside. In a second bowl mix the flour and the salt and set aside. In a third bowl combine the maple syrup and the baking powder and stir well and set aside. Add the liquid ingredients to the dry ingredients and stir to mix well. Pour into greased muffin tins and bake at 375 for 20-30 minutes or until golden brown and cooked through in the center.

In a heavy pan, cook onion and garlic in margarine until onion is soft and transparent. Add rice and cook for about 3 minutes. Pour in the vegetable broth and add the bay leaves. Bring to a boil, cover and simmer for 20 minutes. Fluff the rice with a fork and serve.
Beat first 6 ingredients until smooth. Pour into pie shell. Freeze at least 4 hours. Top with chocolate and caramel syrups and chopped peanuts. Store in freezer.

In a small skillet sautee onion in butter until onions are transparent. Add brown sugar. Stir until evenly distributed throughout onions and liquid is a thick syrup. Remove from heat. Pour glaze into a large zip-lock bag. Cut steaks in half. Place in bag with glaze. Close bag and toss to coat steaks evenly with glaze. Grill steaks 5 minutes on each side or until done to your taste. Makes 4 servings.

Preheat oven to 350 degrees f. Heat olive oil in a large skillet over medium heat. Add garlic and cook for 1 minute. Add carrots and cook for 4 minutes or until golden. Stir in sultana raisins and cook for 2 minutes. Stir in brown sugar. Remove from heat. Stir in yogurt and spices. Cook for 2 minutes. Transfer to a baking dish. Sprinkle with parsley. Bake for 10 minutes. Makes 4 servings.

In large bowl, combine first five ingredients. Mix well. In small bowl, combine margarine, egg and vanilla. Beat well. Add to dry ingredients. Stir well. Pour into 13x9 pan. Top with chopped pecans and sprinkle with cinnamon. Bake at 350 for one hour or until done. Serve warm with ice cream.

Combine cabbage & scallions. Heat the butter over medium heat in a small skillet. Add the almonds & sesame seeds. Stir until almonds are a light brown & toasted. Add the noodles & toast until they are light brown & crisp. Stir in the vinegar & cook until the liquid evaporates. Drain & cool. Stir the cabbage mixture & the toasted nuts & noodles together. Store in the refrigerator. Serves 8.

Preheat oven to 350 degrees. Spray a 12-cup muffin tin with nonstick cooking spray. In a large bowl, mix together the flour, baking powder, cinnamon, and salt. In a small bowl, whisk together the egg and oil. Add the egg mixture to the dry ingredients. Stir in the honey and orange juice. Divide the batter among the 12 cups. Bake for 20 to 25 minutes until golden brown. Cool on a wire rack.

Preheat the oven to 350 degrees. Cream the margarine with the brown sugar and white sugar. Add the vanilla. Beat the flour and baking soda together. Add the dry ingredients to the creamed mixture. Mix well. Add the oats. Drop by rounded spoonfuls onto parchment paper. Sprinkle with the chocolate chips. Bake for 8-10 minutes. Makes about 2 dozen.

Sift together sugar, flour, baking powder, soda and ginger powder. Cut in margarine until mixture resembles coarse meal. Combine dry mixture with pumpkin puree and stir to combine well. Turn out onto a lightly floured board and roll out to about 1/2 thickness. Cut into desired shapes with a biscuit cutter or cut into squares or rectangles with a knife and place 1 inch apart on an ungreased baking sheet. Bake at 400 degrees for 10 minutes or until lightly browned. Serve warm or cool.

Cook pasta according to package directions. Drain and set aside. Combine tuna and Italian seasoning in a bowl and mix well. Stir in butter flavored crackers until crumbled. Add pasta and butter and toss gently to blend. Serve immediately.

Bring water to a boil in large pan. Stir in salt. Add pasta. Stir to prevent sticking. Add milk and sugar. Stir frequently. Simmer for 10 minutes or until pasta is tender. Melt butter in a small skillet. Stir into milk mixture. Remove from heat. Stir in vanilla. Serve warm.

Boil potatoes until fork tender, drain and return to pan. Add onions and cook until soft and golden brown. Remove from heat and mash the vegetables with a fork until smooth. Add roast beef and crumbled cooked bacon and mix well. In a mixing bowl, beat together eggs and worcestershire sauce. Stir the egg mixture into the potato mixture and blend well. Pour into a greased 8 inch square dish and sprinkle with chives and cheddar cheese. Bake at 400 degrees for 30 minutes or until lightly browned.

Bring broth to boil in saucepan over medium-high heat. Cook 3 minutes. Add corn and cook 2 minutes. Add tomatoes, chilies and chickencook 2 minutes or until chicken is cooked through. Add tortilla chipstoss gently to coat. Serve with fresh lime wedges and cilantro leaves for garnish.

Heat olive oil and butter in heavy saucepan over medium high heat. Add onion and cook until translucent. Add garlic and cook another minute. Add sausage links and cook until brown and no pink remains. Add broth, potatoes, and bay leaf to saucepan and bring to a boil. Reduce heat and simmer until potatoes are fork tender. Add baby spinach and simmer until wilted. Add heavy cream and season with salt and pepper to taste. Serve hot and top with grated cheese if desired.

In 9×13 pan, layer 6 bread slices. Sprinkle with 2 cups shredded cheddar cheese. Mix together 1 lb sausage meat, 1 can grape jelly, 1 package velveeta cheese and 1 can cream of mushroom soup. Spread over bread. Cover with 1 can cheddar cheese. Bake at 350 degrees for 1 hour or until bubbly. Cut into squares to serve.

Heat large skillet over medium-high heat. Fry bacon until crisp. Remove bacon and set aside. Saute onion and garlic until tender. Add mushrooms and cook 2-3 minutes. Add bacon. Drain beans and add to skillet. Add wine. Stir until well blended. Add beans. Cover and simmer over low heat 5-10 minutes until beans are crisp-tender. Sprinkle with parmesan cheese. Serve over hot cooked rice.

Cut avocados in half and remove pits. Scoop the avocado flesh from each half and place in a large bowl. Add salt and mash with a fork until smooth. Slice tomato and onion into wedges and add to bowl. Mince cilantro stems and add to bowl. Taste and add more lime juice as desired. Makes 3 cups.

For the dressing, whisk the olive oil, lemon juice and seasonings in a small bowl. Season the salad with salt and pepper to taste. In a large bowl, toss the shrimp with the dressing. Add the avocado and celery and toss to combine. Garnish with tomatoes, parsley and onion.

In small bowl, combine salt, pepper, mustard and juicemix well. Rub mixture on both sides of each breast. Heat oil in large nonstick skillet over medium-high heat. Arrange chicken breasts in single layersaute 2 min per side or until done. Meanwhile combine remaining ingredientsstirring constantly, bring to a boil. Pour over chickenstir to coat. Serve immediately.

Heat oven to 375 degrees. Toss onions with olive oil in oven-proof dish. Season with sugar and 2 tsp salt. Bake for 35 minutes. Meanwhile, sprinkle pork tenderloin with 1 tsp salt and 1/2 tsp pepper. Heat large saute pan over high heat. Brown pork on both sides. Transfer to oven and roast for about 40 minutes, or until pork is done.

In a heavy skillet, heat olive oil. Sprinkle fish lightly on both sides with salt. Saute fish over medium high heat about 3 minutes per side or until fish is lightly browned. Add onion and garlic. Saute until onion is lightly browned. Add green chilies. Stir about 1 minute. Add tomatoes. Stir until mixture is heated through. Add olives. Sprinkle fish with black pepper. Pour wine over fish. Cover skillet. Simmer about 3 minutes. Uncover skillet. Stir in pimento stuffed olives. Cook about 1 minute. Serve hot.
Season snapper with onions, juices, rind, nutmeg. Bake at 350 degrees for 15 minutes. Broil for 2 minutes.

Preheat oven to 350 degrees F (175 degrees C). Melt butter in a saucepan over medium heat. Whisk in flour and cook for 1 minute. Remove from heat and gradually whisk in milk until mixture is smooth. Return to heat and simmer until thick enough to coat a spoon, stirring constantly. Remove from heat and stir in egg yolks until well combined. In a small bowl, combine 1 cup flour with salt. Cut in butter until crumbly. Stir in remaining flour 1 tablespoon at a time until dough is easy to handledo not overmix or dough will be tough. Roll dough out onto a floured surface to 1/4-inch thickness. Cut dough into 1-inch squares. Place about 1 teaspoon filling on each square of dough, then fold into a triangle. Brush with melted butter. Bake in preheated oven for 15 minutes or until lightly browned. Serve warm with ice cream or whipped cream.
Combine dry ingredients in a bowl. Add sour cream to eggs. Add to dry ingredients. Stir in oil and cream-style corn. Mix well. Bake in a waffle iron.

Combine the refried beans, taco seasoning and sour cream in a casserole dish. Bake for 1 hour. In a small bowl combine the cream cheese and milk. Blend in the ground round and the jalapeno. Pour over the top of the casserole. Top with the colby-monterey jack cheese. Bake at 400 degrees for 10 minutes or until the cheese is melted. Serve with tortilla chips.

Combine margarine and corn syrup in a saucepan and heat until margarine is melted and mixture is bubbling. Add the chips and stir until melted and smooth. Remove from heat and stir in vanilla and icing sugar. Fold in the Rice Krispies and spread into a waxed paper lined 8x8" baking pan. Cool and cut into squares.
Bake potatoes until done. Mash with milk and soup. Add ham. Bake uncovered for 30 minutes at 350. Serve with sour cream.
Brew 1/4 cup brewed coffee. Add cinnamon, sugar, 1/2 cup unsweetened chocolate square, and vanilla. Heat to dissolve chocolate. Pour into 2 cups. Top with whipped topping.

In a large bowl combine Bisquick and milk. Stir in chicken. Pour into a 9x13 pan. Add corn. Pour in enchilada sauce. Add taco seasoning. Sprinkle with cheese. Bake at 350 for 30 minutes. Top with lettuce, sour cream, and salsa. Serve with tortilla chips.

Boil a large pot of water to cover the squash. Cut squash in half lengthwise and remove seeds and membranes. Season with white pepper and nutmeg to taste. Add squash to boiling water and cook until tender. Drain and cool. Crumble bacon and set aside. Whisk egg substitute with milk and parmesan cheese in a bowl until smooth. Heat olive oil in frying pan and saute onion until transparent. Add cooked squash and bacon and saute 2 minutes. Add egg mixture and cook over low heat until thickened. Serve over spaghetti squash and garnish with bacon bits.

Put ice in a tall glass. Muddle mint leaves with lime juice in a shaker until smooth. Pour into glass. Top up with blueberry lemonade and stir. Pour in club soda and stir again. Top up with limeade and stir again. Garnish with mint sprig and lime slice.

Combine all ingredients in an airtight jar. Store in a cool dry place until ready to use. To prepare, combine 1 cup mayonnaise and 1 tablespoon dry dressing mix. Whisk well and use as a dip or salad dressing.

Hard boil the eggs for 15 minutes. Let them cool for a bit then run cold water over them. Peel and slice in half. Butter the bread on one side only and sprinkle with salt and pepper. Place the egg yolks in the middle of the bread and top with the egg whites. Serve immediately.

Bring raspberries, water and sugar to a boil in a saucepan. Remove from heat and stir in cinnamon stick. Let cool to room temperature. Strain into a pitcher. Add cider. Chill for several hours. Stir to blend. Serve over ice. Garnish with fresh raspberries.

Drain liquid from cans. In large bowl, combine the fruit. In small bowl, stir together pudding and milk. Add to fruit and stir. Add frozen juice and stir. Refrigerate for 2 hours. Just before serving, stir in sour cream. Serve chilled.

Heat olive oil in a saucepan over medium heat. Add onions, chili and cook for about 10 minutes, stirring occasionally until translucent. Add rice, stirring to coat each grain in oil. Add stock to cover rice completely by 1 inch. Bring to a boil, cover and simmer 20 minutes. Add spinach and cook another 10 minutes, adding more stock if necessary to keep rice covered by 1 inch of liquid. Stir in dill. Serve in large bowls garnished with yogurt and dill.

Bring a large pot of water to a boil over high heat. Add noodles, reduce heat to medium-high, and cook noodles, stirring occasionally, until tender but not mushy, about 8 minutes. Drain noodles. Melt margarine in a large skillet over medium-low heat. Stir in flour, salt and pepper, stirring constantly until flour is light brown, about 2 minutes. Gradually whisk in canned milk until smooth. Bring mixture to a boil over medium-high heat, stirring constantly, until sauce thickens slightly. Stir in frozen peas and mushrooms until heated through. Serve hot over noodles.

Chop key lime in half. Remove seeds. Chop half of each lime. Juice other half of lime. Cut each chicken breast in half. Cut onions in half. Peel garlic cloves. Add all to blender. Add tequila and juice of 1/2 lime. Blend well. Pour over chicken. Serve with white rice.

Sprinkle the flour on a plate. Season the livers with salt and pepper. Dip the livers into the flour and shake off the excess. Heat the oil in a large skillet. Add the livers. Fry for a few minutes on each side. When crispy brown on both sides, remove from the pan. Place the livers on a platter and sprinkle with the oregano. Squeeze the lemon juice over the livers. Serve at once.

Preheat oven to 450 F (230 C). In a large bowl, combine the chicken wings and enough cold water to cover them. Stir until well coated and let stand for 30 minutes. In a large skillet, melt butter over medium heat. Add wings and brown on all sides. Combine the hot sauce and vinegar and pour over wings and turn heat to medium-low and cook for 1 to 1 1/2 hours turning them over every 15 minutes or so. You can also broil them for 15 minutes or until nicely browned. Remove the wings and serve with your favorite dipping sauce (like ranch dressing).

In a medium-sized saucepan over medium heat, combine milk, dark chocolate, butterscotch schnapps and butter. Bring to a boil, stirring often. Remove from heat and stir until smooth. Top with marshmallows. Serves 2-3

Combine milk and heavy cream in a saucepan. Bring almost to boil. Meanwhile combine the 3/4 cup sugar and 1/2 cup water in a small saucepan over low heat. Cook until syrup is clear, about 5 minutes. Remove from heat and stir in lemon juice and lemon zest. Set aside to cool. Preheat oven to 375 degrees. Butter 6 ramekins. In a medium size mixing bowl, beat the eggs with an electric mixer. Gradually add 1/3 cup sugar and beat until thick and pale yellow. Beat in all remaining ingredients, except ramekins. Divide mixture among ramekins. Place ramekins in a shallow pan and pour enough boiling water into pan until it reaches half way up sides of ramekins. Bake for 40 minutes or until souffles are puffed and golden brown. Remove from oven and cool in pan. Serve warm or cold.

Heat oven to 350 degrees Fahrenheit. Slice sausage into diagonal slices and place in a baking dish. Cover dish with foil. Bake for about an hour and a half, turning occasionally. Remove foil and brown lightly for about 15-20 minutes. In a small saucepan, stir together brown sugar and vinegar and heat until sugar dissolves. In a medium bowl, combine remaining ingredients and add brown sugar mixture, stirring until smooth. Pour over sausage and bake for an additional 30-45 minutes or until sauce thickens and turns a dark brown color.

Brown the beef, drain off fat. In large mixing bowl combine the seasoning with the potatoes. Add the meat mixture. Bake at 350 degrees for 1 hour. Serve on soft or hard tortillas with cheese sour cream or salsa.
Melt butter. Saute vegetables until tender. Add stock. Bring to a boil. Add flour to thicken. Add remaining ingredients. Serve with sour cream.

Cook bacon until almost done, remove from pan and drain. Saute onion in bacon grease until tender. Add pimentos and cook for 30 seconds. Stir in mayonnaise. Break up bacon in mixture. Combine with cheddar and worcestershire. Adjust seasoning to taste. Serve with crackers or toasted baguette slices.

Heat oven to 350 degrees. In a large mixing bowl combine the first three ingredients. Mash the cheese with a fork to make a soft paste. Blend well with the onion mixture. Mix in the egg yolk and seasonings. Bake for one hour.

Heat oil in large skillet on medium-high heat. Add chickencook 10 minutes or until no longer pink. Add water, taco seasoning mix and 1/4 cup ortega. Bring to a boil. Reduce heat to medium-lowcover. Simmer 5 minutes or until done. Serve with assorted toppings on warmed taco shells.

Cook pasta according to package directions. While pasta is cooking, heat oil in large skillet over medium heat. Add garlic and cook 1 minute or until garlic is light brown. Add zucchini and broccoli. Cook and stir 1-2 minutes or until vegetables are tender. Add chicken broth and hot red pepper flakes. Cook and stir 1 minute. Drain pasta and add to vegetables. Add salt and pepper to taste. Garnish with freshly grated Parmesan cheese.

Combine the cocoa and boiling waterset aside. Cream the shortening and sugar togetherbeat in the vanilla. Add the egg yolks, one at a time, beating well after each addition. Stir in the cocoa mixtureset aside. Combine the flour, baking soda and saltstir into the batter. Blend in the milk and add the egg whites, beaten to stiff peaks. Pour the batter into two greased and floured 9-inch round baking pans. Bake at 350 for 25 to 30 minutes or until a toothpick inserted in the center comes out clean. Cool for 20 minutesremove from pans to wire racks to cool completely. Frost as desired. Makes two 9-inch layers.

Preheat oven to 350. Place roast on rack in large shallow roasting pan. Rub with garlic and rosemary. Sprinkle with salt and pepper. Rub more garlic and rosemary on top. Drizzle with olive oil. Pour wine around roast. Bake for 30 minutes per pound or until internal temperature reaches 145. Remove roast and pour off drippings. Let roast rest for 10 minutes. Cut into 1/2 inch slices and serve.

Rinse and drain the green beans. Heat the broth to a simmer in a medium-sized saucepan. Add the green beans and cook for 4 minutes. Drain the beans and transfer them to a large bowl. In a small bowl stir together the olive oil, lemon juice and pepper. Pour the dressing over the cooked beans and stir to coat. Divide the beans among four plates and sprinkle the top with the almonds. Garnish with fresh parsley. Serve immediately.

Sprinkle both sides of fish with salt and pepper. Set aside. In a large skillet, saute onion in olive oil until soft. Add zucchini, mushrooms, garlic, wine and water. Add tomatoes. Simmer until sauce is thick. Add fish. Sprinkle with herbs. Bake for 20 minutes at 400-degrees f. Garnish with lemon. Serve with rice.

Heat oven to 350. Combine 1 tablespoon butter, mustard and roasted red pepper in small bowl. Spread onto one side of each slice of italian bread. Top 4 slices with brie. Top with 2 slices ham. Top with remaining brie. Add remaining butter to skillet and heat over medium heat. Cook sandwiches in skillet until golden brown and brie is melted. Cut sandwiches in half and serve with remaining butter.

Beat the egg and the sultanas and add the corn flakes and mix well. Add the flour and mix well. Add the melted butter and the chocolate chips and mix well. Roll into balls with the palms of your hands and place on greaseproof paper on a plate. Leave to cool and harden in the fridge for at least 4 hours. Melt some more chocolate and dip the balls into it and put them back on the plate in the fridge to set.

Butter each half of an onion roll. In a skillet over medium heat, cook the kielbasa in 1/4 cup butter until browned. Remove kielbasa from pan. In same pan, cook 1/4 cup diced onion in butter until golden. In a bowl, combine cooked kielbasa, 1/4 cup chopped onion, and 1/4 cup chopped green bell pepper. In another bowl, beat 1/2 cup mayonnaise. Add 1/4 teaspoon pepper. Spread 1/2 mayonnaise mixture on each half of onion roll. Top mayonnaise on one half with 1/4 cup shredded monterey jack cheese. Top cheese with 1/4 cup sausage mixture. Top sausage mixture on other half with 1/4 cup shredded monterey jack cheese. Place top half on bottom half. Garnish with 1 slice dill pickle. Cut in half crosswise.

Heat oven to 350 degrees F. In 10-inch ovenproof skillet, mix all but the butter and salt. Cover tightly with foil. Bake for 25 minutes. Uncover skillet. Pour in butter and salt, and bake for 10 minutes longer or until golden brown.

Preheat oven to 350. Dredge the chicken in the seasoned flour. Heat the olive oil in a Dutch oven over medium heat. Sweat the onions and garlic for 5 minutes. Add the chicken and cook for 1-2 minutes on each side. Add the wine and simmer for 2-3 minutes. Transfer the mixture to a large baking sheet. Add the remaining ingredients and bake for 35 minutes.

Mix dark corn syrup and eggs. Add evaporated milk. Stir in pumpkin. Add salt and spices. Blend well. Pour into unbaked pastry shell. Bake in 425 degree oven for 15 minutes. Reduce heat to 350 degrees fahrenheit for 30 minutes or until center is firm.

Spread a thick layer of pesto sauce over one slice of panini bread. Add 1/2 cup mozzarella cheese and sprinkle with 1/4 cup Parmesan cheese. Top with bell peppers. Close panini. Spread remaining pesto sauce over other slice of panini bread. Add 1/2 cup mozzarella cheese and sprinkle with 1/4 cup Parmesan cheese. Close panini. Place in panini press and cook until golden brown. Makes 1 sandwich.

Clean prawns. Lightly dust with salt and black pepper. Heat olive oil in a large pan or wok over medium heat until it is very hot but not smoking. Add prawns to pan, cook for 4 minutes or until pink, turning over once. Stir in garlic and chilies and cook for 2 minutes. Add wine and stir to combine. Add lemon juice and parsley. Serve immediately with rice or pasta.

Preheat oven to 400 degrees F. Lightly coat the inside of a 10-cup muffin pan with cooking spray. Peel potatoes and slice each into 12 equal pieces. Place in muffin cups and sprinkle evenly with onions and swiss cheese. Season with salt and pepper and drizzle with cream. Bake uncovered until the potatoes are tender and lightly browned on top, about 20 minutes. Serve immediately.

In a jar with a tight-fitting lid combine sugar, vinegar, oil, mustard, salt, celery seed, celery seed, garlic salt. Cover and shake well until sugar is dissolved. Cut tomatoes in half. Cut sweet onion into thin slices. Slice green pepper. Toss all in dressing. Chill.

Peel and dice the potatoes into small cubes. Boil them until tender. Drain the potatoes. Place them into a large mixing bowl and add the chicken broth. Use a hand-held mixer to blend the mixture until it is smooth. Add the pesto sauce and mix well. Serve warm.

Cook brussels sprouts with stock and seasonings until tender. Mash brussels sprouts against side of pan. Stir in flour with milk. Cook over low heat, stirring until thickened. Add heavy cream, nutmeg and Tabasco sauce to taste. Adjust seasonings with salt and pepper.

Beat cream cheese and sugar in a large mixing bowl until well blended. Stir in chocolate. Gently stir in whipped topping. Fold in 1/3 cup Oreo crumbs. Spoon into two small glasses. Cover and refrigerate 3 hours or until set. Garnish with remaining Oreo crumbs.

Combine milk and salt in a saucepan over medium heat. Stir in light brown sugar until dissolved. Bring to a boil, remove from heat and let stand until cool to the touch. Stir in yeast. Beat egg with water in a small bowl until blended. Stir in egg mixture into yeast mixture in the saucepan. Beat together 2 cups flour and 1/4 cup brown sugar in a large bowl. Stir in yeast mixture until blended. Stir in bacon drippings. Beat in remaining flour 1/2 cup at a time until a soft dough forms. Turn dough out onto a lightly floured surface. Knead for 5-8 minutes or until smooth and elastic. Place dough in a greased bowl. Cover and let rise in a warm place for 1 hour or until doubled in bulk. Punch dough down. Turn out onto a lightly floured surfacedivide into 4 equal parts. Shape each portion into a round loaf. Place loaves in a greased 15 x 10-inch baking pan. Cover and let rise in a warm place for

In a large bowl, combine fiber one and boiling water. Stir until cereal is soft. Add the yogurt, sugar substitute and bananastir well. Add the egg substitute and mix well. Combine the flour, baking soda and saltstir well. Stir into the yogurt mixture just until blended. Spoon batter into muffin cups. Bake in a preheated oven until golden brown, about 25 minutes.

Heat oil in a skillet over medium-high heat. Add steaks and cook to desired doneness about 4 minutes per side for rare. Sprinkle with garlic, black pepper and a few drops of wine. Add broth to pan. Boil until reduced to a thin sauce consistency about 2 minutes. Pour over steaks and serve.

Combine all the spices in a small bowl and rub the mixture evenly on both sides of the fish. Heat the grill to high heat and grill the fish skin side down for 3 minutes and then turn over and grill for another 3 minutes until the fish is cooked through. Garnish with fresh lime wedges and coriander sprigs and serve immediately.

Place orange juice, honey, cider vinegar, and tarragon in a zip-top bag. Add chicken breasts. Let marinate in the refrigerator for 4 hours. Remove from bag. Add orange slices. Cook over medium-high heat until the meat is no longer pink. Add the stuffed olives. Serve with pasta.
Pour kahlua into a glass. Top with sugar. Add coffee and then schnapps. Stir well and serve. Top with whipped cream and sprinkle with chocolate shavings.

Chop the red onion. Slice the garlic cloves. Wash the courgette. Chop the tomatoes. Boil the pasta. Heat the olive oil in a frying pan. Add the onion and garlic. Cook until the onion is softened. Add the courgette. Cook for about 3 minutes. Add the tomatoes. Season to taste. Stir in the pine nuts and the pasta. Sprinkle the Parmesan over the dish.

Boil the potatoes and corn together until tender. When done cooking, remove the two vegetables from the cooking liquid and let them drain. While they are draining, add the bell peppers to the liquid and cook for a few minutes. When all the vegetables are drained and cooled to room temperature, combine the scallion, lemon juice and sour cream. Add the cumin and salt and pepper to taste. Toss the vegetables with the dressing and chill.

Preheat 375 f. Grease 9-inch pie pan. Beat together egg and apple tart mix. Add butter. Mix until crumbly. Press crumbly mixture into bottom of pie pan. Top with apples, raisins and white sugar. Dot with ground cinnamon. Bake until light brown.

Place brussels sprouts and white wine in a large pot. Cook over high heat until liquid is almost evaporated. Add mustard and stir to combine. Lower heat to medium-low and cover. Cook until tender for about 10 minutes. Uncover and stir to incorporate maple syrup. Add more salt and pepper if needed. Serve immediately.

Wash and cut the squash into cubes. Heat the oil in a pan. Add the mustard seeds and when they crackle, add the cumin seeds. Add the chopped onion and fry till golden brown. Add the squash cubes and the spices and mix. Add water and cook till the squash is tender. Serve hot with rice.

Place fillets in a bowl. Combine flour and balsamic vinegartoss with fish. Let stand for 2 minutes. Heat 2 tablespoons of the olive oil in a skillet. Add the fishcook for 2 minutes on each side or until done. Remove fish from skilletset aside. Heat remaining 2 tablespoons of olive oil in the skillet. Stir in the water and the rosemary. Cook for 30 seconds. Add the garliccook for 1 minute. Add the fish. Cook for 30 seconds. Pour the pan juices over the fish. Serve.

Preheat your oven to 350 degrees F. In a large bowl combine potatoes, bacon, shallots, and brussels sprouts. Toss to coat. Pour onto a baking sheet in a single layer. Drizzle with oil and sprinkle with salt and pepper. Roast in the preheated oven until potatoes are tender when pierced with a knife, 30 to 40 minutes. In a small bowl toss together butter and lemon juice. Toss potatoes with dressing. Garnish with fresh herbs. Serve immediately.

In a large bowl, combine first 4 ingredients. Add chicken pieces, turn to coat well with sauce mixture. Cover tightly with plastic wrap and refrigerate 24 hours, turning occasionally. Heat grill to high heat. Place chicken pieces in a single layer on grill rack coated with cooking spray. Grill 5 minutes, turning once, or until no longer pink in the center. Serve with toothpicks.
Mix together. Press into greased 8 x 8 pan. Let cool. Cut into squares.

1/4 lb butter or margarine softened3/4 cup white granulated sugar1 tsp salt1/2 tsp baking powder1/8 tsp freshly grated nutmeg1/8 tsp ground cinnamon1/2 cup fresh lemon juice1/2 cup milk1 lb ripe fresh peaches (2 large)2 tbsp sliced almonds1/2 cup flaked coconutPreheat oven to 400 degrees F. Lightly grease a shallow baking dish or pie pan. Combine the butter or margarine with the brown sugar and beat until well blended. Add the egg and beat until the mixture is smooth. Add the salt, baking powder and spices and beat until thoroughly mixed. Add the lemon juice and mix until just combined. Add the milk and mix until smooth and creamy. Pour mixture into the prepared dish and arrange the peaches on top. Sprinkle the almonds and coconut over the top of the fruit. Bake for about 40 minutes or until golden brown and the fruit is tender. Makes 6 servings

Season pork with salt. In large skillet heat oil over medium heatcook chops 3-5 minutes per side or until lightly browned. Add watercover tightly. Cook 15-20 minutes longer or until a thermometer reads 160 F. Meanwhile combine other ingredients. Remove cover from skilletadd coconut mixture. Cook uncovered 5 minutes longer or until slightly thickened. Sprinkle with parsley. Serve with rice.
In a bowl combine scallions, herbed goat cheese, roasted red peppers, sun-dried tomatoes, fresh spinach. Spread evenly over london broil. Bake at 375 degrees for about 10 minutes.

Preheat oven to 325 degrees F (165 degrees C). Beat eggs, sugar, salt and milk in a large bowl until smooth. Pour into individual tart shells and bake in the preheated oven for 30 minutes or until the custards have set. Allow to cool slightly before serving.

In a crock-pot combine the broth, soup, onion powder and potatoes. Cook, covered, on low for 8 to 9 hours. During last hour of cooking add the chilies. In a small bowl combine the cream cheese, milk, cornstarch and salt. Stir until smooth. Pour over chili. Serve with tortilla or croutons.

Preheat the oven to 400. Season the flour with the seasoning. Dredge the chicken in the flour mixture. Heat 1 tablespoon of the oil in a heavy-bottomed skillet over medium heat. Cook the chicken until browned on both sides. Transfer to a baking dish. Add the apples and pear to the skillet. Add the wine and scraping up any brown bits. Cook until the liquid is almost gone. Add the lemon juice, the remaining 1 tablespoon of oil, the thyme and the sage. Stir to blend. Pour over the chicken. Bake for 20 minutes. Remove from the oven. Spoon the fruit over the top. Sprinkle with the salt and the fresh ground black pepper. Bake for another 15 minutes. Serve warm.

Cook the pasta in a large saucepan of boiling salted water until just tender. Drain. Add the butter to the same pan. Add the garlic and cook for 1 minute. Add the drained pasta to the pan. Add the drained prawns to the pan. Heat through. Add the lemon zest. Season to taste with black pepper. Serve with flat leaf parsley sprinkled over. Serve with lemon wedges on the side.

Combine milk and eggs in bowl. Dip fish in milk mixture. Coat with corn flake crumbs. Season with salt, pepper and cayenne pepper. Fry in deep fat until golden brown. Drain on paper towels. Makes 4 servings.

In a medium bowl, combine milk and pudding. Stir well. Spoon into the bottom of six dessert dishes. Spread topping over the top. Cut cake into 1-inch cubes. Place cubes on top of topping. Top with candy bars. Drizzle with chocolate fudge topping. Chill. Carbs.

Season pork chops with seasoning salt, garlic powder, oregano, parsley flakes, and paprika. Brown on both sides in butter. Remove pork from pan and set aside. Add onion to pan and cook until tender. Add soup mixes, enough water to make the mixture of the consistency of gravy. Return pork to pan. Cook until heated through. Serve on a bed of rice or cooked noodles.

Cut potatoes and carrots into 1/4-inch slivers. Heat oil in a heavy skillet. Add vegetables and saute until slightly crisp. Add green onions and saute for 1 minute longer. Stir in ponzu sauce. Heat through. Season to taste. Serve immediately. Makes 4 servings.

Place olive oil in crockpot and brown chicken pieces on all sides. Sprinkle with garlic powder, seasoning salt, pepper to taste. Add spaghetti sauce mix and white wine. Cook on low for 4 to 5 hours. Add zucchini for last 45 minutes. Serve hot with pasta or rice.

In a large bowl, cream butter and dry milk powder until light and fluffy. Add molasses and mix well. Add egg substitute and mix well. Add flour, salt and baking soda and mix well. Add raisins and mix well. Drop by rounded tablespoon onto ungreased baking sheets. Bake at 375 degrees for 10 to 12 minutes or until edges are lightly browned. Cool on wire racks and store tightly covered.

In a small bowl combine the syrup, vinegar, orange juice, and garlic. Whisk to combine and set aside. Preheat oven to 400 degrees F. Pat the salmon dry with a paper towel. Heat a skillet over medium-high heat. Add 1 tablespoon olive oil and swirl to coat the bottom of the pan. Place the salmon steaks in the skillet and cook until browned on one side. Transfer to an oven-safe plate. In the same pan, add the remaining 1 tablespoon olive oil and the remaining glaze. Bring to a simmer and cook until slightly reduced. Brush the glaze on the salmon and place in the oven to finish cooking, 8 to 10 minutes. Garnish with fresh thyme.

Soak bones in buttermilk overnight. Drain and discard bones and soaking liquid. Combine remaining ingredients in a bowl and marinate in refrigerator for 1 hour or overnight. Grill over medium-high heat for 10 to 12 minutes per side or until done, basting frequently with marinade. Yields 4 servings. Serves 4.

Cook carrots in a small amount of boiling water until tender. Drain and return to pot. Melt butter in same pot over low heat. Stir in brown sugar until melted. Stir in cream. Heat through. Stir in chives.

Mix hash browns and meat together. In a bowl, combine rest of ingredients and spray the inside of a 13x9 pan with cooking spray. Spread the hash brown mixture over the bottom of the pan. Pour the sauce mixture over the hash browns. Sprinkle the cheese over the top. Bake uncovered at 350 degrees for 40 minutes or until the hash browns are crispy. Serve hot.

Heat 1/4 inch of water in a small saucepan over medium-low heat. While water heats, trim ends off zucchini and discard. Cut each piece lengthwise into 1/4-inch-thick strips. Sprinkle zucchini with salt to taste. Blanch for 1 minute. Drain in a colander, then rinse under cold water to stop cooking. Place zucchini in an ice water bath to cool. Remove zucchini from ice water bath. Drain and pat dry. Heat 1 teaspoon oil in a medium nonstick pan over medium-high heat. Add zucchini and cook, tossing occasionally, until tender-crisp, 2 to 3 minutes. Transfer to paper towel-lined plate. In a small bowl whisk lemon juice with lemon zest. Slowly whisk in remaining 3 tablespoons oil. Season with salt to taste. In a medium bowl toss zucchini with vinaigrette. Add basil and toss to combine. Serve at room temperature.

In saucepan bring enough water to cover 2 cups flour to boil. Stirring constantly, gradually pour flour into boiling water. Beat 2 eggs with 2 Tbsp waterpour egg mixture into flour mixture. Stir with wooden spoon until smooth. Dip eggplant strips into batterfry 1 minute each side or until golden brown. Remove from oildrain on paper towels. Repeat procedure with remaining vegetables. Serve with dipping sauce.

Melt together the butter, brown sugar and corn syrup. Add the oats and mix well. Pour the mixture into the bottom of an 8 x 8 x 2-inch pan or dish. Sprinkle the top of the mixture with the coconut. Melt the chocolate chips in the microwave or double boiler. Drizzle the mixture over the top of the bars. Top with the cherries. Cool at room temperature or refrigerate until the mixture hardens. Cut into 9 squares.
With blender puree vinegar with sugar. Add coconut milk and blend thoroughly. Season with salt and pepper. Drizzle over fish or chicken before serving.

Separate eggs. Beat egg whites until stiff. Mix egg yolks with ricotta cheese, cream of tartar, and Splenda until thick. Fold in egg whites. Grease a muffin pan with margarine. Spoon batter into muffin cups. Bake in preheated oven at 375 degrees F (190 degrees C) for 20 to 25 minutes. Serve warm.

Bring broth to a boil. Add all vegetables except pasta. Bring to a boil and simmer for 15 minutes. Add pasta and spaghetti sauce and simmer until pasta is tender. Add italian seasoning and season as desired.

In a mixing bowl, combine together rice flour, water, baking powder, salt and sugar. Mix until smooth. Divide dough into small balls using your hands. Deep fry in hot oil until brown. Drain and sprinkle on top of powdered sugar.

Brown chicken and onion. Drain and cool slightly. In a large bowl, combine onion and chicken with bread crumbs, garlic salt and pepper. Mix well. Form into 24 equal size patties. Beat eggs and dip patties into eggs. Roll in seasoned bread crumbs and refrigerate for 1 hour. Heat oil in heavy skillet or deep fryer. Fry patties in batches of 6-8 minutes or until golden brown on both sides and cooked through. Drain on paper towels. Serve with sour cream or ranch dressing, if desired.

Steam broccoli and chop into small pieces. Cut green onions into small pieces. Chop bacon into small pieces. Chop cashews into small pieces. Drain cranberries. Combine all of these ingredients in a large bowl. Add mayonnaise. Combine. Add enough mayonnaise to coat all of these ingredients. Add a few drops of vinegar. Toss. Refrigerate overnight.

Combine all except for peas and salmon in a large bowl. Mix well. Add salmon and mix lightly. Spray 4 quart crock pot with nonstick spray. Spread half of mixture in the bottom of the crock pot. Arrange salmon in the center of the mixture. Spread remaining mixture over the salmon. Cover and cook on low setting 4 hours. Remove salmon and place in a 9 x 5 loaf pan. Cover with remaining mixture from crock pot and bake 1 hour. Garnish with peas and serve with crackers or toast.

Preheat oven to 375 degrees F (190 degrees C). Grease a loaf pan. In a bowl, combine butter and sugar until light and creamyblend in eggs one at a time. Add mashed bananas, sour cream, and vanillablend well. Combine the flour, soda, and saltstir into creamed mixture. Blend well. Add chocolate chipsblend well. Pour batter into prepared pansmooth top. Bake for 50 to 60 minutes, or until a toothpick inserted near the center comes out clean. Cool before removing from pan.

In a large bowl, combine the grapes, walnuts, and blue cheese. In a small bowl, whisk together the honey, vinegar, oil, and salt. Drizzle over the grape mixturetoss to coat. Cover and refrigerate 30 minutes. Serve chilled.

In saucepan, combine cocoa, sugar and water. Cook on medium heat until mixture comes to a boil. Reduce heat to low. Stir constantly for 2 minutes. Remove from heat and cool. Add vanilla and stir. Freeze according to your ice cream maker's directions. If you don't have an ice cream maker, place the mixture in your refrigerator for 3 hours. Stir every 15 minutes until the mixture thickens and it's the consistency of soft-serve ice cream. Pour into a bowl or airtight container. Freeze until firm.

Preheat oven to 400 degrees f (200 degrees c). Grease a 10 inch square baking dish. In a bowl, combine ricotta cheese, mozzarella cheese, 1/4 cup parmesan cheese, 1/4 cup parsley, salt and peppermix well. Pour over pastastir to combine. Bake in preheated oven for 30 minutes. Top with remaining parmesan cheese. Bake an additional 10 minutes or until bubbly. Serve warm.

Mix together the yogurt, curry powder, coriander and seasoning in a bowl. Put the chicken breasts in a non-stick pan with a little oil, and fry on both sides until browned. Add the vegetable stock cubes, carrot and red peppers to the pan. Add the yogurt mixture. Cook until the chicken is tender. Stir in the green chilies. Serve with basmati rice. Sprinkle with fresh mint.

Dissolve yeast and sugar in warm water. Let stand 10 minutes. Beat egg with vanilla and add to yeast mixture. Stir in cinnamon and melted butter. Combine 4 cups flour and saltadd to yeast mixture. Mix well and chill overnight or until easy to handle. Roll out dough 1/2" thick. Cut with fluted donut cutter or glass. Heat oil to 375°. Fry 2 minutes or until golden brown. Drain. Mix powdered sugar and cinnamon. Dip doughnuts in mixture and place on wax paper to cool.
In a tall glass combine the sponge cake cubes, ice cream, and fresh strawberries. Top with more ice cream and more strawberries. Garnish with more strawberries and whipped cream. Serve immediately.
Spread each hoagie roll with a thin layer of dressing. Arrange meat, cheese, and vegetables over dressing. Bake at 350 for 10 minutes or until cheese is melted. Serve warm.

Cut the fat off of the skin of the turkey and slice the breast into strips. In a large skillet brown the strips on all sides in the olive oil.
