Add the onions and saute until they are soft and translucent. In a 3-quart or larger crock pot combine the strips of meat and onions. Add the broth and the remaining ingredients to the slow cooker and stir to combine well. Cook on high for 4 hours or on low for 6 hours, or until the meat is tender. Remove the meat from the slow cooker and place in the pan you sauteed it in. Turn on the broiler and cook the strips until they are browned on all sides. Serve with rice or noodles, or over buns.

Combine apple juice, lime juice and cornstarch in a small bowl. Set aside. Heat chicken broth to boiling in a small saucepan. Add the bouillion cube. Pour broth mixture into small bowl. Dip each chicken breast in the mixture. Then dip each breast in the lime mixture. Place chicken on a broiler rack. Broil for 10 minutes or until no longer pink. Serve over rice.

In a food processor or blender, mix together all the ingredients except the lamb. Blend until smooth. Reserve marinade. Slice the lamb chops 1/4-inch thick. Place in a zip lock bag. Pour in the marinade. Close bag and refrigerate for 24 hours. To grill the lamb chops, preheat grill. Remove lamb chops from marinade. Grill 2-3 minutes per side or until meat is no longer pink. Serve with grilled corn-on-the-cob and salad.

Preheat the oven to 425 degrees. Cut the potatoes in half lengthwise. Toss the cut side of each half with a little butter. Place in a roasting pan and bake for 30 minutes. Remove from the oven and sprinkle with the spices. Return to the oven for 10 minutes. Season with coarse salt and pepper before serving.

Wash and cut the chicken quarters into smaller pieces. Place in a pot of water and boil. Skim off any foam and when done add scallions and pepper. Remove from heat and add sugar and peanut butter. Mix well and serve over rice.

Mix together the eggs, half-and-half, vanilla and spices. Soak croissants in mixture for 3-5 minutes on each side. Heat butter in skillet over medium heat. Place croissants in skillet and cook for 4-5 minutes or until golden brown on each side. Remove croissants from skillet. Top each croissant with honey nut cream cheese. Top with sliced peaches. Return croissants to skillet and cook for an additional 1-2 minutes until cheese is melted. Serve immediately.

Combine the cabbage and bell pepper and sprinkle with the cilantro and jalapeno. Whisk together the lime juice and cumin. Drizzle over the slaw and toss to coat. Season with salt and pepper to taste. Chill until ready to serve.

In a saucepan over low heat combine sugar and cold water. Stir until the sugar is dissolved. Add chocolates and butter and heat until the mixture is smooth and shiny. Remove from the heat and whisk in the scotch. In a fondue pot or large bowl place the cream. Set over a double boiler and heat until just warm. Pour the warm cream into the saucepan with the chocolate. Whisk until smooth. Serve in a fondue pot with poundcake and a variety of fruit.

Preheat oven to 400f. Lightly spray large rimmed baking sheet. Cut each asparagus spear into 3 pieces. Mix together preserves and soy sauce until smooth. Brush each piece of asparagus with mixture and place on baking sheet. Roast for 10 minutes or until lightly browned and tender. Cool on wire rack and serve at room temperature.

Preheat oven to 400 degrees. Cut up the butter into small pieces. Add it to a large mixing bowl. Add the flour and whisk together. Add the buttermilk and the sourdough starter and mix well. Turn out onto a lightly floured surface and knead for 1 minute or until you have a smooth dough. Divide into 10 equal pieces. Roll each piece into a ball and place on an ungreased cookie sheet. Bake for 12 minutes or until lightly browned. Serve while still hot. Makes 10 biscuits.

Cook the pasta in boiling water for 9 minutes or until al dente. Drain the pasta and return to the pan. Add the butter and stir until it melts. Add the cheddar cheese and stir until it melts. Add milk and stir until heated through. Add the seasoning and stir until incorporated. Remove from heat. Serve hot topped with crackers.

To make the onions, melt butter in a large skillet over medium heat. Add the onions, sprinkle with salt and pepper to taste, and cook until caramelized and dark brown. Set aside to cool completely. Preheat the oven to 425 degrees F. Brush the insides of the bread with olive oil. Top each slice of bread with onions, blue cheese and mustard. Place the steaks on a sheet pan and place in the oven for 10 minutes or until desired doneness is reached. Slice the steaks against the grain and place on top of the bread. Serve hot or at room temperature.

Soak the mozzarella sticks in milk and eggs for at least 1 hour. Drain. Mix together all other ingredients in a separate container. Dip mozzarella sticks in this mixture then into breadcrumbs. Fry in olive oil over medium heat until golden brown. Drain on paper towel to remove any excess grease. Serve hot with marinara sauce or your favorite dip.

Separate biscuits. On wax paper place 4 biscuits. Divide hamburger between them. Spread with bbq sauce. Sprinkle with sugar and onion. Top with remaining biscuits. Bake at 450 for 15 minutes or until golden. Top with cheddar cheese and bake until melted. Serve with sour cream.

Bring chicken stock to a boil in a small saucepan. Add garlic and couscous and cook for one minute. Turn heat off and pour in the hot sauce and olive oil and stir well. Top with a little grated parmesan and serve warm or at room temperature.

In a large plastic bag or shallow dish combine the first 5 ingredients. Add the chicken parts to the mixture, turning to coat well. Refrigerate for 2 to 8 hours or overnight. Remove from refrigerator 1 hour before cooking. In a large skillet or Dutch oven heat the oil until hot. Place the chicken pieces skin side down, cook over medium high heat for 2 minutes or until skin is browned. Turn the chicken pieces overreduce the heat to medium low. Cover the pan and cook for 10 to 15 minutes or until the internal temperature is 165 degrees F (74 degrees C) on an instant read thermometer.

Mix the pesto sauce with the chicken breasts. Roll each breast in the breadcrumbs until well covered and place in a greased casserole dish. Bake in a preheated oven at 375 degrees F for 30 minutes or until the chicken is done. Top with sliced provolone cheese during the last five minutes of baking. Serve with a side of roasted baby portobello mushrooms.

Place meat in heavy duty ziplock bag. In small bowl combine remaining ingredients. Pour over meatseal bag and turn to coat. Refrigerate at least 8 hours. Remove from refrigerator and bring to room temperature. Place roast in roasting pan and bake at 350 for 15 minutes per pound. Serve with green onions.
Remove seed from avocado and mash. Add the rest of the ingredients. Mix well. Serve with tortilla chips.

In a large pot, saute the meat and onions in oil until brown. Add cabbage and water. Bring to a boil and cook until tender. Stir in seasonings and bay leaf. Add parsley and serve over hot rice or pasta with sour cream on top.

In a large bowl combine the first four ingredients. In a saucepan combine the remaining ingredients and cook over medium heat until melted. Stir in the crunchy peanut butter. Pour over the dry ingredients and stir until well blended. Spread into a greased 9x13x2-inch baking pan. Let cool. Cut into 24 squares.

Place 6 to 8 basil leaves in a cocktail shaker. Muddle until all the juices are released. Add 4 tablespoons sugar and 2 ounces rum. Add ice and shake well. Strain into an ice-filled glass. Top with orange juice and top with club soda. Serve garnished with an orange slice and some mint.

Melt butter over low heat in a non-stick skillet. Add carrots to skillet and stir to coat evenly with melted butter. Cover and simmer gently until tender. Uncover, add brown sugar and mustard. Stir to blend well. Stir in green onions and parsley. Serve immediately.

Cook the ravioli according to package directions. Cook the beef, drain and add to the ravioli. Add the frozen spinach and the spaghetti sauce, cooking until heated through. Add the mozzarella cheese and stir well to blend. Serve hot and enjoy.
Combine quinoa and spinach. In small bowl whisk lemon juice and olive oil. Stir in poppy seeds. Toss quinoa mixture and drizzle with vinaigrette. Chill 30 minutes. Serve in lettuce cups.

Melt butter in a large saucepan over medium heat. Add onions and saute for 2 minutes. Add apples and saute 3 minutes more. Stir in cabbage, salt, and pepper. Cook for 2 minutes more. Sprinkle with vinegar, brown sugar, and water. Cover and cook over low heat for 10 minutes. Mix the flour with a little cold water to make a thin paste. Stir into the cabbage mixture with the wine. Cook for 5 minutes more or until the sauce thickens.

Prepare the toast by spreading a thin layer of pesto on each slice of bread. Set aside. Cut avocados in half lengthwise, remove pit and scoop out into a mixing bowl. Mash avocado using a fork until its the desired consistency. Season with lime juice and a few pinches of sea salt and pepper. Divide between the slices of pesto-covered toast and top with a few slices of ham and a sprinkle of Parmesan cheese. Broil in the oven until the cheese is melted and the ham is warmed through. Serve immediately.

Preheat oven to 350 degrees. In a medium sized mixing bowl, combine the ground beef, ground ham, butter-flavored cracker crumbs, eggs, milk, cider vinegar, brown sugar and dry mustard. Mix thoroughly. Shape into balls about the size of walnuts (about 1 tablespoon each). Place on an ungreased baking sheet and bake for 20 minutes. Remove from oven and pour cider vinegar mixture over the meatballs. Return to oven and bake for an additional 20 minutes. Remove from oven and let cool for a few minutes before serving. Serve hot with toothpicks. Refrigerate leftover meatballs to use for sandwiches.

Rinse the noodles and cook them in boiling water until just tender. Drain well. Heat a non-stick frying pan and cook the tuna for one to two minutes per side or until just seared. Cut into 1 cm (1/2-inch) thick slices. Mix the wasabi and soy sauce together. Add the scallions and arugula and toss. Divide the noodles between two serving plates and top each plate with one portion of the tuna. Drizzle the wasabi sauce over the top and sprinkle with sesame seeds. Serve at once.

Drain and flake the sardines. Add the green onions and mix well. Add the yogurt and mix thoroughly. Add the lemon juice and mix well. Add the prepared horseradish and mix thoroughly. Add the dried dill and mix. Place the mixture into a serving bowl. Surround the mixture with the carrot sticks. Arrange the melba toast around the carrot sticks. Refrigerate until ready to serve.

Melt the wine in a double boiler over low heat. Whisk in the lemon juice and cornstarch until smooth. Stir in the gouda by the handful. When the cheese is melted and smooth season with cayenne pepper and a little ground nutmeg. Transfer the pot to a tabletop burner.

Beat egg whites until they are stiff and then add the sugar. Now add the vanilla and the cornstarch and mix. Add the milk and beat again. Now fold in the banana and pour into a baked pie shell. Chill until ready to serve.

In a Dutch oven or heavy skillet, melt butter over medium-high heat. Add sausagecook, stirring occasionally, until browned on all sides, 5-6 minutes. Remove sausage from Dutch ovenset aside. In Dutch oven or heavy skillet, whisk in flour, thyme, bay leaf, and marjoramcook 3 minutes or until lightly browned and bubbly, whisking constantly. Whisk in winebring to a boil. Cook 1 minute or until sauce thickens, whisking constantly. Stir in sausagecook 2 minutes or until thoroughly heated. Serve immediately.

In a large pot, heat oil over medium heat. Add onions and cook until soft. Add potatoes and parsnips. Cook until just tender. Add short ribs. Cook until browned. Add tomatoes, dill, stock, bay leaves, sugar, vinegar and black pepper. Cover and simmer for 2 hours. Remove short ribs and shred. Return to pot. Heat through. Serve over rice or noodles. Garnish with fresh dill.

Preheat oven to 350 degrees F (175 degrees C). Beat butter and brown sugar in medium bowl until well blended. Beat in egg and vanilla until blended. Beat in flour, soda, salt. Drop by rounded teaspoon onto ungreased cookie sheets. Bake for 10 minutes in the preheated oven. Cool for 1 minute before removing from cookie sheets to wire racks. Place miniature peanut butter cups on top of each cookielet stand until set.

Cut avocados in half. Remove seeds. Scoop the flesh into a medium sized bowl. Mash gently with a fork. Add lemon juice, plum tomato, white onion and jalapeno. Stir gently and season with coarse salt. Serve with tortilla chips.

Combine cornmeal, water, and salt in a saucepan. Cook on low heat for 5 minutes while stirring constantly. Cool slightly. Preheat your waffle iron. Beat butter and eggs together well in a bowl. Stir in the cornmeal mixture and the flour until blended. Add the baking soda and milk and mix thoroughly. Pour mixture into the heated iron and cook for 5 minutes or until done.

To prepare the dough: Heat 1/3 cup of the water to 140 F. (60 C.) and dissolve the salt in it. Pour this into an electric mixer and beat on medium speed for about 10 minutes. Add the 1/4 cup of the flour and beat for 2 minutes more. Beat in the rest of the flour, 1/2 cup at a time, beating well after each addition. Beat in the eggs and then the lemon rind and fat, beating well after each addition. Beat until smooth. Place the dough in a pastry bag fitted with a large star tip. To make the crullers: Heat 1/2 cup of oil to 375 F. (190 C.). Fry 4 or 5 crullers at a time, turning them over often until they are golden brown. Drain on paper towels and dust with confectioners' sugar while still hot. To make the sauce: Heat the remaining 3/4 cup oil and 1/2 cup of water to 375 F. (190 C.). Beat in 2 tablespoons

Preheat oven to 400F. Place a pie crust in a 9 inch glass pie plate. Place sliced pears in crust in concentric circles, leaving some space in the center. Sprinkle with the dried cranberries and ginger. In a bowl stir together the cranberries, water, cornstarch and sugar, until the cranberries have popped. Stir in the lemon zest and cook over medium heat until mixture thickens. Remove from heat and add the dried ginger and milk and stir well. Pour the filling over the pears. Place the second pie crust over the filling and trim to fit. Seal the crust and crimp with a fork or flute with a knife. Make several slits in the top crust for venting. Bake until the crust is golden and crisp, approximately 1 hour. Cool on a wire rack. Serve warm or at room temperature.
Combine cereal and noodles. Set aside. Melt margarine. Add raisins and banana chips. Stir. Add to cereal mixture. Cool. Add nuts. Add chocolate chips.
Place mayonnaise in large mixing bowl. Add chili sauce, worcestershire sauce, cheddar cheese, olives and chopped pecans. Mix well. Serve on crackers or flatbreads. This makes about 4 servings.
Bring to a boil, cover and simmer for 30 minutes. Strain.

In a large bowl combine the pears and grapes. In a small saucepan over low heat whisk together the cream cheese and cream until smooth and melted. Stir in the juice from the canned pears. Pour over the pears and grapes and toss to coat. Chill overnight. To serve, arrange the pears and grapes on a bed of grape leaves.

Combine first 7 ingredients in a large mixing bowl. Beat on medium speed 2 minutes. Stir in remaining ingredient until blended. Spread into 2 greased loaf pans. Sprinkle with cornmeal. Cover and let stand in a warm place 45 minutes. Bake at 400 for 25 minutes.

Melt the margarine and mix it well into the flour and the bouillon. Gradually add the milk and stir over heat until mixture thickens and bubbles. Add the egg yolk and stir until it thickens. Add salt and white pepper to taste and serve warm.

Preheat oven to 400 degrees F. Cut the tomatoes in half and lay them cut-side down in a shallow baking dish. Salt and pepper the insides of each half. Sprinkle the sugar inside each half and sprinkle the dried thyme inside each half. Drizzle the olive oil over the tomatoes and sprinkle the outsides with the remaining salt and pepper and the remaining sugar and the remaining thyme. Roast in the preheated oven for about an hour and ten minutes until the tomatoes begin to collapse. Serve atop pasta or rice or as a side dish.

In a large bowl combine the cream cheese and powdered sugar and mix well. Then add in the pudding and mix well. Add the milk and stir until all the powder is mixed in well. Fold in the Cool Whip and mix well. Add in the chopped chocolate and stir well until mixed together and place in the refrigerator for one hour to set up. Serve as a delicious dessert or a light lunchtime snack.

Saute onion, mushrooms and garlic in oil until tender. Add water to pan and bring to a boil. Stir in nonfat milk powder and onion/parsley flakes. Cook until thick. Correct seasonings to taste. Garnish with green onion tops.
Marinate fish with lime juice and other ingredients for 30 minutes. Thread on skewers. Grill or BBQ for 5 minutes on each side till done. Serve hot.

In a small bowl combine yogurt and garlic. Mix well. Dip each piece into the mixture and set aside. In a shallow bowl combine the flour and paprika. Dust the pieces in the mixture. In a large skillet heat olive oil over medium heat. Add the pieces and brown. Add the soy sauce and cook until done. Sprinkle with parsley and top with parmesan.

Sprinkle meat with salt pork. Wrap in heavy-duty foil and grill over medium-low heat for 2 to 3 hours. Unwrap and grill 1 to 1 1/2 hours more. Cut into serving pieces. In a small bowl combine catsup, steak sauce, vinegar, onion, lemon juice and salt. Toss with meat. Sprinkle with chili powder.

In a greased baking dish, layer 3 tortillas with 3 cups chicken and 1 1/2 cups soup, 1/2 cup water, 1/2 cup soup, 1/2 cup water. Top with 1/2 cup soup, 1/2 cup water and 1/2 cup soup. Top with remaining tortillas, chicken and soup mixturecover with remaining soup and water mixture and sprinkle with cheese. Bake uncovered at 350 degrees for 30 minutes or until heated through. Makes 6 servings.
Combine all ingredients except pecans and pie shell in a large bowl and blend well. Pour mixture into the pie shell and bake at 350 degrees f for 40 minutes. Cool completely on a wire rack and serve.

Pull apart the ice cream sandwiches and place the ice cream in a bowl. Add the magic shell topping and mix. Scoop the ice cream into a serving dish. Scoop the remaining magic shell on top and sprinkle nuts on top.

Combine the eggs and onions and set aside. In a large bowl, combine the cottage cheese and the frozen spinach. Add the egg and onion mixture, the nutmeg and the parmesan. Mix well. Stuff the manicotti with the mixture. Place the stuffed shells in a 9 by 13 baking pan. Top the shells with spaghetti sauce. Sprinkle the tops with the parmesan and the mozzarella. Bake at 350 for 45 minutes.

Mix the basil, spinach, and garlic together in a food processor or blender. Process until fine. Add the pine nuts and pulse until the mixture is creamy. Add the parmesan cheese and pulse until the mixture is well combined. Add the lemon juice and pulse until the mixture is smooth. Add the mineral water and pulse until the mixture is combined. Add the salt and pepper and process until the mixture is smooth. Serve with favorite pasta. This sauce is low in fat and delicious.

Make spice cake according to package directions. Cool. Crush pecans and mix with toffee bits. Beat pudding mix with water until thickened. Fold in whipped topping and spread over top of cake. Sprinkle with crushed pecans and toffee bits and refrigerate until ready to serve.

Preheat oven to 400 degrees f. Season the fish with salt and pepper. Layer the cheddar cheese slices and coarse grain mustard between the two fillets of fish. Place in a baking dish and bake for 15-20 minutes. In the meantime melt the butter in a saucepan. Stir in the flour and cook until smooth. Gradually stir in the cream and season to taste. Stir in the chives. Serve the sauce with the baked cod and garnish with the tomatoes.

Boil honey in water for 1 minute. Add vanilla bean (scraped), cinnamon stick, cloves and lemon zest. Cool to room temperature. Add vodka. Stir well and store in a tightly sealed container at room temperature. Will last indefinitely if kept in a dark place. Use 3 parts vodka to 1 part liqueur.

Place butter in bread pan of machine. Mix warm water and sugar in small bowl until sugar is dissolved. Sprinkle yeast over water mixture. Let stand 10 minutes or until foamy. Add salt, flour, onion, cheese and mashed potatoes to yeast mixture in bread pan of machine. Pour water mixture over all. Select Dough Cycle. Start machine. After completing cycle, remove bread from pan, place on wire rack or baking sheet. Spray loaf with cooking spray. Let bread cool 5 minutes. Remove from pan. Cut into 10 pieces. Serve immediately.

Boil chicken broth and heavy cream in a saucepan over high heat for 10 minutes or until reduced by half. Stir in flour and cook over medium heat until mixture is smooth, stirring constantly. Remove from heat and stir in 1/2 cup cheese and white wine until smooth. Season with white pepper and chives to taste. Serve over lobster tails and sprinkle with remaining cheese.
Beat eggs with water, cornstarch and spices. Dip cheese slices in egg mixture and then coat with breadcrumbs. Deep-fry in hot oil for 2 minutes or until golden brown. Serve with marinara sauce.

In a large pot, saute bacon and shallot until bacon is cooked and shallot is translucent. Add the rice and cook for 30 seconds. Add the chicken broth and stir to combine. Add the water and bring to a boil. Cover and reduce to a simmer and cook for 20 minutes, stirring frequently until liquid is absorbed and rice is tender. Remove from the heat and fluff the rice with a fork. Add the bacon and stir to combine. Taste and adjust seasoning with salt to taste. Serve immediately.

Beat yogurt and cream cheese in large bowl until well-blended. Stir in sugar and vanilla extract. Stir in strawberry. Pour into pie crust. Refrigerate until set. To serve, top with whipped topping and sprinkle with reserved strawberry slices.

Grate the potatoes and squeeze out the excess water with a sieve (you can use a cheesecloth or a clean tea towel if you don't have a sieve).Mix all the remaining ingredients together.Put the grated potato in the mixture and fold together until you have a smooth mixture.Heat the oil in a frying pan over a medium heat.Add the mixture to the pan in a tablespoonful at a time, flattening it with the back of a spoon or a spatula so that it makes a cake about 2cm thick.Fry for 2-3 minutes until the cake is golden brown underneath then turn over and fry for a further 2 minutes until golden brown on the other side.Serve hot with ketchup or sour cream.

Heat oven to 425 degrees F. Butter a baking dish or pie plate. In a bowl, beat butter and eggs together until light and creamy. Add the milk and beat well. Sift together the flour and salt and add to the wet mixture. Stir until just combined. Spoon the batter into the prepared baking dish. Scatter the chopped apple over the top and sprinkle with the brown sugar and cinnamon. Bake for 20 minutes or until golden brown. Serve immediately.

Dissolve fresh yeast in hot water. Add to milk and molasses. Add sugar. Add shredded wheat. Add shortening. Add dry ingredients. Add raisins. Knead 8-10 minutes. Let rise in warm place 1 hour. Bake at 375 25-30 minutes.

Brown bacon in large skillet until crisp. Remove bacon to paper towels. In same skillet, add butter and melt. Add green pepper and onion. Cook over medium heat until tender. Stir in bacon, eggs and milk. Cook over low heat, stirring constantly until eggs are set. Season with salt and pepper. Serve immediately in flour tortilla. Serves 4 to 6.

Preheat oven to 375 degrees f. Cut sweet potatoes into 1/2 inch thick slices. Place in a bowl, add the ginger, nutmeg, pepper, and orange zest, and toss well to coat. Spray a 13 x 9 inch baking dish with cooking spray. Place a single layer of sweet potatoes in the dish. Top with a layer of the chicken breasts. In a bowl, combine the apple juice, 1/3 cup water, and 2 tablespoons cornstarch. Pour over the chicken breasts. Top with a layer of sweet potatoes. Pour the remaining water over the sweet potatoes. Sprinkle with the remaining cornstarch. Cover the pan with aluminum foil. Bake in the preheated oven for 1 hour 15 minutes. Remove the foil during the last 15 minutes of baking. Remove from the oven and let stand for 5 minutes before serving. Serve with a side of broccoli or green beans.

Cut steak into 1/2 inch strips. In a small bowl, combine soy sauce, sherry, cornstarch, broccoli florets and garlic clove. Let stand 10 minutes. In a wok or large skillet over medium heat, heat 1 Tbs oil. Add gingerstir-fry 20 seconds. Add steak stripsstir-fry 20 seconds. Add peanut oilstir-fry 1 minute. Add vegetable mixturestir-fry 3 minutes. Serve over hot cooked rice.

Sauté oil in large saucepan over medium heat. Add garlic and sauté until golden brown. Add onion and sauté until soft. Add carrot, black beans, chicken stock and ground cumin. Bring to a boil, then simmer for 20-25 minutes. Remove from heat and stir in fresh parsley.

Preheat oven to 350 degrees F. Butter a 2 qt baking dish. Saute onions and garlic in butter until golden. Add herbs and saute another minute. Mix herb mixture with pumpkin and season to taste. Place in baking dish and dot with butter. Bake for about 15 minutes or until hot and bubbly. Stirring once during baking. Serve with toasted bread and salad.

Preheat the oven to 350 degrees f (175 degrees c). Grate the potatoes and the zucchini into a bowladd the roasted garlic and onions, and the salt and pepper to taste. Whisk the eggs and the flour together into the mixture and mix until smooth and well blended. Spray two baking dishes with nonstick cooking spray. Pour the mixture into the baking dishes and bake for about 1 hour or until firm and golden brown. Let cool slightly before slicing and serving.

In a large bowl combine the spinach, sour cream and mayonnaise. Stir in the vegetable soup mix, water chestnuts and green onions. Arrange tortilla chips in a serving dish. Pour mixture over chips. Serve with fresh vegetables such as celery, broccoli or carrots.

In 12-inch skillet, cook beef broth, bell pepper, cornstarch and vinegar over medium heat until thickened. Stir in pineapple, water, pork chops and ketchup. Bring to boil. Reduce heatcover. Simmer 45 minutes or until done. Add sugar to taste. Serve over rice.

Combine 1 cup unbleached white flour with 1 tablespoon sugar. Add 1/2 teaspoon salt. Mix thoroughly. Add 1/2 cup buttermilk. Add 1 tablespoon baking soda. Mix thoroughly. Add 1 cup of whole grain wheat flour. Mix thoroughly. Let stand for 5 minutes. Add 1 tablespoon sugar. Knead on a lightly floured surface. Let rise for 1 hour. Bake at 400 degrees for 15 minutes. Makes one large loaf. Makes one small loaf. Makes 24 muffins. Makes 24 rolls.
Drain tunachop or flakemix with the yolk from one egg and the rest of the ingredients. Add one more egg yolk to your taste. Serve on toast or crackers.

Cook pasta shells according to package directions. Drain, rinse with cold water. Put in casserole dish. In same saucepan, heat tomato soup to boiling. Pour over shells. Stir in whipping cream, cheese until smooth. Sprinkle with parsley.

Place the tofu in a colander lined with a large plate and place something heavy on top. Press the tofu for at least 20 minutes or until most of the water is out. Slice into 1cm thick slices. Heat oil and sesame seeds in a non-stick frying pan. Add the tofu and fry on both sides until golden and crispy. Set aside on kitchen paper. Heat the soy sauce in a pan and add the five spice powder and star anise. Add the molasses and reduce by half. Pour over the tofu. Sprinkle with the sesame seeds. Serve with steamed green beans or stir fried vegetables.

Preheat the oven to 400. Combine all the spices in a small bowl and set aside. In another bowl combine the oil and lemon juice. Add the chicken and turn to coat. Place the coated chicken on a baking sheet and cook for about 1 hour. While the chicken is cooking, place the slices of lemon on top for the last 15 minutes. Serve the chicken with the lemons on top.

Dry grenadier fillets with paper towel. Brush olive oil over fillets. Sprinkle with salt, pepper and paprika. Place in a shallow baking dish. Bake at 400 degrees for 10 minutes. Remove from oven. Mix mustard and vinegar. Pour over fillets. Return to oven and bake another 10 minutes or until fillets are opaque.

Place the kumara in a large pan over low heat. Add the margarine and milk and cook for 20 minutes or until tender. Heat a large frying pan over medium heat. Sweat the onion in 1 tablespoon oil until soft. Stir in zucchini, squash and tomatoes and cook 3 to 4 minutes. Season with salt and pepper to taste. Cut the lamb into thin slices. Heat remaining oil in a large nonstick frying pan over medium-high heat. Cook lamb slices until browned and cooked to your liking, about 2 minutes each side. Arrange 4 slices of lamb on each plate. Top with vegetables. Serve with kumara mash.

Preheat oven to 450°F. Rub potatoes with 1 Tbsp. oil. Sprinkle with chili powder, paprika and garlic salt. Toss to coat. Spread potatoes out onto baking sheet. Roast, turning once, until golden brown and crispy, about 20 minutes. Cool slightly. Combine cilantro and lime juice in small bowl. Slice potatoes. Top with sour cream. Serve with avocado dip.

Bring water to a boil in a medium saucepan. Add couscous. Cover and remove from heat. Let stand 5 minutes. Stir in plums. Set aside. In a large bowl combine couscous and plums. Stir in scallions. Top with goat cheese and mint. Mix well. Drizzle with honey and vinegar. Season with pepper. Serve.
Heat oil in large skillet. Brown pork chops. Add vegetables and tomato sauce. Cover and cook about 15 minutes. Add vinegar. Cook until heated through. Serve over rice.

Preheat oven to 350 degrees F (175 degrees C). Line 2 baking sheets with parchment paper. Cream together the butter and brown sugar until smooth. Beat in the egg, milk, flour, baking soda, and salt until well blended. Fold in the oats and both types of candy pieces. Drop by teaspoonful onto the prepared baking sheets. Bake in the preheated oven for 8 to 10 minutes, or until the edges are golden brown. Allow to cool on the baking sheet for 1 minute before moving to wire racks to cool completely.

Wash potatoes and pat dry. Toss in a bowl with oil to coat evenly. Sprinkle with pepper and herbes de provence. Place in a single layer in a 400f oven for about 45 minutes, turning once or twice. Roasted potatoes may be refrigerated up to 3 days, or frozen for up to 1 month.

Heat olive oil in a large saucepan over medium-high heat. Add the whole wheat flour. Stir with a wooden spoon to mix. Add the shiitake mushroom. Add the thyme. Stir. Add the vegetable stock. Bring to a boil. Reduce heat to low. Simmer 5 minutes. Add the soy sauce. Add the apple cider vinegar. Add sea salt. Add the fresh ground black pepper. Remove from heat. Serve immediately.

Melt butter in saucepan. Add sugar. When melted, stir in cinnamon and remove from heat. Pour into tortilla and spread out. Top with bananas and honey. Roll up and place in pan. Chill. Cut into 8 slices. Top each with whipped cream and a chocolate chip. Serve cold.

In a large skillet brown beef and diced onions together in a large skillet. Drain any grease that is in the skillet. Add the diced tomatoes, the dry soup mix and the cooked macaroni. Mix well. Simmer 15-20 minutes or until sauce thickens up.

Preheat oven to 350 degrees F (175 degrees C). In a large mixing bowl, cream the butter and sugar. Add the eggs one at a time and stir. Add the flour and stir until smooth. Add the chili powder and stir until well combined. Using a teaspoon, drop the dough onto a baking sheet lined with parchment paper. Bake for 10 to 12 minutes in the preheated oven. Remove from the oven and cool on a wire rack.

Cook pasta according to package directions. While pasta is cooking, steam cauliflower in microwave or on stovetop until crisp-tender. Drain cauliflower and set aside. Heat oil in large skillet over medium heat. Add cauliflower, garlic, and red pepper flakes. Cook for 3 minutes or until cauliflower is at desired doneness. Serve over pasta with parmesan cheese sprinkled on top.

Spread 1 tablespoon prepared mustard on each of 4 english muffin halves. Divide ham among 4 muffinstop each with 1 tablespoon worcestershire sauce. Sprinkle each evenly with 1/4 teaspoon cheddar cheese. Layer each half with 1 half-egg white. Top each with remaining half.

Mix together the first 7 ingredients. Cook the barley in the broth until tender. Combine the stuffing mixture with the barley. Sprinkle the turkey with garlic pepper seasoning. Arrange the stuffing in the cavity. Cover with foil. Bake at 325 degrees for 1 hour. Remove the foil for the last 1/2 hour. Garnish with parsley.

Bring stock to a boil. Add bok choy. Cover and simmer until tender. Remove bok choy leaves from stems and set aside. Add carrots. Simmer until tender. Remove wonton wrappers from the package. Place 1 teaspoonful filling in the center of each wrapper. Dip fingers in water and run around edges to seal. Add wontons to boiling stock. Cook for 1-2 minutes. Remove from stock with slotted spoon and place on a platter. Sprinkle with white pepper and sesame oil. Ladle stock over wontons. Garnish with bok choy leaves.

Prepare the potatoes according to package directions. Melt butter in a large nonstick skillet over medium-high heat. Add potatoes. Cook and stir until heated through, about 5 minutes. Spread potato mixture evenly in the pan. Sprinkle with the cheese. Bake for 1 minute or until the cheese is melted. Top with the salsa. Serve immediately.
Beat together first 3 ingredients until fluffy. Beat in egg yolks and frangelico. Spread into crust. Bake in 425° oven 10 minutes. Reduce heat to 350° and bake 30 minutes. Cool. Chill.

Preheat the oven to 400 degrees F (200 degrees C). Combine the ground chicken, breadcrumbs, egg, lemon juice, tomatoes and basil in a mixing bowl. Season with salt and pepper. Form into 4 patties. Place the burgers onto a greased baking sheet. Bake in the preheated oven for 20 minutes. Top each patty with a slice of feta cheese. Return the pan to the oven and continue to bake until the cheese is melted. Serve on whole wheat buns with lettuce and tomato.

Preheat oven to 350 degrees F. Roll out pastry to fit 9-inch deep dish pie pan. Fold over edges and crimp to form a rim or edge. In a large bowl combine eggs, butter, light corn syrup, brown sugar, fresh lemon rind and lemon juice. Mix well with a spoon. Sprinkle with flour and blend well with a wooden spoon. Stir in pecans. Pour into pie pan. Bake for 1 hour or until center is set. Cool on a wire rack. Serve with whipped cream or ice cream, if desired.

Bring large pot of water to boil. Cook potatoes until tender, 8-10 minutes. Add meats to water to brown well, 5-8 minutes. Drain fat, reserving 1/4 cup. Add meats to water to brown well, 5-8 minutes. Drain fat, reserving 1/4 cup. Add meats to water to brown well, 5-8 minutes. Drain fat, reserving 1/4 cup. Add meats to water to brown well, 5-8 minutes. Drain fat, reserving 1/4 cup. Add meats to water to brown well, 5-8 minutes. Add meats to water to brown well, 5-8 minutes. Add meats to water to brown well, 5-8 minutes. Drain fat, reserving 1/4 cup. Add meats to water to brown well, 5-8 minutes. Drain fat, reserving 1/4 cup. Add meats to water to brown well, 5-8 minutes. Add meats to water to brown well, 5-8 minutes. Add meats to water to brown well, 5

Preheat oven to 325 degrees. Grease and flour a tube pan. In a mixing bowl with an electric mixer combine the margarine and sugar until smooth. Add the cream cheese and continue beating until smooth. Beat in the eggs one at a time. Blend in the flour and baking powder until smooth. Pour into pan. Bake for 1 hour and 10 minutes or until cake tests done. Cool in pan for 10 minutes and remove from pan. Cool completely. Spread with a lemon glaze.

Preheat oven to 375 degrees f (190 degrees c). Grease baking sheets or line with parchment paper. In a medium bowl, cream together the butter and granulated sugar until light and fluffy. Beat in the eggs and vanilla. In a small bowl, whisk together the flour, baking powder, baking soda, salt, cinnamon, ginger, cloves and cardamom. Gradually add the dry mixture to the wet mixture and mix well. Roll the dough into 1-inch balls and place on the prepared baking sheets, spacing 2 inches apart. Bake for 8-10 minutes in the preheated oven, or until the edges are lightly browned. Allow the cookies to cool for 5 minutes before removing from the baking sheet and placing on a wire rack to cool completely. Dust with powdered sugar before serving, if desired. Makes about 5 dozen.

Put the rum and sugar syrup into a heatproof glass or mug. Add the nutmeg and cinnamon stick and pour the boiling water over them. Butter the rims of the glass or mug with the remaining butter and serve.

Rub the meat thoroughly with the dry rub, cover and refrigerate for several hours or overnight. Preheat grill to medium high heat and place the ribs on the grill for about 10 minutes on each side. Lower heat to medium and cook for 30-60 minutes until the meat is tender and falls off the bones. Serve with a little lemon juice and enjoy.

Cut the cucumbers into 1-inch chunks. In a small bowl, combine the lime juice, fish sauce, sugar, chilies, dried shrimp and salt to taste. Transfer to a serving bowl and stir in the peanut oil to blend. Serve immediately topped with the roasted peanuts.

Combine coconut and sugar. Beat egg yolks and add to coconut mixture. Stir in milk. Cook slowly until mixture thickens. Cool. Whip egg whites until stiff. Fold into mixture. Spoon into a 9x13 baking dish. Bake at 350 for 20 minutes. Serve hot or cold.

In a mixing bowl, mix eggs with feta and ricotta cheese. Set aside. Cut phyllo sheets into 4-inch squares. Put 1 teaspoon cheese mixture on each square and fold over. Lightly brush with butter and sprinkle with a little salt and pepper. Bake at 375 degrees for 12-15 minutes or until golden brown. Serve immediately or at room temperature. Makes 24 pieces.

In large bowl combine the fruit. Toss with 1 tablespoon mayonnaise until evenly coatedcover and refrigerate until ready to serve. In a small bowl combine yogurt with honey until smoothcover and refrigerate until ready to serve. Drain yogurt mixture well. Gently fold yogurt mixture into fruit mixturecover and refrigerate until ready to serve. Garnish with walnut pieces.
Preheat oven to 375f. In a medium bowl, combine spinach, egg white, basil, oregano, and mozzarella cheesepress into a 9-inch pie plate. Bake 20 minutes or until crust is firm and browned.

In a large bowl combine all the dry ingredients except the cornmeal and bacon bits. In a separate bowl combine the liquid ingredients and mix well. Add the liquid to the dry ingredients and mix well. Turn out onto a lightly-floured surface and knead for a minute or two. Form the dough into a ball, and place in a greased bowl. Cover and allow to rise for one hour. Turn the dough out onto a lightly-floured surface and roll it out to a 1/8-inch thickness. Sprinkle the bacon bits over the top and roll the dough up as you would for a jelly roll, starting at one end. Place the roll seam side down on the floured surface and roll it out again to a 1/4-inch thickness. Cut the roll into 1/2-inch wide strips and place on a lightly-greased cookie sheet. Cover and allow to rise for one hour. Bake in a preheated 375 degrees oven for 15 minutes. Serve hot.
Mix all ingredients together. Place in crock pot. Cook on low heat 4-5 hours. Serve over rice.

Soak almonds in water overnight. Drain and grind in a food processor. Add powdered sugar and orange flower water. Add food coloring to taste. Stuff the dates and walnut halves. Wrap in plastic wrap and place in the refrigerator overnight. Dip in melted chocolate and serve.

Bring the chicken broth to a boil. Add the chicken breasts and reduce the heat to low. Cook for 10 minutes. Add the vegetables and continue to cook until the vegetables are soft. Stir in the oregano and salsa and simmer for 5 minutes. Add the bow tie pasta and cook for 8 minutes. Stir in the cayenne pepper and cook until the pasta is tender. Serve warm.

In a large pot, saute the onion and garlic. Add carrots. Stir in the vegetable broth. Bring to a boil. Add the beans and tomato. Reduce heat and simmer for 30 minutes or until the vegetables are tender. Salt and pepper to taste.
Place tomato and onion in blender. Blend until smooth. Remove and put into serving bowl. Add the rest of the ingredients and stir until mixed. Serve with chips or as a garnish for tacos or burritos.

Blanch red peppers in boiling water for 2 minutes. Remove and let cool. Scoop out seeds and cut a slit in the base of each pepper. Chop up tomato into small pieces. Chop spring onions. Heat olive oil in pan. Add spring onions and saute for 2 minutes. Add the chopped tomato and basil leaves and saute for 1 minute. Add the chopped garlic and saute for 1 more minute. Remove from heat and pour mixture into red peppers. Sprinkle with salt and pepper. Bake for 20 minutes.

Combine the first five ingredients in a bowl. Crush the ramen noodles and set aside. Mix the dressing ingredients and toss with the cabbage mixture. Add the ramen noodles to the cabbage mixture and toss again. Chill until serving time.

Crush biscuits into fine crumbs and add hazelnuts and rice flour. Stir in Nutella and hazelnuts. Shape into 3/4 inch balls and roll in finely chopped hazelnuts. Melt chocolate and dip balls in chocolate. Let stand to set.
Cook rice with water and margarine. Add soup mix. Layer chops over rice. Cover with foil. Bake at 325 degrees for 1 hour or until meat is done.

Chop up your chicken breast into small pieces and sauté them with bell pepper and picante sauce. Season with a little salt and pepper. Stuff the filling into the tortilla shells and sprinkle with shredded cheese. Spray a baking pan with vegetable oil and place your stuffed tortillas into the pan with the filling facing up. Bake at 350 degrees for about 15 minutes or until the edges start to turn golden brown.

Combine the first three ingredients in a saucepan. Bring to a boil over medium heat. Stir until it thickens. Remove from heat. Let cool for a few minutes. Mix in pudding and food coloring. Pour mixture into a prepared 9x13 pan. Cover and chill for several hours or until firm. Slice into squares. Store in the refrigerator.

Add the sugar to the white wine vinegar. Heat the vegetable oil in a saucepan over medium heat. Add the sesame oil to the vegetable oil. Then add the lemon juice to the sesame oil. Mix the garlic powder into the lemon juice. Add the seasoned pepper to the lemon juice. Stir the seasoned pepper into the lemon juice. Add the sesame seeds to the lemon juice. Stir the sesame seeds into the lemon juice. Stir the sesame seeds into the lemon juice. Pour the dressing over the vegetables. Stir the vegetables. Add the vegetables to the salad.

Season the meat with a mixture of salt and pepper. In a large skillet heat the butter over medium high heat until it starts to bubble. Add the bacon and saute until crisp. Add the meat to the skillet and brown the meat on both sides. Remove the meat from the pan and set aside. Add the onion to the pan along with the garlic clove and saute until the onions are softened. Add the sauerkraut and cook for 10 minutes or until the liquid starts to evaporate. Return the meat to the pan. Stir in the beer and bring to a boil. Reduce the heat and simmer for 15 minutes or until the meat is fork-tender. Serve with noodles or rice and a green vegetable.

Cut sole fillets into 1-inch pieces. Combine seasoning salt and sugar and sprinkle over fillets. Mix flour and garlic butter. Place 1 tablespoon mixture over each fillet. Wrap each fillet with 1 slice of lemon. Place in foil packets. Bake at 450 degrees F for 15 minutes. Beat egg yolks with lemon rind and parsley. Add mayonnaise. Beat egg whites to soft peaks. Fold into yolk mixture. Spread over fillets. Serve at once.
Slice french bread. Sprinkle with parsley. Dip cheese slices into butter, then into flour. Deep fry until golden brown. Drizzle with lemon juice. Serve with french bread.

In a bowl combine garlic, honey, vinegar, and 1/2 teaspoon of salt and 1/4 teaspoon of black pepper. Rub this mixture all over the chops and let marinate in the refrigerator for 2 hours or longer. Heat oil in a large skillet over medium heat until hot and shimmering. Add chops and sear for 2 minutes per side or until browned and cooked through.
Melt butter in a 9x13 pan. Sprinkle in the hashbrowns. In a bowl mix the sour cream, soup and cheese. Pour over hashbrowns. Bake at 350 for 30-35 minutes. Top with Rice Krispie.

Pour the water into the crock pot and then add the onion soup mix and the cubed onions. Place the pork chops into the water and soup mix and cook for 6 to 8 hours or until pork chops are cooked thoroughly.

Place biscuits in single layer in 9x13-inch baking pan sprayed with cooking spray. In small bowl, mix together garlic and butter until crumbly. Sprinkle over biscuitspress lightly into biscuits. Bake 10 to 12 minutes or until golden brown. Remove from ovensprinkle with mozzarella. Bake 1 to 2 minutes longer or until cheese is melted. Serve warm.

Combine yogurt, salt, pepper, oil and chopped parsley in a bowl. Blend well. Place on serving platter. Peel the figs. Grill for about 5 minutes per side (or until soft but not falling apart). Place grilled fig on plate with dollop of yogurt. Sprinkle on a few hazelnuts and drizzle on the honey.

Peel peachescut into wedges. In a bowl, combine the peach wedges with the brown sugar and cinnamon and set aside. In a small saucepan, melt the butter and add the flour, stirring constantly until combined. Stir in the peaches with the butter mixture and cook over low heat until the peaches are tender and mixture is thickened. Remove from heat and set aside to cool slightly. In a separate bowl, combine the nuts with the melted butter and stir until the nuts are coated. Spoon the mixture onto a baking sheet. Place in a preheated 375f oven for 10 minutes, stirring once or twice. Remove from oven and stir in the cooled peaches. Allow to cool completely before cutting into slices.

Boil water. Add pasta and cook until al dente. While pasta is cooking, heat the olive oil in a medium saucepan over medium heat. Add the onion and cook until softened, about 5 minutes. Add the heavy cream and bring to a simmer. Cook until the sauce thickens a bit. Add the ham, peas, salt, and black pepper. Cook for 30 seconds or so. Drain the pasta. Add the pasta to the saucepan along with the parmesan cheese. Toss until everything is coated in the sauce. Serve immediately.

Mix together crumbs and margarine. Press into bottom and sides of 9inch pie pan. Mix gelatin with boiling water and let stand for 1 minute. Beat cream cheese until smooth. Add sugar and beat until fluffy. Add gelatin mixture and beat on medium until well blended. Add milk and syrup and beat on high for one minute. Add blueberries and fold in gently. Pour into pan and chill for at least 4 hours before serving.
Combine espresso with the maple syrup and stir well. Add milk and top with cocoa powder and whipped cream. Serve immediately.

Heat oven to 400. Cut peppers lengthwise into 1/2-inch-thick stripsplace in a large bowl. Toss with 1 1/2 tablespoons oil. Roast at 400 for 20 minutes or until tender. Add garlicroast for 5 minutes. Place in a food processor. Add vinegar, hot sauce and Worcestershire sauceprocess until smooth. With the machine running, slowly add remaining 1/4 cup oil. Place in a bowlstir in parsley. Season to taste with salt and pepper. Toss with remaining vegetables. Garnish with remaining parsley. Top with crumbled feta.

In large nonstick skillet heat 1/2 tablespoon butter over medium-high heat. Add garlic and cook 1 minute or until fragrant. Add bread and cook 1 minute per side or until lightly toasted. Remove from skillet. In small bowl stir together parsley and 1 tablespoon butter. Spread parsley mixture over toasted side of bread. Sprinkle with parmesan. Place bread in single layer in skillet. Top each with 1 slice of each cheese and cook over medium heat 1 minute per side or until golden. Serve with sour cream or tomato soup.

Mix together all the dry ingredients except the shortening. Cut in the shortening until mixture resembles coarse crumbs. Stir in milk. Spread into greased and floured individual oven dishes. Bake in preheated oven at 350 for 20-25 minutes. Cool in pans. Serve with sweetened whipped cream or chocolate frosting.

Boil water in a medium saucepan. Add lemon slices and sugar. Cook over medium heat until sugar dissolves. Remove from heat. Add half-and-half and stir until combined. Add pineapple chunks. Stir over low heat until mixture is thickened and bubbly. Cool completely, about 2 hours. In a bowl, beat cream until soft peaks form. Fold cream into pineapple mixture. Pour into a freezable container and freeze until firm.

In a large mixing bowl, combine butter, light brown sugar, and peaches. Pour half the mixture in a 13x9 pan that has been sprayed with cooking spray. In another bowl combine the remaining ingredients for the cake mix, mix well. Pour on top of peaches and bake for one hour or until the cake is set in the center. Allow to cool for at least one hour before serving.

Preheat the oven to 350 degrees f (175 degrees c). Wrap a paper towel around the bottom of the squash to absorb excess moisture. Cut each squash in half from stem to tip. Scrape out the pulp and seeds. In a bowl, mix the sugar, flour, salt, cinnamon, nutmeg, orange rind and brazil nuts. Fill the cavity of each squash with the filling. Bake the squash in the preheated oven for 1 hour or until the flesh is tender. Sprinkle with the butter before serving. Serves 4 to 6.

Brown the turkey kielbasa in olive oil until the outside is slightly crispy. Chop the onion, green peppers, and celery ribs finely into small pieces. Saute them in the pan with the turkey kielbasa for about 5 minutes. Sprinkle with the cajun seasoning, and add the bay leaf. Cook for another 3 minutes. Add the stewed tomatoes (drained) and the chicken broth. Bring to a boil, then reduce heat to simmer. Cover the pan and simmer for about 15 minutes or until the liquid is gone. Add the white rice, stirring to combine everything together. Cover the pan and cook until all the liquid is gone and the rice is tender. If it is not done, cook for another 5 minutes or so until it is done to your liking.

Cook pasta according to package directions. Meanwhile saute onions and chiles in oil until tender. Add zucchini and oregano. Cook until tender. Add tomatoes. Cook about 1 minute. Pour sauce over pasta. Sprinkle with cheese. Serve.

Peel and cut the potatoes into 1 inch cubes. Place in a large bowl and toss with 2 tablespoons of the sour cream. Cover with plastic wrap and refrigerate until ready to serve. In a bowl whisk together the remaining sour cream with the mayonnaise and the dill. Season with salt and pepper. When ready to serve remove the potato cubes from the refrigerator and toss with the dill mixture. Garnish with chives before serving.

Place chicken breasts in a heavy duty zip-top bag or in a large glass or stainless steel bowl. Add the neufchatel and onions and mix well. Add the sherry and mix well again. Add the mayonnaise, lemon juice, hot sauce, nutmeg, and paprika. Mix well again until all the ingredients are blended together. Refrigerate until chilled or serve immediately on crackers, bread, or crudites.

In a large skillet, cook the pine nuts in the extra virgin olive oil over medium-high heat until lightly brown, 3 to 4 minutes. Remove the pine nuts from the pan, keeping warm. Add the asparagus to the pan. Cook over medium-high heat for 3 to 4 minutes. Stir in the garlic clove and cook for 30 seconds. Stir in the gemelli pasta. Add the broth and cook until the pasta is tender, about 10 minutes. Stir in the pine nuts. Add the fresh lemon juice, lemon-pepper seasoning and coarse salt to taste. Stir until well blended.

Preheat oven to 350 degrees F (175 degrees C). In large bowl, stir together flour, butter, and pecans until crumbly. Press into bottom of 9x13-inch baking dishbake for 15 minutes in the preheated oven. Combine cream cheese and whipped topping in a large bowlbeat until smooth. Beat in powdered sugar and vanilla until smooth. Fold in chocolate chipspour into crust. Bake for 15 minutes in the preheated oven. Stir together hot milk and instant pudding mixpour over hot chocolate layer in baking dish. Bake for 15 minutes in the preheated ovencool completely. Cut into squaresgarnish with candied pecans before serving.

Pound pork to 1/2 inch thickness. Combine eggs, milk, mustard, worcestershire, salt and pepper. Place 1 tablespoon of mixture in middle of each slice of pork. Roll up to form a log. Wrap each log with 2 slices of bacon. Place in a 9x13 baking dish. Bake 40 minutes. Turn and continue baking for 20 minutes more.

Heat oil in skillet on medium heat. Add onions and cook until clear. Add beans and mix well. Heat up flour tortillas in microwave for 30 seconds each side or heat in skillet until browned. Place burrito on plate and put onion mixture on it then sprinkle cheese on it. Roll up and eat. Serve with lettuce, salsa or sour cream.

Grate zucchini and squash. In a bowl, combine grated vegetables with the breadcrumbs and cheese. Add onions and seasonings and mix well. Lightly beat egg and add it to mixture. Mix well again. Form into patties and refrigerate for 30 minutes. Preheat oven to 425. Butter a baking sheet or baking dish. Place patties on baking sheet and bake 20 minutes or until lightly browned. Serve hot with melted butter or ranch dressing.
Mix all ingredients together well. Divide into 12 balls. Bake at 350f for 20 minutes.

Brown hamburger in a skillet. Add onion, garlic, brown sugar, tomato soup, tomato sauce. Cook over low heat until hamburger is done. Drain fat. Add cream of chicken soup. Heat until bubbly. Add milk. Stir until well blended. Add noodles. Stir until hot. Remove from heat. Add cheese. Stir until melted. Serve hot.

Rub the tenderloin all over with the salt, pepper, onion powder, garlic powder, thyme, ginger, and cranberries. Heat the oil in a skillet over medium high heat until hot but not smoking. Brown the tenderloin on all sides until golden brownit should be about 1/2 to 1-inch thick. Place the tenderloin in the slow cooker and pour the pineapple juice over it to cover the bottom of the slow cooker. Add the cranberries and pineapple chunks, then cover the tenderloin with the liquid from the pineapple chunks. Cook the tenderloin for 4 hours on high or 8 hours on low. About 30 minutes before the tenderloin is ready to serve, add the soy sauce to the slow cooker and stir the tenderloin and juices.

Bring water to a boil in a large pot. Add ramen noodles. Stir frequently. When noodles are soft (about 5 minutes) add ketchup. Stir occasionally until ketchup is absorbed. Add bread cubes and stir occasionally until they are absorbed. Top with American cheese and serve.

Heat oil over medium heat. Add garlic and cook until fragrant, about 1 minute. Add stock. Add turkey leg. Bring to a boil. Add collards. Add salt and pepper to taste. Reduce heat to low. Cover and simmer for 10 minutes or until tender. Stir in crushed red pepper. Serve with crusty bread.

In a large bowl, cream butter, granulated sugar and dark brown sugar until light and fluffy, about 3 minutes on medium speed. Beat in eggs until thoroughly blended. Stir together dry ingredients. Gradually stir dry mixture into wet mixture until dough forms. Stir in chocolate chips. Divide dough into 2 portions, wrap each portion in plastic wrap. Refrigerate 2 hours or overnight. Preheat oven to 350f. On a lightly floured surface roll each portion into a 12 x 10-inch rectangle. Cut each rectangle into 6 rows by 4 columns for a total of 24 squares. Place squares on parchment paper-lined cookie sheets 1 inch apart. Bake for 15 to 17 minutes until golden brown. Let cool on sheets for 2 minutes. Transfer to wire racks to cool completely. Store in airtight containers up to 1 week at room temperature.
Combine meat with mashed potatoes. Add egg and spices. Form into burgers. Fry in lots of butter. Serve with fried egg or fried potatoes.
Mix milk, soup, and mushrooms together to make a sauce. Brown chops on both sides in oil. Pour sauce over chops, cover, and simmer for about 1 hour or until tender. Serve over rice or noodles.

In a large skillet heat olive oil over medium heat. Add the chorizo and saute until browned, about 5-6 minutes. Add the onion and cook until tender. Add the eggs and half-and-half. Reduce the heat to low. Stir together until the eggs are set. Season with the oregano. Serve immediately.

Heat oil in wok. Add onion. Cook for 2-3 minutes. Add butter. Cook for 1-2 minutes. Add chicken and cook for 3-4 minutes. Add capers. Add lemon rind. Add lemon juice. Stir in basil. Cook for 1-2 minutes. Serve on rice. Garnish with basil.

Cream together the butter and the sugar. Add the egg yolks and vanilla. Stir in the flour and sifted dry ingredients. Fold in the orange rind and lemon zest. Chill for one hour and then roll out on lightly floured board. Cut out the cookies and bake for five minutes in the preheated oven.

Cut filet into slices and season with black pepper. In the same pan used for beef add red wine and boil until reduced by half. Add butter lettuce leaves and toss through to wilt. Arrange beef and lettuce on serving plate. Dot with avocado dip and sprinkle over nasturtium petals. Drizzle over reduced red wine sauce. Garnish with sprigs of fresh herb and nasturtium petals.

Heat oven to 400. Grease 12 muffin cups. In medium bowl mix together egg, buttermilk and brown sugar. Beat in margarine until smooth. In another bowl mix together oats, all-purpose flour, baking powder and baking soda. Stir into egg mixture. Stir in blueberries. Spoon batter into greased muffin cups. Bake 20-22 minutes until golden brown. Cool on wire rack. Makes 12. On pearl sugar. Pearl sugar is coarsely ground sugar used for decorating baked goods.

Mix coleslaw and green onions together in a large bowl. In a small bowl, stir together the remaining ingredients except the nuts. Pour over the coleslaw mixture and toss well. Stir in nuts. Refrigerate for 30 minutes or more before serving.

In a 10-inch skillet saute beef and garlic until brown. Add onion and saute until tender. Stir in the remaining ingredients. Cook over medium heat until the mixture begins to thicken. Serve over egg noodles.

Place the tomatoes and olives in a shallow baking dish. Drizzle with olive oil. Season with pepper and salt and mix gently to coat. Bake for 10 minutes or until the tomatoes are heated through and slightly softened. Transfer to a serving plate and sprinkle with the crumbled garlic. Garnish with fresh basil or oregano. Serve with bread and cheese.

In a food processor, pulse cookies until finely ground. Transfer to a large bowl. Add 1/2 cup melted butterstir until mixture holds together. Press mixture onto bottom and up sides of a 9-inch springform pan. Freeze 30 minutes.In a large bowl, beat ice cream until slightly melted. Stir in peanuts. Spread over crust. Freeze 3 hours or until firm.In a medium bowl, combine chips and 1/2 cup fudge saucemicrowave on High 1 minute or until melted, stirring occasionally. Drizzle over top of ice cream.Place a layer of crushed peanut butter cups on top of ice creamdrizzle with coffee liqueur.Freeze 4 hours or until set.Let stand 15 minutes before removing sides of springform pan.

Cream the butter and sugars until creamy. Blend in the flour and salt until crumbly and can be formed into balls. Refrigerate for one hour or until chilled. Roll into balls and press into shortbread shapes. Bake at 350 degrees until lightly browned.

Preheat oven to 350. Mix first 5 ingredients. In another bowl mix all remaining ingredients except applesauce. Stir dry ingredients into the wet. Stir in applesauce. Pour batter into greased 9-inch square pan. Bake for 30 min. or until toothpick inserted in center comes out clean. Cool on wire rack. Serve warm.
Saute garlic in olive oil until fragrant. Add pine nuts and cook 2 minutes. Remove from heat and stir in basil and cheese. Toss in pasta and tomato. Serve immediately.
Brown and drain beef. Add sugar and seasonings. Add all veggies and can of tomatoes. Bring to boil. Cover and simmer till done. Serve over rice or bread.

Place pears in a large bowl. Add lemon juice and mix well. Heat the butter, sugar and dark brown sugar in a large saucepan until the sugar has dissolved. Add the pears and cook for 3-4 minutes or until the pears are tender. Add the heavy cream and heat until hot. Stir in the vanilla and salt. Pour into individual serving dishes and let cool for 1 hour. Add 2 tablespoons of scotch to each serving. Serve.

Sift together the flour, baking powder, salt in a bowl. Set aside. Beat the egg with the water until blended. Stir in the bread cubes. Add the egg mixture alternately with the sifted ingredients to form a moist dough. Drop by teaspoonfuls onto boiling vegetable soup, stew or stock. Cover tightly and cook for 15 minutes. Do not peek!

Sift together flour, cocoa, eggs, milk and oil in a medium bowlstir in vanilla. Heat 1/8 inch of oil in a nonstick skillet over medium heat. Pour 1/4 cup of batter in the center of the panswirl to coat the bottom of the skillet with the batter. Cook for about 2 minutes per side until golden brown. Remove from the heatsprinkle with cocoaroll up and eat

In 10in skillet, melt butter over low heat. Add cracker crumbs. Stir and cook until light golden brown. In bowl, combine eggs with Tabasco. Add scallops and stir to coat. Drain any excess liquid. Add to skillet. Stir to blend. Add salt and pepper. Cook over low heat until eggs are firm. Serve immediately.

Beat together butter and sugars until light and fluffy. Beat in eggs one at a time until well blended. Stir in vanilla and chocolate chips. Combine flour, salt, and baking sodastir into butter mixture just until blended. Drop by teaspoonfuls 2 inches apart onto ungreased cookie sheets. Bake at 375 for 8 to 10 minutes or until edges are lightly browned. Cool 1 minute on cookie sheetsremove to wire racks to cool completely. Store tightly covered. Makes 4 dozen.

Preheat oven to 400 degrees F (200 degrees C). Grease 12 muffin cups. In large bowl, combine flour, cocoa, baking soda and saltset aside. In large bowl, cream together butter and sugar until light and fluffy. Add eggs one at a time, beating well after each addition. Stir in vanilla. Sift dry ingredients into batter alternately with sour cream. Fold in 2 cups of the chocolate chips. Spoon batter into muffin cups. Bake for 15 to 18 minutes in the preheated oven, or until toothpick inserted near the center comes out clean. Remove from oven. Top each muffin with 1 tablespoon of the remaining 1/2 cup of melted chocolate. Melt chocolate in top of double boiler over simmering water. Let cool. Serve muffins warm.

Combine first 2 ingredients in a mixing bowlbeat with electric mixer on low speed 30 seconds. Beat on medium speed 1 minute. Add frozen juice concentratebeat until blended. Spoon into 10-inch pie shell. Chill 4 hours or until firm. Serve with whipped topping.
Blend together the salad oil, sweet pickle juice, catsup, sugar, vinegar, paprika, pepper, celery seed, garlic powder, and salt. Store in the refrigerator.

In a large bowl toss together the tomatoes, mozzarella and basil until well combined. Set aside. Cook the penne in a large pot of boiling salted water until al dente. Drain the pasta and place it in the bowl with the sauce. Toss well to combine and serve.

In a large skillet, saute onion in olive oil until tender. Add ground beef and cook until brown. Add remaining ingredients and bring to a boil. Reduce heat and simmer until pasta is tender. Serve topped with cheese.

In a small bowl combine the cream cheese, ranch dressing mix, Miracle Whip, jalapeno and 1/4 teaspoon of the garlic powder. Set aside. Heat the grill to high. Grill the chicken until cooked through. Remove from the grill. Slice into strips. Spread the cream cheese mixture evenly on the bottom half of the tortilla. Top with the lettuce, chicken slices and tomato. Roll up. Cut into 2-inch slices. Sprinkle with the remaining garlic powder. Makes 4.

In a large stockpot, saute shallots in melted butter until tender. Add scallions and celery. Saute until tender. Add chicken broth, potato and rosemary. Bring to a boil, cover and simmer for 20 minutes. Remove from heat. Stir in half-and-half and nutmeg. Ladle into bowls. Garnish with parsley. Serve hot.

Preheat oven to 350 degrees F. Grease two 8-inch square baking dishes. In a small bowl, combine cornmeal and buttermilk. In another bowl, mix together cream cheese and 2 tablespoons butter until well blendedadd eggs and beat until well blended. Stir in cornmeal mixture just until combined. Spoon mixture into baking dishes and bake until golden and set in center, about 30 minutes. Cool slightly, then spread each serving with 1/3 cup of cranberry chutney. Cut each into 6 wedges and serve.

Cut 8 red apples in half lengthwise. Remove cores from each half. Place halved apple with cut side down in bottom of each half. Pour 2 teaspoons of red food coloring into each half. Add 1/4 teaspoon of cinnamon oil to each half. Place each half with cut side down into the center of each apple. Place apple with cut side up onto skewer. Brush with mixture of corn syrup and water. Sprinkle with granulated sugar. Refrigerate until serving time.

Pre-heat barbecue to medium high. Rub both sides of steak with garlic. Sprinkle with red wine. Rub both sides of steak with olive oil. Season with soy sauce. Cook on barbecue until browned and cooked to desired doneness. Turn occasionally. Remove from barbecue. Place rump on plate. Pour barbecue sauce over steak. Top with sliced onion and rosemary. Serve on bun or with rice.

In a large saucepan melt butter over medium heat. Add ginger and ground turmeric. Cook 2 minutes. Add cardamom seed, cinnamon stick and nutmeg. Cook 1 minute. Add onion and garlic. Cook 2 minutes. Add allspice and cloves. Cook 1 minute. Add 2 cups water. Bring to a boil. Lower heat. Simmer 5 minutes. Add remaining 4 cups water. Cook 30 minutes.

Cook the chicken breasts until no longer pink in the middle. Drain and put into a greased 9 x 13 pan. Mix the mayonnaise with the italian seasoning and spread over the chicken breast. Sprinkle with the nacho cheese flavor dorito crumbs and top with the butter. Bake for 20 minutes at 350 degrees.

In a food processor combine the ricotta cheese, yogurt and walnuts. Cover and process until smooth. Add the garlic and process for 3 seconds. Add the pepper and salt. Cover and process until smooth. In a large skillet heat the butter over medium heat. Add the sauce and the basil and parsley. Cook and stir for 5 minutes or until heated through. Serve with the pasta.

Preheat oven to 350. Mix together all ingredients except stuffing. Form into loaf and place in baking dish. Bake for 1 hour or until done. Drain juice from stuffing and mix with melted butter. Pour over turkey loaf and bake 5 minutes longer. Serve.

In a heat proof bowl or pitcher, pour boiling water over tea and ginger slices and let steep for at least 5 minutes. Strain. Add mint and allow to steep for at least 15 minutes more. Strain again and discard solids. Add sugar and stir until dissolved. Add lemon juice and stir well. Refrigerate for at least 4 hours or overnight before serving. To serve, fill glasses with ice cubes and add tea to fill. Garnish with fresh mint.

Place oreo cookies in bottom of 9" springform pan. Beat cream cheese until light & fluffy. Add cream & beat until blended. Add ice creams & beat until blended. Add topping & walnuts & mix until well combined. Pour over oreos. Cover & freeze until firm.

Mix yogurt with the mayonnaise, then add vinegar, garlic and dill to make a marinade for the fish. Marinate the fish at least one hour in the refrigerator. Prepare grill for fish, with medium heat. Grill the fish until the fish flakes easily. Serve with fresh lemon wedges.
In a large bowl, toss together all the salad ingredients. In a smaller bowl combine all the dressing ingredients. Drizzle the dressing over the salad and toss. Serve immediately.

In a large bowl toss the penne pasta with the caesar dressing. Heat the broth to a simmer. Add the chicken broth to the pasta mixture. Add the cooked chicken, red pepper and mozzarella cheese. Heat through. Garnish with garlic-flavored croutons and parmesan cheese. Serve immediately.

Preheat oven to 400 degrees F (200 degrees C). In a large bowl, combine the Yukon Gold Potatoes, Extra Virgin Olive Oil, Salt and Peppertoss to coat. Spread the coated potato wedges out onto a baking pan. Bake for 15 minutes in the preheated oven. Turn the potatoes over, then bake for an additional 15 minutes. Remove from oven. Serve warm.
In small saucepan, combine steak sauce, pineapple juice, brown sugar & cornstarch. Cook over med heat until thickened & clear. Brush over meat. Grill to desired doneness. Serve with steak sauce.

In large bowl, toss squash and onion with olive oil. Spread vegetables in single layer on baking sheet. Bake 20 minutes or until vegetables are tender. Remove from oven. In small bowl, mix spices and salt and pepper. Add to vegetables. Stir. Serve hot.

Combine first 3 ingredients in a medium bowlset aside. Place barbecue sauce in a shallow dish. Combine remaining 4 ingredients in a small bowl. Pat chicken dry. Combine Italian dressing and next 3 ingredients. Thread zucchini, yellow squash, red pepper, and chicken alternately onto 4 skewersbrush with barbecue sauce mixture. Grill 5-7 minutes per side or until chicken is done. Sprinkle with Italian dressing mixture. Garnish with orange.
Roll each leaf around 1/2 cup meat mixture. Add to crock pot. Add remaining meat mixture and mix. Add water. Add tomato paste and spices. Cover and cook on low for 8 hours. Serve on rice.

Preheat oven to 350 degrees. Butter a 1 1/2 quart baking dish. In a medium bowl, stir together flour, sugar, and baking powderadd milk, stirring just until dry mixture is moistened. Spread mixture over bottom of prepared pan. Arrange pineapple chunks over mixture in rows, overlapping slightly. Sprinkle cheese over top. In another medium bowl, combine cracker crumbs and melted buttersprinkle over top of cheese layer. Bake for 30 minutes or until lightly browned and set.

Dissolve jell-o in boiling water. Cool to lukewarm. Stir in eggs and sugar. Stir in 1/2 of fruit. Pour into a 9x13 pan. Refrigerate until set. Cut in small squares. Melt butter. Toast graham crackers. Spread with butter. Sprinkle with nuts.

Hard boil eggs for 20 minutes. Remove from pot and peel shells. Place in bowl and cover with vinegar and water. Let set for 12 hours. Stir in bay leaves, garlic cloves and salt. Cover and let set for 24 hours. Drain and rinse. Store in refrigerator.
Cook rice with sugar, half-and-half cream and cornstarch. Add beaten eggs. Cook over low heat 15 minutes, stirring constantly. Add crushed pineapple and pecans.

Mix soy sauce and jam together in small saucepan over low heat. Stir until smooth. Remove from heat. Add honey and garlic. Pour over ribs and marinate in refrigerator overnight. Grill ribs over medium heat until tender. Brush with marinade. Cook until bubbly. Serve with rice.

Preheat oven to 375 degrees f (190 degrees c). Grease a muffin tin.In a large bowl mix together the whole wheat flour, baking soda, salt, sugar, orange zest and sourdough startermix well. In a medium bowl, mix together the egg, oil and vanilla. Add the egg mixture to the dry ingredients all at oncestir only until moistened (batter should be slightly lumpy). Stir in the cranberries by hand.Spoon into prepared muffin tin. Bake in the preheated oven for 18 to 20 minutes or until a toothpick inserted into the center comes out clean. Cool for 5 minutes before removing from muffin tin to a wire rack to cool completely.

In a large bowl whisk together vinegars, mustard, honey, and 2 tablespoons water. Season with salt and pepper. Add tomatoes and toss to combine. Add bread, tossing until bread is evenly coated. Let stand 10 minutes. Stir in basil. Serve at room temperature.
Combine all ingredients in a mixing bowl. Mix well. Form patties and roll in flour. Fry in hot oil until golden brown on each side.

In a saucepan whisk together tomato soup and cheese. Heat until cheese is melted. In a shallow bowl beat together egg and mustard. Dip each piece of bread in the egg mixture. Coat both sides in bread crumbs. Place in hot oil and fry until golden brown. Drain on paper towels. Serve with the cheese sauce.

In a small bowl, combine lime juice, fish sauce, sugar and chili. Let stand for 5 minutes. Slice flank steak diagonally across the grain into thin slices. Arrange meat in a large bowl. Add lime juice mixture, onion, cucumber, tomatoes, cilantro and scallions. Toss to blend. Place lettuce in a bowl. Top with meat mixture. Garnish with more cilantro.

Line a 9 x 12 pan with wax paper and set aside. Combine morsels with marshmallows and nuts. Pour mixture onto the prepared pan. Let stand until firm but still soft. Remove from pan by lifting off wax paper. Cut into 1-inch squares. Store in an airtight container.
Spread bread with olive oil and mayonnaise. Layer turkey breast and roasted red peppers. Top with cheese and watercress. Broil until cheese is melted. Cut in half and serve.

Cream the butter and sugars. Add vanilla and egg and mix well. Sift flour and add to mixture. Mix well. Fold in the puffed rice cereal and form into small balls. Place on ungreased cookie sheet and bake at 350 degrees for 15 minutes.

Beat egg whites until stiff peaks form. Add sugar and beat until glossy and stiff peaks form again. Add ground cardamom and ground cinnamon and beat until smooth and shiny. Gently fold in the slivered almonds. Drop by teaspoonfuls on greased baking sheet and bake for 12 minutes at 350 degrees.

In a large skillet brown lean ground beef. Drain fat. Stir in water and taco seasoning. Bring to boil. Reduce heat. Simmer 5 minutes. Stir in green chili. Reduce heat. Simmer 5 minutes. Stir in peppers. Remove from heat. Add taco sauce. Spoon into warmed taco shells. Top with cheese. Serve with guacamole, lettuce and salsa.

Wash blueberries. In a saucepan, combine the water and sugar. Add the lemon juice. Bring the mixture to a boil over medium heat. Add the cinnamon stick. Cook for about 10 minutes. Add the blueberries and cook until the fruit is softened. Remove the cinnamon stick. Stir in the maple syrup. Serve warm or cool. Serve warm or cool.

Boil water for pasta. In a large skillet, heat butter. Add shrimp and saute 3-4 minutes, or until opaque. Add the garlic salt. Stir in the pasta. Pour in the milk and cream and cook for 2-3 minutes. Add the basil and the cheese. Toss well. Serve immediately with extra shrimp and Parmesan cheese.
Place all ingredients into a blender. Blend on high speed about 1 minute or until smooth. Pour into glasses and serve immediately.

Clean the spinach leaves thoroughly and wash them thoroughly with running water to get rid of all the dirt from them. Now chop the fresh spinach into fine pieces using your hands and keep aside for later use. Mix the chopped spinach with dried bread crumbs and mix well to prepare the stuffing. Divide the stuffing into equal portions to make it easier for you to roll up the stuffing to make the balls. Now take one portion of the stuffing and roll it into a ball by rolling it between your palms. Take one ball and press it flat between your palms to make a thin patty like disc. Then dip it in the beaten egg white to coat it evenly on all sides. Now dip the egg white coated ball into bread crumbs and coat it evenly on all sides with bread crumbs. Now press the ball once again between your palms so that the bread crumbs stick well on it to make it look more attractive. Now heat oil in a frying pan to deep fry the balls. Once the oil is hot enough then slide the bread crumb coated balls one by one into the hot oil and deep fry them on high fl

Cook corned beef in a crockpot with an onion soup mix. Drain well, then shred with a fork. Combine meat with eggs, breadcrumbs, celery, parsley and seasonings. Shape into patties and fry in oil until browned on both sides. Serve hot with a dipping sauce such as ketchup or mustard.

Season chops on both sides with salt and pepper and dredge in flour, shaking off excess. Heat 1 tablespoon oil in a large frypan over high heat and brown the chops in batches for 1 minute each side. Transfer to a plate. Add remaining oil to pan and cook onions and garlic until soft. Add sugar and cook for 2-3 minutes or until golden brown. Add tomato sauce, vinegar, ginger and curry powder and bring to a boil. Return chops to pan and reduce heat to medium. Cover and cook for 1-1 1/2 hours or until chops are tender and sauce is thickened. Serve sprinkled with parsley and a little extra ginger.

Combine first four ingredients in large bowl of stand mixer fitted with dough hook. Mix well. Stir in oil and enough water to make dough easy to handle (about 1 cup). Knead on medium speed for 8 minutes, adding more water by teaspoonfuls if dough is dry.

Melt sugar & butter together. Add evaporated milk & bring to boil. Add butterscotch chips & vanilla. Boil for one minute. Remove from heat. Add oats & coconut. Drop by teaspoonfuls on waxed paper. Let stand for 10 minutes.

Cut up all vegetables and place in large container. Add canning salt and mix well. Let sit for 3 hours. Drain well. Measure equal amounts of vinegar, water and sugar together. Bring to a boil for 1 minute. Stir in pickling spices. Pour over vegetables. Let set for 3 days. Refrigerate for 2 weeks.

Melt honey with the marshmallows and butter in a large pot over low heat. Remove from heat and mix in the vanilla and salt. Stir in the oatmeal and cereal. Press into a 9x13 baking pan. Sprinkle with the coconut and peanuts. Refrigerate for about an hour. Cut into squares.

Butterfly chicken breast fillets and dredge in flour. Beat eggs and milk together with a fork. Dip chicken into eggs and milk then into breadcrumbs. Heat butter in a frying pan. Add chicken and fry for 3-4 minutes on each side until golden brown. Pour over a little garlic butter. Sprinkle with freshly ground black pepper, chopped parsley and Parmesan cheese. Serve immediately.

Preheat oven to 350 degrees. In a large mixing bowl, cream together the butter, granulated sugar, and vanilla extract until fluffy. Beat in the egg, then mix in the flour, baking powder, and salt until combined. Stir in the milk until smooth. Spread batter into a greased 12-cup muffin pan.
