Sprinkle each muffin with the streusel topping. Bake for 16 to 18 minutes in the preheated oven, or until golden brown. Cool for 5 minutes in the pan before removing to cool completely on wire racks. Serve warm or cold with fresh strawberries.

Cook chicken with chicken rice-a-roni according to package directions. In a large bowl, combine chicken, soup, mushrooms, bell pepper, celery, and cheese. Spoon mixture into 2-quart casserole dish. Bake uncovered at 350° for 40 to 45 minutes or until hot and bubbly. Sprinkle top with parsley, if desired. Serves 4 to 6.

Cream together the butter and the vegetable oil. Add the sugar and cream until light and fluffy. Add the egg and continue to cream together. Add the dry ingredients in order and continue to cream. Put into refridgerator until dough is cold. Roll out the dough to 1/4-inch thickness. Use cookie cutters to cut the shapes of your choice. Place on greased cookie sheets. Bake at 350 degrees for 6 to 8 minutes or until edges are lightly browned. Remove from oven and let cool on wax paper. Makes about 2 1/2 dozen.

Combine first 3 ingredients in a large bowl, beating until light and fluffy. Beat in vanilla. Beat in eggs, one at a time. Combine flour, baking soda, and saltadd to brown sugar mixture and stir until blended. Stir in chocolate chips. Drop by teaspoonfuls 2 inches apart onto ungreased baking sheets. Bake at 375 for 8 to 10 minutes or until edges are lightly browned.

Combine orange concentrate, lemon juice and hoisin sauce. Heat over medium heat until boiling. Add sugar. Stir until dissolved. Add ginger and garlic. Reduce heat and simmer for 30 minutes. Remove from heat and cool. Preheat broiler and line a baking pan with aluminum foil. Brush both sides of the wings with the glaze and place on the baking pan. Broil on high for about 10 minutes on each side until golden brown. Sprinkle with green onions and serve immediately.

In medium saucepan, combine apple cider, apricot nectar, sugar and lemon juice. Stir over medium heat until sugar is dissolved. Add orange juice. Stir and heat to boiling. Reduce heat and simmer for 3 minutes. Stir in ground spices. Remove from heat and cover. Let stand for 10 minutes. Serve hot.

Combine oil, vinegar, salt, pepper and curry powder in a small bowl. Toss with florets to coat. Let stand at room temperature for 10 minutes. Spread florets on a baking sheet. Roast in a 400 degree f oven until golden brown, turning once, about 15 minutes. Remove from oven. Add more vinegar to the marinade if needed. Stir in raisins. Toss with florets until raisins are distributed evenly.

Wash the leek well. Cut into thin slices and saute in a little butter with the leek in a skillet. Add the sour cream and the spinach. Stir till it all comes together. Season with a little salt and freshly ground black pepper. Put into a greased pie tin. Add a layer of cheese on top of the mixture. Roll out the pastry thinly. Place over the pie dish and seal the edges with a fork. Brush the top with egg yolk mixed with a little milk. Bake in a preheated oven at 180C/350F for 30-45 minutes until crisp and golden brown.

Put sugar and tea in large saucepan and pour in 3 cups cold water. Heat mixture to boiling on high heat. Add milk, cover and reduce heat to medium low. Simmer for 10 minutes. Remove from heat and stir in ginger. Serve in cups with milk.

In a medium-size bowl combine quinoa, 1 tbsp. lemon juice, 2 tbsp. olive oil, 1/4 tsp. pepper, 2 tsp. pistachios, 2 tbsp. parsley, 2 tbsp. mint. Transfer to a platter. Top with 1/2 of the red onion, 2 tomatoes, 1/4 of the cucumber and 1/2 tbsp. of the remaining pistachios. Repeat with remaining ingredients. Garnish with remaining pistachios.

Place parsley in a shaker and muddle with a wooden spoon until it is very finely chopped. Pour out into a bowl and add lime zest and lime juice. Fill shaker with cold water and add to parsley mixture. Strain into a large glass and stir in sugar. Fill with club soda and serve over ice.

Sweeten yeast with sugar and 2 tablespoons of water in a small bowl. Set aside. Cream butter in a large bowl. Add cottage cheese and beat until smooth. Stir in 1/3 cup of sugar. Add the eggs 1 at a time, beating well after each addition. Stir in the cornstarch, milk and rum. Beat until smooth. Turn into the buttered pan and smooth the top. Cover and set in a warm place until it rises 1 inch above the rim of the pan. Bake in a 400 degree F oven for 10 minutes. Remove from oven and poke the surface of the cake with a fork 15 times. Return to the oven and bake until the surface is golden brown and the cake springs back when lightly touched in the center, about 20 minutes more. Remove from oven and cool in the pan on a wire rack for 30 minutes. Run a knife around the edges of the pan and invert onto the rack to cool completely. Whisk the remaining 1/3 cup of sugar and lemon juice and lemon r

Bring sauce to a boil. Cook pasta as directed on package. Drain and return to pot. Add ground beef and sauce and mix well. Add 1 cup of mozzarella and 1 cup of parmesan and stir to combine. Pour into 9 x 13 baking dish. Sprinkle remaining 1/2 cup mozzarella and 1/2 cup parmesan on top and bake uncovered for 25 minutes or until top is golden brown and bubbly.

Cook the carrots in the salted water for about 2 minutes. Drain and set aside. In a large skillet over medium heat, melt the butter and add the brown sugar and ginger. Cook for 1 minute, then add the caraway seed and the orange peel. Cook for 1 minute. Add the cooked carrots and the orange juice and cook for 1 minute over high heat. The carrots are done when the liquid is reduced and the carrots are glazed. Remove from heat and serve.
In a small bowl combine the oil and dill. Sprinkle fillets with the dill mixture. Squeeze lemon over fillets. Broil 4 inches from heat for 8 minutes or until fish flakes easily with a fork.

Soak garbanzo beans in water to cover by 2 inches for at least 8 hours. Drain beans. Cover with fresh water by 2 inches. Bring to a boil. Simmer uncovered over medium heat for 1 to 1 1/2 hours, or until beans are tender but firm. Drain beans. Combine beans with onions, balsamic vinegar, salt, rosemary and 1 tablespoon extra virgin olive oil. Serve warm. Serves 2.

Preheat oven to 375f. Cream together the butter and sugars until light and fluffy. Beat in the almond extract and flour until well blended. Shape into 1 inch balls. Roll balls in finely chopped nuts (almonds or pecans). Place on an ungreased cookie sheet. Bake for 12 minutes or until lightly browned. Cool on wire rack.
Put avocados and lime juice in blender and puree until smooth. Add chicken stock, garlic cloves, cream and salt. Blend again until smooth. Serve with lemon wedge on top.

Cut chicken into bite-size pieces. In a small bowl combine the soy sauce and wine. Add the chicken and marinate in refrigerator overnight. Heat a wok or large skillet over high heat. Add the oil and stir-fry the onion and green onions until crisp-tender. Add the chicken and stir-fry for 1 minute. Add the water and soy mixture and cook until liquid has evaporated. Stir in the cornstarch mixture and cook until thickened. Stir in the bean sprouts. Serve hot.

Prepare a boiling water bath. Sift together eggs, water and salt. Stir in enough flour to make a soft dough. Roll out on floured board until 1/2-inch thick. Cut into squares with 2 1/2 -inch cookie cutter. Place squares on boiling water bath for 15 minutes or until cooked through and tender. Remove with slotted spoon and drain on paper towels. Serve with butter and sour cream or with your favorite soup or stew. Serves 4 as side dish, 2 as main dish with salad.
Mix together all ingredients. Form into balls. Place on parchment lined baking sheet. Bake for 7-8 minutes. Cool and enjoy.

Melt butter in a skillet over medium heat. Add garlic and saute for about 1 minute. Stir in leftover stuffing and combine well. Pour into an unbaked pie crust. Add shredded cheese and meat. Beat together the eggs and milk. Pour over the mixture and sprinkle with salt and pepper. Bake at 350 degrees for 35-45 minutes or until the top is golden.

Place potatoes in an 8 inch square baking dish which has been wiped down with shortening or sprayed with pam. Potatoes will thaw over night in the fridge. Sprinkle dish with cheese, ham and onions. In a separate bowl, beate eggs, evaporated milk, pepper and salt together. Pour into baking dish over the potato mixture. Cover and refridgerate for several hours or overnight. Remove from refridgerator 30 minutes before baking. Bake, uncovered, at 350 for 55-60 minutes or until a knife inserted near the center comes out clean.

For bologna, combine cream cheese, garlic and black pepper in small bowlspread over bolognawrap in plastic wrap and refrigerate until ready to servefor wrap, slice bologna 1/4-inch thicktoast rolls under broilerspread bottom of rolls with cream cheesetop with bolognaadd slice of cheeseadd baby dill picklestop with roll topsserve immediately.

Heat oil in a large skillet over medium heat. Add onion and garliccook for about 5 minutes or until softened. Add wine and cook until reduced by about half. Stir in greens and cook for about 1 minute. Transfer to a slow cooker. Stir in broth. Cover and cook for 5 hours or overnight. Mash some of the cooked greens. Stir in beanscover and cook for about 1 hour longer or until greens are tender. Season with pepper. Serve with crusty bread.
Whisk together all ingredients except for buttermilk and feta cheese. Add buttermilk. Whisk in feta cheese. Store in refrigerator. Drizzle over greens.
Combine turkey, kiwi fruit, raisins and walnuts in a medium bowl. In a small bowl combine dressing ingredients. Drizzle over fruit and turkey mixture. Toss lightly. Arrange on lettuce leaves.
Combine first four ingredients in a large bowlbeat at medium speed with an electric mixer until well blended.Stir in apples and pecans.Refrigerate several hours or until set.Serve with crackers.

Cut bacon into small pieces and saute in a skillet until crisp. In a mixing bowl combine ground beef and spices with bacon drippings and egg. Add speculaas and mix thoroughly. Divide mixture into meatballs and brown in skillet with butter. Simmer in spicy ketjap and sambal sauces for 10 minutes or until cooked through. Serve in a bun with cucumber slices and raw onion rings.

Preheat the broiler. Lightly spray a rimmed baking sheet with vegetable spray. In a small bowl combine the honey, lime juice, hoisin sauce and soy sauce. Brush the chicken with half the glaze. Arrange in a single layer and sprinkle with the cumin and paprika. Broil 3 inches from the heat for 6 minutes. Turn and brush with the remaining glaze. Broil until the glaze is bubbly and the meat is no longer pink in the center. Garnish with the toasted sesame seeds and sprinkle with the garlic. Serve immediately.

Heat peanut oil over medium heat. Add the Szechuan peppercorns, ginger, garlic and saute 1 minute. Add the chicken thigh fillets and saute 2 minutes. Add the rice wine, honey, light soy sauce and the star anise. Bring to a boil and cook for 10 minutes or until the chicken is cooked through. Serve with white rice.

Bring a large pot of lightly salted water to a boil. Add the peas and boil until they are crisp-tender, about 5 minutes. Drain the peas and place them in a serving bowl. Mash the green onions with the butter until it forms a paste. Add the mint leaves and the chives. Spread this mixture on the warm peas. Serve at once.

Heat olive oil on medium-high heat. Add scallops and saute 2 minutes on each side. Remove from heat. Sprinkle with chives and season with salt and freshly ground black pepper to taste. Serve immediately.

Preheat oven to 350 degrees F. In a mixing bowl, combine the brown sugar, granulated sugar, flour, eggs, milk, vanilla, butter and pecans. Divide mixture into 36 equal parts. Roll each part into a 1-inch diameter log. Place on an ungreased cookie sheet. Bake for 12 minutes. Cool for 1 minute before removing from cookie sheet. Makes 36 tarts.

Trim fat from chestnuts. Cut each in half lengthwise. Cut each half into quarters. Cut bacon strips into 1-inch lengths and lay out. Cut each piece of bacon lengthwise into 3 pieces. On each piece of bacon place a piece of liver. On each piece of liver place a piece of chestnut. Roll up each end of the bacon strip over the chestnut and liver. Secure with toothpick. Combine ketchup, worcestershire sauce and sugar. Brush over bundles. Combine remaining ingredients. Pour over bundles and refrigerate overnight.

In a large skillet, saute the onion and garlic in the sesame oil until tender. Add the peas and carrots, chicken and the remaining ingredients. Stir gently until well-blended. Cook until heated through. Serve over the rice.

Preheat oven to 425 degrees F. Wash, peel, and cut sweet potatoes into thin 1/2 inch long strips. Toss with spices. Place a large rimmed baking sheet in oven for 5 minutes. Add potatoes and bake for 20 minutes or so until golden brown. Mix lightly halfway through. Remove from oven. Toss in sugar. Serve immediately.
Heat a heavy skillet over medium-high heat. Add the mushrooms, goat cheese, and sweet red pepper strips. Stir for a few minutes until the goat cheese melts. Serve on a toasted baguette.
Brown meat. Drain fat. Add remaining ingredients. Simmer until blended and cheese is melted. Serve with tortilla chips.

Preheat oven to 350 degrees F (175 degrees C). Spray a baking dish with nonstick cooking spray. Place the chicken breasts in the baking dish. Combine the honey, orange juice, ginger, black pepper, and red pepper flakes in a small saucepan over medium heatbring to a boil, stirring constantly. Boil for 1 minute, then pour over the breasts and toss to coat thoroughly. Sprinkle with the corn flakes. Bake for 30 minutes in the preheated oven, until the breasts are no longer pink. Garnish with parsley.

In small bowl, blend first three ingredients until smooth. Add chilies, olives and onion. Blend well. Split buns. On bottom halves, spread one-fourth of mayonnaise mixturetop with ham, tomato, remaining one-fourth of mayonnaise mixture and cheese. Top with tops of buns. Wrap in wax paper. Chill until ready to serve. Cut each sandwich in half to serve.

Spread 1 cup of cream cheese over a 8x8x2 baking dish. Spread 1 cup of miracle whip over the cream cheese layer. Spread 1 can drained crabmeat over the miracle whip layer. Add 1/4 cup seafood cocktail sauce over crabmeat layer and sprinkle 1/2 cup cheddar cheese over the seafood sauce layer. Add 1/2 cup each chopped green pepper and chopped green onion over the cheddar layer and add 1/4 cup seafood sauce over the green pepper and onion layer. Add 1/2 cup diced tomatoes over the seafood sauce layer and sprinkle 1/2 cup cheddar cheese over the tomatoes. Bake at 350 for 25 - 30 minutes or until bubbly and brown on top. Serve hot with crackers or chips.

Heat oil over medium high heat in a large sauce pan. Add broccoli, potatoes, onions, garlic and carrots. Cook 3-4 minutes or until crisp-tender. Add stock. Bring to a boil. Reduce heat. Simmer 10 minutes or until potatoes are tender. Add milk. Stir to blend. Season with salt and pepper.

Preheat oven to 350 degrees. Melt 1/2 cup butter in a large skillet. Stir in cranberries and 1 cup sugarcook over medium heat until mixture thickens and the cranberries pop. Stir in 2 tablespoons brandy. Spoon onto a plate. Drizzle with whipping cream. Serve with sliced poundcake and garnish with slivered almonds and mint. Serves 6.

Soak navy beans overnight in water in a large bowl. Drain beans in a colander. Put ham bone in a large pot along with beans and 8 cups of water. Cook over medium-high heat until ham bone is tender about 1-1 1/2 hours. Add garlic and bay leaf. Continue to cook for an additional 10 minutes. Remove ham bone. Cut the potato into 1/2 inch cubes. Peel carrot and celery and cut into 1/2 inch cubes. Heat butter over medium high heat in a saucepan. Add potato, celery, carrots and cook 5 minutes. Add vegetables to the pot along with 4 cups of the cooking liquid. Cook for 10 minutes more or until vegetables are tender. Serve soup hot with a slice of ham and crackers.

Place in blender 2 cups vanilla ice cream and 1 cup whole milk or low fat milk. Add 1/2 cup vanilla yogurt and 1/2 cup toasted marshmallows. Blend until smooth. Pour into 2 glasses and serve immediately.

Combine all the ingredients in a gallon size ziplock bag. Mix well. Add the chicken to the bag. Marinate in the refrigerator 6-8 hours or overnight. Grill the chicken on a clean grill, turning occasionally. Serve the leftovers with fresh lettuce and tomato. Make sure to add the yogurt sauce to the lettuce.

In a medium size skillet melt butter over medium-high heat. Add red snapper fillets and sprinkle with pepper and salt. Saute for 2-3 minutes per side. Remove from skillet. In the same skillet saute onions and green bell peppers in butter until soft. Add wine and Worcestershire sauce. Cook 1 minute. Return fish to pan. Pour sauce over fish. Sprinkle with cheese. Place in preheated oven and bake 10 minutes.

Melt the butter in a skillet over medium heat. Add the ground beef and cook, stirring and breaking up the meat until browned. Drain off the excess grease and return the meat to the pan. Stir in the whole kernel corn, ranch style beans and rotel tomatoes. Stir together. Combine the water and taco seasoning in a large bowl. Add the instant rice and stir to combine. Spread the rice mixture in the bottom of a 13 x 9 x 2 inch baking pan. Top with the meat mixture. Sprinkle with cheddar cheese. Bake for 20 minutes. Remove from the oven and allow to sit for 5 minutes before serving.

Cook sweet potatoes, covered, in a small amount of water in a saucepan over low heat for 15 to 20 minutes or until tender. Drain. Mash the cooked potatoes. In a small saucepan over medium heat, combine the mashed potatoes, butter, sugar and pepper. Stirring constantly, cook for 4 to 5 minutes or until heated through. Add the cream. Mix well. Serve hot. Makes 6 servings.

In a large skillet, heat olive oil and saute garlic until golden. Add diced tomatoes and saute until tomatoes are softened. Add dried apricots and raisins and continue to cook until tender and liquid is almost gone. Add chicken and cook until done. Season with salt and pepper.

combine honey, wine, mustard & cinnamon in medium bowl. mix well. pour into shallow bowl or pie pan. add sliced cooked ham. refrigerate for at least one hour. remove from refrigerator 30 minutes before serving. heat broilerplace ham under broiler for 2-4 minutes on each side until glazed.

In a large skillet, melt butter. Add pork. Cook over medium high heat until pork is browned. Add cream. Heat until thickened. Stir in mango chutney. Heat until hot. Season with salt and pepper. Serve with rice and green onions.

Beat butter and sugar together until creamy. Beat in egg yolk and vanilla. Sift in flour and baking powder. Add salt and peppermint extract. Blend well. Drop by teaspoonfuls on greased baking sheets. Bake at 375 f for 8-10 minutes. Remove from oven and let cool on wire rack. Melt chocolate and spread over cookies. Garnish with miniature candy canes. Let cool. Makes about 3 dozen.

Place 1 cup of crescent dough on ungreased cookie sheet. Spread with cream cheese. Add chicken. Sprinkle with chilies. Bake at 350 degrees f for about 10-12 minutes or until golden brown. Remove from oven. Spread with butter. Sprinkle with corn chips. Bake for another 10 minutes. Serve warm.

Preheat oven to 400 degrees F (200 degrees C).Toss together carrots and 2 teaspoons of the kosher salt. Spread on a baking sheet. Bake for 10 minutes. Meanwhile, melt the butter in a small saucepan over medium heat. Stir in the remaining 1 teaspoon of kosher salt and the ginger ale. Cook until reduced by half. Stir in the parsley and chili powder. Pour the sauce over the carrots and toss to coat. Sprinkle with parsley. Makes 4 servings.

Mix cream cheese with sour cream and mayo. Place in a decorative glass bowl. Add enough seafood cocktail sauce to cover the bowl. Top with canned shrimp. Top with mozzarella cheese. Garnish with green peppers and green onions. Chill. Arrange assorted crackers around the bowl. Serve.
Sauté ground beef and onions. Add remaining ingredients. Heat until cheeses are melted. Spread mixture evenly on each half of the bun. Top with remaining half of bun. Makes 2 burgers.

Cook small red potatoes in boiling water until fork-tender. Drain and cool. Combine mayonnaise and soy sauce in a small mixing bowl. Add sugar, ginger, and water chestnuts. Fold in the potatoes, bell pepper, and scallions. Refrigerate overnight to blend the flavors. Garnish with more scallions. Serve cold.
Melt butter and add sugar. Stir in honey. Add cereal and mix well. Let cool. Press into pan. Cut into squares and store.

In small bowl, combine the green onion, tomato, dressing, salt, and pepper to blend well. Spread 1/4 of the mixture over 1/2 of the tortilla. Top evenly with the turkey, lettuce, tomato, onion, and cheese. Fold the tortilla over. Repeat with remaining tortillas to make 2 wraps. Wrap each in plastic wrap. Refrigerate until serving time. Cut each wrap diagonally into 4 pieces. Serve with chips if desired.

Toast the walnuts in a dry sauté pan over medium-high heat until fragrant and lightly browned. Add soy sauce and cumin and cook over low heat for about 2 minutes. Stir in tomatoes and cook until tomatoes are heated through. Remove from heat and stir in the cilantro and green onions. Place about 1/3 cup of the tomato mixture in each taco shell and top with the collard greens and avocado slices. Garnish with the toasted walnuts and serve with lime wedges.

Slice the cabbage and onions as thinly as possible. Place the vegetables in a bowl and add the sugar and vinegar. Let stand for 1 hour. Then add the remaining ingredients. Refrigerate for 1 hour. Serve immediately.

Combine all ingredients except breadcrumbs in blender until smooth. Stir in breadcrumbs until well blended. Shape mixture into 4 patties. Place patties on greased baking sheet. Bake uncovered at 400 for 20 minutes. Serve on 1 pt. of baked potato topped with 1 pt. salsa. Yields 4 servings.

Preheat oven to 375 degrees F (190 degrees C). In a small bowl, whisk together the eggs with the milk, salt and pepper until smooth. Spread half of the bread cubes evenly over the bottom of the greased baking dish. Top with ham, cheese and the remaining bread cubes. Pour the egg mixture evenly over the top of the bread cubes. Bake for 40 minutes in the preheated oven, or until the top is set and the edges are golden brown.

To cook the polenta, bring the water to a boil in the saucepan or small pot. Slowly add the cornmeal while whisking constantly with a wire whisk. Continue whisking until the polenta thickens, about 10 minutes. Remove from the heat, add the butter, cheeses, and peppers. Stir well to blend and allow the cheeses to melt completely before serving. Serve warm or at room temperature.

Sift flour and oatmeal into a bowl. Add the other ingredients except water. Mix well. Add water slowly until you have a soft dough. Knead lightly on a lightly floured surface. Roll out 5mm thick. Cut out with a 5cm round cutter. Place on a lightly greased tray. Bake in a preheated oven at 180 degrees celsius for 10 minutes. Cool on tray. Store in an airtight container.

Roll out dough to 1/8inch thickness. Cut into rounds. Bake on ungreased sheet at 375degrees until light golden brown. Toss together apples and maple syrup. Spread on cooled shells. Roll up and cut into 1inch slices.

In a medium saucepan, combine honey and sugar. Cook over medium heat until mixture bubbles. Remove from heat and add vanilla extract. Set aside to cool. In a small bowl, whisk together the eggs, butter and corn syrup. Blend into the honey mixture until thoroughly mixed. Pour into the pie shell. Bake at 350 degrees Fahrenheit for 30 minutes or until the edges are set and the center is firm but still a little wobbly. Cool on a wire rack. Garnish with pecan halves.

Mix rice krispies with melted butter and cream cheese. Add 2 cups sugar and 1/2 teaspoon cinnamon. Beat in the 2 eggs and 1/2 cup milk. Add the cooked egg noodles, raisins, and 1 cup milk. Pour into a greased 9x13 baking pan. Bake at 350 for 25 minutes. Serve warm.
Cover chops with onion. Add remaining ingradiants. Bring to a boil, reduce heat and simmer for 1 hour. Stir occasionally.

In a small bowl combine cream cheese, milk, salt and pepper. Spread on crescent roll dough. Place a piece of chicken on the cream cheese mixture on the dough. Roll up the dough over the chicken. Place the rolls in a greased 9"x13" pan. Bake at 350 for 25 minutes. Serve hot with your favorite side dishes.

In a skillet, brown sausage with onion and garlic. Drain fat. Let cool slightly. Place 1 teaspoon meat mixture in the middle of each wonton wrapper. Top with 1 teaspoon cheese and 1 teaspoon dressing. Fold wrapper over and pinch edges to seal. Place on a baking sheet and bake at 350 degrees F for 15 to 20 minutes or until golden brown.

Mix together garlic clove, salt and pepper. Rub onto pork chops. Place pork chops in a roasting pan. Add 1 tablespoon butter, garlic clove & 1/4 cup apple juice. Bake at 400 degrees F for 1 hour or until done. Remove pork chops to a serving platter. Stir together jellied cranberry sauce and remaining apple juice. Spoon over pork chops. Sprinkle with ground cloves. Makes 4 servings.

In skillet saute onion and garlic in oil. Remove from pan and reserve. In same pan saute prosciutto until crisp. Add reserved onion and garlic and prosciutto to tomato mixture. Cook for 20 minutes. Add capers and cook for 5 minutes. Serve with spaghetti.

Mix Bisquick and milk. Add the egg and beat until smooth. Add 1 teaspoon cinnamon and 1/4 teaspoon nutmeg. Dip slices of bread in mixture and cook in skillet. Turn and cook 30 seconds longer. Dust with powdered sugar.

Preheat oven to 375 degrees F. In a small bowl, combine the cream and nutmeg. Brush the phyllo pastry sheets with the butter and place another sheet on top. Place 1 tablespoon of the filling on each sheet. Brush the sheets with the butter and top with another sheet. Place the pastry on a baking sheet. Place another baking sheet on top of the pastry. Bake for 15 minutes. Remove the top baking sheet and bake for 10 minutes more. Remove and cool slightly. Cut into triangles. Serve and sprinkle with parmesan cheese.

Cut the pepper in half lengthwise and remove the seeds. In a food processor combine the pepper, feta cheese, vinegar, sugar, and cayenne. Process until smooth. Refrigerate for at least 30 minutes. Serve with pita triangles.
Combine jelly powders, cold water, and cold water in a medium bowl. Stir well. Pour into cups. Chill. In each cup, layer gelatin, fruit, and Cool Whip. Top with a strawberry.

Peel and devein shrimp. Set aside. Heat vegetable oil in a large skillet. Add garlic, scallion and gingerroot and cook until fragrant. Add shrimp and cook until pink. Season with salt and peppercorn mixture. Add chile and cilantro and toss to coat. Serve immediately.

In a medium heavy-bottomed saucepan combine sugar, evaporated milk, butter & salt. Heat over medium-low heat until it comes to a boil, stirring constantly. Remove from heat & add chocolate chips. Stir until melted & blended. Stir in marshmallows & nuts. Spread into prepared pan. Refrigerate for 30 minutes or until set. Cut into 1-inch squares. Store in refrigerator.

In a large saucepan, combine water with dried navy beans. Bring to a boil. Cover and simmer until tender, about 1 hour. Drain beans. In a separate bowl combine beans and potatoes and return to the pot. Add carrots and onion and continue to cook on low heat until heated through. Season with salt and pepper. Add cooked ham and thin egg noodles and heat through. Serve with a dollop of cream and a little chopped parsley on top.

In saucepan beat butter until creamy. Add sugar, mix well. Add water, cocoa, mix well. Stir in vanilla. Stir in quick-cooking oats. Drop by spoonful onto wax paper. Sprinkle with powdered sugar. Let cool.

Preheat oven to 250f. Combine cereals in a large bowl. Melt butter in a small bowl and stir in the Worcestershire sauce and seasoning salt. Pour over the cereals and toss to coat. Spread the cereal mixture out evenly onto a large baking sheet. Bake for 1 hour stirring every 15 minutes. Cool. Stir in nuts. Store in an airtight container.

Put the dry beans in a large pot with water to cover. Bring to a boil. Reduce heat to low. Add the ham and simmer for one hour. Drain. Return to pot. Add cabbage. Add carrots, tomatoes, and celery. Cook another hour. Add onion. Add salt and pepper. Add sausage. Cook an additional hour. Add elbow macaroni. Cook until macaroni is tender.

Saute mushrooms and onions in butter until tender. Stir in spinach. Sprinkle with salt and pepper. In a large bowl beat eggs with milk. Mix into mushroom mixture. Pour into unbaked pie shells. Top with grated cheddar cheese. Bake at 350 degrees for 35 minutes. Remove from oven and let stand for at least 10 minutes. Cut into wedges and serve.

Wash the bell peppers. Chop into small pieces. Heat the oil in a pan. Add the chopped bell peppers and cook for 10 to 15 minutes. Add the salt and garlic. Cook for another minute or two. If you want the massa to be very thick, you may leave the mixture to cool. Then grind in a blender or food processor. If you like your massa to be thinner, add a little more olive oil. If you are making the massa for a dessert or for a garnish, add some water or milk. You can also use this paste to make other things like sauteed vegetables or rice.

Sauté the onion in the butter or margarine until tender. Brown the meat with the onions in the flour and seasonings. Stir in the water, tomato paste and onion soup mix. Bring to a boil and simmer for 15 minutes. Add the sour cream and heat through. Serve over hot cooked rice or egg noodles.

Prepare crescent dinner rolls as directed on package for filling. In a large bowl combine the apples, sugar, butter, orange juice and cinnamon. Fill each triangle with 2 tablespoons of the apples. Bring the opposite sides together over the apples to make a triangle. Place 2 inches apart on a greased baking sheet. Brush each triangle with beaten egg. Bake at 375 for 12-15 minutes or until golden brown. Serve warm or cold.

Sift flour, baking soda, cinnamon and salt together in a large bowl. Make a well in center of flour mixture. Combine eggs, oil and vanilla extract in a separate bowlbeat well. Gradually add egg mixture to flour mixture, stirring just until moistened (batter will be lumpy). Fold in pears. Spoon batter into greased muffin cups. Sprinkle with pecans. Bake at 375 for 20-25 minutes or until a wooden pick inserted in center comes out clean. Serve warm.

Preheat oven to 350 degrees. Place the cream cheese, butter and flour in the bowl of your electric mixer. Beat until well blended. Add the egg and beat until smooth. Add the brown sugar, vanilla and pecans. Mix well. Divide dough into 36 equal portions. Form into balls and place on a lightly floured surface. Flatten with the palm of your hand. Place a teaspoonful of the cranberry mixture on one half of the ball. Fold the other half over the filling. Seal the edges with a fork. Place on a greased baking sheet. Bake for 15 minutes or until lightly browned. Let cool. Dust with powdered sugar. Store in an airtight container. Makes 3 dozen.

In a nonstick skillet over medium-high heat, melt 1 tablespoon butter. Add apple slices and saute until tender-crisp. Remove from heat and set aside. On a lightly floured surface, roll out each slice of bread to form a square about 8 inches long. Spread one side of each square with apple butter. Top with swiss cheese, then top with apple slices. Fold over bottom half onto cheese filling. Using a pastry brush, brush egg wash over the top half of each square. Press edges together, then fold into quarters. Heat a nonstick skillet or a panini press over medium-high heat until warm. Brush skillet or press with melted butter. Place each sandwich in skillet or press and cook until golden brown, about 4 minutes per side for skillet, about 3 minutes per side for a panini press.

Heat the milk in a large saucepan over medium heat. Add the butter and whisk to melt. Whisk in the flour. Cook, whisking constantly for about 4 minutes or until the mixture bubbles and is thick. Season with salt and black pepper. Add the oregano and garlic. Transfer to a serving dish.

Sprinkle the anchovies with the lemon juice and let stand for 5 minutes. In a bowl combine the cauliflower with the olives, capers, garlic, herbs and 1/2 cup of the oil. Season with salt and pepper. Add the remaining 1/2 cup of oil and the lemon-flavored anchovies. Toss. Serve immediately.

Measure the sugar into a heavy pot. Add the lime rind and lavender. Pour on the boiling water to cover the mixture. Stir until sugar is dissolved. Let cool for 2 hours. Drain the liquid into a saucepan. Add the lime juice and the peach halves. Bring to a boil over high heat. Let cook for 30 seconds. Add the liquid from the pot with the rind and lavender. Bring back to a boil. Add the sugar and stir. Add the pectin. Bring back to a boil. Add the lemon juice. Remove from the heat. Skim off the foam. Ladle into the sterilized jars. Seal immediately. Process in a boiling water bath for 10 minutes.
In a slow cooker, combine all ingredients and place ribs on top. Cover and cook on low heat 8-10 hours or until ribs are tender and meat is falling off bone. Serve with rice and vegetables.

Whisk together the oil, vinegar, mustard and basil in a small bowl. Season the dressing with salt and pepper to taste. Cut the tomatoes in half and scoop out the pulp. Arrange the tomatoes cut side up in a shallow dish. Pour the dressing over the tomatoesturn to coat well. Chill at least 2 hours or overnight before serving. Garnish with the basil leaves if desired.
Place all ingredients in a food processor and process until smooth and creamy. Scrape down sides and process until well mixed and smooth.

Follow your bread machines directions for dough cycle, add all ingredients to your machine in the order given above and start the bread machine. When the dough has finished mixing, remove from the bread machine and allow to rise for 1 hour or until doubled in size. Turn out onto a lightly floured surface and knead for 2 minutes. Roll out to a 1/2 - 3/4" thickness and cut into rolls with a biscuit cutter or pizza cutter. Place cut outs onto a parchment paper lined cookie sheet and allow to rise for 20 minutes or until doubled in size again. Bake at 350 degrees for 15-20 minutes or until golden brown. Allow to cool on wire racks before serving.

Mix together wine and olive oil. Add lemon and lime juice, sea salt, dry oregano and crushed red pepper flakes. Add garlic cloves. Mix well. Marinate meat overnight. Baste as necessary. Roast as desired.

Cut onion in half. Remove skin from onionslice onion into thin strips. Chop bacon into small pieces, fry bacon in medium size frying pan until crisp. Remove bacon from pan and drain on paper towels. Chop bacon into small pieces. In a large pot bring water to a boiladd ricecook rice according to package instructionsdrain rice. Heat bacon grease to a medium size temperature in a large frying panadd onion slicescook onion until softadd smoked sausagecook until sausage is heated throughadd chopped bacon bitsadd green cabbagestir until cabbage is tenderadd sugarstir to combineadd margarinestir to combineadd ricestir to combineadd seasoning to tasteserve immediately.

Cook quinoa according to instructions. When cooked set aside to cool. Meanwhile chop up carrots. Add quinoa and carrots to a bowl. Toss together. In a small bowl combine lemon juice, soy sauce, olive oil, garlic. Mix together. Pour over quinoa and carrot mixture. Add parsley and sunflower seeds to taste. Serve as a side or as a main dish.

Preheat the grill. Cut the potatoes into 1/8-inch slices. Cut the onions into 1/4-inch slices. In a large bowl combine the olive oil, dijon mustard, thyme, salt and pepper. Toss the potato and onion slices together. Arrange the potatoes and onions onto the grill rack. Cook for 4 minutes or until the potatoes are tender. Turn over the slices. Cook for 4 more minutes. Remove from the grill. Serve warm.

Beat first 4 ingredients at medium speed with an electric mixer until smooth. Gradually add brown sugar and vanillabeat until blended. Stir in chocolate chips and pecans. Spread onto bottom of a 9x13x2-inch baking pan coated with cooking spray. Top with the honey and the graham crackers. Bake at 350° for 15 minutes or until golden. Cool completely on a wire rack. Drizzle with melted chocolate. Serve with graham crackers.

Place the ground beef in a bowl. Mix in the milk. Form into a loaf. Place in a 9x13 inch baking dish. Top with the can of salsa. Bake at 350 degrees F. for 1 hour. Serve with your favorite Mexican dish and a salad.

In a large saucepan heat oil over medium-high heat. Add onions and cook until softened- about 3 minutes. Add garlic- cook 1 minute. Add tomatoes and cook until mixture is thick- about 10 minutes. Stir in navy beans- reduce heat to low. Simmer for 5 minutes. Stir in milk- cook 10 minutes. Add sea salt- black pepper. Divide into four bowls. Garnish with parsley. Serve with tortilla chips.

Sift flour, sugar, salt, and baking powder into a large mixing bowl. Make a well in the center of the mixture. In a separate bowl, lightly beat the eggs and add the milk. Gradually add to the dry mixture. Blend to form a batter that is just thick enough to drop from the spoon. Heat a lightly buttered skillet or griddle over medium heat. Using a tablespoon measure, drop 1/4 cupfuls of batter onto the hot surface. Cook until the bottoms are browned, about 1 1/2 to 2 minutes. Turn and cook the other side for 1 1/2 to 2 minutes more. Makes 8 to 12 pancakes, depending upon the size of the drop.
Place the milk, rice and eggs in the crockpot. Stir to combine. Add the sugar, almond extract, and salt. Stir again. Add the cherries. Cook on high for 3 hours. Serve warm.

Cut acorn squash and sweet potatoes in half. Put cut side down on a foil lined baking sheet. Bake in 400 degree oven for 45 minutes. While vegetables are cooking, heat oil in a large skillet over medium heat. Add leeks and saute until soft. Remove leeks and set aside. In same pan, cook chicken until browned. In a small bowl, combine marmalade with hoisin sauce and maple syrup. Add broth and orange juice and stir well. Pour over chicken and cook 1 minute. Add leeks and cook 1 minute longer. Divide vegetables among plates. Top each with a piece of chicken and drizzle with sauce.

Melt chocolate chips in a double boiler over hot water. Stir in the miniature marshmallows. Remove from heat & stir in the heavy cream. Stir in the vanilla and let cool for at least 30 minutes. Fill the ice cream container halfway with the chocolate mixture. Freeze for 4 hours. Scoop out the ice cream & place in a plastic bag. Refill the container with the ice cream mixture & freeze for another 4 hours or more. Repeat steps until the container is full of ice cream.

Preheat oven to 350. Cream together the butter and sugars in a large mixing bowl. Add in the eggs and the vanilla. In another bowl mix together the flour, salt, baking powder and baking soda. Combine the wet and dry ingredients. Stir in the chocolate chips. Place the dough on an ungreased cookie sheet. Using your fingers, make 1 inch balls of dough. Bake for 10 minutes.

Heat oil in skillet over medium-high heat until hot. Add carrots and cook until almost soft. Add broth and bring to a boil. Add drumsticks and cook until browned on both sides. Add mustard and brown sugar. Mix well. Add water, cornstarch, parsley, mustard powder and cayenne. Cook until thickened. Add drumsticks, cover and bake for 45 minutes or until done.

Cook the orzo until al dente in boiling water. Drain in a colander. Rinse under cold water to cool. Drain again. Transfer to a serving bowl. Add lemon juice, marjoram, mustard, zest, and olive oil. Toss to combine. Fold in the feta, scallion, olive, and tomatoes. Serve.
Brown ground beef with onion and green peppers. Drain. Add refried beans. Stir together. Spoon onto flour tortillas. Top with sour cream.

Preheat the oven to 350 degrees F (175 degrees C). In a large bowl, combine flour, ground flax seeds, baking soda, salt, granulated sugar, brown sugar, and butter. Beat in the egg until blended. Stir in the vanilla and the peanut butter until thoroughly combined. Drop by teaspoons onto ungreased cookie sheets.Bake at 350 degrees F (175 degrees C) for 10 minutes in the preheated oven.Remove the cookies from the cookie sheets to wire rackscool completely.Store in an airtight container. Makes 24 cookies.

In a large saute pan over medium high heat, saute onion in peanut oil until onion is soft and golden. Add mango. Cook until mango is soft and liquid is almost absorbed. Add the white vinegar and cook until liquid is absorbed. Add the orange juice and banana and cook until the banana is soft. Stir in the remaining ingredients. Simmer uncovered for 10 minutes. Cool and refrigerate. Serve at room temperature.

Place the oats into an electric slow cookeradd 1/2 cup water and the rum extractstir well. Cover, set the cooker on low and cook for 8 hours or overnight. Stir in the remaining 2 cups water and the sugar and cook for 30 minutes longer or until the oats are tender. Stir in the bananascover again. Cook 30 minutes longer or until the liquid is absorbed. Stir in the Splendaserve hot.

Melt the butter in a large skillet. Add the onion and cook over medium heat until tender. Add the ham and cook for 1 minute. Add the cooked noodles and combine well. Add the salt and pepper and toss to combine. Sprinkle with caraway seeds.

To a medium-large saucepan, add the white cabbage and cover with cold water by at least 1 inch. Bring the water to a boil and cook over moderate heat until the cabbage is very tender and has shrunk to about 3/4 of its original volume, about 10 minutes. Drain well and squeeze the cooked cabbage with your hands to remove excess water and then mash with a potato masher or a fork. Add the reduced-sodium bacon and cook over low heat, stirring constantly to melt the bacon into the cabbage. Add the butter and stir until melted and the mixture is very smooth and creamy. Season with salt and pepper to taste and stir in the ground allspice. Transfer to a serving bowl and serve warm or at room temperature. Makes 6 to 8 servings.

Bring large pot of water to boil. Add angel hair pasta. Cook 3 minutes or until al dente. Add cherry tomatoes and pine nuts. Drain and set aside. In large skillet over medium heat, add sun-dried tomato vinaigrette dressing and cream cheese. Cook until cream cheese is melted. Stir in shrimp. Pour mixture over pasta. Top with dried basil. Serve warm.

Place the lima beans in a large pot. Cover with the water. Add the lima bean bag. Bring to a boil, reduce heat to low. Cover and cook until tender. Add the remaining ingredients. Season with salt. Serve with horseradish.

Preheat oven to 375 degrees. In a medium-size bowl combine the crusty italian bread cubes with the olive oil. Spread on 2 baking sheets, then sprinkle with the garlic salt and black pepper to taste. Bake for 10 minutes or until lightly browned. In a skillet over medium heat, saute the shallots with the garlic until tender, 5-6 minutes. Add the red bell peppers and fresh mushroomssaute until tender. Remove from heatstir in the herbs. Spread the mixture on the cubes of italian bread. Top with the swiss cheesebake until the cheese is melted, about 5 minutes. Remove from ovencool slightly. Slice into triangles to serve.

Prepare vegetable mixture by combining onion, celery, bell peppers, and sour cream. Set aside. Heat oven to 350 degrees. Stir together soup, milk and next 4 ingredients in large bowl. Stir in vegetable mixture. Spread in 13 x 9 baking dish coated with cooking spray. Bake uncovered 30 minutes. Sprinkle with cheddar cheese. Bake until cheese is melted and mixture is heated through. Combine melted margarine, flour, sugar, and milk. Stir until smooth. Pour over corn mixture. Sprinkle with additional cheddar cheese. Bake 5 minutes. Serve warm.

Beat butter until creamy. Add eggs one at a time. Add in flour, baking powder, and salt. Add lemon juice and essence. Put batter into a greased 8 inch square dish. Bake in preheated oven for about 45 minutes. Cool on a wire rack.

Preheat oven to 375 degrees F (190 degrees C). Lightly grease a baking sheet. Combine the flaked coconut, sugar, butter and egg until blendedstir in vanilla. Spread onto the bread slicesbake for 8 minutes or until lightly browned. Cool before serving.
Coat each side of chicken with flour, dip in the honey dijon mustard, then dip in the dry breadcrumbs. Fry in oil until golden brown on each side. Serve with your favorite vegetable or pasta salad.

Rinse collard greens in cold water. Chop leaves into 1-inch squares. Drain. Saute onion in butter. Add collards with barbecue sauce. Stir to combine. Cover with water. Bring to a boil. Reduce heat. Simmer until tender. Add maple syrup. Stir to combine. Salt & pepper to taste.

Cook bratwursts over medium heat 15-20 minutes or until done. Cut each sausage crosswise into 1-inch slices. In a large skillet, melt butter over medium heat. Add flourcook 1 minute, stirring constantly. Gradually add cold water. Stir until smooth. Add sour creamcook over medium heat 1-2 minutes or until mixture is smooth and slightly thickened. Add bratwurstcook 1 minute longer or until heated through. Serve on toasted rolls.

Preheat oven to 325 degrees F. Rub roast with mustard. In a medium bowl, combine remaining ingrdiants. Mix well. Pour mixture over roast. Bake 1 hour 30 min or until meat is done. Let stand 10 min. Cut into 1/2-inch slices to serve.

Place a piece of seafood seasoning in the center of each potato half and arrange each salmon fillet over the seasoning in each half of the potato. Spray a baking sheet with cooking spray. Place the potato halves, cut sides down on the baking sheet and bake for 12 minutes. Serve warm.

Place all ingredients in blender. Blend until smooth. Place in ziplock plastic bag. Place beef steak in plastic bag and turn to coat. Let stand at least 1 hour in refrigerator. Grill or broil as desired. Serve with baked potatoes and asparagus.

In a large bowl, combine the cabbage and carrot and set aside. In a small bowl, combine the cilantro, lime juice, and vinegar. Season to taste with salt and chili powder. Add to the vegetables and toss well. Serve immediately or refrigerate overnight.

Heat oil in a large skillet over medium heat. Cook onion, garlic, and cayenne in oil until softened, about 3 minutes. Add greens to skillet and cover. Cook until wilted, about 2 minutes. Stir in chicken broth. Season with salt. Cook for 3 minutes. Serve immediately.

Cut bacon in thin strips and fry in skillet until done but not crisp. Remove from skillet and set aside. Add onions and mushrooms and cook over low heat until tender and liquid is almost gone. Add bacon and eggs and continue cooking until eggs are done but still soft and fluffy. Remove from heat. Season with salt and pepper. Serve on slices of whole wheat bread.

In a large bowl, combine the beans, blue cheese, onion, oil, vinegar, pecans, salt and pepper. Toss lightly to combine. Cover and refrigerate for several hours. Just before serving, toss lightly again. Serve at room temperature.

Grease bottom & sides of a 13 x 9 x 2 inch pan. In a microwave safe bowl, melt oil, chocolate morsels & bittersweet squares. Stir until smooth. Add sweetened condensed milk & juicestir until smooth. Spoon into pan. Bake at 350° for about 20 minutes or until sides begin to pull away from pan. Cool completely. Place nuts on wax paper in a single layer. Sprinkle with cherry juice. Cut cooled bars into squares. Drizzle with remaining juice. Place a cherry in each square. Wrap in wax paper. Store in the fridge.

Cook pasta in boiling salted water until tender but still firm to bite. Drain. Meanwhile, heat oil in a large skillet. Add broccoli, sugar snap peas, zucchini, cream cheese. Cook over low heat until cheese is melted. Stir in lemon juice. Add cooked pasta. Mix well. Sprinkle with Parmesan. Serve topped with basil. Serves 4.

Preheat oven to 350 degrees. In a medium bowl combine milk and buttermilkset aside to let stand for about 10 minutes. In a large bowl combine flour, sugar and cornmealset aside. In a small bowl combine the egg and oilstir with a fork to blend. Add egg mixture and milk mixture to flour mixturestir just until combined. Pour batter into a greased 9-inch square pan or a greased cast-iron skillet. Bake at 350 degrees for 35 to 45 minutes or until golden brown and a toothpick inserted in center comes out clean. Serve warm with butter or margarine and honey or preserves.
Peel and slice apples. Combine apples and juice in saucepan. Bring to boil. Add boiling water. Remove from heat. Stir in sugar, vanilla and honey. Let cool. Serve.

Spread bun halves lightly with the salsa. Layer bottom halves with roast beef, onion, peppers and cheese. Place on a baking sheet and broil until golden brown and the cheese is melted. Top with remaining bun halves and serve.

Heat butter and oil in a large saute pan over medium heat. Saute onions and garlic until softened, about 4 minutes. Add mushrooms and saute until they are lightly browned and softened. Add bouillon cube and season with salt and pepper. Add water and boil for 3 minutes. Add nutmeg and stir. Pour mixture over cooked egg noodles or rice. Top with sour cream.
Melt chocolate and peanut butter. Add peanuts and rice krispies. Drop on wax paper covered cookie sheets. Cool in fridge. Candy sets quickly.

In a large skillet over medium heat, saute onions in oil until tender. Add the rice, curry powder and seasonings, stirring constantly until the rice is lightly browned. Stir in the lentils, coconut milk and spinach. Heat through. Serve over brown rice.

Peel the avocados and remove the pits. Cut them into chunks and put in a bowl. Add the green chilies, tomatoes, and the salt and pepper to taste. Mash with a fork until it is the consistency you want it to be. Add the mayonnaise, the lemon juice and the onion and garlic powder to taste. Mix well and chill in the refrigerator for at least 30 minutes before serving.

Saute the onions in the oil until tender. Add the chicken broth and bring to a boil. Add the rice and reduce heat to a simmer. Cook for 15 minutes. Add the green beans. Cook for another 5-10 minutes or until rice is tender. Add the basil and pepper. Toss well. Add the tuna. Serve with the cherry tomatoes.

Cut the bread into 1" slices. Heat a griddle or skillet over medium heat. Spread the pesto on one side of the bread slices. Add the tomato on the same side as the pesto. Place a slice of bacon on the other side of the bread and top with the lettuce leaf. Place the bread on the griddle or skillet with the lettuce side up. Cook until the bread is golden brown on the bottom side. Flip the sandwiches over and cook until the bacon is crispy on both sides. Serve with additional pesto on the side for dipping.

Season both sides of the steak with the garlic powder. Preheat grill to high. Grill steak 2 to 3 minutes per side. Remove to plate and cover with foil. Combine sour cream and 1 tablespoon blue cheese. Place steak back on grill and brush with the sour cream mixture. Grill until heated through. Sprinkle with remaining 2 tablespoons of cheese.

In a small bowl mix together cream cheese and spring onions. Stir in cheeses and black pepper. Chill until firm. Shape into a log. Roll in nuts. Wrap and refrigerate until serving time. Serve with crackers.

Heat 1 teaspoon vegetable oil in a large nonstick skillet over medium heat. Add onion and jalapeno peppersaute until tender, about 5 minutes. Add rice and saute 1 minute. Add beans, coconut milk, broth, thyme, salt, and pepper. Bring to a boil. Reduce heat to low. Cover and simmer until liquid is absorbed and rice is tender, about 25 minutes. Fluff rice with a fork before serving. Serve over the rice.

Mince garlic and green onion together. Dice jalapeno and add to garlic and green onion. Mash avocado with a fork and add to the jalapeno mixture. Squeeze lemon juice over and add a sprinkle of chili powder. Salt to taste. Serve with tortilla chips.

Heat olive oil in frying pan. Add chopped garlic. Add slices of chicken fillets. Cook until brown and juices run clear. Remove from pan. Heat another frying pan. Add bacon and cook. When bacon is cooked remove from pan and keep warm. Add sliced red capsicum and cherry tomatoes to pan. Cook for 1 minute. Add chopped parsley. Combine potato slices and capsicum mixture. Place chicken fillets over potato mixture. Place bacon slices over fillets. Bake in oven for 30-40 minutes or until juices run clear. Serve with green salad.

In a blender combine milk, eggs, sour cream, salt and pepper. Heat 1 Tbsp oil in a 9x13inch baking dish. Spread half of the green onion mixture on bottom of baking dish. Pour 1/3 of the egg mixture on top of the onion mixture. Sprinkle with 1/3 of the cheese. Repeat twice with remaining green onion mixture, egg mixture, and cheese. Bake at 400 degrees for 30 minutes or until golden brown.

In a large skillet over medium high heat, brown pork chops in oil. Season with black pepper and crushed red pepper flakes. Remove to a plate. Add garlic to drippings in skillet, stirring constantly until lightly browned. Add stewed tomatoes, water, spaghetti sauce and meat tenderizer. Stir well, add browned meat and cook for 10 minutes or until meat is no longer pink. Serve over cooked spaghetti noodles.

Place flour and salt in a food processor fitted with a steel blade. Pulse a few times. Scatter the shortening pieces over the top, then process just until the mixture resembles coarse meal. With the machine running, slowly pour in the water and process just until the dough comes together. Divide the dough into 2 equal portionswrap each tightly in plastic wrap and refrigerate at least 1 hour or up to 3 days before using.

Preheat oven to 200 degrees C. Heat a large cast-iron skillet over medium-high heat. Add olive oil. Add onion and saute until translucent. Add sweet potatoes and garlic. Season with cumin and cilantro. Add water. Cover skillet with lid. Cook until potatoes are tender. Remove from heat. Remove lid and add chili and cheese. Stir until evenly combined. Place 1 tortilla on work surface. Spoon 1/3 of the potato mixture onto center of tortilla. Fold 1/2 of the tortilla over potato mixture. Repeat with remaining tortillas and filling. Place on baking sheet. Bake for 15 minutes. Serve with sour cream.

Drain the broad beans. Combine butter, yogurt, brown sugar, molasses, dry mustard, salt, and water in a small bowl. Place the broad beans in an ovenproof serving dish, drizzle the yogurt mixture over them, and bake at 350 degrees for 30 minutes, or until the beans are tender. Serve at once.

Prepare the vegetables. Chop the white onions into small pieces. Cut the grape tomatoes in half. Cut the portabella mushrooms in half. Dice the orange and red bell peppers and yellow bell peppers. Skewer all the vegetables onto one of the wooden or metal skewers. After all the vegetables are on the skewer, place in the refrigerator for 1 hour. Then bake in the oven for 15-20 minutes until the vegetables are soft. Serve with the Italian dressing.

Grate potatoes and mash in a large bowl. Beat together egg and milk until frothy and pour into mashed potatoes. Stir in sugar and pepper. Sift together the flour and salt. Stir into potato mixture until it forms a smooth batter. Melt butter in a lightly oiled pan and pour in batter to form 4-6 patties. Cook over medium heat until lightly browned on both sides.

Combine the Italian seasoning, parsley flakes, onion powder and garlic powder in a medium bowl. Stir in 1 teaspoon each kosher salt and pepper. Add the baby red potatoes, tossing to coat. Arrange the potatoes in an even layer in a 9x13x2 inch baking pan coated with cooking spray. Drizzle with 1 tablespoon olive oil and sprinkle with the parmesan cheese. Bake at 450 for 30 minutes or until browned. Cool 2 minutes before serving.

Layer half the tortillas in a greased 9x13 baking dish. Combine first six ingredients and pour over the tortillas. Sprinkle with remaining 1 cup cheese. Top with remaining tortillas. Bake at 350 for 30 minutes.

Combine first 3 ingrediants. In a slow cooker combine remaining ingrediants. Stir. Cook on low for 6 hours. Remove from heat. Add 2 tablespoons of lemon juice to the mixture. Taste and add more to your liking. Serve with crackers or sandwiches.

Mix together 1/2 tsp salt, 1/2 tsp worcestershire sauce, 1/4 tsp dijon mustard, 1 tsp cornstarch and rosemary to make a paste. Rub all over the breast. Place in baking dish. Sprinkle with remaining 1/4 tsp salt. Bake at 375 for 45 mins. Remove from oven. Top with a layer of pineapple slices and 10 maraschino cherries. Return to oven and bake for another 5 mins. Serve immediately.

In a 2 quart casserole dish, combine sausage, sauerkraut, onions, parsley flakes, fresh ground black pepper, and salt. Top with cream of mushroom soup. In another bowl, mix together pasta and parmesan cheese. Spread mixture evenly across casserole dish. Bake for 45 minutes or until heated through and bubbly. Serve with freshly baked bread.

Melt butter. Peel banana halves and cut into thin slices. Toss with lemon juice and sprinkle with sugar. Heat phyllo pastry in microwave until soft but not hot to touch. Spread melted butter on pastry sheet. Lay another sheet on top and brush with butter. Continue layering buttering phyllo pastry until you have five layers. Spoon 3 to 4 tablespoons bananas onto bottom phyllo sheet. Roll up to form a log, ending with phyllo on top of log. Brush top of log with remaining butter. Bake on baking sheet at 375f for about 20 minutes or until lightly browned. Cool. Cut into slices, drizzle with hot fudge, sprinkle with caramel candies and powdered sugar.

In a large pot of boiling water, cook the butternut squash until tender, 10 to 12 minutes. Drain and let cool. In a large skillet, melt the butter over medium heat. Add the onion and cook until softened, 5 to 6 minutes. Add the butternut squash and the next 3 ingredients. Cook until combined. In a large bowl, whisk together the brown sugar, eggs, vanilla, milk and salt. Stir into the butternut mixture. Pour into a greased 13-inch x 9-inch baking pan. Bake at 350 degrees for 40 minutes or until a knife inserted in the center comes out clean. Sprinkle with pecans. Cool for 10 minutes. Sprinkle with fresh parsley. Serve warm. Serves 6.

Beat egg yolks in a medium sized bowl until blended and thickened. Add milk and stir well. Beat egg whites until stiff peaks form. Gradually add 1/4 cup sugar and 1/2 teaspoon vanilla to egg yolk mixturefold in egg whites with a rubber spatula, folding gently until batter is light and airy. Melt 1 teaspoon butter in a nonstick skillet over medium heat. Pour 1/4 cup batter into pan for each pancake. Cook until bottom is golden brown, 2 to 3 minutesturn over and brown the other side. Serve hot with warm syrup.

Cut cucumbers into 1 inch pieces. Peel and dice onion. Peel and slice red pepper into 1/2 inch strips. Mix all ingredients except vinegar. Cook over medium heat until thick. Add vinegar and bring to a boil. Boil 5 minutes until thick. Cool and refrigerate.

Preheat oven to 400 degrees F. In a bowl, mix together spinach, feta cheese and eggs. Add sun-dried tomato and black pepper to the mixture. On a floured surface, roll out puff pastry to fit a greased baking sheet. Cut puff pastry sheet in half to form two rectangles. Place about 1/3 of the spinach mixture on the top half of each rectangle. Fold pastry in half. Cut each rectangle into two triangles. Place triangles on baking sheet. Brush each triangle with milk. Bake 12-18 minutes or until golden brown.
Combine all ingredients in a saucepan. Stir until sugar is dissolved. Heat until boiling. Remove from heat. Let cool. Store in refrigerator. Stir before using. Makes 2 cups of syrup.

Combine margarine and sugar in a bowl over hot water and beat until creamy. Add cocoa and beat until blended. Add eggs and beat until blended. Add vanilla and beat until blended. Sift together the flour and baking powder. Add to the margarine mixture and stir just until blended. Pour into the pie crust and bake for 55 to 60 minutes or until the pie is set in the middle. Cool on a wire rack before cutting into pieces. Garnish with a dollop of whipped topping and a chopped walnut on top of each piece of brownie pie before serving.

Heat apple juice over medium heat in a small saucepan. Stir in boiling water until mixture is steaming hot. Pour into a large glass or mason jar. Add decaffeinated tea bags to the hot liquid. Add ground allspice. Steep for several minutes. Remove tea bags. Add honey. Stir until dissolved. Add lemon slice. Serve hot or cold.

Clean hens thoroughly and pat dry inside and out. Combine butter and soy sauce in a small bowl and brush inside of hens. Add onion to bottom of baking dish. Arrange hens on top of onions. Stuff each one with 1/2 an apple. Cover with foil and bake in 350 degree oven for one hour. Remove foil and bake for 20 more minutes. Sprinkle with chopped parsley.

To make cookie, combine 1 cup powdered sugar with 1 egg white and 1 tsp vanilla. Blend well. Add enough warm water (1/2 cup) to make stiff dough. Roll into balls and place on lightly greased cookie sheet 1" apart. Bake at 350 degrees for 15 minutes or until lightly browned. Cool on wire racks. To make icing, combine 1/4 cup powdered sugar and enough warm water (1 tsp) to make a thick glaze. Drizzle over cookies. If desired, food coloring may be added.

Preheat oven to 375. Prepare grilled cheese sandwiches. Slice in half and place cut side down. Bake for 20 minutes. While sandwiches are baking, boil the hotdogs for 5-10 minutes or until cooked through. Cut in half. Serve each half between two halves of the sandwich. Serve with mustard and pepper.

Cut up the tomatoes and onions. Blend together in a food processor until finely chopped. Add the other ingredients except the limes. Blend for 1-2 minutes. Remove and add the limes. Taste and adjust seasoning with lime juice if necessary. Let sit for 15 minutes. Serve with tortilla chips.

In a small bowl, mix the ketchup, molasses and water. Heat a nonstick skillet over medium heat. Spray with cooking spray. Cook the shrimp in the pan until they begin to turn pink, 1 to 2 minutes. Add the green onions and the ketchup mixture. Cook and stir until the mixture coats the shrimp. Serve over rice.

Combine all ingredients except nuts in a medium saucepan over low heat. Bring mixture to a boil, stirring constantly until a candy thermometer reads 234 degrees F. Remove from heat, stir in nuts until well coated. Drop by teaspoons onto waxed paper or buttered aluminum foil. Cool completely before storing in airtight containers.
In the jar of a blender, combine strawberries, cantaloupe and juice. Blend on high speed for 30 seconds or until well blended. Stir in the honey. Pour into a glass. Serve immediately.

Combine first 4 ingredients in heavy-duty mixer bowl. Beat with paddle until well blended. Add remaining ingredientsbeat 1 minute. Drop by teaspoonfuls about 2 inches apart onto ungreased cookie sheets. Bake 8-10 minutes or until golden brown. Cool 1 minuteremove from cookie sheets to wire racks to cool completely.

Preheat oven to 375 degrees F. Combine coconut, oats, flours and baking powder in small bowlset aside. Combine egg and banana with butter in large bowlmix well. Add dry mixturestir just until moistened. Spoon batter into lightly greased or paper-lined muffin cups. Bake at 375 degrees F. for 20 minutes or until golden brown. Cool in pan on rack for 5 minutes. Remove to rackcool completely. Makes about 2 dozen muffins.
Cook carrots and parsnips until tender. Drain. Add sweet butter and nutmeg. Beat until fluffy. Add salt and pepper. Serve warm.
Mix all ingredients together in an ice-filled glass. Serve with lime wedge.

Saute the garlic and lemon zest in the butter over medium heat for 1 minute. Add the broccoli and cook until crisp-tender. Remove from the heat. Stir in the lemon juice and toss to coat. Garnish with almonds. Serves 4.

Boil water for pasta. Chop garlic. Mince chili. Heat olive oil. Add garlic and chili. Cook 1 minute. Add crabmeat. Cook 2 minutes. Add parsley and black pepper. Cook 1 minute. Stir in pasta. Add sea salt to taste. Cook pasta another 3 to 4 minutes. Add white wine if desired. Serve immediately.

Mix cake mix and cream cheese together with a fork until crumbly. Stir in 2 eggs well. Press mixture into a 9 x 13 inch pan lined with wax paper. Bake 25 minutes at 350 degrees. When cooled cut into 1-inch squares and roll in coconut-walnut mixture.

Preheat oven to 400 degrees F (200 degrees C). Coat cutlets with flourshake off excess. Beat eggs in a shallow dish with sage and peppercoat cutlets in egg mixture and then dip in breadcrumbs, pressing gently to adhere. Heat oil in a skillet over medium heatcook until browned on both sides. Bake cutlets in preheated oven until no longer pink in the center and juices run clear (170 degrees F (77 degrees C)). Squeeze lemon juice over the cutlets before serving.

Boil the chicken, cook the red potatoes in their skins in boiling water until tender when pierced with a fork. Cook the sweet potatoes in their skins in boiling water until tender when pierced with a fork. Peel the cooked sweet potatoes and mash them with the cooked red potatoes. Stir in the yogurt and milk. Season with the dill weed, salt and pepper. Shred the cooked chicken and toss it in the chicken mixture. Stir in the green beans. Refrigerate until ready to serve. Serve the chicken mixture on buttered bread with the cooked green beans on the side.

Cook pasta in boiling water. Heat oil in another pan. Brown meat. Add onions. Add tomatoes. Add water. Cover and simmer for 20 minutes or until meat is tender. Drain. Add pasta. Sprinkle with cheese and serve.

Slice cube steaks to desired thickness (about 1/2-inch). Sprinkle with salt & pepper. Coat with flour mixture. Heat oil in heavy large pot over medium-high heat. Working in batches, add steakscook until browned, turning once (about 5 minutes per batch). Transfer steaks to plate. Add broccolisaute until crisp-tender (about 3 minutes). Add garlicstir 1 minute. Stir in soy sauce, vinegar, ginger & sesame oilboil until liquid is slightly thickened (about 1 minute). Whisk cornstarch & waterpour into pan & stir until thickened (about 1 minute). Return steaks to panheat through (1-2 minutes). Serve over rice.

Cook pasta in boiling salted water according to package directions for al dente. Drainrinse under cold running water. Add pineapple tidbits and lemon juice to pasta. Stir gently until thoroughly blended. Beat eggs and flour in a mixing bowl with a whisk until thoroughly combined. Add to pasta mixturestir to blend thoroughly. Add salt and sugarstir to blend. Let stand in refrigerator for 1 hour. Add fruit cocktailmix gently until thoroughly blended. Add Cool Whip and marshmallowsmix gently until thoroughly blended. Serve immediately or store in refrigerator up to 24 hours.

Preheat oven to 350 degrees f (175 degrees c). Butter a 9x5-inch loaf pan. In a medium bowl, combine the butter, sugar, eggs, vanilla, and almond extract until blended. In another bowl, whisk together the flour, cinnamon, baking powder, and salt. Gradually add the flour mixture to the butter mixture alternately with the milk, beginning and ending with the flour mixture. Fold in the nuts. Pour into prepared loaf pan. Bake in the preheated oven for 1 hour or until a wooden pick inserted near the center comes out clean. Remove from oven and let cool in the pan for 10 minutes before removing to a wire rack to cool completely.

Pour yogurt into blender container. Add banana and blend. Add chai tea mix and milk. Blend well. Pour into 2 glasses. Top each glass with a scoop of caramel ice cream topping and a dollop of whipped topping. Serve immediately.

Preheat oven to 400 degrees f (200 degrees c). Sift together flour, baking powder, salt and sugar in a mixing bowl. Cut in butter until mixture resembles coarse crumbs. Stir in cream cheese. Add milk all at once and stir with a fork until a soft dough forms. Turn dough onto a lightly floured surfaceknead gently until smooth. Roll out to a 1/2-inch thickness. Cut into rounds with a 2-inch round cutter. Place 1-inch apart on an ungreased baking sheet. Brush tops with egg whitesprinkle with sugar. Bake 15 to 18 minutes or until golden brown. Serve warm.

Cream the margarine until fluffy. Blend in the sugar until fluffy. Stir in the real butter and the egg until the mixture is light and fluffy. Blend in the vanilla and flour until the mixture is smooth. Shape the dough into 1 inch balls and roll in additional confectioners sugar or topping of choice. Wrap in waxed paper or freezer paper. Store in refrigerator. Makes 8 dozen.

Preheat oven to 400 degrees f. Grease a 9-inch pie plate with vegetable oil. Beat bisquick and eggs in a bowl until smooth. Stir in onion, garlic, parmesan cheese and oregano. Add spinach to mixture. Stir well. Sprinkle with breadcrumbs. Place in pie plate. Bake 30 minutes or until golden brown. Let cool 5 minutes before cutting into 12 pieces.

Heat oil in large skillet over medium-high heat. Stir in cabbage and cook until tender. Add celery, green pepper and onion. Cook 1 minute or until crisp-tender. Stir in seasonings. Heat through. Serve immediately.

Cook the sausages in a skillet until no longer pink in the middledrain well. In a large saucepan combine the pineapple tidbits, brown sugar, and ground cinnamon. Cook over medium heat until mixture comes to a boilreduce heat. Simmer for 5 minutes or until the mixture thickens slightlystir in the sausages and the banana. Heat through. Serve immediately.

Combine the chicken wings with milk in a large bowl. Add the salt and cayenne pepper, mix well. In another bowl combine the breadcrumbs and sesame seeds. Take a wing from the milk mixture and dredge through the breadcrumbs. Heat the vegetable oil in a deep fryer. Fry the wings for 3-4 minutes. Drain and serve with lemon wedges.

Cook 3-4 tortillas in a heated frying pan. Mix together 1 cup of red chili sauce and 1/2 cup of milk, stirring in 1/2 cup of grated cheddar cheese, then set aside. Crack 2 eggs in the frying pan and fry the eggs until done but not hard. Place 1/2 cup of the chili sauce mixture in the middle of each frying pan. Place an onion ring on the chili sauce mixture and then add a fried tortilla to cover the onion ring and the chili sauce mixture. Sprinkle 1 tablespoon of grated cheese on top of each enchilada. When the sauce mixture is bubbling around the edges, take the enchiladas out of the frying pan, place on a plate and top each with 2 tablespoons of the remaining chili sauce mixture.

Melt the chips and butter together in a large saucepan over low heat. Stir in the milk and almond extract. Add the liqueur and remove from heat. Cool to room temperature. Line a cookie sheet with wax paper and spoon the mixture into balls. Chill in the refrigerator for 4 hours. Melt the almond bark in the microwave or double boiler. Roll the balls in the almond bark. Let set at room temperature or refrigerate until firm. Roll the truffles in almonds. Store in the refrigerator.

Dry roast red chilies in a skillet and let cool. Remove the seeds and skin and grind to paste in a blender. Combine all the remaining ingredients and mix well. This paste can be refrigerated for up to a week. It is excellent when added to soups or cooked vegetables.

In a saute pan heat the olive oil. Add garlic and cook until fragrant. Add pine nuts and almonds. Saut for a minute or two. Add spinach and cook until tender. Toss in the ham. Salt to taste. Serve immediately.

Melt butter in a large saucepan over medium heat. Stir in leek and cook until softened, about 5 minutes. Stir in curry powder and cook 1 minute longer. Stir in powdered ginger and cook 1 minute longer. Stir in frozen peas and cook 1 minute longer. Stir in carrot, celery, water, milk and salt and pepper to taste. Bring to a boil, reduce heat to medium-low, and simmer, uncovered, for 5 minutes or until vegetables are tender. Serve hot.

Chop the green onions and place them in the bottom of a large serving bowl. Add the chopped garlic cloves and let stand for 10 minutes to allow the flavors to blend. Add the tomatoes, olives, basil and oregano. Toss and add feta cheese and mix together. Add the red wine vinegar and the olive oil and mix together. Taste for seasoning and serve immediately.

Cut potatoes into 1/2 inch chunks. Cook in boiling water for about 15 minutes or until tender. Drain. In skillet heat oil and butter over medium heat until butter is melted. Saute potatoes for 5 minutes stirring frequently or until lightly browned. Sprinkle with salt and pepper to taste. Serve immediately.

Cook pepper and onion in butter in skillet until tender. Add green pepper strips. Stir in beans and sauce. Stir in chili powder. Bring to boiling. Simmer 2-3 minutes. Place hot dogs in buns. Spread each bun with 2 T. of bean mixture. Top each hot dog with 2 T. of cheese. Serve in buns. Serve with corn chips.
Crush graham crackers. Mix all other ingredients and pour into pan. Top with more crackers and chill overnight. Cut into squares.

Line a 13-inch by 9-inch baking dish with foil. Butter the foil. Combine the first four ingredients in a large saucepan over medium heat. Stir until the honey has melted. Add the oats and raisins. Cook over medium-high heat, stirring constantly for about 2 minutes. Stir in the nuts. Spread the mixture in the prepared pan. Cool. Lift the foil from the pan. Cut the mixture into 12 squares.

Preheat oven to 425 degrees F. Rinse and trim cauliflower. Cut into large florets and place in shallow roasting pan. Toss with olive oil and season with salt and pepper. Roast until browned and tender, about 20 minutes. In a small skillet over medium heat, melt butter and saute flour for 3 minutes until browned and fragrant. Gradually pour milk into butter-flour mixture, whisking constantly until mixture comes to a simmer. Add salt and pepper to taste and simmer for 1 minute. Remove from heat and stir in gruyere until melted and well-combined. Serve hot over roasted cauliflower.

Preheat oven to 375 degrees. Place butter in 9x13 inch baking pan. Place 8 biscuits in pan and bake 10 minutes or until golden brown. Cool 5 minutes. Cut each biscuit diagonally in half. Combine 1/2 cup butter and 1/2 cup sugar in a medium bowl. Beat until smooth. Spread over top of cooled biscuits. Top with 1/2 of the strawberries and 1/2 of the blueberries. Refrigerate 1 hour. Beat cream cheese and remaining 1/2 cup butter until smooth. Beat in 1 cup of the cool whip. Spoon over berries. Top with remaining strawberries and berries and remaining cool whip. Refrigerate 1 hour. Cut into squares. Makes 12 servings.

Boil the water in a saucepan. Boil the carrots until tender in boiling water. Melt the butter in a skillet over medium heat. Stir in the carrot and cook for 2 minutes. Stir in the sugar and marsala wine and heat for 2 minutes longer. Season to taste with salt and freshly ground black pepper. Serve.
Cube cheddar cheese. Mix together with cream cheese, mango chutney, onion and ground ginger. Serve with crackers.

Brown the ground beef in a skillet. Add the onions and green peppers and saute for a few minutes. Add the cooked rice and season with salt and pepper. Pour into a 3 quart baking dish. Bake at 350 degrees for 40 minutes.

Combine soy sauce, light maple syrup and sesame oil in a large bowl. Add the gingerroot and garlic cloves and mash together with a fork until well blended. Add the salmon and scallions. Toss the mixture well to coat the fish. Cover and refrigerate for 2 hours. Preheat the broiler. Arrange the salmon in a shallow baking pan and brush both sides of the fish with the sauce. Broil 6 inches from the heat source for 2 minutes per side. Serve warm.

In a large saucepan, bring water to a boil. Place wontons in a steamer basket. Add to the boiling water. Reduce heat to a simmer. Cook for 25 minutes. Meanwhile, combine chicken broth, gingerroot, straw mushrooms, and green onions in a medium saucepan. Bring to a boil. Cook for 5 minutes. Add to the wontons. Let stand for 2 minutes. Top each serving with the sour cream.

Preheat oven to 375f. Coat chops with flour and salt and pepper on both sides. Melt 1 tablespoon butter in large skillet on medium-high heat. When bubbly add chops and cook 3-4 minutes each side until golden. Remove chops from skillet, place in casserole dish. Combine honey with remaining butter, pour over chops. Bake uncovered 20-25 minutes or until chops are cooked through. Sprinkle with toasted nuts and serve.

Preheat oven to 350 degrees F (175 degrees C). Grease bottom only of 2 (9x13-inch) pans. Prepare cake according to package directions. Pour into prepared pans and bake in the preheated oven until done. In a small bowl, combine the sour cream, oil and vanilla. Cool cakes in pans for 10 minutes. Remove from pans to cooling racks. Spread the top of each cake with the sour cream mixture.

Preheat oven to 375. Line a baking sheet with foil. Spray the foil with cooking spray. Trim the asparagus and cut the spears into 1-inch pieces. Spray the spears with cooking spray and arrange on the baking sheet. Spray the shallots with cooking spray and arrange on the baking sheet with the asparagus pieces. Bake 20 minutes or until the spears are crisp-tender. Combine the shallots, butter and vinegar in a small bowltoss gently until well blended. Serve with the asparagus.
Combine first four ingredients well. Pour into greased 10″ pie plate. Bake 350 degrees until golden. Fry green onion slices in olive oil. Sprinkle boursin cheese over top. Broil until melted. Serve.
Bring sugar-free jello and boiling water to a boil. Stir until dissolved. Stir in cold water and ice cubes. Chill until ready to serve. Pour into glasses. Top with fat-free cool whip.

Remove pits and scoop out flesh from hass avocadoes. In a large bowl mash avocadoes with a fork. Mix in the mayonnaise, lime juice and hot sauce. Stir in remaining ingredients. Refrigerate for an hour before serving. Serve with tortilla chips.

Soak lentils in enough water to cover lentils by 2 inches (5 cm), overnight. Drain lentils and place in a medium saucepan. Cover with water by 2 inches (5 cm). Bring to a boil over high heat. Cover, reduce heat to low and simmer for 20 minutes or until lentils are tender. Melt butter in a large skillet over medium heat. Saute ginger, garlic, coriander and cumin seeds in butter until fragrant, about 1 minute. Add hot chili pepper to the pan, and saute for another minute. Add turmeric and stir to combine with the spices. Add lentils with their cooking liquid, spinach, water, salt and pepper. Bring to a boil over high heat. Reduce heat to low, cover and simmer for 5 minutes or until mixture is hot. Remove from heat. Serve with lemon wedges.
