Cook beans in a large saucepan until tender but still firmdrain and rinse with cold waterdrain well. Combine beans, tomatoes, cucumber, onion, parsley, oregano, and dressing in a large bowltoss to coat. Garnish with eggs, if desired.
Mix all ingredients together and shape into balls and put on greased cookie sheet. Bake for 20 to 25 minutes at 375 degrees F (190 degrees C). Makes about 4 dozen balls.

Cut the stalks off the bottoms of the bok choy. Toss the cut stalks with the salt in a large bowl. Set aside for 20 minutes. In a small bowl whisk together the sunflower oil, fresh ginger and garlic with the red chili pepper flakes. Place the fish sauce in a small bowl, add the garlic cloves and let sit for 20 minutes. In a large skillet heat the sunflower oil over medium-high heat until just smoking. Add the garlic-ginger mixture and stir for 1 minute. Add the cut stalks of the bok choy and cook, stirring occasionally until the bok choy is tender but not browned, about 3 minutes. Add the thai fish sauce mixture and toss well to coat the bok choy with the dressing. Add the leaves of the bok choy and toss well with the dressing until they are completely wilted. Serve hot or at room temperature.

Preheat oven to 400 degrees F. Cut the tomato in half. In a small bowl combine the balsamic vinegar, basil, pepper and salt substitute. Place the tomato halves in a baking pan. Drizzle with oil. Sprinkle the balsamic mixture over the top. Bake for 15 minutes. Remove from the oven. Turn the tomatoes over. Bake for another 15 minutes or until the tomato is soft. Let the tomatoes cool. Drizzle with olive oil. Serve as a side dish.
Combine yogurt and mint in shallow bowl. Whisk in soup mix. Add chicken to bowl and turn to coat. Marinate in refrigerator for at least one hour. Grill as desired. Serve with rice pilaf. Serves 4.

Preheat oven to 350f. Line two baking sheets with wax paper or a Silpat mat. Mix together the flour, baking soda, and salt in a small bowl. Beat the butter and sugars with the mixer on medium speed until creamy, about 2 minutes. Beat in the vanilla extract, then add the cocoa and mix until the cocoa is completely blended in. Gradually add the flour mixture until just blended. Add the egg whites and mix on medium speed until smooth, about 1 minute, stopping the mixer to scrape the sides of the bowl. Stir in the miniature chocolate chips and walnuts. Drop by rounded spoonfuls onto the baking sheets, placing 2 inches apart. Bake for 8 to 10 minutes until lightly browned at the edges. Remove from oven and let cool on the pans for 2 minutes before transferring to wire racks to cool completely.

In a large bowl combine chipotle peppers with adobo sauce, red onion, lime zest, garlic and cumin. Stir together and season with kosher salt. Add flank steaks and stir to coat. Cover bowl with plastic wrap and let stand 1 hour at room temperature. Remove meat and discard marinade. Grill steaks on high heat for about 5 minutes on each side or until desired doneness is reached. Serves 4.

Place all the dried mixed fruit in a bowl. Add the tea and brandy. Stir to combine. Cover with clingfilm or plastic wrap and leave to stand for 2 hours. Preheat the oven to 180°C/350°F/gas mark 4. Sift the flour and mixed spice into a large bowl. Stir in the dark brown sugar to make a thick batter. Make a well in the center of the dry ingredients. Add the eggs and stir with a wooden spoon until the mixture comes together to form a soft dough. Stir in the mixed fruit and brandy mixture until just combined. Turn the dough out onto a lightly floured work surface and knead for 1 minute until smooth. Transfer to a lightly greased large bowl, cover with clingfilm or plastic wrap and leave to rest for 30 minutes. Meanwhile, prepare the topping. Place the butter and granulated sugar in a bowl and cream together until light and fluffy. Add the mixed spice and beat until combined. Line a 1.2 litre/2 pint pudding basin with a double

Cut the bell peppers into thin strips. Heat the butter until melted in a large pan on the stovetop. Add the shallots and bell peppers. Cook for 5 minutes or until bell peppers are softened and slightly browned. Add the green beans, salt and pepper. Saute for 5 minutes or until the green beans are hot. Sprinkle the dish with the garlic powder right before serving.

In large saucepan heat oil and saute onion over low heat for about five minutes. Add mushrooms and cook about two more minutes. Add vegetable broth. Add carrot. Cover and simmer about ten minutes. Add lentils. Cover and simmer for about twenty minutes. Add rosemary and bay leaf. Cook another ten minutes. Stir occasionally. Serve hot.

Core apples (do not remove seeds). Fill cavity of apples with water. Put apples in a saucepan and cover with water to about 1 inch above the tops of the apples. Bring to a boil, then reduce the heat and simmer covered until tender, about 15 minutes. Remove the cover and continue simmering until the water evaporates and the syrup thickens slightly. In a small bowl, combine the butter, sugar and cinnamon. Slice the apple in half from stem to tip, being careful not to slice all the way through. Place the apple halves in a shallow bowl. Spoon the butter mixture over the apples, then top with the chopped nuts. Serve hot or cold. Makes 4 servings.

Cook pasta as directed. In a large skillet over medium heat saute onions until tender. Add garlic. Stir in plum tomatoes. Simmer 10 minutes. Add spinach. Cook 2 minutes or until tender. Drain pasta. Toss pasta with sauce. Serve sprinkled with romano cheese.

Cut out the stem end of each tomato. Carefully scrape out the pulp with a spoon leaving the shell of the tomato intact. Put the pulp in a bowl with the rest of the filling ingredients. Mix well and fill the tomatoes with the mixture. Garnish with parsley. Serve cold as an appetizer or as part of a picnic lunch.

Remove stems and cores from apples and cut in half. Blend flesh with lemon juice and lemon zest. In separate bowl, soak dates in hot water to soften. Blend with maple syrup. Fold in apple mixture. Pour into ramekins. Sprinkle with sesame seeds and lemon balm. Refrigerate overnight. Serve with a dollop of yogurt.

Slice the wax beans in 1 inch pieces. Cut the green beans in 1 1/2 inch pieces. Heat the vinegar and sugar to boiling in a saucepan over medium heat. Stir in the beans and pepper and cook 3 minutes. Add the onions and cook 2 minutes. Remove from the heat. Add the oil and celery seed and mix well. Cool. Add the green beans and mix well. Toss with the minced garlic. Refrigerate until ready to serve. Serve cold.

Mix egg whites with vinegar and salt until stiff. Fold in powdered sugar with a spatula until all combined. Put in refrigerator for at least 4 hours. Put in small mounds on a serving plate. Sprinkle with sliced strawberries or other fruit. Drizzle with raspberry syrup. Serve with whipped cream.

Heat the oil in a large skillet over high heat. Add the chicken& saute until no longer pink. Add the seasoning to taste. Add the mushrooms. Stir the wine into the pan. Bring to a boil. Cover the pan and reduce the heat to medium. Cook until the mushrooms are tender. Stir in the capers. Serve the mushrooms over the chicken.

Preheat oven to 425 degrees F. Prepare pastry for double-crust 9-inch pie. Line pastry shell with granola cereal. Mix the tapioca, brown sugar and butter. In a large mixing bowl, combine the tapioca mixture and the cherries. Stir in the tapioca and the almond extract. Pour into the prepared pastry shell. Bake at 425 degrees for 30 minutes or until the center is bubbly. Reduce oven to 350 degrees and bake 30 minutes longer or until filling is bubbly. Cool on a wire rack.

Bring a pot of lightly-salted water to a boil. Cook pasta according to package directions. In a small skillet, combine cream-style corn and whole kernel corn. Heat until warm. Drain pasta and toss with butter and cheese. Toss with creamed corn. Serve immediately.

In sauce pan combine sugar, corn syrup, & chocolate. Heat until it reaches 234f stirring constantly. Remove from heat & add milk & vanilla. Stir until thick & glossy. Cool & then beat until smooth. Add 1/2 c butter & beat until smooth. Spread on cakes.

In a large saucepan heat the oil over medium heat. Add the onions and garlic and saute until tender. Add the jalapeno and cook for 1 minute. Add the pinto beans and seasonings. Add the vegetable broth. Bring the mixture to a boil. Reduce heat and simmer for 5 minutes. Serve with fresh tomatoes.

Preheat oven to 400 degrees. Spray 2 large cookie sheets with cooking spray. In a large bowl combine ground beef and taco seasoning. Shape into 32 balls. Place on a cookie sheet and bake for 12 minutes. Take out of oven and set aside. In a small bowl combine 1 can of refried beans and 1 can of sour cream. Place in a blender or food processor and blend until smooth. Dip each ball into the mixture and place back on the cookie sheet. Bake for an additional 2 minutes. Let cool. Serve in a tortilla shell with sour cream, cheese, tomatoes and olives.

In a large bowl, beat the eggs well with a fork or whisk. Add the breadcrumbs and stir well with a fork or whisk until crumbs are coated and mixed with the eggs. In a small bowl or glass measure, combine the chicken broth and water and stir well with a fork or whisk. Stir the chicken broth and water mixture into the eggs and breadcrumbs mixture until well blended. Add the italian cheese and stir well with a fork or whisk until the cheese is well blended with the mixture. Heat the soup pot and add 1 tablespoon of oil or butter and 1 tablespoon of flour stirring with a fork or whisk until well blended and the flour is light brown (brown roux). Add 1/2 cup chicken broth and 1/4 cup water stirring with a fork or whisk until well blended. Add the rest of the chicken broth and water mixture and stir well with a fork or whisk until well blended. Add the eggs and breadcrumbs mixture and stir well with a fork or whisk until well blended and cooked.

Cut each french roll lengthwise and spread with softened butter. In a small bowl combine paprika, cheddar cheese, garlic powder, and chopped fresh parsley. Sprinkle mixture evenly over top and bake 8-12 minutes, or until crust is browned and cheese is melted. Serve warm with dipping sauce if desired.

In a large skillet over medium heat, melt 6 tablespoons butter and add chile and scallions. Cook until softened, about 2 minutes. Add garlic and cook until fragrant. Add thyme and cook 1 minute. Add broth and bring to a boil. Add shrimp and cook until pink and curled, about 2 minutes. Remove from heat and stir in parsley. Serve hot over rice.

Bring a large pot of salted water to a boil and add the potatoes. Cook them for about 15 minutes, or until they're soft when you pierce them with a fork. Once they're soft, drain the potatoes and put them back into the same pot. Stir in the ricotta cheese and 2 tablespoons of the butter and mix it together well. Add the chopped kale and stir it together with the ricotta mixture. Add salt and pepper to taste. Serve with more chopped parsley and the remaining 1 tablespoon of butter to drizzle on top.

Melt the butter in a medium sauce pan over medium-low heat. Add the flour and stir until smooth. Add the milk and stir. Cook and stir until the mixture thickens. Add the cream and cook until heated through. Stir in the cheese and spices. Season with salt and pepper to taste.

Preheat oven to 350 degrees F (175 degrees C). Grease and flour 2 8x2 inch cake pans. Combine cake mix with water, eggs, orange extract, oil, and pineapple until batter is smooth. Pour batter into prepared cake pans. Bake in preheated oven for 20 to 30 minutes. Let cakes cool in pan for 15 minutes before removing to wire rack. Once cooled, top cakes with frosting.

Place the liquid ingredients in the pan and add the yeast and 1/2 teaspoon of the sugar. Add the honey to the top of the liquid. Add the wheat flour and mix well. Add the shortening. Add the rest of the sugar and the salt. Add the remaining white and wheat flour to make a stiff dough. Knead a few minutes and let rise in a warm place until doubled in bulk. Knead again and put in a well oiled loaf pan. Let rise again in a warm place until doubled in size. Bake in a 350 degree oven until golden. Enjoy.

Dip the chicken in seasoned flour. Brown the chicken in butter. In a saucepan combine honey, lemon juice, liqueur, soya sauce, orange zest and bring to a boil. Pour over the browned chicken. Bake at 375 degrees for 30 minutes. Serve with hot cooked rice.

Thaw pie crust as directed. Combine broccoli, onion, bacon and next 5 ingredients in a large bowl. Beat 3/4 cup sour cream, 1/2 cup thyme, 1/2 cup worcestershire sauce and remaining ingredients in a medium bowl. Pour egg mixture over vegetable mixturestir gently to coat. Spoon mixture into pie crust. Bake at 375 for 30-35 minutes or until set. Cool 10 minutes. Cut into 6 wedges.

Preheat oven to 350f. Line shallow 2-quart baking pan with foil. Spray foil with cooking spray. In a small bowl, combine preserves, ketchup, vinegar and hot sauce. Brush both sides of the chicken with 1 tablespoon of the preserves mixture. Place the chicken in the pan. Bake for 45 minutes. Sprinkle chicken with thyme. Bake 10 minutes longer or until the juice of a 1/2 lemon runs clear when a knife is inserted into the thickest portion. Serve over rice or noodles.

Preheat oven to 375f. Line muffin pans with paper cups. Cream together the sugar and the oil. Stir in the eggs. In a separate bowl, combine the dry ingredients. Add to the wet mixture. Fold in the carrots and apples. Spoon into paper cups. Bake for 15 to 20 minutes or until golden. Serve warm or at room temperature.

Combine oats, flour, and brown sugar and blend well. Add butter and cut in until the mixture resembles coarse corn meal. Mix in cinnamon and set aside. Grease a 9 inch pie dish and lay half the apple slices in the dish. Add half the oat mixture. Add the rest of the apples and the rest of the oat mixture. Bake at 350 for 45 mins.

Mix all together in a large bowl. Put in refridgerator for 1 hour. Take out and form into meat pies. Put on a greased cookie sheet. Bake at 350f for 30 minutes. Take out and top with ketchup or chili. Serve with bread.
While potatoes are cooking, combine lemon zest with lemon juice and olive oil in large bowl. Salt to taste. Stir in potatoes, cilantro and scallions. Serve warm or at room temperature.

Preheat oven to 350 degrees F (175 degrees C). In a medium bowl, combine the flour and salt. Beat eggs and add the sour cream. Mix in the sour cream mixture. Mix in the blueberry filling. Pour into the baked pie crust. Bake for 45 minutes in the preheated oven, or until a knife inserted in the center comes out clean. Cool. Drizzle with the almond extract glaze.

Brown bacon in heavy skillet and remove with slotted spoon and set aside. In same skillet saute potato, broccoli, carrots and onion until tender. Add Kielbasa and saute until browned. Combine with bacon in 13x9x2 baking dish. Sprinkle with salt and pepper and bake at 350 for 1 hour or until potato is tender.

In a small heavy sauce pan with a tight fitting lid, place eggs in water and cook over low heat for about 5 minutes or until eggs are done. Transfer eggs to an electric beater or bowl in an electric mixer and beat until cooled. Add lemon juice, salt, cayenne pepper, and 2 tbsp unsalted butter and beat until thickened slightly. Add remaining 1 tbsp unsalted butter in small bits until well incorporated. Sauce will coat the back of a metal spoon. If not thick enough, continue beating until it does coat. Serve immediately or keep warm until serving time.

Peel and chop the potatoes and place them in a large pot of cold water. Season with 1 tablespoon of the salt and bring the water to a boil. Reduce the heat to medium and simmer the potatoes for 20-25 minutes or until they're tender. (The exact time will depend on the size of your potatoes.) When they're ready, drain the potatoes in a colander and let them cool to room temperature. Once cool, transfer the potatoes to the bowl of a food processor fitted with the steel blade attachment and process them for about 1 minute or until smooth. Set the potatoes aside. To make the caramelized onions, heat 3 tablespoons of the butter and 1 tablespoon of the olive oil together in a large skillet over medium heat. Add the onions and season with the remaining 1/2 teaspoon of the salt and the ground thyme and cook them for 10-15 minutes or until the liquid is gone and the onions have browned and caramelized. Add the white wine vinegar and continue to cook for 2-3 minutes or
Mix all together. Let cool. Toss together well. Serve cold.

Wash onions well. Slice into 1/4" slices. Mix well with soy sauce, Dijon mustard and honey. Place in 400 degree oven for 30 minutes or until tender. Grill on foil over fire for 5-10 minutes or until grill marks appear.

Preheat oven to 350 degrees F (175 degrees C). Grease 2 9x5x3 inch loaf pans. Stir together cornmeal, whole wheat pastry flour, sugar, baking powder, baking soda and salt in a bowl. In another bowl, combine egg whites and buttermilk. Add egg white mixture to flour mixture, stirring just until blended. Stir in corn kernel and cheese. Pour into prepared pans. Bake 40 to 45 minutes in the preheated oven. Cool in pans 10 minutes before removing to wire racks to cool completely.

Butter two slices of bread. Layer 1/4 of mustard on each slice. Arrange half the ham over mustard. Top each slice with swiss cheese. Lay remaining slices of bread over cheese. Spread mustard over the top slices of bread. Heat a panini press or frying pan over medium heat. Cook until bread is toasted and cheese is melted.

Preheat oven to 350 degrees. Heat 2 tablespoons of the oil in a large skillet over medium heat. Season the pork with salt and pepper and brown in the hot oil for 5 minutes per side. Pour in the wine and garlic and stir. Cover and bake for 1 hour. Remove from the oven. Skim off the fat and discard. Cover the skillet and refrigerate for 24 hours. Preheat the oven to 350 degrees. Remove the skin and place the pork in a roasting pan. Add the remaining 2 tablespoons of oil to the skillet and heat. Pour in the lemon juice and scrape the browned bits from the bottom of the pan with a wooden spoon. Pour the sauce over the pork. Bake for 30 minutes. Season with salt and pepper and sprinkle with paprika and bay leaves. Bake for an additional 20 minutes or until the meat reaches an internal temperature of 165 degrees.

Rub chickens with olive oil. Add onion to bottom of crockpot. Place the chickens on top of onions. Rub the tops of the chickens with the lemon zest. Squeeze the juice of 1/2 of the lemon on each breast. Sprinkle with the thyme, paprika and parsley. Add the rest of the lemon zest to the other half of the lemon. Juice the remaining 1/2 of the lemon into the crockpot. Cover and cook on low for 6-8 hours. Serve the chicken breast on top of the onions.

Brown hamburger and onions in a large frying pan. Drain fat. Add mushroom soup and water to browned mixture. Stir until smooth and bubble for a few minutes. Drain fat from tortillas and add to mixture. Pour into a greased casserole dish. Combine evaporated milk and green chilies and spread over top of casserole. Sprinkle cheddar and mozzarella cheeses over the top and bake at 350 for 30 minutes or until heated through. Serve hot.

Mix flour, sugars, oil, egg yolks and vanilla in a large mixing bowl until crumbly. Beat whites with cream of tartar until stiff, add salt & peanut butter, beat until glossy. Fold in flour mixture and chill 2-4 hours. Form into 2-inch balls, roll in colored sugars or nuts. Bake on greased cookie sheets at 350 degrees for 12-15 minutes.

Place salmon in a microwave-safe dish and drizzle with light soy sauce and gingerroot. Cook on high for 8 minutes or until the fish is flaky and cooked through. Scoop out the flesh of the fish and place into a bowl. Stir in the sweet chili sauce and set aside to cool. Serve over steamed rice and garnish with sliced spring onions.

Cut fruitcakes into 24 slices and spread with brandy. Wrap in plastic wrap and refrigerate for 1 day. Cut each slice into 4 pieces and place on a large tray covered with wax paper. Melt white chocolate in a double boiler or in the microwave. Dip the fruitcake pieces in the chocolate. Place on wax paper to harden. Decorate with decorative candies if desired. Refrigerate until ready to serve. Store in an airtight container in the refrigerator for up to 2 weeks. Makes 24 servings.
Combine all dressing ingredients. Cut mushrooms into small pieces. Toss with dressing. Add green onion tops.

Heat oven to 325 degrees. Grease a 8 inch square pan. In a large bowl mix together flour and rice flour. In a saucepan heat sugar and butter until sugar is dissolved. Cool slightly. Beat in eggs and vanilla. Stir in flour mixture. Spread in pan and bake 25-30 minutes or until done. Cool. Cut into squares. Melt butterscotch chips and drizzle over top. Cool. Makes about 24 bars.

Preheat grill to medium heat. Season the tuna steaks with salt and pepper. Brush both sides with olive oil and grill for about 4 minutes on each side. Meanwhile, whisk together balsamic vinegar, orange juice and soy sauce. Serve tuna with the glaze drizzled on top.

Prepare the frappe. To an 8-cube ice cube tray, add the half-and-half, chocolate syrup, ice, sugar, water, coffee, vanilla vodka and low-fat milk. Freeze for at least 2 hours, or overnight. Prepare the frappe in the blender. To make one drink, blend all of the frappe ingredients for about 2 minutes or until slushy. Serve in a tall glass with a straw. Prepare the frappe in a pitcher. To make one drink, combine all of the frappe ingredients in a pitcher for about 2 minutes or until slushy. Pour into two tall glasses with straws.

In a small bowl, combine miso, rice vinegar and sakestir until smooth. In a medium bowl, combine brown sugar, soy sauce and gingerroot. Pat fish dry and sprinkle with salt and pepper. Dip in soy mixture and coat with pankoplace in a single layer in a greased shallow baking dish. Bake, uncovered, at 400 for 10-12 minutes or until fish flakes easily when tested with a fork. Let stand for 5 minutes. Melt butter in a small bowl in the microwave for about 1 minute or until meltedwhisk in vinegar mixture until smooth. Pour over fish and garnish with green onions. Serve with rice.

Place chicken breasts in a 6 quart crock pot. Add chicken broth. Cook on low for 4-6 hours or on high for 2-3 hours. Remove chicken from crock pot and shred. Return chicken to crock pot and add macaroni, chopped broccoli and cheese. Cook on high for 10-15 minutes or until the cheese is melted. Serve with toasted garlic bread.

Preheat oven to 350 degrees F. Combine cracker crumbs, parsley, seasoning, salt and cayenne. Divide crumb mixture evenly between 4 plates. Cut each scallop in half lengthwise. Dip each scallop piece into mustard to coat completely. Roll in crumb mixture. Place 2 scallop halves on each plate. Bake 10 minutes or until golden. Makes 4 servings.

Combine cranberries, sugar, cinnamon, lemon juice & water in 3 qt saucepan. Bring to boil over high heat. Reduce heat & simmer, uncovered, 5 minutes. Stir in marmalade & walnutsheat through. Transfer to 3-qt baking dishbake 15 minutes at 350 degrees F. Cool 30 minutes. Serve warm or cold.

In a large saucepan, heat the oil over medium heat. Add the onion, pepper, and garlic and cook until golden brown. Add the red pepper flakes. Add the water and bring to a boil. Add the clams. Cook for 6 minutes. Stir in the lemon juice. Serve sprinkled with the scallions.

In a bowl mix eggs, milk and salt. In a pan heat butter over medium heat. Add onion and garlic and saute for 1-2 minutes. Then add the sliced mushrooms and saute till it gets light brown. Add the beaten egg mixture into the pan. Once the egg starts to set, sprinkle the shredded cheese on the top of the egg and cover the pan and let it set for a minute or two. Once the egg is set on the bottom, take it out of the pan and serve.

Place the ginger, vinegar and soy sauce into a small saucepan. Heat over medium heat until ginger is tender. Add the fish to the pan. Add the scallion and season to taste. Cook until fish is done. Serve over rice.

Preheat the oven to 400 degrees f. Place the chickens in a large roasting pan. In a small bowl, mash the garlic with 1 teaspoon of the smoked paprika. Rub the mixture all over the chickens. Squeeze the lemon over the chickens. Put the pan in the oven. Roast the chickens for 45 minutes. Turn the chickens over and roast for another 45 minutes. Meanwhile, in a small skillet over high heat, heat 1 tablespoon of the olive oil. Add the butter. When the butter foams, add the remaining 1/2 teaspoon paprika and the thyme. Cook until the butter is browned. Drain the juices from the pan. Pour the butter mixture over the chickens. Sprinkle with the parsley. Serve hot.

Heat the butter in a large pan. Add the chopped onions and fry until soft. Add the bacon and fry until the bacon is almost cooked. Add the lentils and the vegetable stock. Cover the pan and bring to the boil. Lower the heat, add the chopped tomatoes, the double cream and the salt & pepper. Simmer for 15 minutes. Season to taste. Serve the soup topped with the chopped parsley.

Place the first seven ingredients into a large mixing bowl and combine well. Add the herbs and stir until combined. Form into a loaf and place into a glass baking dish. Cover with aluminium foil and bake for 1 hour 15 minutes. Remove the aluminium foil and bake for a further 10 minutes.

Preheat oven to 350. Cook potatoes in microwave. Drain and stir in eggs and milk. Add onion and dill. Season with salt and pepper. Spread into 13x9 baking dish. Top with frozen fish sticks in 3 rows of 6 longways. Sprinkle evenly with cheese, spreading, making sure some of it gets down in between and around fish sticks. Bake at 350, uncovered, for about 35 minutes. Serve with coleslaw and garlic bread.
Combine all ingredients in order listed. Spread into greased 8x8 pan. Bake at 350 for 20-30 minutes until firm.
Crumble angel food cake and place in bowl. Mix pudding with milk until thick and creamy. Pour over angel food cake. Spread with cool whip and garnish with heath candy bar pieces.

Sift flours and baking powder together. Add salt and mix well. Add the honey and milk. Blend well. Work the mixture into a soft dough. Roll out to 1/4 to 1/2 inch thickness on a lightly floured surface. Cut with a round cutter. Bake on a lightly greased cookie sheet at 400 degrees for 10 to 15 minutes or until golden brown. Makes 30 to 36 cookies depending on the size of cutouts.

In a large pot, combine broth and macaroni. Bring to a boil. Cover. Reduce heat to low and cook 12 to 15 minutes or until the pasta is tender. Stir in the remaining ingredients and bring to a boil. Reduce heat to low. Simmer 5 minutes. Serve hot.

Saute the ground beef and sausage in oil until browned. Add the kielbasa, and saute for an additional 2 minutes. Add the diced onions and garlic and saute until tender. Add the red beans and rice mix. Add the water and bring to a boil. Cover and simmer for 30-40 minutes or until the liquid has been absorbed. Serve hot.
Combine chile, garlic, lemon juice in blender. Marinate shrimp overnight. Thread shrimp onto wooden skewers. Grill over medium-hot fire for 1 minute per side. Serve with lemon wedges.

Prepare chicken breasts by cutting them in half and pounding them flat with a meat pounder or rolling pin. Sprinkle them with salt and pepper. Heat 3 Tbsp of oil in a wok or large frying pan over medium-high heat. Sear the chicken on both sides until lightly browned. Remove the pan from the heat and transfer the chicken to a plate. In a medium bowl combine the ketchup, vinegar, brown sugar, soy sauce, cornstarch, red pepper flakes, and sesame oil. Mix well to dissolve the cornstarch. Return the pan to medium-high heat and add the remaining tablespoon of oil. Pour in the sauce mixture, bring to a boil and simmer for 2 minutes or until the sauce thickens slightly. Toss in the green onions, sprinkle with sesame seeds, and serve over rice or noodles.

Preheat oven to 400 degrees. Toss the shallots and the oil in a bowl and transfer them in a single layer to a baking sheet. Roast the shallots until lightly browned, stirring occasionally and rotating the pan once or twice, about 20 minutes. Remove from the oven and let cool. Toss the shallots in the vinegar and sprinkle with the salt and pepper. Serve warm.
Beat shortening, sugar, and eggs until light and creamy. Add mashed bananasadd dry ingredients. Blend well. Add pecans. Bake at 350 degrees for 1 hour. Bake in loaf pan or 9x5x3 pan or muffins cans.

Preheat the oven to 400 degrees. Place the cut sweet potato chunks on a sheet pan. In a small bowl mix the butter with the honey. Stir in the orange juice, cayenne, cumin, smoked paprika until well mixed. Drizzle the mixture over the sweet potato chunks. Toss them well to coat. Season with the kosher salt and fresh ground pepper to taste. Bake until the potatoes are tender when pierced with a fork.
Combine eggnog and milk in a small saucepan. Heat over low heat just until steaming. Stir in chocolate syrup and bourbon. Sprinkle with nutmeg and float marshmallows on top of each serving.

Combine shredded coconut, sesame seeds, dry breadcrumbs, egg whites and sesame oil in a large shallow bowl. Mix well. Spray a baking sheet with cooking spray. Heat oven to 350 degrees F. Spread the coconut mixture on a plate. Coat each breast lightly with cooking spray. Dip breast in the coconut mixture to coat completely, turning to coat both sides. Place on the baking sheet. Repeat with remaining breasts. Bake 20 to 25 minutes, or until the coating is golden and the turkey is cooked through. Serve immediately. Serves 4.

Cook rice according to package directions, omitting butter and salt. Cool, then cover and refrigerate until chilled. Meanwhile, combine celery and cranberries in a small bowl. Whisk together oil and vinegar in a large bowltoss with rice. Add celery mixture, tossing well. Garnish with walnuts. Can be made ahead to this point. To serve, toss with spinach leaves. Makes 4 servings.

Sprinkle the fish with a little salt and pepper. Dip fish in beaten egg and then coat with self-rising cornmeal. Fry in hot oil until golden brown and crispy on all sides. Drain on paper towels. Serve hot with your favorite sauce.

Peel the potatoes. Grate them. Place in a large bowl. Beat the egg into the potatoes with a fork. Add the soy sauce and melted butter. Heat oil in a frying pan. Scoop the mixture with a spoon. Flatten it into a small round pancake. Fry until golden brown on both sides. Sprinkle with honey.
Combine chocolate and milk in a small saucepan. Heat and stir over low heat until melted and well blended. Remove from heat and stir in coffee and vanilla. Serve hot.

In a small bowl, combine the maple syrup, dijon mustard, vinegar, rosemary and garlic. Place lamb loin chops in a shallow dish. Pour half of the maple syrup mixture over the loin chops. Turn each chop over so that the other side is covered with the mixture. Refrigerate for 4 hours. Heat a grill pan over medium-high heat. Add the lamb loin chops and cook for 2 minutes on each side for medium-rare.

In a large mixing bowl stir together flour, baking powder and salt. Stir in the coconut. In another bowl combine the egg, milk and vanilla. Make a well in the center of the dry ingredients. Add the liquid. Beat until smooth. Heat a skillet over medium heat. Brush with oil. Pour batter in to the skillet. Cook for 15 minutes. Flip and cook for 15 more minutes. Makes 8 slices.

Boil the potatoes in lightly salted water until done. Drain the potatoes and return to the pot. Add the seasoning to the hot potatoes. Melt the butter in a large skillet over medium-high heat. Brown the ground beef and drain off the fat. Add the cream of celery soup to the ground beef. Add the potato mixture to the beef mixture. Mix well until combined. Line a 9x13 baking dish with foil. Pour the beef mixture into the dish. Unroll the crescent dinner rolls and place on top of the filling. Pinch the rolls together on top of the filling. Spray with cooking spray. Bake in a 350 degree oven for 20 minutes or until the rolls are golden brown. Cut into squares or triangles. Top each slice with 1 Tbsp real butter and sprinkle with Parmesan cheese. Serve warm.

Preheat oven to 375 degrees F (190 degrees C). In a large bowl, cream together the peanut butter and sugars until light and fluffy. Beat in the egg and vanilla until blended well. Fold in the miniature semisweet chocolate chips. In a small bowl stir together the baking powder and salt. Gradually add the dry ingredients to the peanut butter mixturestir until well blended. Drop by rounded teaspoonfuls 2 inches apart onto ungreased cookie sheets. Bake for 10 minutes in the preheated oven, or until lightly browned around the edges.

In a 3-quart saucepan, combine pasta, salsa con queso, milk, chicken and green onions. Bring to a boil. Reduce heat to low. Simmer 10 minutes or until pasta is tender. Sprinkle with cheese. Serve warm.

Preheat oven to 400 degrees F (200 degrees C).Line baking sheet with aluminum foil, lightly coat with vegetable spray.Wash potatoescut into 1/2 inch thick slices.Sprinkle potato slices with salt and pepper.Add bacon and onion to a medium skilletfry until bacon is browned and onion is tender.Add butterstir until melted.Drain bacon and onionstir into potato slices.Transfer to baking sheetbake for 10 minutes.Remove from ovenstir in cheese, bacon, and onion.Continue baking for 5 minutes, or until potatoes are crispy on the edges and tender on the inside.

Preheat oven to 350. In a shallow bowl, blend together bread crumbs, parmesan cheese, parsley, salt, and pepper. In a small saucepan, heat butter and garlic over very low heat until butter melts. Remove from heat. Brush chicken pieces with garlic butter, then roll in bread crumb mixture to coat. Place chicken skin side up on a large foil-lined baking sheet. Mix together any remaining crumb mixture and butter and sprinkle over chicken. Place in oven and bake 1 hour.

In large saucepan, combine all ingredients and stir over heat until dissolved. Boil over medium high heat for 5 to 7 minutes or until mixture reaches 255 degrees F on a thermometer or forms a soft ball when dropped into cold water. Remove from heat and stir in toffee bits. Pour into a parchment-lined 9X13-inch pan. Cool for 1 hour or refrigerate for 2 hours. Cut into 1-inch squares with a sharp knife while warm. Store wrapped at room temperature for up to 2 weeks or refrigerated for up to 1 month.

Peel and cut the potatoes into bite size pieces. In large sauce pan, combine potatoes and enough cold water to just cover the potatoes. Bring to a boil over high heat and cook until tender, about 15 minutes. Drain and return potatoes to the pot. Stir in butter and let melt completely over medium heat. Add the sour cream and salad dressing mix and stir until well blended and heated through. Salt and pepper to taste and serve hot.

Cut off and discard the tops and bottoms of the tomatoes and onions. Cut them in half. Peel the corn and cut the kernels off the cob. Add the basil leaves to the vegetables and stir together. Pour the olive oil and vinegar over the mixture. Season with the salt and pepper. Serve at once. Serves 4.

Preheat oven to 350F. Place Frito Corn Chips in 13 x 9-inch pan. In small bowl, mix soup, sour cream, green pepper and green chilies until well blended. Place chicken breasts in the pan with the Frito Corn Chips. Pour soup mixture over the chicken. Sprinkle with Colby-Monterey Jack Cheese. Bake 30 to 35 minutes or until the chicken is no longer pink in the center. Serve with the Roasted Red Peppers on top.

Sauté onion and garlic in 1 teaspoon of the oil in a large skillet over medium heat until tender. Stir in radishes and cook 2 minutes. Add pastastir well to coat. Remove from heat. Stir in remaining 1 tablespoon oil and the parmesan.

Place the fillets between 2 pieces of plastic wrap and pound until they are 1/4 inch thick. Combine the flour and baking powder in a shallow bowl. Beat the egg white until foamy. Dip the fillets in the egg white and then in the flour mixture. Heat the oil in a heavy skillet. Fry the fillets in the hot oil over medium heat for 1 1/2 minutes per side or until the fillets are golden. Serve with lemon and chili sauce.

In a large frying pan heat 1/2 lb. sausage. Cook until browned. Stir in onion and cook until tender. Beat eggs and milk in a bowl. Season with salt and pepper. Pour into pan and cook until set. Fold and remove from pan. Fill 6 corn tortillas with sausage mixture. Top with eggs, cheese and hot sauce. Serve with salsa.

Heat butter in skillet. Saut onions and green pepper in it. Sprinkle with flour. Gradually stir in hot broth. Season with salt and pepper. Add barley. Cover. Simmer for about 1 hour, stirring occasionally.

Cook the noodles according to the directions on the package. While the water is heating up, brown the hamburger and the onion. Drain the water from the veggies and add them to the pot with the meat and the noodles. Add enough water to cover the whole dish. Sprinkle the seasoning packet over the top and cover with a lid. Cook for 10 minutes. Remove the lid and serve immediately.

Preheat oven to 350 degrees. In a saucepan combine the breadcrumbs, cheese, light cream, egg yolks and nutmeg. Cook over low heat until the mixture is thick and well blended. Season to taste with pepper and salt. Butter a shallow baking dish. Break the cauliflower into bite size florets and cook for about 10 minutes or til still somewhat firm. Drain and rinse under cold water. Pour the sauce over the cauliflower and turn to coat. Sprinkle with the remaining cheese. Bake in preheated oven for 15 minutes or til cheese is melted and bubbly.

In a skillet, heat oil over medium heat. Add serrano ham and saute for 1 minute. Add the asparagus, season with salt and pepper to taste. Cook for 2 minutes or until the asparagus is tender but still crunchy. Serve hot or cold.

Cream butter and brown sugar together until smooth. Beat in eggs and hot water. Sift together flour, powder, soda and salt. Beat into creamed mixture. Add chocolate chips. Drop by rounded teaspoon onto an ungreased cookie sheet. Bake 10 minutes at 375 degrees.

Preheat oven to 350 degrees F (175 degrees C). Grease a 12-cup muffin pan, or line with muffin papers. Combine flour, baking powder, and baking sodaset aside. In a separate bowl, combine granulated sugar with milkstir until smooth. In another bowl, combine melted butter with the eggsmix well. Combine the dry ingredients, marshmallows, and chocolate chips into the sugar mixturestir until just combined. Stir the butter mixture into the dry mixture just until blendeddo not overmix. Spoon into the prepared muffin pans, filling 2/3 full. Bake in the preheated oven for 15 to 18 minutes. Remove from oven to cool on a wire rack for 5 minutesserve warm or at room temperature.

Preheat oven to 350F. Blend hot sauce with 1/2 cup water and vinegar. Place chicken in shallow baking pan. Pour hot sauce mixture over chicken. Bake 1 hour 15 minutes. Sprinkle with celery seed. Combine with pepper to taste. Serve with fat free blue cheese dressing for dipping.
Toast wafers. Mix butter and sugar until well blended. Add egg white and beat until foamy. Fold in cream cheese and coffee liqueur. Spoon into wafers. Sprinkle with cinnamon.

Combine garlic and basil leaves in a food processor. Pulse until a fine puree forms. Add blanched almonds and pulse until finely chopped. Add in cheese. Add in olive oil in a slow, steady stream while blending. Add lemon juice. Season with salt and fresh pepper. Let rest for at least one hour before serving.
Sautee vegetables in butter. Add stock. Add honey. Add garlic. Simmer until tender. Puree. Salt & pepper. Melt butter to thicken.
In a large pot over low heat, cook celery and onion in oil until tender. Add ham, green pepper, tomatoes, and salt. Cook until liquid is almost gone. Add rice. Cook until done. Serves 4-6.
Cook and crumble bacon. Arrange lettuce and tomato on bread. Spread with mayo. Makes 2 sandwiches.

Brown meat in a large skillet, drain grease. Add sausage and brown. Mix together the meat, sausage, cheese, sauce, seasonings and bread crumbs. Spread onto the bread and bake in a 350 degree oven for 10-15 minutes.

In a large skillet over medium high heat, warm the olive oil. Add the carrots, zucchini and scallions. Cook, stirring occasionally, for 2 minutes. Add the water. Bring to a boil. Reduce the heat to medium low. Cover and simmer for 4 to 5 minutes or until the vegetables are crisp-tender. Add the garlic. Cook and stir for 1 minute. Add the lemon juice. Season to taste with salt and pepper. Garnish with basil and chives.

Preheat the oven to 350 degrees F. Combine the roasted tomato slices, onion slices, orange rind, olive oil, garlic, green chilies, fresh thyme leaves & basil leaves in a bowl. Sprinkle salt & black pepper over. Place the fish in a baking dish. Spoon the mixture over the fish. Bake for 10 minutes. Turn the fish over. Bake for 5 minutes more. Serve immediately.
Add all to a crockpot and mix well. Cook on low for at least 6 hours, but up to 8 hours.

Combine first five ingredients in microwave safe bowl. Cook on high 3 to 4 minutes or until boiling. Stirring every minute. Add peanut butter and stir until melted. Remove from microwave. Stir in oats. Drop by spoonfuls onto waxed paper. Cool until firm.

Slice the top off the garlic bulb and place in a bowl. Pour water over it. Leave overnight. Rinse off the bulb. Place on a baking sheet and drizzle with the vinegar. Sprinkle the salt over it. Bake at 350 degrees for 20 minutes. Melt the butter in a saute pan. Add the honey, lemon, pink peppercorns. Cook for 2 minutes. Pour over the garlic. Cook for another 15 minutes. Cool completely before serving. Serve as an appetizer or snack.

Melt and brown 1/2 pound of unsalted butter in a heavy 2-quart saucepan over low heat (it will take about 1 hour). Watch carefully while you do this because it will burn quickly if it gets too hot! Once the butter has browned and is fragrant and delicious, remove from heat and let cool a bit. Then add 3/4 cup of light karo syrup and 1/2 cup of light brown sugar to the cooled butter and stir to combine. In a medium bowl, beat together 4 large eggs and 1/4 cup freshly squeezed lemon juice (not a drop more or it will curdle). Whisk in the cooled browned butter/sugar mixture and vanilla extract and salt to taste. Pour into an unbaked 9-inch pie shell and bake in a preheated 350-degree oven for 45 minutes or until the center of the pie has set. Cool thoroughly before serving. 1/2 pound of butter and 3/4 cup of karo syrup are equal to 1

Preheat the oven to 450 degrees F (230 degrees C). Season the shrimp with salt and pepper. In a large skillet, heat the vegetable oil over medium-high heat. Dust the shrimp with flour and pan-fry in the hot oil until they begin to turn pink, about 1 1/2 minutes per side. Add the white wine and simmer until evaporated and the shrimp is cooked through. Pour the heavy cream into the skillet and bring to a simmer. Season with lemon juice and chopped parsley. Serve immediately with toothpicks and lemon wedges.
Mix the butter and milk together. Add the rest of the dry ingredients and knead well. Form into loaves and allow to rise. Bake at 350 degrees F for 35-40 minutes. Let cool.

Beat ricotta cheese, eggs, sugar and vanilla. Stir in pudding mix. Beat in milk. Pour into 9-inch square baking pan. Bake at 350 degrees for 50 minutes. Cool. Top with non-dairy topping. Decorate with sprinkles and marshmallows.

Place all ingredients in food processor and blend until smooth. Refrigerate for at least 1 hour. Remove from refrigerator and roll into ravioli using an egg roll wrap. Cook in boiling water for about 2 minutes or until wraps float to top. Drain and serve with sour cream, salsa or butter.

Add 2 tbsp cornflour to the stock Add the bok choy to the stock and cook for 2-3 minutes. Add the sweet chilli sauce, stirring to combine Add the stock to the bok choy and beef in a wok Stir-fry for 1 minute until the bok choy is bright green Add the dark soya sauce and stir-fry for 1-2 minutes until the bok choy is just cooked through Serve with rice and drizzle over with sesame oil.

Preheat grill. Combine all spices in a small bowl. Pull husks back from corn. Combine butter and spices and spread evenly over each ear of corn. Place husks back over corn and wrap in foil. Place on grill and cook covered for 10 minutes. Remove from heat and unwrap husks. Serve with remaining melted butter.
Mix all together. Pour over chicken. Refrigerate overnight. Grill or bake.

Place the peas and the milk into a small saucepan and bring to the boil. Add the flour, cornstarch and baking powder to the milk, stirring continuously until it thickens. Remove from the heat and stir through the eggs. Place the halloumi and mint into a small food processor and blitz until finely chopped. Add the pea mixture and process until a thick paste is formed. Take a small spoonful of the paste and roll into a ball. Press the balls down into the batter until they are just covered. Heat a small amount of vegetable oil in a large pan. Using a slotted spoon, carefully lower the balls into the hot oil. Fry for a few minutes until golden brown all around. Drain on paper towels. Serve immediately with a yoghurt dip or mayonnaise.

Combine cream cheese and sour cream in a large bowl. Stir in garlic until well blended. Add chicken. Add onion and tomatoesmix well. Spread on pizza crust in a circular motion. Top with mushrooms, mozzarella and cheddar cheeses. Bake on a lightly greased baking sheet at 400° for 12-14 minutes until crust is golden brown and cheese is melted. Top with parsley and Parmesan cheese before serving.

Peel and juice 3 lemons. Peel and slice one orange into wedges. Slice other orange into segments. Remove pith from lemon peel and squeeze juice into large pot with water. Remove ginger from lemon peelmash ginger into lemon juice mixture. Stir in honey until dissolved. Slice remaining orange into wedges. Stir cinnamon stick, cloves and slices into lemon mixture over medium heatbring mixture to a boil, then reduce heat to low, and simmer until thickened. Remove cinnamon stick, cloves and orange sliceslet cool. When mixture is cool enough to handle, place in blender containeradd ice cubes and blend until smooth. Pour into pitcherrefrigerate until ready to serve. Stir in orange segments before serving. Garnish each glass with an orange slice if desired. A flavoring extract available at liquor stores and in the liquor or specialty foods section of some supermarkets.

Remove the outer leaves of the Brussels sprouts. Cut off the top. Boil the brussels sprouts for 5 minutes. Drain the water and add salt. Heat a pan of vegetable oil. Put the Brussels Sprouts into the pan. Add Garam Masala Powder. Stir fry for 3 minutes. Serve.

Place the mandarin oranges and pineapple in a blender and puree. Transfer to a medium bowl and add the lemon juice. Stir in the jalapeno and salt. Add the oil and stir until evenly mixed. Transfer to a small serving bowl. Cut the chicken breast into 1/2 inch thick pieces. Coat the chicken evenly with the oil mixture and the black pepper and the cayenne. Grill the chicken over high heat for about 3 minutes per side or until no longer pink in center. Serve the chicken with the mandarin orange salsa.

Mix cumin, chili powder and salt in small bowl. Rub both sides of the chicken with this mixture and let sit for 15 minutes. In a large skillet brown the bacon. Remove bacon and drain the grease. Add the chicken to the bacon grease and brown both sides. Remove the chicken from the skillet. In a small bowl combine the salsa, sour cream, and ranch dressing. Pour the sauce over the chicken and serve.

Heat milk in a small pot over medium heat until it begins to bubble at the edges (this should be less than a full boil). In a separate bowl, mix the sugar, cornstarch, and salt to form a smooth paste. Pour the hot milk into the bowl with the pastestir to mix well. Turn off the heat, add the egg yolks, and stir to mix well. Return the mixture to the heat and continue to stir until it begins to thicken. Pour the mixture into a strainer over the yogurt (or other thickener), straining to remove any lumps in the custard. Set the yogurt/custard mixture aside to cool down to room temperature (30 minutes to 1 hour). When cool, add the vanilla and Chambord to the yogurt/custard mixture. Put the bread in a medium bowlpour the custard over the bread to soak it up. Let sit for 30 minutes to an hour to let the custard soften the bread. Add the chocolate chips to the bread mixturestir well to incorporate. Add the raspberries to the mixturestir well to incorpor

Cook the beans according to package directions (or steam them for 10 minutes if using fresh or frozen whole beans). Drain the beans and rinse under cold waterdrain again. In a large bowl, combine the beans with the orange rind, cranberries, honey, bacon bits and pepper to taste. Toss gently to coat the beans evenly with the dressing. Chill for several hours before serving.

Heat oil in skillet over medium-high heat. Add onions and cook until onions are softened, about 3 minutes. Add chicken and cook 5 minutes until it begins to turn white. Stir in corn and next 3 ingredients. Cover and simmer for 10 minutes. Stir in salt and pepper. Stir in low-fat sour cream. Serve warm. Can be refrigerated or frozen. Great for burritos, tostadas, etc.

Preheat oven to 350 degrees F (175 degrees C). Line muffin tin with paper liners. Mix together cake mix and pumpkin puree. Add Egg Beaters egg substitute, agave nectar, cinnamon, salt, water, and olive oil flavored cooking spraystir until well combined. Fill each paper liner about half full with batter. Bake in the preheated oven until a toothpick inserted in the center comes out clean, 15 to 20 minutes. Allow to cool for 10 minutes before removing from the muffin tin to wire rack to finish cooling.

Wash and sort bell pepper into three colors: green, red, yellow. Wash, then dice peppers into small pieces (about 1/2 inch cubes). Place peppers in large pot and cover with cold water (about 4 quarts). Heat to boiling (about 5 minutes). Remove from heat. Allow to stand 10 minutes. Remove bell peppers with slotted spoon and set aside. Drain bell peppers in colander or strainer. Place in blender or food processor. Set aside. Pour boiling vinegar mixture over hot peppers (about 1/2 inch above peppers). Let stand 15 minutes. Drain in colander or strainer. Rinse with cold water (to cool peppers). Chop peppers in food processor or blender. Measure peppers to make sure 4 quarts of peppers (about 2 pints). If needed, add more chopped peppers to 4 quarts (about 16 cups) of peppers. Return to blender or food processor. Add remaining ingredients. Mix thoroughly. Pour into canning kettle. Process according to manufacturers directions
Thaw shrimp. Drain. Mix all other ingredients. Add shrimp. Stir. Serve over lettuce.

In a medium bowl combine the pineapple, mandarin orange segments, eggs, sugar, cornstarch and salt. Set aside. Beat whipping cream in a large bowl until soft peaks form. Fold in 1 1/2 cups of the Cool Whip. Fold in the fruit mixture. Spoon into a 13x9x2-inch baking dish. Refrigerate at least 8 hours before serving. Sprinkle with coconut.

Place chicken in slow cooker. Add the salsa and green chiles. Cook on low for 5 hours. Remove the chicken from the slow cooker and shred it. Add the half-and-half and half the can of green chiles to the slow cooker. Stir well to combine. Pour the mixture over the tortillas in the pan or over the tray of tortillas on your plate. Top each tortilla with about a tablespoon of the mixture, and sprinkle with half the cheese. Roll the tortillas up and place in the pan or on your plate. Top each roll with the remaining cheese. Cover the pan or plate with foil or plastic wrap and bake at 400 for 15 minutes. Uncover and bake for 5 more minutes, or until the cheese is melted on top. Let stand 5 minutes before serving. You can also make them in the oven. Spread the mixture in the pan or on the tray of tortillas. Sprinkle with the cheese. Bake at 400 for 15 minutes. Uncover and bake for 5 more minutes, or until the che

In large saucepan over low heat, melt margarine. Add marshmallows and stir until melted and smooth. Turn off flame and stir in extracts and chips. Stir in cereal and continue folding until well coated. Press into a greased 9x9-inch pan and chill for at least 4 hours. Frost with vanilla icing or sprinkles, if you like.
Boil shrimp and cook till done. In a wok, heat oils, add garlic powder and stir fry. Add soy sauce and honey. Add cooked shrimp. Add lemon juice and hot chili. Add chopped cilantro. Serve.

Cook sausage and onions until sausage is cooked through. Pour off fat. Combine sausage mixture with eggs, milk, sour cream and salt and pepper. Pour into 8 x 8-inch baking pan. Bake for 40-45 minutes. Sprinkle with cheese before serving.

Combine the sugar, milk, chocolate squares and butter in a small saucepan and stir over low heat until the mixture is smooth. In a large bowl combine the confectioners sugar and vanilla. Slowly pour the hot milk mixture into the bowl of confectioners sugar and stir to combine until smooth.

Place a layer of cubed angel food cake on the bottom of a tall glass. Add a layer of prepared vanilla pudding and top that with cubed strawberries. Repeat layers. Top off with whipped cream and a sprinkle of red food coloring to create a red heart on the top of the parfait.
Brown hamburger. Add noodles. Add gravy mix. Add salt and pepper.

In a small heavy saucepan bring the water to a boil with the sherry wine and honey and simmer for about 10 minutes to reduce to about a half cup of liquid. Add the apricots and simmer for about 5 minutes until the liquid is thick and syrupy and the apricots are tender and beginning to break down. Add the fresh cranberries and continue to simmer until the cranberries begin to pop and release their juices. Serve warm or chilled.

Preheat oven to 350 degrees F (175 degrees C). Grease a 12 cup muffin tin. Mash bananas in a large bowl with the brown sugar. Add vanilla essence, margarine, skim milk, and eggmix well. In another bowl, combine flours with the bicarbonate of sodamix well. Stir into the banana mixture just until moistened. Fold in walnuts. Spoon batter into muffin cupssprinkle with sugar. Bake in preheated oven for 20 to 25 minutes.

Season fish with salt and pepper. Heat 1 tbsp. of butter in skillet. Add fish and cook 3-4 minutes per side. Remove fish from skillet. Add tomatoes to skillet with remaining butter and cook until tomatoes soften. Add onions and basil. When onions are transparent, add fish and stir to coat. Sprinkle with cheese.

Bring water and peanuts to boil. Remove from heat and allow to cool. Add the lemon juice and grated fresh ginger. Dice the carrots and onion finely. Drain the peanuts and add to the other vegetables. Add the carrots and onion. Sprinkle the vegetables with the seasoning and serve.

In a large bowl, mix together flour, yeast, salt, raisins and apple. Mix well. Add water and eggs and stir with a wooden spoon to form a soft dough. Add the milk and beat well until the dough is light and fluffy. Knead for 5 minutes then put the dough into a greased bowl. Cover with a towel and leave it to rise for 1 hour in a warm place. Turn out onto a floured surface and roll out to about 1/2 inch thick. Cut out the shapes using a round pastry cutter or floured knife. Heat oil in a large saucepan until it is very hot. Drop the dough shapes into the hot oil and fry for 2-3 minutes on each side. Drain on kitchen paper. Dust with icing sugar and serve hot or cold.

Combine broth, creole seasoning, onion, chicken, salt and pepper in a skillet and bring to a boil. Reduce heat, cover and simmer for 25 minutes or until chicken is done. Add tomatoes and cook for 2 more minutes. Remove chicken from skillet, reserving broth and tomatoes in skillet. Cover chicken with cooked spinach and sprinkle with green onions.

Cook meat in skillet until no longer pink. Add tomato soup and water to skillet. Cook for 10 minutes over medium heat, stirring occasionally. Combine cooked egg noodles, corn, mushrooms, and olives in a bowl. Add beef mixture, stirring well. Spoon into a 2-quart baking dish that has been coated with nonstick cooking spray. Top with shredded cheese. Bake at 350 degrees F for 30 minutes.

Heat oven to 350 degrees F. Melt butter in a large skillet over medium heat. Stir in onion. Cook until tender (about 5 minutes). Stir in soup, milk and broccolimix well. Transfer mixture to a 13-inch x 9-inch baking dishstir in rice. Top with velveetacover with foil. Bake at 350 for 25 minutes. Uncoverbake 10 minutes longer or until bubbly.

Peel and shred cabbage. Heat the oil in a large skillet over medium heat. Add the onion and cook until soft, about 2 minutes. Add the cabbage and cook until wilted and tender, about 5 minutes. Stir in the cooked oysters and heat through. Combine the flour and milk in a bowl until smooth. Beat the egg white until stiff and fold into the flour mixture. Season the vegetables to taste and add a splash of soy sauce if you like. Pour the mixture over the vegetables and sprinkle with the egg and green onions. Cook until the eggs are set. Serve immediately.
Combine first 4 ingredients in a blender. Add sugar and process until smooth. Makes 1 1/2 cups. Makes 1 1/2 cups. Makes about 1 cup. Makes 1 cup. Makes about 1 1/2 cups.

Mix first five ingredients together in a fry pan. Cook until the mixture thickens to the consistency of cake batter. Remove from the heat and add the rest of the ingredients and mix well. Drop by spoonful onto waxed paper and let cool. Store in an airtight container in the refrigerator.

Heat oil in a medium saucepan. Add shallots and saute until soft and golden. Add all spices and stir-fry 1 minute more. Add coconut milk and bring to a boil. Add rice and lime leaves. Reduce heat to low and simmer 10 minutes. Serve hot.

Preheat the oven to 375 degrees F (190 degrees C). In a bowl combine the flour with the salt. Pat the flour mixture onto the chicken breasts. Heat the wok oil in a wok or large frying pan over high heat. Working in batches of 2 to 3 pieces at a time, add the chicken to the wok and cook for 1 minute on each side, turning as needed. Transfer the cooked chicken to a 2-quart casserole dish. Pour the white vinegar into the wok. When it begins to sizzle, add the scallions. Remove from heat. Pour over the cooked chicken. Combine the hot water with the lemon juice. Add the chicken broth and lemon curd. Stir until well blended. Pour over the chicken. Sprinkle with the lemon zest. Bake in the preheated oven for 30 minutes.

Cook the barley according to the package directions. Drain in a colander and rinse under cold water. In a large serving bowl, combine the drained barley with the olive oil. Sprinkle with the lime juice, and add the seasonings. Toss well. Serves 4.

Cream cheese, margarine and flour. Add Krispie cereal and stir until well blended. Shape mixture into 1-inch balls and roll in chopped nuts. Place 2 inches apart on ungreased cookie sheet. Flatten with a fork dipped in flour. Bake at 350 for 8-10 minutes or until golden brown. Cool on wire rack. Yield: 60.
Combine first 7 ingredients in a large bowl. Shape into 6 patties. Grill 4-5 inches from heat 10 minutes or until done.
Let all ingredients come to room temperature. Blend all ingredients together. Shape into a ball and roll in pecans. Refrigerate until firm. Serve with crackers.

Spread cream cheese in the bottom of a pie dish. Spread jalapenos on top of cream cheese. Mix canned chili and green onions in a bowl. Spread over jalapeno peppers in pie dish and sprinkle with cheese. Bake in oven for 10 minutes at 350 degrees. Serve with tortilla chips or crackers.

Boil potatoes until tender and drain. Cool in ice water. Place potatoes in a large mixing bowl. Add the bacon drippings, italian dressing, paprika, ground red pepper, onions, celery, and red peppers. Stir well. Refrigerate at least 4 hours before serving.

Preheat oven to 350-degrees. Melt butter in skillet over medium heat. Add raw peanuts and spices. Cook for 5 minutes stirring constantly. Stir in dried cherries and transfer mixture to baking sheet. Bake for 10 minutes. Cool. Store in an air-tight container for up to 3 weeks.

Melt butter in a large skillet over medium heat. Whisk in cornstarch, water, brown sugar and salt. Cook until thickened. Add raisins and lemon juice. Stir in bananas. Cook until heated through. Serve immediately.
Cut bananas and oranges into slices and slice strawberries. Cut up grapes. Mix fruits in a bowl. Mix together sour cream and honey. Add juice. Pour over the fruits. Serve.

Cream together butter and 3/4 cup of the sugar. Beat in egg and vanilla. Combine flour and salt. Gradually add flour mixture to creamed mixture. Chill dough until easy to handle. Roll dough into 1 inch balls. Place on wax paper. Place Hershey kiss in center of each ball. Press lightly. Freeze. Roll in remaining 1/4 cup sugar. Store in airtight container.

Combine milk and pudding mix in a medium bowlstir well with a wire whisk. Combine cream cheese and sugar in a large bowlbeat with an electric mixer until light and fluffy. Stir in milk mixturebeat until well blended. Refrigerate for at least 1 hour or until slightly thickened. Spoon into prepared crustspread to within about 1/4 inch of rim. Freeze for about 4 hours or until firm. Spoon Cool Whip over top of frozen filling. Smooth with a knife or spatula. Return to freezer and freeze until set. Remove from freezer about 15 minutes before serving. Top with toasted pecans.

Heat the oil in a skillet over medium-high heat. Add the chicken and sprinkle with the cumin. Brown the chicken on both sides. Add the onion& garlic. Reduce the heat to medium-low. Cook until the onion is soft. Add the lemon juice& orange zest. Stir in the orange & lemon juices. Add the capers. Cook until the sauce thickens. Serve over the rice.

In a small bowl combine the horseradish, soy sauce, garlic, salt and pepper to taste. Brush the mixture onto the salmon. Cook over medium heat on the preheated grill for about 5 minutes. Turn the fish over and baste on the other side. Cook for about 5 minutes longer, or until the fish is cooked through. Serve immediately topped with a dollop of sour cream mixed with mayonnaise, fresh basil and squeeze of lemon juice.
In a 2-quart casserole, combine the cooked rice and the cooked bacon and onion. Add the green pepper and remaining ingredients. Blend well. Bake in a 350 degree oven for 30 minutes. Serves 4.

Cut the 12 slices of bread in half diagonally to make triangles. Melt butter in skillet, add 2 slices of process american cheese to each half and swiss to the other half. Place 2 slices of cooked ham on each half. Cook until the cheese melts. Serve with mustard or mayonnaise.

To prepare the salad, whisk together the low fat cottage cheese with the low fat sour cream. Add parsley, tabasco, lemon juice, salt and pepper to taste. Fold in the baby spinach. Toss in the carrots and cherry tomatoes. Top with toasted almonds.

Toss together the broccolini and 1 tablespoon olive oil in a large bowl. Place the remaining olive oil in a small bowl and whisk in the vinegar and mustard until smooth. Add the garlic and lemon juice and whisk until thickened. Pour the dressing over the broccolini and toss to coat evenly. Season to taste with salt and pepper and serve.
Melt butter in pan. Add shallots, and saute for 3 minutes. Add beer and vinegar. Bring to a boil. Add lemon juice. Season to taste. Serve over seafood. Garnish with parsley.

Cut off the top of the eggplant and scrape out the seeds. Drizzle with olive oil and bake at 350 for 1 hour. Cut into 1 inch pieces. Mix in the rest of the ingredients. Bake another hour. Top with parmesan cheese and bake for 10 minutes more.

Sauté the mushrooms in the butter until tender. Add the onion and saut for 5 minutes. Add the lemon juice. Allow the mixture to cool, then stir in the mashed potatoes. Sprinkle with the sour cream. Salt and pepper to taste. Serve hot.

Bake meatballs according to package directions. Unwrap crescent rolls. Arrange 3 crescent triangles to form a rectangle. Top with 1 meatball. Arrange 3 crescent triangles to form a rectangle. Top with 1 meatball. Arrange 3 crescent triangles to form a rectangle. Top with 1 meatball. Arrange 3 crescent triangles to form a rectangle. Top with 1 meatball. Fold triangle sides together over meatball to form a triangle. Press edges with fingertips to seal. Crimp edges with fork. Place on ungreased baking sheet. Bake at 350 for 15 to 20 minutes or until golden brown. Remove from oven. Sprinkle with cheese and serve with pasta sauce.

In a saucepan over medium heat add the water. Add the bay leaves, whole cumin seeds and green chilies. Bring to a boil, add the cabbage, reduce heat to medium low and cook until tender. Remove the bay leaves. Add sugar, salt to taste. Serve over coconut.

Cut meat into 1/2 inch cubes and marinate in lemon juice and olive oil for 30 minutes or more. Grill or broil over medium heat until meat is cooked through and still pink in the center. Season meat to taste with salt and pepper. Serve with pita bread, tomato, cucumber and onion salad and tzatziki sauce.

Beat together peanut butter and sugars. Add egg and vanilla and mix well. Add flour and baking soda and mix. Add chocolate chips. Drop by teaspoon onto an ungreased cookie sheet and bake at 350 for 12-15 minutes.
Brown chicken in skillet. In crockpot combine chicken, salsa, garlic powder, cumin, chili powder, salt and pepper. Cook on high 4 hours. Stir in corn and beans. Serve with tortilla chips.

Preheat oven to 350 degrees. Line an 8×8 inch square pan with parchment paper. In a large saucepan over low heat, melt butter. Stir in flour and cook for 1 minute. Remove from heat and let cool for 5 minutes. In a large bowl, using an electric handheld mixer beat the eggs and sugar until pale and thick. Beat in lemon juice. Gradually beat in dry mixture until well blended. Add lemon zest and beat until smooth. Transfer batter to the prepared pan and bake for 30 to 35 minutes or until a skewer inserted in the center comes out clean. Let cool completely on a wire rack. In a small bowl, combine icing sugar and lemon juice until smooth. Drizzle icing over brownies. Sprinkle with sea salt. Cut into squares.

Mix the first 8 ingredients in a small bowl. Rub over both sides of the chicken halves. Grill the chicken over medium heat for 5 minutes per side or until done. Chop. Serve the chicken in the tortillas with the toppings.

Cook the frozen peas in the boiling water for 5 minutes or until tender. In a medium bowl, combine the melted butter, honey and seasoned salt. Stir in the pecans. Drain the peas and add the honey-pecan mixture. Toss well to coat.

Brown onions and crumble sausage in skillet. Drain well and set aside. Combine all other ingredients in a bowl. Spoon into pie shell and top with sausage and onions. Bake at 350 for about an hour or until set.

Preheat oven to 350 degrees. In a large skillet heat oil over medium heat. Add onion and garlic cloves, cook 3 to 5 minutes or until onion is tender. Stir in jalapeno and tomatoes, heat 1 minute. Stir in squash and corn. Cook 2 to 3 minutes or just until vegetables are crisp-tender. Remove from heat. Spoon mixture into a 1 quart casserole or baking dish. Stir together chili powder and cheese. Sprinkle over vegetables. Cover with lid or foil. Bake for 10 minutes or until cheese is melted. Uncover. Bake for 5 minutes longer or until top is browned.

Combine 2 cups flour, salt and baking powder in a large mixing bowl. Cut in butter until mixture resembles coarse crumbs. Stir in milk, egg and vanilla until well blended. Stir in applesauce. Drop batter by 1/4 cup onto hot griddle sprayed with cooking spray. Brown on both sides. Serve hot with applesauce if desired.

Combine sesame oil, sesame seeds, and broth in a small saucepan. Bring to a boil, then boil for 1 minute. Remove from heat. Add beans and stir to coat evenly. Pour into a serving bowl. Sprinkle with sesame seeds. Serve hot or room temperature.

Heat oil in wok or large skillet over medium-high heat. Add leeks and stir-fry 2-3 minutes or until crisp-tender. Stir in carrots and oranges and cook for 5 minutes or until just crisp-tender. Stir in ketchup and brown sugar and cook 30 seconds or until thickened and well blended. Stir in soy sauce and cook 30 seconds or until hot. Remove from heat and add peanuts. Serve over cooked rice.
Dry out biscuits. Crumble into mixture. Brown chops in oil. Add cream of mushroom soup. Stir in celery and onion. Let simmer for 5 minutes. Add egg and seasonings. Bake at 375 for 30 minutes.

Heat the oil in a large heavy saucepan over medium heat. Add the onions, carrot, and celery. Cover and cook, stirring occasionally until the vegetables are tender. Add the brown rice, cooked wild rice, mushrooms, and cooked beef or chicken. Add the broth, cover, and cook until the rice is tender, about 45 minutes. Sprinkle with the pecans.

Sift together flour, cinnamon, and salt. Beat together milk and eggs. Stir in the dry ingredients. Add melted butter to batter and stir in well. Let batter sit for 10 minutes to allow the flours to absorb the liquid. Heat griddle or skillet over medium heat. Pour small amount of batter on the griddle with a ladle. Cook until small bubbles appear on the surface of the batter, about 2 minutes. Turn over and continue to cook until golden brown on the second side. Keep cooked pancakes warm in a 200 degree oven while you cook the remaining pancakes.

Preheat oven to 350 f. Coat chicken thighs with olive oil. Sprinkle with dried oregano and fresh rosemary. Roast for 35-45 minutes or until juices run clear. Remove chicken from pan. Slice potatoes in half lengthwise and place them cut side up around chicken. Sprinkle with garlic cloves. Return chicken to pan. Add cherry tomatoes and lemon juice. Bake until potatoes are tender. Serve hot.

Bring 1-1/2 cups water to boil. Add quinoa and cook, covered on low heat until water has been absorbed. Fluff with a fork. Place in a large bowl. Combine remaining ingredients in a large jar with a lid. Shake well. Pour dressing over quinoa and toss to combine. Serve chilled. Makes 8-10 servings.

Preheat pressure cooker to high heat. Rinse the pork ribs under cold water to remove excess fat. Pat them dry with paper towels. Rub them generously with the prepared mustard. In a small bowl combine the salt, pepper and paprika. Rub the seasoning over the pork. Heat the oil in a large skillet over medium high heat. Brown the pork on all sides. Place the pork in the bottom of the pressure cooker. Pour the beer over the pork. Lock the lid and bring the pressure cooker to high heat. Cook at high heat until the first whistle. Reduce the heat to low heat. Cook the pork at low heat for 60 minutes. Remove the lid carefully. Remove the pork from the pressure cooker to a cutting board. Strain the liquid into a bowl. Add the mustard and mix well. Return the liquid to the pressure cooker. Bring to a boil and reduce until thickened. Return the pork to the pressure cooker. Cover. Cook over low heat for 15 minutes.
Saute vegetables in oil. Add garlic. Season with salt and pepper. Add tomatoes and cook until thickened. Top with cheese. Sprinkle with parsley.

Slice the red bell pepper in half lengthwise. Remove seeds and ribs. Slice into thin strips. In a large pan over medium-high heat add 1 tablespoon olive oil. When the oil is hot add the sliced bell pepper. Sauté until the bell pepper is soft but not browned. In a bowl beat the eggs with the remaining olive oil. Season with the cumin, paprika, coriander, cayenne and salt. Stir the tomatoes into the eggs. Pour the mixture over the bell pepper in the pan. Cover the pan with a lid, turn the heat down to low and cook for 10 minutes until the mixture is set but still moist in the middle. Garnish with cilantro before serving. Serve with hot bread for mopping up the juices.

Preheat oven to 375 degrees f. In a medium bowl combine feta cheese, olives, garlic powder, oregano, and salt to taste. Mix until well blended. Form into 8 patties. Spray a cookie sheet with non stick cooking spray. Bake 20 minutes until done to your liking. Heat pitas in microwave for 15-30 seconds or until soft but not hot to the touch. Spread tzatziki sauce on each pita. Top with lettuce and burger. Enjoy!

Crush the grahams. Melt margarine over low heat. Add sugar and grahams, stirring until well blended and crumbly. Press into bottom of 8 x 8 pan. Bake 5 minutes at 350 degrees. Combine marshmallows and juice. Pour over graham crust. Bake at 350 degrees for 15-20 minutes or until set. Cool 10 minutes. Fold Dream Whip into Cool Whip. Spread on top of graham crust.

Place a little of the chopped parsley and hot pepper sauce in a serving dish and set aside. In a 12-inch oven-proof skillet over medium-high heat, melt half of the butter and add the wine and water. Stir to combine and bring to a boil. Add clams and cover with a lid. Steam for about 4 minutes until most of the clams have opened. Remove from heat and season with salt and pepper. Toss with lemon wedge and serve with reserved parsley and hot pepper sauce.

Heat oil in a large heavy skillet over medium heat until hot. Peel potatoes then cut each into 1/2 inch thick slices. Sprinkle slices evenly over the hot oil. Cook for 2-3 minutes or until crisp and browned. Turn over and cook for another 2-3 minutes or until browned on the other side. Remove from heat and add onion and bell pepper. Stir to mix and heat through. Season with salt, black pepper, garlic powder and paprika to taste.

Combine all the ingredients in a blender and blend until smooth. Serve immediately or chill in the refrigerator for up to 1 hour. To serve, spoon into 4 glasses or bowls, top with sliced strawberries or raspberries and serve immediately. Serves 4.

Place 3 tablespoons of peanut butter into a blender or food processor. Process until smooth. Add the milk. Blend until smooth. Add the 3 tablespoons of milk chocolate chips. Process until the chocolate is melted. Add the marshmallow creme. Continue processing until smooth. Add the graham cracker crumbs. Add the cinnamon. Pour the chocolate peanut butter mixture into a fondue pot. Place the apple on a skewer or on a graham cracker. Serve the s mores fondue with the apple.

In a large bowl combine whole wheat flour, baking powder and cinnamon. In a separate bowl, combine the oatmeal and milkstir until smooth. In a third bowl combine the apples and pears with the brown sugar and stir until coated. In a fourth bowl, combine the egg whites and the nonfat yogurt and stir until blended. Add the oatmeal mixture and the fruit mixture alternately to the dry ingredients and mix just until combined. Spoon batter into a greased muffin pan. Bake at 350 F for 35 minutes or until done. Serve warm or cool completely on a wire rack.

In a large skillet, saute mushrooms and green onion in oil until tender and liquid has evaporated. Add milk to skillet and bring to a boil over high heat. Remove from heat and set aside to cool slightly. Beat together the eggs, mayo and mushroom mixture. Add the stuffing mix and tomatoes and stir until well combined. Pour into a greased 13 x 9 baking dish. Sprinkle with cheddar and bake at 350f for 30 minutes or until golden brown and set. Serve warm.

Preheat oven to 350 degrees f (175 degrees c). Boil the sweet potatoes in their skins in salted water for 20 minutes or until very tender. Remove the skin and mash with the remaining ingredients until smooth. Serve immediately or refrigerate and reheat at 350 degrees f (175 degrees c) for 15 minutes before serving.

Preheat oven to 350 F. Cut off and discard the stem and seeds from the peppers. Cut the peppers into 1/2-inch thick strips. In an ovenproof casserole dish combine the peppers, olive oil, onions and bay leaves. Roast uncovered until the vegetables are tender and the liquid has evaporated. Season with the salt and pepper.

Boil 1 large russet potato and 1 cup potato water until potato is tender (about 1 hour). Drain potato and potato water and let cool completely (potato can be cooled in the refrigerator). Peel potato and mash with a potato masher to make a chunky purée. Let cool completely. Remove potato from refrigerator and cut potato purée with a large spoon or with a food processor fitted with a metal blade until a smooth paste forms (if using food processor, return to refrigerator and cool completely before adding to potatoes). Add 1/4 cup sour cream and 1 teaspoon fresh lemon juice to mashed potatoes and stir well to combine. Place 1 large pinch of dill in food processor and pulse until finely chopped (or finely chop by hand). Stir chopped dill into potato mixture. Add 2 teaspoons Dijon mustard and 1 teaspoon smoked salmon to potato mixture and stir until well combined. Spoon mixture into 1/2 of egg halves and spr
Heat ghee in a pan. Add garlic and ginger paste and sauté. Add the yogurt and continue to stir. Add the tomato puree, salt and red chili powder. Add the chicken and cook till done. Serve hot. Enjoy.

Soak crumbs in potato starch. Beat eggs with sugar. Add juice and zest. Stir in crumbs. Grease a cake pan. Pour in mixture. Bake at 300 degrees f (145 degrees c) for one hour. Let stand in pan 5 to 10 minutes before turning out. Sprinkle with walnuts.

In a small saucepan over low heat combine 2 tablespoons of butter and 1 tablespoon of chicken broth until butter is completely melted. In a small bowl combine the remaining 2 tablespoons of butter and 2 tablespoons of flour until the mixture resembles wet sand. Gradually stir in milk and chicken broth until well blended. Simmer over low heat for 5 minutes or until thickened, stirring constantly. Stir in 1/2 teaspoon of pepper and 1/4 teaspoon of garlic powder. In a small bowl combine the mayonnaise and 1 tablespoon of chicken broth until well blended. Set aside. Spread mayonnaise mixture over cut sides of the sourdough bread. Top with lettuce and cheddar cheese slices. Arrange turkey slices over cheese. Drizzle with chicken broth mixture. Top with remaining bread slice and serve immediately.

Preheat oven to 350 degrees. Spray an 8x12-inch pan with cooking spray. Combine all ingredients and stir to mix well. Spread in pan. Sprinkle with almonds. Bake for 45 minutes. Let stand 5 minutes. Serve.

Melt margarine in small saucepan over low heat. Stir in honey, brown sugar and vanilla until melted. Remove from heat. Stir in peanut butter until smooth. Stir in rice flour, quinoa and baking soda until dough forms a ball. Shape into 1 inch balls. Place on baking sheet lined with wax paper and chill in refrigerator for 30 minutes. Pre heat oven to 350f. Bake for 10 minutes or until lightly golden on edges. Remove from oven and allow to cool on baking sheet for 10 minutes before transferring to cooling rack.
