In a large skillet heat butter over medium heat. Add garlic and cook until lightly golden, 1-2 minutes. Add shrimp and season lightly with salt. Cook until pink, about 2 minutes. Remove from heat. Add half of the feta to the skillet. Stir in cream. Place green onions on top. Serve warm over rice. Serve remaining feta separately.

In a heavy bottomed soup pot saute the garlic and onions in the butter for about 5 minutes until the onions are translucent. Add the chopped cilantro and mix well. Add the chicken broth and bring to a boil. Reduce the heat and simmer for about 20 minutes or until the vegetables are soft and the flavor is concentrated. Using an immersion blender blend the soup until it is completely smooth and creamy. Add the heavy cream and stir well. Season with salt and pepper. Serve the soup hot with some freshly chopped cilantro as garnish. Serves 4.

Marinade chicken overnight with Catalina dressing. Cook and drain. Mix together Catalina dressing, water and mayo. Cut bacon into small pieces. Layer on bottom of casserole. Add chicken. Cover and bake for 25 minutes. Top with monterey jack cheese. Bake for 5 more minutes until cheese is melted. Serve with green onions.
Toss spinach with 2 tablespoons dressing. Spoon 1/2 cup mixture onto 2 slices of bread. Top with 1/2 cup strawberries and 1/4 cup cheese. Repeat with remaining bread. Serve immediately.

Combine brown sugar and white sugar. Cut shortening into sugar until it is the size of peas. In another bowl combine 1 cup of the flour, the graham flour, and the baking soda and baking powder. Mix well. Add the salt. Add the sour milk and vanilla. Beat for 2 minutes. Add the shortening mixture. Beat well. Add the remaining flour. Beat until well blended. Divide the dough in half. On a lightly floured surface roll each half to 1/4 inch thickness. Cut into 1 1/2 inch squares. Place 1 inch apart on ungreased cookie sheets. Bake at 400 degrees F for 10 minutes. Cool on wire racks. Yield 3 dozen.
Combine milk and lemon juice. Add pineapple and pecans. Pour into pie shell. Chill. When firm, top with Cool Whip and garnish with cherries.

Pour half of the dressing into a large bowl. Add 1 cup of italian salad dressing and mix well. Add wings and mix until all covered. Cover with plastic wrap and place in refrigerator for at least 2 hours. When ready to bake, preheat oven to 350 degrees f. Place wings in baking pan and bake uncovered for 45 minutes or until browned. Serve hot with extra dressing for dipping.

Preheat oven to 350f. Spray a 9 x 13 baking dish with nonstick spray. Place chicken in a single layer in the prepared pan. Combine remaining ingredients in a small bowl and pour over chicken. Bake 40 minutes or until the juice is clear. Garnish with lime wedges. Makes 6 servings.
Heat oil in a skillet. Saute onions and garlic until tender. Add the other ingredients and cook for 10 minutes. Serve over rice.

Cut the chicken into 1 inch cubes. Combine with the garlic, salt, cumin, paprika, thyme and olive oil. Cover and allow to marinate for 2 hours. Thread the chicken and vegetables on skewers. Grill over a hot fire or under a broiler for 5-7 minutes on each side. Serve with lemon juice and cayenne.

Place frying chicken in a pot. Add broth and cook for 30 minutes. Then add kahlua and cook for 10 minutes. After that add red wine vinegar, ketchup and soy sauce. Mix and cook for 5 minutes. Add cornstarch and ginger and mix well. Cook for 1 minute. Serve with rice and vegetable.

Preheat the oven to gas mark 4 and lightly grease a 900g loaf tin. Cream together the butter and the brown sugar until light and fluffy. Beat in the eggs one at a time. Stir in the buttermilk and the olive oil. Sift the self-raising flour and plain flour together with the cinnamon. Stir into the mixture. Spoon into the loaf tin. Scatter over the strawberry jam. Bake in the oven for 1 hour.

In 9-inch round baking dish with 3-inch sides, combine milk, brown sugar, margarine, and cinnamon. Stir to blend well. Spread evenly in baking dish. Sprinkle with oats. Bake in 350 degree oven 30 minutes or until set. Top with apple slices, dried cranberries, and walnut pieces. Makes 6 servings.
Boil potatoes until tender. Drain and cool. Mash with cream and butter. Add roasted garlic and lavender flowers. Season with salt and pepper.

Melt butter in a large Dutch oven over medium heat. Add flour and stir until mixture becomes smooth. Slowly stir in milk. Bring to a boilreduce heat. Cook and stir 5 minutes or until thickened. Add chicken broth, chicken, green chili pepper and garlic powder. Cook and stir until thoroughly heated. Season with salt and pepper. Yield: 6 to 8 servings.

In a mixing bowl combine all meatball ingredients. Mix well. Divide into 16 meatballs. Bake 40 minutes or until cooked through. Melt jelly in medium saucepan. Add ketchup. Add wine. Simmer until reduced by 1/3. Cool. Place meatballs in glass bowl. Top with jelly sauce. Serve with toothpicks.

Sift the flour and muesli in a bowl. Rub in the softened butter until the mixture resembles fine bread crumbs. Add the remaining ingredients and mix well. Roll level tablespoons of mixture into balls and place on a lightly greased baking tray. Flatten each ball slightly with a fork. Bake in a moderately hot oven (350f) for about 10 minutes until lightly golden. Cool on a wire rack.

Mix horseradish and seasoning salt in small bowl until well combined. Spread each tortilla with one-fourth of the cream cheese mixture. Sprinkle each tortilla with one-fourth of the ham and 1 teaspoon of the Worcestershire sauce. Roll up tightly and wrap in plastic wrap. Refrigerate for several hours or overnight before serving.

Combine rhubarb and water. Bring to boil and simmer for about 5 minutes or until rhubarb is tender. Beat cream until thick and add pudding mix and vanilla extract. Mix until well blended and smooth. Spread mixture over the bottom of the unbaked yellow cake batter. Bake as directed on the box and let cool slightly before cutting and serving.

Cream the butter with the sugars until creamy. Beat in the eggs one at a time. Mix the milk and pudding together in a small bowl and set aside. Sift the dry ingredients together then mix in the milk mixture. Chop the chocolate into small pieces then fold into the dough. Roll into balls about 1 inch in diameter. Place balls about 2 inches apart on a greased cookie sheet. Bake at 350 for 10-15 minutes or until done. Remove from oven and let cool on cookie sheet for 1 minute. Remove from cookie sheet to rack to cool completely. Yields 2 dozen medium size cookies.

In a large pot, combine the butter, onions and mushrooms. Saute over medium heat until softened and well blended. Add the noodles and saute 3-4 minutes until crispy. Add the water and crushed tomatoes. Bring to a boil. Reduce heat and simmer for 10 minutes. Serve with parmesan cheese and croutons.

Melt the margarine and brown sugar over low heat. Add the milk and bring to a boil. Cook and stir for 2 minutes. Remove from heat and add the natural-style peanut butter and vanilla extract. Stir until smooth. Spread the mixture into the prepared baking dish. Sprinkle the top with icing sugar and refrigerate until set. Cut into squares to serve.

Preheat oven to 350 degrees. Butter a 9-inch pie pan. Layer 3/4 of the ham, 3/4 of the onion, 1/2 of the asparagus, 1/4 of the cheese on the bottom of the pan. Mix the eggs, milk, pepper and dried vegetable flakespour over ham mixture. Top with remaining 1/4 of the onion. Sprinkle with remaining 1/4 of the cheese. Bake for 40 minutes. Cool slightly. Garnish with parsley.

Flatten chicken and sprinkle with poultry seasoning. In a non-stick skillet, cook chicken for 4-5 minutes on each side or until juices run clear. On bun bottoms, layer the chicken and cheese. Top with bacon and bun tops. Broil 4-6 inches from the heat for 1-2 minutes or until cheese is melted. Top with any or all of the optional items.

Preheat oven to 375f degrees. Line a baking sheet with parchment paper and place the cut-side-up halves of the squash on the baking sheet. Bake for 35-40 minutes until the squash is soft and tender when pierced with a knife. Let cool slightly and scoop the seeds from the halves with a spoon or spoon the pulp from the halves. Add the pulp to a food processor along with the water, unsalted butter, and the maple syrup. Process until smooth. Season with salt and pepper to taste. Serve warm or at room temperature.

Combine cream cheese with neufchatel in a microwaveable bowl. Heat in microwave until smoothstir occasionally. Add salsa and crabmeat. Cook 30 seconds more on high power or until mixture is heated throughstir well. Garnish with parsley before serving with tortilla chips.

Place the lentils in a large pot of cold water. Bring to a boil and simmer for 20 minutes. Add the remaining ingredients except the corned beef. Bring to a boil and simmer for 15 to 20 minutes. Add the corned beef and simmer for 10 minutes. Add salt and pepper to taste. Serve in bowls with toasted bread.
Combine all together in a blender and blend until smooth. Chill until serving time. Serve with chips or as a spread on crackers.
In a large pot, combine broth and apple. Bring to a boil. Add carrots and cook until tender. Add evaporated milk and heat through. Stir in nutmeg. Serve warm.

Microwave toffee bars until melted. Stir in marshmallows and peanut butter. Stir in rice krispies and semisweet chocolate chips. Roll into balls using waxed paper. Dip balls into chocolate. Decorate as desired.
In a large skillet, cook turkey until brown. Add gravy and stir until heated through. Stir in mushroom pieces.
Peel radishes and slice thinly. Spread goat cheese on baguette slices. Sprinkle with coarse salt. Top with sliced radishes.

Combine raspberries with cornstarch in a small saucepanadd sugar and 1/2 cup of water. Cook over medium heat for 5 minutes or until thickened, stirring constantly. Stir in strawberriescontinue stirring until juice is thickened. Remove from heatstir in lemon juice. Spoon into individual serving dishessprinkle with almonds. Chill until set. Makes 2 servings.

Preheat oven to 350 degrees F (175 degrees C) Grease a casserole dish. Mix half-and-half, margarine, onion and cheese together in a saucepan over low heat until melted. Pour over potatoes, stirring gently. Sprinkle with bacon bits. Bake in the preheated oven for 1 hour. Serves 4-6.
Peel and chop the cauliflower into florets. Add the remaining ingredients. Cook until cauliflower is tender. Cool and refrigerate.

Prepare the crust as directed on the package. Pour 2 cups of the milk into a medium bowl. Add the pudding mix. Beat with an electric mixer on low speed for 1 minute. Spread evenly into the prepared crust. Beat the cream cheese and the Equal in a large bowl with a hand mixer or a stand mixer until smooth. Fold in the frozen whipped topping. Spread the mixture evenly over the chocolate. Refrigerate for 3 hours. Garnish with chocolate chips if desired.

Heat grill to medium heat. Lightly spread one side of bread with butter. Spread 1/2 of turkey breast and provolone on one side of toast. Top with 1/2 of ham and spread other side of toast with jam. Top with remaining turkey, provolone, ham and remaining toast. Heat until melted and golden brown. Serve with hot sauce if desired.
Melt cheese in microwave oven. Add sausage and salsa. Heat in microwave oven until hot. Serve with crackers or chips.

In a heavy saucepan, melt margarine. Add sugar and mix well. Add evaporated milk & mix well again. Bring to a boil over med heat & boil for 5 minutes or until mixture forms a ball when tested. Remove from heat & stir in chips, marshmallow cream & nuts. Cool & cut into squares when firm.
Place all ingredients in a blender or food processorblend well. Chill in a covered container in the refrigerator for several hours or overnight. Strain the dressing before using.

Place the chicken breast halves in a large saucepan. Add enough water to cover. Bring to a boil. Reduce the heatsimmer 20 minutes or until the chicken is no longer pink. Cool in the broth. In a small bowl combine the mayonnaise and sour cream. Cut each apple and grape in half. In a large bowl combine the chicken, grapes, cantaloupe and apple. Add the mayonnaise mixture and toss gently to coat. Refrigerate for 1 hour. Serve in the bowl or arrange the fruit mixture and the chicken in individual bowls and garnish with the almonds.

Mix together all ingredients. Add in 1 tbsp. water at a time until you get a dough like consistency. Press into a lightly greased 9 inch pan. Bake at 350 for 20 to 25 minutes. Cool completely. Frost with any icing.

Make the dough. Mix eggs and butter. Add the tapioca flour. Add the salt and pepper. Knead until you get a soft dough. Add a small amount of parmesan cheese, or any other kind. Divide the dough into equal parts. Divide the dough into pieces. Roll each piece out to a small circle. Add a small amount of any other type of cheese. Roll each circle up like a Swiss roll. Place the rolls on a baking sheet. Bake for about 15 minutes in the oven. Serve warm.
Combine orange and lime juices in large bowl. Add garlic, cilantro and salt and pepper to taste. Add fish fillets. Refrigerate up to 2 hours before serving. Serve with rice and beans.

Melt butter over medium high heat in a pot. Add flour and stir to combine well. Gradually add milk while continuing to stir constantly. Add vanilla and salt. Continue to stir until mixture is thickened and bubbles around the sides of pot. Pour mixture into a medium bowl and let cool for about 10 minutes. Beat eggs in a small bowl. Add to mixture and beat well. Add sugar and beat until well combined. Divide mixture evenly among dumpling dishes and spread evenly. Add a pat of butter to center of each dumpling. Bring water to a boil in a large saucepan over high heat. Reduce heat to medium-low. Add dumplings. Cook for about 10-12 minutes or until dumplings are cooked through and are no longer doughy on top. Whisk together 1/4 cup butter, milk, maple syrup, and salt in a small bowl until smooth. Pour into a medium saucepan over medium-high heat and bring to a simmer. Cook until butter is melted and mixture is thickened, about 3 minutes. Serve

Combine oil, syrup and honey in a medium-sized bowl. Add orange and vanilla and beat well with a fork until mixture is smooth and well-blended. Fold in oats and mix well until coated. Add pecans and raisins and stir to combine. Spread in a single layer on a rimmed cookie sheet coated with cooking spray. Bake at 300 degrees for 50 minutes to 1 hour, stirring every 15 minutes to prevent burning. Cool on cookie sheet. Stir in cinnamon and nutmeg. Store in airtight container. Makes about 3 cups.
Peel, seed and mash avocados with a fork. Add remaining ingredients and mix. Store in airtight container for up to 2 days.

Heat olive oil in a saute pan. Add the green beans and saute for 3-4 minutes. Add the garlic, dry white wine and lime juice. Cover and cook for 4-5 minutes or until the green beans are tender. Remove the cover and sprinkle with the cheese. Let the cheese melt for 1 minute or until it is slightly browned. Remove from heat, season with salt and freshly ground black pepper to taste. Serve immediately.

Trim fat from roast. Cut into 2-inch cubes. Place cubes in crock pot. In a separate bowl combine mushrooms and soup. Drain off excess liquid. Combine mushrooms and soup mixture with water in crock pot. Sprinkle with ranch dressing mix and chicken gravy mix. Cover with lid. Cook on low 6-8 hours or until fork tender. Serve over rice or mashed potatoes.

Soak frozen green beans in a bowl of water for 30 minutes or until thawed. Drain well. Heat the olive oil in a large skillet or saute pan over medium heat until hot. Add the drained beans to the pan and saute for 3 to 4 minutes or until heated through. Season with salt to taste and add the garlic and cilantro. Stir for 1 minute or so. Serve hot or at room temperature.

Spread 2 tablespoons of mayo on each half of bagel. Top 1 with ham and 1 with onion. Top each with 2 slices of tomato and 1 basil leaf. Sprinkle each with 1/4 cup of shredded mozzarella. Top with remaining halves and serve.

Heat oil in skillet over medium heat. Cook green chilies for 2 minutes. Add sausage and continue cooking until sausage is browned. Stir in eggs. Remove from heat and stir in milk and biscuit mix. Let cool. Add 2 cups shredded cheese and fold in. Spread 1/2 of the mixture onto a greased 8-inch square baking pan. Top with the remaining 1 cup shredded cheese. Cover and refrigerate until firm. Heat oven to 375. Remove the crust from refrigerator and place in ungreased 9-inch pie pan. Top with remaining crust. Bake for 20 minutes or until crust is golden. Cut into wedges. Serve with hot salsa.

Steep tea bags and mint in boiling water for about five minutes, then add lemon juice and let stand for another five minutes. Remove bags and stir in apple juice. Serve over ice, garnish with lemon slices and fresh mint.
In a large bowl, combine beans, hazelnuts, mustard, vinegar, salt and oil. Mix well. Cover and chill for several hours. To serve, toss with red onion.

Place roast in crockpot. Add barbecue sauce, apricot preserves, peppers and onions. Cook covered for 8 hours on low, 5 hours on high. Remove roast and shred with two forks. Return to crockpot and stir to coat with barbecue sauce. Add mustard and sugar and cook uncovered for 10 minutes more to thicken the sauce. Serve with kaiser rolls.

Spread cream cheese mixture on 4 tortillas. Top with spinach and roast beef. Roll up tightly. Place on a cookie sheet. Cover tightly with plastic wrap. Refrigerate 2 hours. Meanwhile, combine horseradish and mustard. Melt butter in a small saucepan. Dip beef roll-ups into butter mixture. Dip into sauce mixture. Top with cheese. Bake at 350° F (175° C) for 15 minutes. Serve warm.

Bring water to boil in large pot. Peel the outside of the lemongrass bulb to release the oils. Chop the lemongrass bulb finely. Add the lemongrass to the boiling water. Reduce the heat to medium and cook for 15 minutes. Add the herbal tea. Simmer for 10 minutes. Strain the lemongrass and herbal tea. Stir in the honey. Pour the tea through the strainer. Serve hot. Serving suggestion: Add a slice of lemon for extra flavor.

Saut potatoes and onion in butter until soft. Add stock and bring to boil. Add potatoes and simmer for 20 minutes. Add butternut squash and simmer another 10 minutes. Stir in spinach and cook for 2 minutes. Serve in wide, shallow bowls with chopped green onions. Drizzle with vinegar just before serving.

In a food processor combine all the ingredients. Pulse until the mixture is coarsely pureed. Transfer to a bowl. Stir in more oil if the mixture is too thick to pour. Add more black pepper if you like more heat. Store in the refrigerator in a sealed container. The flavor will intensify in the fridge. Serve as a condiment or an appetizer.

Bring a large pot of water to a boil. Add spaghetti and cook until al dente. Meanwhile, heat oil in a skillet. Add the onion and saute until tender. Add the pasta sauce and simmer for a couple of minutes. Stir in the capers. Add the olives and tuna and mix well. Season with salt and red pepper flakes. Drain the pasta and stir into the sauce. Serve immediately.

Preheat oven to 350 degrees. Brown pork chops in skillet. Drain excess oil and return to skillet. Add potatoes, onions and soup mix. Stir well. Add milk and heat through. Top with cheese. Cover. Bake for one hour.

1) Preheat oven to 375 degrees F (190 degrees C). Spray a baking dish with cooking spray, or grease with butter.2) Combine the oats, flour, and brown sugar in a large bowl. Cut the butter into the mixture using a pastry blender or fork until the mixture resembles coarse crumbs.3) Toss the sliced apples with the lemon juice, zest, and sugar in a small bowl until evenly coated. Arrange the apples in the prepared pan in a single layer.4) Sprinkle the top of the apple mixture with the oat mixture. Bake in the preheated oven for about 1 hour or until the top is golden brown. Serve warm with whipped cream and frozen yogurt.
Spread cream cheese on tortilla. Sprinkle with pickle slices and ham. Roll up tortilla as tight as possible. Chill overnight. Slice into 1/2-inch-thick pieces. Serve with ranch dressing.

Preheat oven to 350 degrees F. In a large bowl combine egg whites and salt and beat on high speed until stiff peaks form. Gradually add sugar and beat until stiff peaks form again. Gently fold in wafer crumbs and pecans until combined. Pour into an unbaked 9-inch pie shell and bake for 10 minutes. Cool completely. In a small bowl combine topping and vanilla and spread over cooled filling. Sprinkle with remaining 1/4 cup chocolate wafer crumbs and top with chocolate shavings if desired. Refrigerate until ready to serve.

Preheat oven to 350 degrees. Mash the banana. Sift together the flour, baking soda, salt, nutmeg. Cream the butter. Add the mashed banana. Add the sugar, egg yolks, and the vanilla. Add the dry ingredients alternately with the buttermilk. Beat until well blended. Fold in the egg whites. Bake for 45 minutes.

Mix rice and salsa in medium bowl. Heat sausage in large skillet over medium-high heat until browned, stirring to crumble. Stir in rice mixtureheat through. Spoon into 13x9 in. baking dish coated with cooking spray. Crack eggs into each indentationsprinkle with cheese. Bake at 350 for 25-30 minutes or until eggs are set.

Put the water in a large heavy saucepan over high heat and bring to a boil. Reduce the heat to low, add the Nutella and whisk until it melts completely into the water (about 3 minutes). Whisk in the sugar and the salt. Bring the mixture back up to a boil. Reduce the heat to low and cook over the medium-low heat for about 8 minutes, or until the mixture thickens enough that a spoon leaves a trail when swirled through it. Remove from the heat and whisk in the butter and the vanilla essence until fully incorporated. The mixture will be thick and bubblylet cool slightly before serving with ice cream, fruit or whatever you like!

Preheat oven to 350 degrees F. Spray 8-inch pie pan with cooking spray. Lightly beat together egg whites and egg yolks. Add herbs and cheese. Stir in vegetables. Spoon into pie pan. Sprinkle with cheese. Bake 12 to 15 minutes or until set. Cut into wedges to serve.

Prepare noodles as directed on package. In a large saute pan or wok, heat olive oil and garlic over medium heat until garlic is lightly browned. Add noodles and toss until thoroughly coated with oil and garlic. Add chicken bouillon powder and oyster sauce and toss until well combined and evenly distributed. Add parmesan and toss until melted. Add butter and toss until evenly distributed. Serve immediately while still hot.

Peel, core and chop the gala apples. Place in a heavy-based pan with the sugar and water. Bring to a boil and simmer for 10-12 minutes until apples are soft. Remove from the heat and stir in the passionfruit puree and butter. Pour into a 20cm x 30cm shallow ovenproof dish. Scatter the biscuit crumbs over the top of the mixture and bake in the oven for 20-25 minutes until the topping is golden brown and crisp. Serve with a scoop of vanilla ice cream.

Slice potatoes thinly, as thin as possible. Heat oil in a skillet. Saute onion in oil for 3 minutes. Add the potatoes to the skillet. Sprinkle the garlic salt and pepper over the top. Toss to mix well. Continue to cook over medium heat until the potatoes are tender and golden brown.

Place frozen hash browns in bottom of the crockpot. Top with ham and onion. Sprinkle the green pepper and cheese over the top. Crack the eggs into a bowl and beat well, then add the milk. Pour over the top. Cover and cook on low for 7-8 hours or 3-4 hours on high. Serve hot.

In a large skillet coated with a small amount of oil, saute the chicken and mushrooms over medium heat until no longer pink. Drain and set aside. In a mixing bowl, whisk together the egg substitute, milk, salt and pepper until well blended. Add the vegetables and chicken mixture to the bowl. Heat a large nonstick skillet or griddle coated with a small amount of oil over medium heat until hot. Pour the egg mixture into the hot pan. Cook for 3 minutes or until the top is set but still runny in the middle. Slide the frittata onto a plate, then cut it into wedges to serve. Sprinkle with parsley and cheese if desired.

Bring milk to boil. Add lemon rind and cinnamon. Turn off heat. Add honey. Soak bread in liquid. Beat eggs. Dip bread in beaten eggs. Dip into bread crumbs. Fry in hot oil. Serve with sour cream and lemon wedge.

Melt margarine in a large pot. Add flour and stir with whisk until smooth and bubbly. Slowly add chicken broth and milk. Cook 3 minutes. Add crabmeat and cook another 3 minutes. Add salt and pepper to taste. Serve with toast.

Combine first 5 ingredients in a medium bowlset aside. Bring broth and next 3 ingredients to a boil in a medium saucepan over medium heatstir in couscous, and cook 5 minutes or until liquid is absorbed and couscous is tender. Spoon couscous mixture into a large bowldrizzle with remaining 1 tablespoon oil. Sprinkle with parsley and ginger flakestoss gently.

Combine sugar and butter in sauce pan. Bring to boil, stirring frequently. Remove from heat. Beat in evaporated milk and spices. Stir in the pumpkin and the marshmallow creme. Stir until well blended. Add chocolate chips and nuts. Stir until melted. Pour into a buttered 9 x 13 pan. Refrigerate until cool and cut into squares.

Preheat oven to 350 degrees F. Brown roast in skillet or oven-proof panremove excess fat and drain. In a 3 quart saucepan, combine dressing, soy sauce and garlicheat and stir until hotpour over roast and bake for 1 hour or until meat thermometer reads 160 degrees F. Remove from ovensprinkle with onion and serve.

In a medium bowl combine cream cheese, lemon juice and heavy creammix well. Place cherry tomatoes in a small bowladd tuna, onions and salt and pepper to tastegently mix together. Spoon into cherry tomatoes, top with a sprig of basil (optional) and serve immediately.

Spray baking sheet lightly with cooking sprayarrange chips in single layer. Top with refried beanssprinkle with ranch style beanstop with cheese. Bake 10 minutes or until heated through. Serve immediately with light sour cream, pickled jalapeno peppers, and Tabasco sauce if desired.

Heat a small pan over medium heat for 2 minutes. Add the olive oil and heat for another 2 minutes. Break an egg into the pan, season with salt and pepper. Fry for 1 minute or until the white is set. Put bread on plate and break over egg. Sprinkle with chile flakes. Place the garlic on the bread. Crush the cumin seed with a spoon on top of the garlic. Drizzle with balsamic vinegar. Garnish with coriander.

Mix fruit with sugar, lemon juice and lemon zest. Let sit for 30 minutes, stirring occasionally. Preheat oven to 375 degrees. Bring milk to a boil in a pot over medium heat. Stirring constantly, slowly add flour and baking powder. Reduce heat to a simmer. Remove from heat and stir in butter, lemon zest, and salt. Drop dumplings into fruit mixture by the heaping tablespoon. Bake for 20 to 30 minutes or until lightly browned. Serve warm with ice cream or whipped cream.

Cut bacon into 1/4-inch pieces. In a large skillet or Dutch oven, cook bacon over medium heat for 8 minutes or until crisp. Remove from pandrain and set aside. In the same pan, cook the onion in the bacon fat for 3 minutes or until tender. Add potatoes and stircook for 5 minutes or until the edges of the potatoes begin to brown. Add 2 cups waterbring to a boil. Reduce heatcover and simmer for 5 minutes or until the potatoes are tender. Add half-and-half and the reserved baconheat through. Add the creamed corn, frozen corn and the black peppercook 1 minute or until heated through. Salt and pepper, if desired.

Cut off the fat from the meat and place the meat into a slow cooker. Place the vegetables around the meat. Mix together the soups and water. Add the seasonings. Pour this mixture over the meat and vegetables. Cook for 5-6 hours on low. When done cooking, use a slotted spoon to remove the vegetables and place them in a serving dish. Serve the beef and vegetables with the juices.
Combine first 3 ingredients in a large bowl. Beat with a mixer until well blended. Pour into prepared crust. Cover and refrigerate 3 hours. Top with cool whip and lemon rind just before serving.

Follow manufacturers instructions for adding the liquid and the dry ingredients. Add the liquid first. Add the cheeses and onion on top of the flour. Add the yeast. Set the cycle to basic cycle and medium crust color. Press start. After the machine has completed the cycle remove the bread from the pan and place it on a rack to cool. Slice and serve.

Heat the oven to 350. In a medium bowl combine the ground meat, red bell pepper, and the red pepper flakes. Mix well. In another bowl combine the apricot jam, catalina dressing, soy sauce, ginger and garlic. Mix well. Shape the meat mixture into meatballs. Place the meatballs into a 9 x 13 pan. Pour the sauce over the meatballs. Cover with foil. Bake for 45 minutes. Uncover and bake for 15 more minutes. Serve over steamed rice. Garnish with sliced green onions.

Preheat oven to 450 degrees F. Lay bacon in a roasting pan. Cook in oven until crisp, about 15-20 minutes. Let cool a bit and crumble. Bring a medium saucepan of water to a boil with a pinch of salt. Add the haricots verts and cook until tender but still bright green and firm to the bite, about 2 minutes. Drain and let cool under running water. In a small bowl combine shallot and vinegar and let stand for 15 minutes. In a medium bowl, whisk walnut oil into shallot-vinegar mixture until emulsified. Season with salt, pepper and a bit of the bacon. Toss haricots verts with dressing. Serve garnished with walnuts and parsley.

Preheat oven to 350f. Beat cream cheese with milk until smooth. Stir in bacon, parmesan cheese, onion, parsley. Unroll crescent rolls. Spread with cream cheese mixture. Sprinkle with parmesan cheese. Roll up. Bake 12 to 15 minutes or until golden brown. Cut each wedge into 2 equal wedges. Serve warm. Makes 24 servings.

Cut livers into bite sized pieces. Heat oil and brown livers on both sides. Add onions and garlic to the pan. Saute until the onion is tender. Add the tomatoes and the green peas. Cook for 10 minutes. Season with salt and pepper. Add basil and serve.

Heat oven to 350 degrees. Lightly grease a baking pan. Combine first five ingredients in a small bowl. Add tomatoes to the mixture. Spoon mixture into pan. Bake for 1 hour. Meanwhile cook pasta according to package directions. Drain well. Toss cooked pasta with the scallop mixture. Garnish with fresh basil leaves.

Combine the blue cheese with the green olives in a blender and chop. Place the chopped cheese and olives in a bowl and add the gin. Mix well. Fill a chilled martini glass with the gin mixture and fill the rest of the way with vermouth. Stir well. Garnish with an olive and serve.

For the graham cracker crust, combine the graham cracker crumbs and 1/4 cup melted margarine. Press into a 12-cup muffin pan or a mini-muffin pan. Bake for 5 minutes. Allow to cool.For the filling, in a large mixing bowl beat together the cream cheese, cocoa powder, and 1/4 cup melted margarine until smooth. Beat in the condensed milk and egg until just blended. Stir in the chocolate chips. Pour filling into the crusts. Bake for 15 minutes or until the filling is set. Allow to cool completely. Chill in the refrigerator for at least one hour before serving.

Mix the corn, sugar and salt in large bowl. Pour in water and stir well. Let stand 30 minutes, stirring occasionally. Heat the coconut milk in small saucepan over medium heat until hot but not boiling. Pour milk over corn mixture stirring well. Stir in vanilla. Spoon into 8 individual glasses or 2-quart baking dish. Cover with wax paper. Refrigerate 3 hours or until ready to serve. Uncover. Serve with whipped cream, if desired.

Combine whole milk, half-and-half cream, white chocolate, sugar and vanilla in a double boiler. Place on stove and bring to boil while stirring constantly with whisk. Remove from heat, add brandy and blend well. Pour into warmed mugs. Garnish with grated nutmeg if desired.

Place fillets in a shallow dish. In a large skillet, heat oil over medium high heat. Sprinkle pork generously with salt and pepper. Cook 3 minutes on each side or until browned on all sides. Meanwhile, heat vinegar in a small saucepan over medium-low heat until simmering. In a small bowl, combine 3 tablespoons vinegar, mustard and 1/4 teaspoon saltstir well. Add apples to skilletcook 5 minutes or until tender, turning apples occasionally. Add remaining 1/4 teaspoon saltstir well. Add mustard mixture and 2 tablespoons vinegar to skillettoss well to combine. Add maple syrupcook 1 minute or until apples are coated and syrup is slightly thickened, stirring frequently. Arrange 3 apples on each of 4 platestop with fillets. Serve with rice and steamed broccoli.

Preheat oven to 350 degrees F. Pierce potatoes in several places with a sharp knife. Place potatoes and squash in a large roasting pan. Drizzle with 2 tablespoons of olive oil. Add garlic and herbs. Season with salt and pepper. Roast for 40-60 minutes or until potatoes are tender. Remove from oven and turn vegetables with a spatula. Drizzle with remaining 2 tablespoons of olive oil. Roast an additional 15 minutes or until potatoes are golden brown. Cool slightly. Garnish with freshly chopped parsley. Serve warm.

Bring 2 cups water to a boil. Add quinoa and stir. Simmer for 10 minutes. Add 2 cups more water. Cook for 15 minutes or until tender. Stir in almonds and dried apples. Spray an 8x8 inch baking dish with cooking spray. Pour contents into dish and bake at 350 for 20 minutes. Melt brown sugar and butter together in small saucepan. Brush over hot quinoa. Sprinkle with raisins and cinnamon. Cool. Serve with yogurt.

Cook macaroni according to package directions. Brown ground beef in a skillet. Add onions, garlic, ginger seasoning and chili seasoning mix. Cook until meat is no longer pink. Add water. Stir in tomato sauce. Cover and simmer about 20 minutes. Stir in macaroni. Salt and pepper to taste. Serve with cheese and sour cream.

Mix together peanut butter, banana, brown sugar, golden syrup, egg, baking soda, soy flour and rice flour. Roll into balls and press lightly with fork. Bake at 375 for about 10 minutes or until golden brown. Remove from cookie sheet and cool. Makes about 24 cookies.

Mix hash browns and bacon together in crockpot. Add onions and peppers. Sprinkle with cheese. In a medium bowl beat together eggs milk and seasonings. Pour over top of hash brown mixture in crockpot. Cook on high 1 hour and 15 minutes. Stir and cook 1 hour longer. Serve hot. Serves 4-6.

Prepare brown rice according to package directions. Combine lettuce, chicken, rice and remaining ingredients in a large bowl. Toss gently to combine. Serve at once or cover and refrigerate until serving time.

Heat 1 tbsp. vegetable oil in a large skillet over medium-high heat. Stir-fry broccoli 3 to 4 minutes or until crisp-tender. Drain and set aside. Heat remaining vegetable oil and stir-fry garlic for 10 seconds or until golden. Add beefstir-fry until no longer pink. Stir in broccoli and oyster sauce. Cook and stir until heated through. Sprinkle with pepper. Serve over hot cooked rice.

Slice grapefruit in half. Remove membrane and juice vesicles. Lay grapefruit half on a plate or flat surface. Place a pat of butter on top of the grapefruit half. Sprinkle with a little sugar. Broil in oven until fruit is tender and top is browned. Serve with a cherry on top.

In a skillet heat butter over medium heat. Add shallots and cook until tender. Add cream. Bring to a boil. Add basil, lemon juice, vinegar, tabasco sauce. Salt and pepper. Remove from heat. Stir in zucchini and tomatoes. Toss to coat. Transfer to serving dish. Garnish with basil. Makes 4 servings.

Cut fish into 4 portions. In a shallow dish combine flour, rind and pepper. In a shallow dish beat the egg. Dip fish into egg and then into flour mixture. Heat margarine in frying pan. Brown fish on both sides. Top with ham and cheese. Pour milk and parmesan cheese over top. Brown 5 minutes longer.

Boil beets for 30 minutes or until tender. Drain beets. Peel and slice. Toss with oil, vinegars and seasonings. To serve, spread sour cream on toast points. Top with beets. Garnish with fresh tarragon or chives.

cook macaroni mix according to directions. In a large frying pan or dutch oven cook ground beef with the onions. Add the pepperoni. Drain the grease. Add the pizza sauce. Stir in the cooked macaroni. Spoon the mixture into a 9x13 inch baking dish. Cover with mozzarella cheese. Bake at 350 degrees for 30 minutes or until bubbly.

Spread olive oil over the crust. Cook the chicken breast in the oven. Add a bit of salt and pepper. Top the crust with buffalo wing sauce. Lay the cooked chicken over the sauce and sprinkle with blue cheese dressing. Add celery and sprinkle with shredded cheddar. Bake until crust is crispy.

In a large saucepan over medium heat, combine the chicken broth, tomatoes and beans. Bring to a boil. Add garlic and herbs. Reduce heat to low and simmer for 15 minutes. Add artichokes and cook for 10 minutes longer. Season with salt and pepper. Serve with pasta.

In a large bowl whisk together the skim milk and sugar until dissolved. Add heavy cream and vanilla and whisk until smooth and frothy. Combine cake mix and sprinkles in a bowl. Slowly add the milk mixture and stir until batter is the consistency of cake batter and thoroughly combined. Pour batter into an ice cream maker and churn according to manufacturers directions. Serve immediately or freeze until ready to serve.

Preheat oven to 400 degrees F (200 degrees C). In a large bowl, beat together the eggs, biscuit mix, and the sugar until well combined. Stir in the vegetable oil and the milk until just combined. Stir in the chocolate chips. Grease muffin tins or line with paper liners. Fill each cup with the batter, about 2/3 full. Bake in the preheated oven for about 20 minutes, or until a toothpick inserted into a muffin comes out clean. Serve warm. Makes about 1 dozen muffins.

In a large skillet over medium-low heat, melt the butter. Add the garlic and cook for 30 seconds. Stir in the orzocook and stir until it is lightly browned. Add the waterbring to a boil. Reduce the heat to low. Cover and simmer until the orzo is tender, 15 to 20 minutes. Stir in the half-and-half. Simmer for 5 minutes. Stir in the parmesan cheese. Season to taste with salt and pepper. Serve the orzo topped with the shrimpsprinkle with basil.

Prepare cake according to box directions except use only one cup of water instead of 1 cup water and one cup milk. Add one tsp of poppy seeds to dry ingredients. Do not add to batter. Fill center of bunt pan with one stick of unsalted butter. Pour batter over butter. Bake at 350 degrees for approximately one hour. Cool and frost if desired. Serving size is based on a 12 cut cake.

Beat together eggs and milk in a saucepan. Cook over low heat until set. Add the cheese and stir until melted. Fold in green pepper and onion. Cook 1 minute more. Fold in black olives. Spread filling on a warm flour tortilla. Garnish with chopped green pepper, olives and salsa.

Cut off and discard the bottom of the fennel bulbs. Cut off the top third of each bulb, then slice the remaining bulbs crosswise into thin rounds. Place in a large bowl and add the apple, corn and red onion. In a small bowl, whisk together the oil, lemon juice and sugar and pour over the vegetables, tossing to coat well. Garnish with the fennel leaves and serve.

Spread 1 teaspoon butter on each slice of bread. Cut each buttered slice in half crosswise or into 2 pieces. Top each piece of bread with 1 ounce (1/2 cup) of cream cheese. Top with several slices of smoked salmon. Top with cucumber slices.
Fry the noodles in a little oil and butter until lightly browned. Turn them into a bowl and add the sour cream and seasonings. Mix well and serve immediately.

Slice baguette in half lengthwise. Sprinkle golden raisins on bottom half. Drizzle onions with oil and saute in skillet until they begin to brown. Add capers. Saute for 3 minutes. Add fresh dill. Saute for 1 minute. Season to taste with hot sauce and pepper. Arrange on top of baguette. Top with cooked shrimp. Serve immediately.

In a small bowl combine the butter and the crushed garlic. Cut the french bread lengthwise into 1-inch-thick slices. Spread the butter mixture over the top of each slice of bread. Sprinkle with the parmesan. Broil in the oven until the bread is crisp and golden-brown and the cheese is melted. Cut into wedges and serve.

In a small skillet over medium heat saute the onion until it is tender. Add the cheese whiz. Cook 30 seconds stirring constantly. Remove from heat. Place 2 slices of cheese whiz on each bun. Top with a hot dog. Sprinkle with the onion mixture and a little black pepper. Makes 4 servings.

Cook potatoes till done. Peel and slice. Put slices in a large bowl. In a large pot, cook light margarine in a large pot over low heat till margarine has melted. Whisk in flour till mixture is smooth and blonde. Gradually whisk in skim milk. Heat to a boil, reduce heat to low and cook till mixture is thick. Add onion. Cook till onion is tender. Add sliced ham. Cook till heated through. Add cooked potatoes. Season with salt and pepper. Pour mixture over potatoes in bowl. Mix till all is coated. Transfer to a 2 quart greased casserole dish. Sprinkle with cheese. Bake at 375 degrees for about 45 minutes till bubbly. Serve.
In a large bowl, combine the first four ingredients. Pour over the pasta. Add the remaining ingredients and toss well. Chill thoroughly. Makes 12 servings.

Beat egg and add dough. Press into 9x13 pan and spread evenly with filling. Bake for 25-30 minutes or until edges begin to brown. In a small bowl, mix powdered sugar with enough lemon juice to make a thick glaze. Drizzle over warm bars and let cool completely before cutting into squares.

Preheat broiler. Spray flat bread with olive oil. Broil until crisp and golden-brown. Spread with pestosprinkle with cheesetop with rosemary. Broil until cheese melts. Garnish with peppers and tomatoes. Serve immediately.

In a large bowl mix parsley, garlic, shallot, italian seasoning and rosemary. Add chicken to mixture and toss to coat. In another large bowl, combine lemon juice, dijon and olive oil. Add chicken mixture and toss to coat well. Cover and marinate 20 minutes. Remove from marinate and grill on an oiled grill rack over medium high heat 5-7 minutes per side or until cooked through. Serve immediately.

Combine the first six ingredients. Cut in the shortening. Mix to a soft dough using just enough buttermilk to make a soft dough. Knead on a lightly floured surface. Let rise in a warm place until double in bulk. Divide in half. Roll each half into a circle about 1/8 inch thick. Cut into wedges with a pizza cutter. Place on a lightly greased baking sheet. Let rise until double in bulk. Bake at 400 degrees for 10-15 minutes or until done.

Preheat oven to 400. In mixing bowl combine dry ingredients. Beat milk and sour cream together. Add to dry ingredients. Mix lightly with fork. Pour into greased 8x8 pan. Bake 20 minutes. Melt 1 tablespoon shortening. Pour over hot cornbread. Allow to cool. Serve with butter and honey.

Pre-heat oven to 375f. Mix ground beef, stuffing mix, water, egg, and the barbecue sauce ingredient from the variation you chose. Press into 12 muffin cups sprayed with cooking spray. Make an indentation in center of each meatloaf. With spoon fill indentation with sauce. Bake 30 min or until cooked through. Top with cheese, continue baking 5 minutes or until cheese is melted.

In a saucepan over low heat, combine the condensed milk and butter. Bring to a boil. Turn off the stove and stir in the chocolate and coconut. Allow to cool for about 10 minutes. Add vanilla. Fold in the walnuts. Spread into an 8 inch square pan lined with wax paper. Refrigerate for at least 2 hours. Lift out of pan and cut into squares. Store in an airtight container.

Preheat oven to 350-degrees f (175-degrees c). Cut 4-5 slits in each breast and place between 2 sheets of wax paper or plastic wrap. Pound gently with mallet or rolling pin to flatten to 1/2-inch thickness. Lay out onion slices between each breast to prevent them from sticking to each other. Combine garlic, red pepper flakes, oregano and salt to tasterub mixture over all sides of the chicken. Heat olive oil in skillet over medium-low heatadd chicken and cook for 4-5 minutes per side or until no longer pink in center and juices run clear when center is cut with a knife. Place on baking sheet. In small bowl, combine lemon juice, 1 cup water and 1/4 teaspoon pepperpour over top of each breast. Bake for 15 minutes or until cooked through (no pink in center)remove from ovensprinkle with additional parsley if desired. Serve hot or warm with pasta or

In medium bowl, combine preserves and gingerset aside. In small bowl, combine lime juice and lime peelset aside. Combine mustard and black pepper in another small bowlset aside. Preheat broiler and oven. Thread the peaches on the skewers alternating with the lime slices and the peppered peach preserves mixture. Broil peaches about 6 inches from heat for about 2 minutes per side or until peaches are slightly charred on the outside and the preserves are bubbly. In the meantime, spray the ham steaks with nonstick cooking spray and broil about 6 inches from the heat for about 5 minutes on each side or until the meat is cooked through. Serve the peaches over the ham steaks and drizzle the lime peel and lime juice mixture over the peaches and the meat and sprinkle the mustard and black pepper mixture on top of each serving.

Combine orange juice, lime juice, ginger root and green onion in a small bowl. Whisk in Teriyaki sauce and garlic until well blended. Place salmon in a non-metallic baking pan and pour half of the marinade over the salmon and let it sit for 15 minutes. Pour remaining marinade over salmon and bake in preheated oven for 10 minutes. Cook for an additional 5 minutes or until fish flakes easily with a fork. Serve with rice and garnish with green onion slices.

Heat heavy cream to just below a simmer over medium heat. Add vanilla extract and stir well to combine. Slowly stir in dark brown sugar and whisk to dissolve completely. Remove from heat and let cool for 10 minutes. Stir in ground cinnamon. Transfer syrup to an airtight container and store at room temperature.

Sift the flour once or twice. Measure the cream cheese and place it on a table or board with a smooth top. Using a rolling pin, roll the cream cheese to a thin sheet (about 1/8 inch thick) about 8 to 10 inches square. Dip the sheet of cream cheese into the granulated sugar until well coated. Sprinkle with a pinch of salt to taste. Set aside until the cream cheese becomes firm enough to handle (about 30 minutes). Sprinkle the firm cream cheese with a small amount of the all-purpose flour. With a sharp knife or a bench scraper, cut the cream cheese into 1/2-inch cubes. Mix the cubes with the all-purpose flour to coat evenly. Roll into 1-inch balls. Place them 2 inches apart on ungreased cookie sheets. Bake 15 to 20 minutes until lightly browned. Remove from the oven and cool on the cookie sheets for about 5 minutes before removing to wire racks to cool completely.

Preheat oven to 350 degrees. Prick each potato with a fork. Drizzle each with 1/2 tsp oil. Sprinkle with 1/4 teaspoon salt and 1/4 teaspoon pepper. Bake for 40 minutes or until the potatoes can be easily pierced with a fork. Serve warm with a dollop of sour cream, sprinkled with blue cheese, chives or both.
